Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Several Special Touches”
Reviews.Author: NCCC
Reviews.Content: Very central with great staff, nice rooms and really nicely decorated public areas. Look out for the fabulaous light fittings and chandeliers. Its a pity that the restaurant doesnt serve dinner but the staff are only too willing to give good recommendations. do try to book the hotel Vespa for a day. Its a great way to see Amsterdam and good value for â‚¬49 for 24 hours rental.... All in all a good experience and we were lucky to get a room upgrade based ona Tripadvisor offer.... the "friends of estherea" deal will ensure that we return to avail of the promised benefits of joining!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeannette25
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights recently. It is a great location on the Singal. It is approx. 20 mins walk from Central Station. Walk all the way to Dam Square and take a right across two parallel streets to the Singel Canal. The hotel is beautifully furnished and there are loads of restaurants and cafe bars nearby. We did not have a breakfast option with our booking but there is a great little cafe on the corner that does a good breakfast. The cost for breakfast in the hotel is â‚¬18 which I think is quite steep. Tea and coffee is free in the bar area all day with cookies or chocolates which is a nice touch. There is no restaurant for lunch or dinner but you can order room service and the hotel uses two restaurants nearby for these meals at no extra charge. As there are plenty of restaurants nearby there is no need to eat in the hotel. The room was lovely and spotlessy clean. Staff are very friendly and will make recommendations for places to see or things to do. We came to see the Keuchenhof Gardens which are a must and the Floriade which is held every 10 years in Holland. This is good for garden enthusiasts. The Keuchenhof is definitely a place to see. Spectacular park with 7 million bulbs planted in different layouts. The colour is absolutely beautiful and the scent of flowers is everywhere. It is 45 min outside of Amsterdam and opened mid March to Mid May.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: declansmyth
Reviews.Content: arrived for one night stay.fantastic receptionist who showed us map of amsterdam and local restaurants.Complimentary tea and coffee in reception area . Beautiful decor in reception with stunning fish tank.Our rooom was beautiful and very clean. relaxed atmosphere in hotel.breakfast overpriced next morning so we went to brooje bert nearby where we had a fantastic value breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Baroque decor but decrepit aromas”
Reviews.Author: BDWarr
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff, and the decor shows a great sense of fun and humor, with a huge baroque crystal chandelier and a gold-crusted grandfather clock dominating the lobby, along with the impressive tropical fish tank. There was free espresso, tea and hot chocolate from the machine off the lobby. The breakfast was simple but very well done; the fruit was fresh and sweet, and the scrambled eggs were cooked perfectly (if you've seen many hotel buffet scambled egg trays, you'll know how unusual this is). Bed was comfy and fairly roomy for a European urban hotel room. Only complaints: there was an annoying smell wafting through the hallway on floor 2, where our room was located in the back of the hotel, which smelled to me like a bit of sewer gas may be seeping back into the hotel via the plumbing system, but we only noticed it faintly in our room. Also, television required an additional fee, and Internet access was very slow, which is unforgivable when you're charging 10 euro per day (per device) for access. However we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel overlooking a canal!”
Reviews.Author: divinedivs
Reviews.Content: loved this sweet little hotel overlooking a beautiful canal in d heart of Amsterdam just walking distance from d dam square and just a couple of tram stops down to d central station! I stayed in a single room which was sooo cute and on d uppermost floor of d hotel (and yes there is an elevator though kinda slow ;)) ..it had magnificent views of d canal AND d sky during sunrise and sunset..could see d rooftops and d clouds n colors of d sky :) there was complimentary hot choc and tea coffee etc in d lobby with two desktop comps as well :D staff was sweet (they were kind enough to order a pizza for me from a pizza delivery chain ! ) but, there was an indian guy at d reception who was extremely rude i wonder why....maybe they r rude to fellow indians? i had thot i'd take up d matter and write back to them telling them abt this man and how rude he was.. bu then. i just decided to be indifferent to it :) barring that i had a very comfortable stay at d hotel esp since i was traveling alone - i felt warm, comfortable and at home !

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mslola1965
Reviews.Content: We started in a room in the 1st floor or 2nd floor here in the US, but it was very noisy due to the upstairs people. When another room was available they relocated everything for us, since we were out on a tour. The staff was very accomodating and helpful with every single request. I like the refreshments available at the lobby. I wished I could make that flavor water here. Rooms were very clean and the cleaning staff very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Is location worth the price ?”
Reviews.Author: Dirk D
Reviews.Content: Ideal location close to museums , historical sites and shopping areas, with nice views on the Singel canal (for those who can afford the pricy canal-view rooms ). Except for the staff at the reception , all other staff seemed unexperienced and were sometimes rude , not up to standard for a 4 stars hotel . We stayed in room 210 ,probably one of the biggest canal-view rooms , with a sober decoration compared to other areas in the hotel . Breakfast and parking are extra , which brings the price tag at 430 Eur for a one night stay . I did not make a benchmarking , but is the location and poor service really worth that price ?

Reviews.Title: “adorable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveler2
Reviews.Content: Adorable little hotel with a lobby area which reminds me more of a bed & breakfast than a hotel. Great location! Everyone I encountered at the front desk was friendly and helpful. My room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Only negative is that the walls seem a bit thin and you can hear the other guests in the hallway coming in and out of their rooms. I notice that there were even complimentary earplugs in the the room.

Reviews.Title: “You will not sleep here.”
Reviews.Author: jah187
Reviews.Content: If you intend to sleep, do not stay here. You'll be awakened by every footfall in the room above you and every noise next door. The house keeping is especially noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RSD_Surrey_UK
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and well presented hotel in a great location overlooking the Singel canal. 20 minute walk from the Amsterdam Centraal railway station, or 2 stops on the tram (No.2). Eur13 by taxi. Nicely decorated comfortable rooms. Free tea and coffee and Easter eggs and sweets in the lobby. Good selection for breakfast although a little expensive at Eur18 per head (kids under 12 are free). Very friendly and obliging staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely breakfast and cosy stylish interiors compensate the price”
Reviews.Author: Polinda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a rather quiet historical district with 5 minutes walk to the most famous attractions. It is located on the channel in 4 of these old amsterdamish narrow buildings. The interiors are old fashioned (but recently renovated and very clean), they make you feel like at a family home, very cosy. The breakfast is awesome. It's 15 minutes walk to the Centraal from where you can go to other cities. You could get there even quicker, but you can't help stopping to take pictures every other minute %) It was worth paying their room price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: MarcB83
Reviews.Content: Great location on a lovely canal, quiet yet near everything. Great service. Very clean and very nice hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessiDoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea is a gem! It is a beautiful hotel with a great staff. They upgraded us to a superior room which was a decent size for a European room and it was beautifully decorated. The hotel is also in a very good location. Your a quick walk from everything that you'd want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel but choose a canal view room”
Reviews.Author: d_lt_25
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It was our second time staying here. Very centrally located - you can walk everywhere. Nice furnishings, nice bathrooms, nice staff. One thing to point out though if you dont like noise at night request canal view rooms- the rooms facing the street behind the hotel get noisy during the night because of traffic and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph W
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself, its location, and its personnel are top-flight. Hotel Estherea is located within a few minutes walk of the heart of the city, near plenty of sights and good restaurants, yet situated on a quiet street along one of the inner canals. Moreover, the staff were hugely accommodating and knowledgeable. Although public transportation comes within 200 yards of the hotel, we were able (at ages 65 and 62) easily to walk from the hotel to the Museum Square going south, the Tropenmuseum and other locales going east, and the Anne Frank House and other points west. The tram only came into play for us when we arrived with our luggage on a Saturday evening and when we left the following Saturday morning. Also, booking on TripAdvisor.com meant that we received a free upgrade from a "classic" (rather small) room to a "deluxe" (ample-sized, by European standards) room as well as free Internet throughoiut our stay. Foir some reason, this upgrade policy only applies to TripAdvisor.com reservations. With all of the breakfast, lunch, and dinner places nearby -- several within less than 100 yards -- we did not eat at the hotel, and so cannot comment on the food. But the hotel does provide a nice array of complimentary hot and cold beverages throughout the day and night, as well as snacks at the bar and cookies/cakes in the inner vestibule during most of the day/evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhapsodyman
Reviews.Content: Good choice for a really special break. Handy for museums, shops and canals so you can park the car and walk everywhere. Be good to hire bikes as this means you can cross the city in about 20 minutes. The lounge and bar are sumptuously furnished and the free tea and coffee is quite a good wheeze - nice when you get back from a walk in the cold air.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, well located hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Fuffbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Estherea for three nights mid March and would well recommend it. The pluses : well located and only a short stroll from plenty of bars and restaurants, an excellent value pre-paid breakfast (â‚¬13 per head), beautiful charming rooms - we had a jacuzzi bath and a chandelier over the bed and plenty of public areas to chill and enjoy the complimentary tea / coffee / hot chocolate. The minuses were minor : namely that the accoustics can be quite strange i.e. one morning we thought the couple next door were in our room, and a cat reguarly seemed to appear at reception. I only mention it as it wasnt' the type of hotel you'd expect to see a cat in reception!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: George H
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this hotel and we'll go back again. Having taken a close look at what's there, I am confident that there is no better place to stay. Restaurant was great, pool was good, hot tub was great. We had a good time. Their excitement was addicting! We were given a whole list of family activities that went on all day to add to the festivites. can honestly say the staff was up to the challenge of what appeared to be a full house. The manager was out and about at all times on Saturday night and again on Sunday. Although he was busy, he also didn't hesitate to stop and greet the guests. The staff seemed busy but not stressed and all greeted us with a friendly hello in the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well situated”
Reviews.Author: MichaelCoffey
Reviews.Content: This a delightful hotel, well situated in the town centre and within walking distance of a range of good restaurants. The dÃ©cor has an Edwardian look to it; the reception area is warm and friendly and provides complimentary hot drinks throughout the day. The rooms were very comfortable and well maintained (with real room keys!) and breakfast was plentiful and varied. The hotel first opened in 1942, which must have been an interesting time to be opening a hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel was a real find and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: sassyangel
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Amsterdam. I Chose very carefully the things that would be important to me for the trip and what would not, read other peoples comments and also looked at our budget. I chose this hotel for its boutique acclective look, which i love, and its location. We where not dissapointed at all. The decore of the hotel is fantastic, beautiful chandillers, blossom trees and funky wall paper. The staff where accomodating to our needs, polite and nothing was questioned. For example i am a very light sleeper and we had a deulux room street side. I Had a bad nights sleep due to the road noise ( and the couple next door bonking at 3 am ... very noisily... please note the walls are very thin there is no need to be extra vocal!) . I informed the laduy atr the desk who imediatly changed our room, and she was even kind enough to think about where the room was so it would cause us less issues to find it, they moved all our bags for us too. Bags taken to the room on request no problem. we arrived at 0930am and our bags where safley stored until our return. I would advise if your not a good sleeper to get a room that faces the patio garden. I wanted a view but to be honest your not in your room enough to be staring at the view. We stayed in room 300 on second night which they used for a family the night before as it is definatley larger that the previous one we stayed in, 302 however it was also a great room. My husband slept like a log in both rooms. Loved the jucuzzi bath tub and walk in shower. The free coffee/ tea, biscuits, sweets are an brilliant added bonus especially when u have been on your feet all day and you can sit in the lobby on the very comfy seats and enjoy a free drink! We got a free upgrade to the delux room through tripadvisor which was great. We will be returning to amsterdam , and we will definatley be returning to the Hotel Estherea!!

Reviews.Title: “Estherea, not the finest, not the worst”
Reviews.Author: massis_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea is ideally located, right in the center of Amsterdam, close to the central station. Not too far of the big must-sees of the city. The hotel itself has quite a big reception room. Staff is friendly and helpful. No keycard, but a good old key to open my room. Upside: no technical glitches, downside: you have to drop of your key everytime you leave the hotel. The room was a bit dated to my feel, not modern at all. Cosy, rather big. It has everything you need: tv, refrigerator (although i only found this in a closet at the morning of my departure...), big comfy bed. The bathroom was rather small. Only a bathtub, no shower. But it did the job. Breakfast was nice, a broad selection of food. But expensive, as everything in the hotel. WIFI is paying, carpark cost about â‚¬ 50 for one night! All in all, it's a bit of a mixed bag. It's expensive for what you get. I have no idea if this is the case for all hotels in Amsterdam. But it's clean, nice, and has a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “quite good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marco P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Small rooms and baths. no deluxe rooms with canal-view. You carry your luggage by your own. beds confortable. little bit expensive in relations of quality

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: IvanaP603
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively to Amsterdam and have stayed in numerous hotels throughout the city, but the Estherea is by far my favorite hotel. The location is superb, right in the heart of Amsterdam, on the Singel canal. The house, a beautiful 17th century canal house, is extremely elegant, warm and welcoming, with rich colors and gorgeous chandeliers. The rooms are lovely, very clean with comfortable beds. Each room has its own distinct style and color scheme, and can be accessed with an elevator, a huge bonus, especially in a city where elevators are rare! All of Amsterdam's main attractions are within walking distance, including Dam Square. You can relax in one of the beautifully decorated sitting rooms and enjoy free hot beverages, cookies and other goodies offered by the hotel throughout the day. Staff very helpful and professional. Rooms facing the canal offer splendid views over looking the Singel canal. The hotel breakfast is fine and convenient, but there are several wonderful places in the neighbourhood worth exploring for breakfast. There are a couple of Dutch pancake houses not too far from the hotel which serve up wonderful pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraLewis186254
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for my 30th birthday and when booking the hotel added this was the reason for the trip and found a mini bottle of champagne and chocolates in our room, whiich was a lovely touch. We had a superior deluxe room and it was lovely, there was a spa bath which was amazing. The staff were extremely helpful with luggage and advice on the area. There is a complementary teaa/coffee machine with various biscuits and pastries which again was a lovely touch and certainly got used by all the guests in the hotel, Excellent location too. Only criticism is it is quite expensive to not include breakfast. but overall would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Superb for Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: avecarvalho
Reviews.Content: Estherea hotel is very well located, only two blocks away from Dam Square and a 10 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal, starting point for those who are arriving by train from Schipoll Airport. As touristic Amsterdam is not a big city, everything can be reached by foot or taking a tram on Dam Square. It is a very well decorated hotel, with the reception, a library and a restaurant on the first floor. As it was Valentine's day when we arrived, a bootle with candy and a rubber duck painted with hearts were waiting in our room. Rooms are big, considering other Amsterdam's hotels. Very clean and superbly decorated they transmit a cosy ambience. Bathroom is really small, but clean and nice. I am relatively tall (1,83m) and I had to bend a little to fit beneath the shower, because the ceiling is low. Breakfast is really good. There is not a huge list of choices, but everything is top quality. Staff is nice, but if you take a cab through the concierge it may cost you twice as much as if you take it on the street. Two things disappointed us a little: as we did not get a room facing the canal, our room's windows faced the street behind the hotel and it was a busy and loud street (the Hotel knows that, as they supply ear plugs in the bedside drawer and encourage the guests to use it). The other thing is that just at the side of our room, neighbor to the hotel, there is a traditional Amsterdam Coffee Shop. So, one day, the windows were opened during the time we went to walk and the expected scent of Cannabis filled our room. As we are definitely non smokers, it made us go out again and wait the scent to fade away. It is something that the staff at the reception should warn the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed here, but the first time was 1999 so quite abit was updated since then! We usually stay elsewhere in Amsterdam we find the nightly rate is a bit high, however they had some great winter rates so we decided to spoil ourselves ! We would normally choose a canal view room, but this time we choose a jacuzzi room overlooking Spuistraat..The bathroom was huge and great and so was the jacuzzi! The room was of decent size and very comfortable! The breakfast, although a tad expensive was awesome! I loved the decÃ³re of the Lobby and loved the chairs in the little lounge, as well as the chandelier's and the color scheme! We came the day after Valentines's and it was so nicely decorated :) It was so cold outside we enjoyed to just sit in the lounge and have a coffee or beer and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere (I do not remember it being so relaxed when we stayed in 1999). The staff was friendly and helpful, we had free wi-fi ( I booked on their website online), and I would love to stay here every time we come to Amsterdam if it wasn't so pricey! Also love that area of Amsterdam so location is perfect! Hope to stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Roseleaf
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the charm of an old canal house with all modern conveniences. The room was beautiful and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Being there in winter, we liked that coffees, hot chocolate, and a selection of teas were always available. They even gave us a rose and a red rubber ducky with hearts on Valentines Day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful romantic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieNolan
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Our experience there was fantastic! This hotel is beautifully designed and you get complimentary coffee or hot chocolate downstairs available at all times. The staff were very helpful and a pleasure to deal with. Room service was prompt and of a high standard. Rose petals and a bottle of processo in our bedroom (of course at an extra cost) was elegantly laid out as seen from the photo I put up. We would highly recommend this hotel especially for a nice romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Near everything”
Reviews.Author: JukkaPaananen
Reviews.Content: Small, classic -however very fresh and newly furnished and fresh smelling- hotel with good mood reception people that did their work very well. Third floor room with view to the channel was medium size double bed room that was decorated very tastefully with lot of fabrics and wood. Bathroom was very nice - all together excellent facilities. Hotel is very centrally located: 15 minutes walking from Central Station, 5 minutes from Damrak and Dam Square, 10 minutes to Leidseplein etc. Sufficient with shops and restaurants near by ... strongly recommend one of the Bruin Cafe:s (traditional Dutch beer and snack bars) on the way to Jordaan. shops, restaurants etc are very near. Artist oriented Jordaan area is as well near

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytimbo
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place was great and did not stop impressing us- beautiful rooms, attentive staff- we brought dinner back to the hotel and they were happy to supply plates, cutlery, and napkins- with a smile! Really friendly staff- everyone says hello (in many languages) and the weekend buffet breakfast was superb.. The trip advisor upgrade was very appreciated! Thanks hotel Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned”
Reviews.Author: Tessa P
Reviews.Content: Really central and within walking distance of rail station and nearly all Amsterdam's sites. Our room was warm and very comfortable, though I did have to ask for a second pillow for my side of the bed! Room was quiet in terms of noise from outside the hotel; but giant footsteps could be heard from room above; tip: ask for a room on the top floor! Large, comfy sitting area near reception is a big bonus for footsore tourists, and books, journals and free flowing hot drinks aid relaxation. Reception staff are efficient and super friendly; one of them even advised on how to avoid over charging cabbies! No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps getting better and better”
Reviews.Author: ElVikingo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the hotel. This was our 7th time at the hotel, and eventhough we return every 6 months, it is amazing to see the little improvements that are made everytime we return. Greeted with a pleasant smile and welcome back at the check in, which took all but 2 minutes. Had a nice room overlooking the Singel canel, would highly recommend if you have the budget for it, but the deluxe rooms overlooking Spui is also nice. The breakfast seems to be nicer, however it can feel a little cramped when they are busy. The wifi seemed to work better and faster this time around, so maybe they have upgraded that part since last time. Service was great as always. However would like to see the PC's upgraded in the lobby, and maybe a coat hanger in the bar, so you do not need to drop your coat off when leaving or wanted a cocktail before going out. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Staff were extra welcoming to our one and three year olds”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderQ
Reviews.Content: Great place right in the heart of town. Seriously could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 3 nights here on a mid week break. We took a taxi from Centraal Station which cost 7â‚¬ and took less than 5 minutes. Although check in is nominally 3 o'clock we arrived at 12 and were met with politeness and the room was ready for us. We stayed in a lovely room on the 1st floor , it was nicely decorated in a luxurious manner rather than a modernist manner . The bathroom had twin sinks and a jacuzzi style bath with a separate shower. Toiletries were provided. The room was spotless as was the entire hotel as I could see. the staff were ever willing to advise and assist whenever they were needed. We did not take the breakfast option this time although people we talked to were happy with the quality. We did avail ourselves of the compementary coffee which was of a good quality and available 24 hours a day. The Hotel bar is quite small but the prices were consistant with bar prices and not inflated. The location of the hotel is near to the 9 streets and is 3 minutes from the Spui, 5 minutes from Anne Frank and less than 5 minutes to Dam square. We found the hotel to be central enough as not to use any transport during our visit, even the museum quarter was less than 10 minutes walk. The Hotel has several good restaurants in the vicinity in various price ranges. The only drawback I can possibly think of is that the hotel does not provide free wifi but this had no negative effect on our break. We would definately stop here again on our next visit to Amsterdam and would reccomend it to anyone looking for a more romantic style of hotel or a very well situated hotel. I would say if you want a brash night life located hotel this is not for you

Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: PeregianPair
Reviews.Content: My wife and I together with our two adult children and their partners spent a long weekend at the Estherea in February 2012. The hotel is ideally located on Singel canal, not far from any of the major attractions so we were comfortable walking to most. We had 3 rooms, including a canal room that had a fantastic view of the frozen canal when we were there. The rooms were all good sizes and beautifully decorated. The beds were incredibly comfortable, with sumptuous matresses and the fluffiest duvets we've ever experienced. All staff were very friendly, even down to the house staff who were meticulously cleaning the chandelier in the entry foyer on Sunday morning and still had time to offer a greeting. All day free coffee and nibbles were greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome in sub zero temps”
Reviews.Author: Virgingymbunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an ideal location with Dam Square just behind and the Nine shopping streets in front, however it is a very quiet and peaceful setting on Singel which meant we slept very soundly aided by the very comfortable beds. Ideal for couples of all ages looking for friendly service in luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Dutch hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmg1958
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea is a classic Dutch hotel. Built in a series of 17th century buildings right next to the Singel canal. It's interior and rooms are classically furnished. The breakfast is very good. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The only downside is the lack of insulation between floors and walls...try to get a room on the top floor. Otherwise a very nice and well-located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Dutch experience”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Gamble
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights at the Hotel Estherea and it was a great experience. The location is excellent in the center of the city-just a block or two from dozens of restaurants and with in walking distance of sites such as the Anne Frank House and Dam Square. The rooms were more spacious than I expected and impeccably decorated. Gorgeous traditional furnishings and very comfy beds. The lobby area is equally lovely and comfortable and is a great place for an evening drink. People tend to gather and it's a nice place for conversation with other guests. Plush towels and a beautiful, large bathroom were an added bonus to this hotel. The staff speaks very good English and they are most helpful and accommodating. The breakfast is also very good with a wide selection of meats, cheeses, fruit, eggs, and breads and well worth the added cost. If you book through the hotel's website you can choose packages that included a discounted breakfast. The only thing keeping me from giving the hotel a perfect rating? It's not well insulated and we could hear people in neighboring rooms as well as the people above us. I'm a heavy sleeper and it didn't bother me but it did keep my husband awake at night. All in all, I would certainly recommend this lovely hotel and would visit there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: bagin1981
Reviews.Content: I loved it! The first hotel in the center - anywhere out of town a short walk. The hotel itself is small, very cozy. . Despite the fact that the room was without view, very nice, though small, perhaps as elsewhere in the Netherlands in small hotels. Breakfast - buffet style. Coffee from the coffee machine during the day for free Rooms cleaned every day. Stuff was polite. In general, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: mouseflower
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 relaxing nights at the welcoming Hotel Estherea. Though we had a very early morning arrival time, the hotel staff gladly accepted our luggage to free us to take a long walk along the canals. By the time we returned we were able to access our room several hours before the official check-in time so that we could change our clothes and regroup after our trans-Atlantic flight, a courtesy we very much appreciated. Our room was on the small side, but beautifully decorated. It faced the courtyard (no canal view rooms were available) and was very quiet. We especially loved the orchid-filled lobby and the 24 hr. coffee/tea/hot chocolate service. It was a pretty spot to sit and look at the canal and have a drink. We ate our breakfast a la carte, and everything was delicious and served elegantly. The location of the hotel is nearly perfect. You can easily walk with a suitcase from the train station, and to many fine restaurants and cultural sites. If given the opportunity, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel quiet location”
Reviews.Author: peteruk53
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before getting the early train back to the UK . I had been working elsewhere, and had a night in Amsterdam. The hotel is on a quiet canal. My room overlooked the canal, with good views. The room was quite big, compared to what I had heard about hotels in Amsterdam. Stairs were fine, not like a loft ladder, as some are. The room was well furnished, if a bit chintzy and dark, but otherwise great, very clean, great shower and bathroom, really comfortable bed. Free internet in the lobby area, also a bonus. I didnt eat there, so cannot comment, but the concierge was really helpful in finding me a good Italian restaurant nearby. I got a taxi there, but I realised that its close to the Central Station, so for my return, I got the concierge to describe the walking route to me, which he did. Overall, nice stay, cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Purrina
Reviews.Content: We would definitely return to this hotel. We had a Classic room (smallest and cheapest) and it was perfectly decorated, comfortable and very clean. We loved the public areas too i.e. library, lounge and bar. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we did not want to pay 18 euros apiece (though there is a Pain Quotidien behind the hotel on Spuistraat). The free tea / coffee / cappuccino / hot chocolate was very welcome. This hotel was well placed for exploring the city on foot.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, welcoming, great experience”
Reviews.Author: blowyourowntrumpet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel Estherea, and found the experience wonderful..From the moment we arrived and discovered we had an up graded "canal view " room,(414) the outlook was good! The staff were friendly and very willing to help,give directions etc. We also returned to our room to find complimentary prosecco and chocolates for a birthday treat, and the next day 14th february we got Valentine treats left in our room...Rooms were very clean, the cooked breakfasts were great and there was also a large variety of fresh fruit,fresh breads, meats,cheese et al. The 24hour coffee machine was fantastic and the quality great,offering huge selection of coffee, tea and drinking chocolate. The beds were comfortable and we slept very well. Situated on one of the prettiest canals in Amsterdam and close to Dam Square,and twelve minutes to central station, we were able to walk everywhere with ease. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and I certainly will stay again. As a footnote, we took a trip to Haarlem, 15 mins on the train, lovely town, well worth a visit, especially the tour around CorrieTen Boom museum, which was free and the local tour guides passionate about their subject,for me a more moving experience than Anne Frank..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: GMCYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Found the hotel exactly as described. Well situated, very clean and our room although small was excellent. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snail49
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel ! My first time in Amsterdam and wanted a gorgeous hotel and this hotel certainly ticked all the boxes. I booked via Tripadvisor which entitled me to an upgrade to a deluxe room. I arrived at the hotel in a temperature of minus 7, they pointed me to the free coffee/tea facilities and gave me a choice of rooms on 4th floor. Our room was really nice, the heating worked, the bed was very comfortable and the shower and jacuzzi both worked extremely well. As it was my first time had to ask the Reception for directions on more than one occasion and they were very helpful and courteous. Please stay at this hotel..it may not be in the main 'drag' but it's only a few mins walk to Dam and you'll love it! PS: join the Estherea Friends on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine Trip”
Reviews.Author: Newty52
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Hotel very comfortable and was a welcome base after the snow and cold weather we have just experienced. Comfortable bed, fab bathroom and complimentary tea, coffee etc together with cookies and small cakes. Didnt eat in the hotel but found plenty of nice places for lunch and dinner but would recommend small dutch cafe left out of the hotel on the corner of the 1st bridge, Bert,s and Ernies for breakfast a 3rd of the cost of the hotel but no way detracted from the food. If we ever return would look no further than to stay at the Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_FW
Reviews.Content: Om Singel canal with wonderful views of th canal. Tastefully decorated. Great breakfast with old selection of eggs, breakfast meats, cereals....all the trimmings. Good location within easy walk to Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated- well run- very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Travelthoughtfully
Reviews.Content: We qualified for an upgrade and had a room facing the Canal on the second floor. Rooms not big but perfectly adequate. Very comfortable bed. Very good complimentary coffee and hot chocolate from a machine in the foyer which was most welcome as it was very cold in Amsterdam when we were there and all the canals had frozen over. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive so we had croissants and coffee in cafes nearby, and watched the world go by. As citycentre hotels go, it is good value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jlxu
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights courtyard facing room. The room size was large with great layout in room and bathroom. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Eustatia
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, the great spacious lobby with lounge areas, the coffee machine, cookies. Loved the room we were given at first, a huge orange room right above the front door. The room had three sets of huge windows. But we had to move as it was really loud at night. We could hear people outside going in and out of the front door and also, smoking outside and we could smell it in the room. Also, the room was right next to internal main stairwell with old squeaky floors. And even I used the earplugs to sleep I still could hear the stairwell vibration. People run up and down and it sounds like horses migration in the open field. We moved to the top floor but the room was not nice. It was very small, with little window (it was an attic room) and no place to lounge. So we did not get lucky with the room but I loved the hotel and its location. And, best of all they have the coolest cat which I had a pleasure petting every night. It made my day!

Reviews.Title: “For a city hotel - just gorgeous.”
Reviews.Author: andyl2001
Reviews.Content: For a city hotel - just gorgeous. That is: smart, thoughtful, a discreet luxury :) Aquarium at the reception desk - simply fascinating :) The library and living room downstairs next to the tea room - coffee machine, coffee and tea available all day for free (it is in the city, then the hotel!). All rooms are decorated differently. As far as I've seen - at least on my floor - no two have the same wallpaper, consequently, curtains / blankets / pillows / chandeliers are all different :) Since the decoration of the room is designed in the same style. Love and the owner and staff of the hotel felt everywhere - from first to last floor. In the breakfast room a lot of orchids - at least, was at that time. Hotel in the center, up to 4 stops of tram station.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: NeginN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, who live in Toronto, got married in Amsterdam in July, 2011, and we stayed at this hotel for four days around our wedding date. While the ceremony itself was at a different venue, the Estherea Hotel was the starting point for our wedding day photos, which turned out more beautiful than we could have imagined. The 'Getting Ready' photos in our large room were lovely, in particular as the wallpaper and floor carpets created a romantic, victorian-like look. After that, I came down the main stairway into the lobby where my husband greeted me with my wedding bouquet - we loved this moment itself as much as the memories that we can revive through our amazing wedding photos. Also, the bar area with the large crystal ceiling lamps, as well as the colourful glass in the foyer leading to the dining area, in particular, created beautiful backdrops for our first photos together in our wedding attire. This is simply a beautiful hotel, perfectly situated in the heart of Amsterdam, along one of the most scenic canals! What we also liked about the hotel was that they gave us a (relatively!) good price for our large canal-facing room. They did this mainly, I suspect, because they expected that we would bring in a large amount of business as our wedding guests were mostly travelling from abroad as well. However, the normal rates of this hotel are quite high, which, ultimately, lead to only one other wedding guest staying there. We could fully understand our guests' decisions to stay elsewhere, as we ourselves would also never stay in such a pricy hotel except for a once-in-a-lifetime event like our wedding. However, for those who are willing to indulge, I highly recommend this hotel! It is infinitely more endearing, romantic, and special than the large luxury hotel chains you can find in any major city. The other thing that we absolutely loved, was the breakfast buffet. It was so full of variety and tastes, that it was hard to restrain myself for the sake of fitting into my wedding dress, and -certainly- the morning after the wedding I finally took full and unrestricted advantage of this culinary experience! The only thing we thought they could slightly improve on was, in certain respects, their service. During our stay many of our family and friends who were staying in nearby hotels stopped by off and on to meet us for activities and meals in the nearby vicinity. At one occasion, a staff member confronted us saying that this created a bit of a security risk for them. We found a solution in the end, and, especially, on our wedding day, they were more than gracious about the amount of people lingering in the lobby before my arrival at the staircase. But, what we found a bit disturbing was that at two different occasions, hotel maids gave us entry into our hotel room, not verifying who we were; and this, in my opinion, is a much more grave security issue than the presence of non-guests in the lobby area. Finally, back on the positive side, I want to mention a rather small aspect that, in my opinion, gave the hotel its finishing touch. There was an adorable three-coloured cat in their hotel lobby that seemed to live there and walked around freely in the hotel area. This little, well-mannered host fit in perfectly with the ambience and the atmosphere of the place while giving it the personal touch of a Parisian-style boutique hotel: unique and artistic in every way!

Reviews.Title: “So Lovely”
Reviews.Author: lavitabella
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 enjoyed this charming hotel in the Singel so much that we would not hesitate to recommend to friends. The hotel was decorated for Christmas which added to ambience. Rooms were small but adequate with plenty of storage and a really lovely bathroom. Nice , clean and well laid out. The decor in the rooms was lovely, bed comfortable and heating just perfect. The hot cappuccinos, hot chocolates and cookies free all day in reception area was a nice touch. What a nice way to be greeted as you come in from the cold. Bar area was nice and the sitting area with plenty of large lounges and chairs was a great place to relax and unwind after a day out. Staff were all very helpful and seemed very friendly. Breakfast was nice- something for everyone. I have stayed in many 5 star that didn't have the ambience this hotel had. Congratulations to the owners. A great choice for our trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Very Chilled”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIIYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Had a very relaxing and chilled out time here, rooms were excellent as was the service and it is a tremedous location. Well reccoemnedced!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Priya211
Reviews.Content: I would most definitely return to this hotel. Firstly its location is brilliant, all of the main sites are in close proximity and there are tram stops close to the hotel for venturing a little further. It is situated on one of the beautiful canals and the hotel looks lovely at night when its all lit up. There are various cafe's and restaurants within a short walking distance. I would recommend the Luxembourg cafe, it is a lovely atmospheric setting where you could people watch all day. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful. The pictures i saw of the hotel when planning the trip definitely do not do it justice. The front of house areas and bedrooms are really wonderful and there is a complimentary tea/coffee etc machine in the lobby. The lobby and bar are beautifully decorated and very comfy. The hotel also has a couple of computers which are of complimentary use. There is also a small board just next the bar which has various vouchers for discounts and deals on local attractions, restaurants etc. The rooms are of a good size and you are able to book a room with a jacuzzi which is lovely after roaming Amsterdam all day in the cold months. The room we stayed in had a good sized bathroom which included a separate walk in shower and then in the main bathroom area were his and hers sinks and as mentioned, the jacuzzi. The toilet was located just next door to the bathroom in a separate room. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. All members of staff were pleasant and helpful in general and with any queries. The young man who showed us to our room gave us a very warm welcome and made good conversation. Working in the hotel industry myself i am usually very particular and critical but i really do not have a bad word to say about this hotel. They will definitely make your stay in Amsterdam a brilliant one.

Reviews.Title: “nice for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: LondonCat100
Reviews.Content: Such a great location and lovely staff & amazing rooms - great value for money. Have stayed there twice now and will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, well-located hotel. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: drnovak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent just one night at Hotel Estherea in Amsterdam and we had a very nice stay. The staff at the front desk is very friendly. Our room was very clean and plenty spacious. I had mentioned on the website when I reserved that we were staying the night for my wife's birthday and there was a nice little gift of chocolates and a small birthday card in the room when we arrived. A very nice touch. The lobby is very attractive and there is complimentary coffee, hot chocolate and water available in the lobby at all times as well as some little candies and snacks. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but only because we had reservations at a local cafe. The hotel is in a very nice location and is along a very nice canal and close to the "9 little streets" which is a nice shopping area. Also close to Kalverstraat. It was slightly noisy in our room with the street below and we could hear the neighboring room in the morning, but they did offer complimentary earplugs at the front desk. Our night stay was not cheap, but it is definitely the quality hotel I would expect for the price. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and warm atmoshere in the heart of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: vele30
Reviews.Content: Excellent location.Warm atmosphere in a very typically Dutch style. Easy walking to old part of town, nearby all the most important attractions in Amsterdam: less than 10 minutes from Leidseplein and five minutes walk from Dam Square. Rooms are not so big, but confortable clean and well equipped, bathrom wery confortable and functional. Good buffet breakfast, but a bit expensive. I recommend the hotel to people who want have few vacation days in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - must go back”
Reviews.Author: LizandDan
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I've stayed in. Just got back after staying with a friend and we loved this hotel. Check in was swift, although we had to wait a couple of hours for our room despite requesting an early check in, but it was lunch time so we didn't mind. The public areas are simply stunning, the free coffee and hot chocolates were of a high quality. There are free biscuits, cakes, nuts at various times throughout the day. There is a beautiful tortoiseshell cat roaming around who thinks she's a princess. Just realised that makes me sound like I've been partaking in some typical Amsterdam activites, but actually just repeating what reception said! Room was large. We were upgraded to a triple room so had a massive sofa, which was great for having a few drinks whilst getting ready. Bathroom was spotless, but had no extractor, which was a little odd. With no window it was a bit like being on board a ship. Would have preferred a bath screen rather than a shower curtain, but just personal preference. Breakfast was outstanding. Plentiful, varied, healthy or unhealthy, champagne, cake. The service is friendly, professional, helpful and well organised. The barmen were knowledgeable and great fun. Location is perfect for exploring all over the city. Just need to find an excuse to go back there now with my Husband.

Reviews.Title: “It was good for us...”
Reviews.Author: janinaD
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend over the summer so I don't have as much experience as others. I will say for $500 US it was just average. The decor is very nice. The bed was not comfortable, it was 2 singles combined to make a larger bed so during the night you feel the middle of the bed separating. The bathroom was large and the shower was good. They have an old fashioned key that you have to give back every time you leave. Location was PERFECT though, Id stay again just for that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: grmcfrey
Reviews.Content: A traditional canal side house, with lavish furnishings and comfortable public areas. The room was very well appointed and the bathroom spacious and very well fitted. It's only 20 mins walk from central station and all the major attractions are walkable. There are many restaurants near by, which serve both dinner and breakfast. The Estherea buffet is very nice but quite pricey (18 euros). The hotel provides complimentary hot drinks at all times; there is a wide choice and they are of a very good quality. The staff are very helpful and friendly. I thoroughly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky with Quality”
Reviews.Author: melbster
Reviews.Content: Estheria offers comfortable decent sized rooms with large and well appointed bathrooms in a great central location. The public rooms of the hotel offer some great places to relax in well furnished rooms with a luxurious but quirky feel. Staff were always helpful and well informed about options for eating or other travelers services. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great breakfast, good facilities, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: TashBeestie
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised when we walked into Hotel Estherea, from the outside it looked very unassuming but the lobby was very beautifully decorated, with amazing crystal chandeliers, the most beautiful tropical aquarium which looked like it came straight out of FInding Nemo. The rooms are also beautiful and very comfortable and clean. We were on the 5th floor overlooking Spruistraat and found it was very quiet. They also had the best breakfast spread, everything was really tasty and such a wide variety of food, with a nice array of little jars of jams and chocolate sprinkles! The hotel provides really good facilities, with a 24 hr bar that was actually very well priced, as well as free coffee, hot and cold drinks, peanut snacks and biscuits at all time. Location was great, on Singel and walkable to the whole of central Amsterdam, Museumplein & Vondelpark. Probably the only thing that stuck out to me as unpleasant in my stay was that some of the staff could have been a little bit friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hope51
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in late August whilst visiting family in The Netherlands. Although there is a lot to like about this hotel unfortunately we found the tiny bathroom with the louvered doors awkward and impractical. If not for this I would have given the Estherea a higher rating as the location, bedroom size (we had a double canal view room), great downstairs guest areas with free tea, coffee or hot chocolate available all day, make for a very pleasant and homely place to stay in the heart of Amsterdam. My daughter was particularly taken with the hotel cat! The breakfast room is a little too small for the crowds at the height of the tourist season. Tables very close together and the small child banging cutlery in your face did not make for a very pleasant meal the one and only time I ventured down to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandy L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 2011. Fabulous hotel. Great location within walking distance of all the sights/attractions without being too far out or too close to the hustle and bustle. Beautiful room, very friendly staff. Spotlessly clean. free tea/coffee throughout the day so we kept coming back to our room to drop bags off and have a cuppa. Fabulous breakfasts each morning. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and they recommended Haesje Claes (just around the corner from the hotel really). Great traditional Dutch food, wonderful warm and friendly atmosphere. Highly recommended and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from the 6th Jan 2012 for 3 nights and had a great time. The hotel was better than the photos, our room was spacious and comfortable. The staff were really helpfully. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Location along the canal was great. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was so clean and comfortable. It was a small room but really nicely decorated and we had a lovely view of the canal from our room. The bathroom is very nice. Free hot chocolate in reception was a nice touch. Very good breakfast. Expensive car park. Very high charge for Internet connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “What an upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: TrondM
Reviews.Content: Be aware that this review is for the room I was assigned, the other "deluxe rooms" may be of a different standard. I was upgraded from standard room to deluxe trough an Amex promotion.. And I guess I was very lucky with the upgrade. The staff member escorted me to a room with double doors.. I thought I was going to another part of the hotel, but looking inside it was a huge room with two floors. Turns out that I was given the "Orange Suite", a room not even available on the hotel booking website.A mix between a library, meeting room and a royal suite. A multimedia system with an 60 inch tv, blue ray player and radio, all controlled by a wireless remote controller (with display). Separate toilet and a bathroom with both a jacuzzi and shower. The breakfast was typical Dutch, and tasted excellent. I can not find anything negative to say about my stay at Hotel Estherea. They market them selves as a 4 star hotel, but for me this was a 5 star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: madalinaHK
Reviews.Content: The four of us ( two daughters 17 and 11) shared the family room over two nights in December, which was a good deal. Comfortable beds, great location. Room overlooked the main road behind instead of Canal in front and was a little noisy at night, but nothing we couldn't cope with. Delicious hot chocolate from machine downstairs. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than the photos-everything exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: C G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only one night as it was a stopover to meet a friend but I wish I could have stayed longer. The room was lovely with high quality bed (so important when you travel a lot), fluffy cotton towels and other amenities. And clean, clean, clean. The service was excellent and not stuffy. The photos donÂ´t do the common areas justice. I rarely use such spaces in hotels as they are either too uncomfortable or too busy and just there for show. Well, what a lovely place these areas were to visit, to have a coffee or tea (provided free and much better than anything you get in Starbucks) or a glass of wine (they offered to let me taste a few before deciding). It felt like I was in someoneÂ´s elgant but comfortable home. I will definately return, next time with my husband and have already told people that this is THE place to stay in Amsterdam. (Plus there is an excellent artisan cheese shop up the corner whose owner told us of a great, out of the way place to eat. I took a quarter suitcase of cheese home as they pack it up nicely and it isnÂ´t tourist priced). Oh, and the location--so easy and central. And did I mention the views of the canal?

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: TrudyCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Estherea Hotel for 4nights over Christmas. We absolutely loved it and cannot wait to return. We had a deluxe canal view room & it was well worth the extra money. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated, extremely comfortable and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was great with several options to choose from and the staff were very friendly. The location was perfect...close to everything and in a very nice safe area overlooking the Singal canal. This was my first experience of Amsterdam, and thanks to this hotel I really can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karee W
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. The location was perfect and we could not have asked for more. The hotel is quaint and the staff very friendly. I would stay here again. Take a taxi from the train station if you have a lot of luggage but you can walk if you dont have a lot to carry. Lots of shopping in the area and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This is the 3rd hotel I've stayed at in Amsterdam and now will only stay here.”
Reviews.Author: STLbased
Reviews.Content: Great location and a very nice place to stay with helpful staff. We were still adjusting to the trans-Atlantic time change one morning and missed breakfast. We were commenting about how late we slept when we handed our key to the desk clerk. Without us asking, she checked with the kitchen staff to see if it was possible to still get a bite to eat. They were still putting items away so quickly provided us with a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bob_mu_grad
Reviews.Content: he Hotel Estherea is an excellent hotel in every category. It is just minutes from the train station, the tourist attractions, restaurants, and shopping. More important, however, are these aspects. The bed, blankets, and pillows together provide for a comfortable night of sleeping. A wide variety of food is offered at the appropriately priced continental breakfast. Finally, the staff treat you like a friend rather than just another face. All of these together combine for a pleasant stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: poshbird120
Reviews.Content: My partner booked a classic room in this hotel for my birthday. He mentioned this when he booked and we were upgraded to a Deluxe Room at the rear of the hotel which had a beautiful 4 poster bed and jaccuzi bath. The decor in the room had a real touch of class and really made my birthday trip to Amsterdam feel very special. The bar and lounge area with the complimentary hot drinks was a nice place to sit and relax after a day shopping. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. We had a breakfast in the hotel on our last day, didn't fancy the full buffet but the scrambled eggs and croissants in the lounge were more than enough to satisfy our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and nice decorations”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Amsterdam, I must say the Estherea was a very positive surprise to me. The hotel isn't very well known among the locals, but offers a very comfortable stay with nicely decorated rooms. It really managed to impress me. I stayed at the 'Suite van Oranje' (free upgrade offer) which was very impressive with high ceilings, a multimedia entertainment system, and a very nice "library-feel" interior. The location on 'het Singel' (the first of the four famous Canals) is convenient, being close to the city center but still a pleasant distance to the entertainment areas like Leidseplein and Rembrandtplein. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely!”
Reviews.Author: LanaCash
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just enjoyed a three night stay at the Estherea. Although I've read a few reviews commenting on the small room sizes, our room (416) was very spacious, well decorated, warm and clean. We couldn't work the air con/heating so we turned the radiator on and it was wonderful- made the room so toasty. The bed was very generous, as was the bathroom. We absolutely loved the decor throughout the hotel too! The hotel offer free tea, coffee, hot choc and biscuits for all guests, which is absolutely lovely and very unique. The bar area is small but well stocked and comfortable. There is also a library which is wonderfully decorated and looks out over the canal. We didn't have a meal at the hotel so couldn't comment on the food but I'm sure it's great! Location for us was fantastic: about a 5 minute walk from Dam Square but far enough away that there was very little noise or traffic. Staff were very welcoming and friendly. They helpfully informed us that the doors were locked at 11pm but that we just had to ring the bell if we arrived back any later. We had no real cause to have any extensive dealings with the hotel staff as everything was so lovely! All in all we were so pleased with everything. Have to mention again how brilliant the decor is- have a look at the website! I had booked the hotel so was a little worried it wouldn't be to my boyfriend's taste but he loved it too. We really didn't want to leave and will definitely be visiting beautiful Amsterdam and Hotel Estherea next year!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, warm, and welcome”
Reviews.Author: KissinCousins
Reviews.Content: A taxi driver found this wonderful little hotel for us, as we were booked at the Wyndham so far from everything, and decided to change hotels. The location of this little gem was wonderful, within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. The friendly staff went out of their way to make sure we had the perfect room overlooking the canal, a true boudoir with a wonderful bathroom that even heated our towels. It was immaculate and very quiet. After a hard day of walking, sightseeing, and shopping it was so nice to come back to the hotel and enjoy complimentary coffee, hot chocolate and cakes and chocolates, or a drink at the little bar with the couches. Breakfast was wonderful every morning but was 16 eurors a person a day, but we were told if we had booked online it would have been free. This hotel was one of the best parts of our anniversary trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pricey but great”
Reviews.Author: Franchinii
Reviews.Content: Everything nice, Very personalised and stylish rooms. For couples is great hotel experience. Very nice lobby with tropical acquarium and nice furnitures. Only negative things ws the noise of walking on the wooden floor coming from room above.

Reviews.Title: “What to say about one of the nicest hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gustavoarg
Reviews.Content: On several trips to amsterdam, I found Estherea Hotel incredible. The room was spacious, (I have an upgrade to canal view -but I have three working people on my windows doing a restoration on the hotel facade). The bar and comun areas are very cozy and the service was great. Nice place to return.

Reviews.Title: “just chillin”
Reviews.Author: westcoastcanuck
Reviews.Content: my wife and I enjoyed a four day stay at this wonderful property on a stopover between Vancouver B.C. and Rome. Our son and his girlfriend who live in Prague joined us and acted as our tour guides(they know the city well) It was a great few days and we all enjoyed the hotel immensely. Hotel personnel were all friendly, efficient and helpful. The hotel itself is located right on one of the many canals in the city and we found it to be an excellent jumping off spot for our exploring. All in all, we can highly recommend this hotel. Our stay was a few months ago and we are looking for a reason to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love Amsterdam and the Hotel Estherea!”
Reviews.Author: keld0rama
Reviews.Content: First trip to Amsterdam as part of a 10-day vacation over Thanksgiving week. Can't wait to go back! I needed a few things in a hotel when I was booking: an elevator, as my elderly mother has trouble with stairs; preferred not to do the large chain hotels; larger rooms than is customary in Amsterdam; I still wanted that old European charm. This hotel delivered it all. The front desk staff was pleasant and accommodating, even at 9:30pm. They gave us rooms right next to each other - my husband and me in 110 and my mother in 112. These upgraded canal-view rooms had more than enough space. The bathroom was on the small side, but still plenty of room to shower and such. Our rooms had a tub/shower combo, single sink, and commode. The doors are louvered, not solid. Our bed was indded a king. Mother's was 2 twins pushed together; but she was a single so it didn't matter. The heavy, interlined draperies help to deaden the noise from outside. But they also cover the heat registers. You may want to lift a few panels up onto tops of the wooden radiator covers to keep the heat in the room. This hotel has been updated and modernized, but it is still an old soul at heart. The floors in the halls creak...GASP! And the walls are not super insulated from sound. If that's the type of hotel you are looking for, stay at the Hilton. The doors are locked at 11pm. You simply buzz the intercom and the desk clerk will let you in. We never had a problem with this. The hot beverage bar and sweet treats were also a nice touch. We did not eat in the hotel's restaurant. We preferred to experience the local businesses. It is a little pricier than many hotels in Amsterdam. But given the location, the staff, and the charm, it's so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with lots to offer.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel (Hotel Estherea) in November. I absolutely loved the hotel! I loved the furnishings, the staff were very friendly and had good local knowledge. The reading room and hot chocolate were great, just as everyone has described in their reviews. I think what made my stay even more enjoyable was the little extras, like snacks at the bar, the free coffee and hot chocolate and of course the helpful, sincere staff. The location of the hotel was also great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small hotel with personal service.

Reviews.Title: “...chilly night...”
Reviews.Author: VFitaly
Reviews.Content: LOVED: * Excellent location * Room overlooking the canal * Wonderful breakfast buffet * Very nice and helpful staff DIDN'T REALLY LOVE: * Heating failure and no way to start it, resulting in a really chilly December night! Hotel management made up for this, though, by offering us free breakfast and, as I mentioned earlier, Estherea breakfast is really worth a try! * Over-decorated hotel...I am more on the minimal/contemporary design side * Tiniest bathroom HATED: * 2011 - almost 2012 - and still NO FREE WI-FI for hotel guests...could you believe it?!?

Reviews.Title: “a perfect choice for an Amsterdam experience”
Reviews.Author: Bart16
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Amsterdam and the hotel Estherea was a choice with few regrets. in a perfect location to experience the scale and charm of Amsterdam and be close to all the it has to offer, it was comfortable inviting and hospitable. Our room overlooking the canal had a postcard view. Though the room was small and over abundant with upholstery it mimicked the scale of the city. The public areas with comfortable sitting areas, a myriad of reading material and an accomplished aquariam; in and of itself entertaining, completed the hotel experience. Our only regret was a seemingly disinterested staff at the desk that never seemed to engage with its clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: NiklasBB
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at Estherea with my wife on our first weekend for ourselves after the arrival of our baby girl - and we couldn't have asked for anything more. Beautiful, old-style room with three large windows with direct view to the beautiful canals and in a great area with plenty of shopping, good dining and great vibes. We really have to give Estherea our very best recommendations!! We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jrhancock
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel. Superb location with appealing shops and inviting bars right by. Wonderful cost room. Really welcoming bar to settle in. Help-yourself complimentary coffee and cakes. Don't bother searching loads of other hotels book this one. Ps I don't normally bother writing reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Small luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: FranceSuedeSuisse
Reviews.Content: Spent a great week-end at hotel Estherea. Perfect location, you can walk to all the important Amsterdam sites from here. We had a beautiful room with canal view from three windows, comfy beds, nice big bathroom. We arrived early and got our room right away. The breakfast buffet is very good with attentive staff and well worth the money. Efficient housekeeping, our room was made up during the time we spent at the breakfast buffet and was just ready when we came back, great! After a day of museums, having coffee or tea and pastries in the library is a perfect way to unwind. A true luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, location and service”
Reviews.Author: pixel155019
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night but was very impressed by the efficiency at reception, as well as the comfort, style and service.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Discovery”
Reviews.Author: joyceBethesda_Md
Reviews.Content: At the end of our Uniworld river boat trip our one night at the Hotel Estherea was a delight. We arrived around 10 A.M. and fully expected to check our bags until our rooms were available. Imagine our delight when they informed us that one of our rooms was ready and that they were upgrading us to canal front rooms! The hotel, although old, is up to date and furnished tastefully with old world charm. There is a computer and printer in the lobby, if you need to print your boarding passes, coffee etc is available there as well. Best of all is the location, which is on the Singel canal, only a few short blocks from the Flower market, shopping, and just about any other attraction you may wish to visit. The front desk couldn't have been more congenial and pleasant. I highly recommend this hotel when visiting Amsterdam. We would absolutely book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Nothing Else Very Compelling”
Reviews.Author: Wine_Merchant
Reviews.Content: You cannot have a better location in this charming city with easy access to old Amsterdam on Singel Canal. The hotel meets one's basic needs but falls short in a few areas. I paid additional rate for a canal view room and "more space." requested King Bedded room. This hotel idea of a King bed is two single beds pushed together with seperate linens and a gap between the two. In essence you have a single bed. It does not work for one person and more importantly for a couple who want to sleep together. In addition there was not a single comfortable chair to sit in and read. 3 wooden chairs and incongrous wooden table in the middle of the room were the extent of the furnishings. In short the room was not comfortable at all. I have had smaller rooms with more comfort. Housekeeping is very very slow. Two times it took over 5 hours from putting the sign on the door to the room finally being ready. After it is ready there is a constant interruption as various supervisors come to check if the room has been cleaned.. too little, too much. Bathroom was OK but the shower is treacherous if one is not steady and god forbid you turn the wrong faucet. Front desk staff are either very friendly and helpful or imperious. A bizarre acrid stink in the lift needs tending to. The lobby is pleasant and warm with many chandeliers, lots of interesting small touches but not to everyone's taste. In general nothing to keep a return visit if a room with a view and a comfy chair and a real King bed can be secured. Value for money? Fair enough.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit and still rate this hotel one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Tomeck
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit and still the same high standards. The reception staff are friendly, helpful and efficient o complementing the beautiful lobby and lounge area. We arrived early and had breakfast which is excellent and then headed out to do some shopping which is excellent in the nearby vicinity. This visit, we had a room overlooking the canal which we booked long in advance and so was excellent value. Booking in advance is to be reccomended! Comfortable bed. Roome a decent size but bathroom a little small and only just about adequate. Next time, I will request a bigger bathroom. Good restaurants nearby and all sights are walking distance. My only complaint is that there is no tea making equipment in the rooms and so you need to go downstairs to the machine which is free but located such that nocturnal trips in a bathrobe just don't seem correct!

Reviews.Title: “Take me back to 1950”
Reviews.Author: jdvanvalin
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Estherea is one of those old style hotels with dark wood, ornate furniture, and a library full of old books. The even have bellhops. The hotel has been run by the same family since the '40s and though they have modern conveniences (internet terminal, workout room, modern showers, coffee machine) you still feel you've walked a century or so into the past when you visit. Located on the old Singel canal, the hotel is walking distance from most Amsterdam sites, and just a few blocks from Dam square. Our room only had a view of an internal courtyard, but other than that this was the perfect hotel for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel on our trip!”
Reviews.Author: DbTX
Reviews.Content: We just had a quick tour of London, Amsterdam, and Paris. By far, the best hotel of our trip was this one (thank you, all the reviewers before me!). With three of us (husband, daughter, and me), we got the very lovely and spacious room 319, a symphony of blue tones with a superb view over the canal and a truly gorgeous (albeit small) bathroom. The extra bed was a sleigh bed of fine polished wood, no cheap pullout affair. The library and lobby proved great spaces for us to wait for one other. The breakfast was a bit pricey for our American wallets, but it was free for children, which was nice, and nicer still was the around-the-clock free coffee/espresso drinks/hot chocolate and cookies. The hotel staff were very friendly and directed us to a super Indonesian restaurant (Indrapura). We walked to it, like to most places we went. Taxis, which we took to the train station, came in under 5 minutes. Should we come again to Amsterdam, we'll be stopping here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: RenataMattos
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Helpful staff. Room very small but comfortable bed. Good view, though.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaraDeer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay in Hotel Estherea. We had a really lovely time in Amsterdam, and much of that was due to the suptuous hotel we were staying in. Check-in was very efficient, and reception staff were friendly. The lounge and bar areas were really comfortable and a great place to chill out with a book, and enjoy the complimentary coffees and cakes. We stayed in a standard room, and although it was small, the elegant decor made up for it. The bathroom was also small, but again, the space was used well. The only downside to our room was the noise, which has been mentioned by previous reviewers. We could cearly and frequently hear footseps of guests walking past our room, and being on the first floor, we also heard footsteps in the room above. The location was fantastic - a 15 minute walk from central station (and easy to find!), close to the main landmarks, yet away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. There was a huge (and lovvely variety) of places to eat and drink right behind the hotel. All in all, I would definitely reccommend this hotel, and if you're not an early riser (like us), you might want to take along a pair of ear-plugs to avoid being woken up by other guests stomping past your room in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “"winner"”
Reviews.Author: Bordeaux71
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the past year. This hotel is in a great location, has a terrific staff, serves snacks and hot and cool beverages 24/7, and has one of the nicest lobbies you will see. The rooms are comfortable, clean and modern. I can afford more expensive hotels, but will choose Estherea every time.

Reviews.Title: “A Completely Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kktraveler10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. A great location on the Singel, Amsterdam's oldest major canal, in the old city center. The room was very comfortable with a large bath by European standards. A delighful lobby, sitting area with complimentary coffee / hot chocolate. The staff was professional and offered good recommendations for restaurants within walking distance. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -super location - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: Short taxi ride from the train station and on arrival greeted by very friendly receptionist. Room on top floor overlooking the canal - just gorgeous (room and canal) Hotel beautifully decorated in a classical style - deep warm colours Lots of patterns and colours clamouring for attention but it works really well. Large fish tank an interesting focal point in the lounge and the hotel cat a friendly added bonus! Free tea, coffee and cookies/cakes in reception area is a lovely gesture. Breakfast is an extra at 16 euro each - a bit steep if like us you only eat cereal and toast but if you've a large appetite probably not bad.
