Location is great - very central yet quiet at night; lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. Staff very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. Can't recommend it highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Very charming!”
Reviews.Author: Cizein
Reviews.Content: Me and my colleague choose Hotel Estherea on internet and were greatly surprised when we arrived! We just loved this place! Both our rooms were decorated in different ways - with very beautiful and unique decoration. My room had a very nice view towards a canal and I could lie in the bed watching the boats pass by. So nice! The location is also very good, it is near to the flower market and the shopping street Kalverstraat. The breakfast buffet was also really nice. The only thing that I can say is negative is the fact that it was rather noicy in the street outside at night, but everything else is so positive I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Yve2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fabulous with unique and beautiful decor and our room was very comfortable and cozy. The choice of colors and furniture was very striking. The free beverages and snacks in the lobby was a really nice touch. The staff provided very good recommendations for restaurants in the area. The location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “good value, helpful staff, lovely lounge area”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Blackadder
Reviews.Content: Well situated (about 15 min walk from central station or 5 min on tram) It has lovely spacious, comfortable lounge area. The free tea / coffee / choc machine and some cold drinks all day and night is a great touch and people sit around in the lounge chatting because of this -which makes it very friendly. Fabulous 8 foot coral reef aquarium in main area will entertain children I do have regular business trips to Amsterdam and will return to this hotel as it is value for money and very friendly (not the most luxurious hotel I have stayed in -so if that is what you want then you need to pay more) Breakfast was also good (16 euros) NB the room was a reasonable size for Amsterdam (where most are small in size) The internet / wifi is an extra cost

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wetravelin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very quaint. The rooms are small but we thought adequate. The breakfast was very good try to get it included in price. It is within walking distance to everything. We found the front desk staff accomodating. The walls were a bit thin and the outside noise was apparent but we did not let it bother us as the ambiance was wonderful. Beautifully decorated in old world charm. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Met my high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MooYo
Reviews.Content: If you want an excellent hotel and are willing to pay the high price, then Hotel Estherea will not disappoint. What can you say that hasn't already been noted- we were not disappointed in the least with the facility or staff. The front desk personnel are superb. The Mac-daddy coffee machine is excellent. The location is perfect- within walking distance to many attractions (including Anne Frank's house). I suppose my only issue would be that we had to pay $35 Euro to keep the room to 2PM. Given our evening flight and amount of luggage we really had no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: chuck30
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Estherea. Every aspect of the hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was clean, comfortable, and attractively decorated. The staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful. The buffet breakfest was a bit expensive but very good. We a ordered room service dinner one evening because of inclement weather. It was delivered promptly and was excellent. The ground floor of the hotel had a series of interesting rooms, including a lobby, bar, library and reading room. We will certainly stay at this hotel again when we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: WesleyMenezes
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location. The staff are polite and very helpfull. The decoration is superb. Although the rooms are quite small, I would recommend this hotel for a great experience in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, OLD STUFF”
Reviews.Author: KEKEROS
Reviews.Content: Estherea Hotel has a great location, however the hotel stuff is very updated. Our room was really small, and the mattress was out of order at all. The staff was friendly, with the exception of the check-in lady that was really arrogant and unfriendly, and she charged a reserve of 600â‚¬ in our credit card without previous notice. We realized about that when we received a sms from our bank. Estherea could be a good hotel if they invest in order to update the stuff and they pick the right staff.

Reviews.Title: “Regardless of the staring system, it's 5 in our book”
Reviews.Author: BJC883
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed there whilst sighseeing over 3 nights Sept / Oct 2011. A gem of a place and we endorse all the other ratings of excellent and the comments. As for its location... perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: Dallas R
Reviews.Content: In every respects, a classy and comfortable place to stay -- or just hang-out. Probably the nicest and coziest hotel I have ever experienced. Although they have over 90 rooms, it feels as intimate as a B & B. Beautiful, quality furnishings and decor -- ornate, but tasteful. Our standard room was large and well-appointec by any standard, although, I understand that some rooms are smaller. Ours was inside-facing, into a small light shaft that didn't provide much of a view, but we didn't care. The place to be is in the library/reading room, or lounge/lobby area, and relaxing with complementary coffees in a comfortable chair, watching a fascinating aquarium and a very contented cat. Wow! Just like home! (I only WISH my home was as nice!) The staff were friendly and helpful. Check-in/out was hassle-free. Lacation couldn't have been better for our needs. We walked everywhere! All of our friends in the group payed a lot more for less hotel than we did at the Estherea. We would never consider staying anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: atxalice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a long weekend during March. The atmosphere is mesmerizing. It really looks like their pictures (which is rare!). They have wonderful mint infused water in the lobby all day and night that is so refreshing. We hung out in the cozy lobby at the end of each night. They have board games you can borrow from reception. The room was a pretty good size for Europe and so was the bathroom. Very clean and very comfy bed. I will stay here everytime I go now.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandinette
Reviews.Content: Jewel of a hotel, view on the Singel canal in the downtown area, clean, friendly, quiet. Step out the door and you see what Amsterdam is all about....canals, boats and bikes. Fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kathy f
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on 9 October 2011. I loved the opulence yet the hotel retains its family-run atmosphere. One of the few hotel lounges I've seen where I really wanted to spend some time. It felt like staying with some very rich but down-to-earth friends and relaxing in their spacious lounge. Free drinks machine and pastries/candies were a real plus. And the hotel's cat (the receptionsit told me the cat has somehow taken over ownership!!) provides an albeit elusive added welcome. I wouldn't want to to stay anywhere else in Amsterdam now! Elegenace meets convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan7455
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights before leaving Amsterdam for an african safari. This hotel is very conveniently located and is within walking distance of many attractions in Amsterdam. The staff is friendly and efficient. Check in was very easy. The hotel is very secure. The rooms are spacious and quiet. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate available in the lobby for guests. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: furballs
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business in November 2010, but thought as I was planning another trip to Amsterdam that I should have written this last year. Excellent hotel. Great service. I had a room on the back on the 2nd floor (European 2nd, North American 3rd). Really, really quiet. Breakfast was fine, not great, but fine. Hotel is in a great area; a few minutes walk to pretty much all of the touristy areas. Lots of great restaurants in the area. Front desk staff very friendly, speak excellent English. They were able to direct me to a couple of spots I needed to get to, e.g. stores for toiletries etc.. Comfy bed, great pillows, decent size washrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: pottylorraine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a lovely canal close to Dam square. The hotel lobby, bar and breakfast room are stunning. We took the elevator up to our room, without baggage thanks to Easy Jet who decided to send our baggage to London Gatwick!! The room was very pretty, but very small. It also had a large window that viewed out onto a small ventilation courtyard so we had to keep the drapes closed as we could see into other rooms. That made it very dark. When our suitcases finally made it the next day, we had great difficulty finding places to put them due the the smallness of the room. Certainly the bathroom was large and functional. The room itself was very clean. Breakfast was served down off the lobby in two lovely rooms and the food was fine. Breakfast was included in our room rate. The coffee machines int he breakfast room were great and the same machine was available just off the lobby 24 hours a day. Free internet is also available in the lobby and they have two computers for people traveling without one. I spoke to a couple who had a much larger room on an outside wall overlooking the canal and they were very happy with it. I would stay at this hotel again as the location was good but I would book a room with an outside view as we felt very claustrophobic in ours. The staff were very helpful and friendly and it had a homey feeling to it with the cat walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: liliLeuven
Reviews.Content: Most charming aspects of the hotel are the situation at the canal and the cosy rooms. I just stayed for 1 night and I'll certainly go back. All of the personnel was very friendly and helpful. Prices are rather high but it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: M29G
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel, very well situated in front of the Singel canal. The staff was really friendly and kind.The only downside was the heating, which didn't work that well.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MarieAirdrie
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel which I would recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam. The location is fantastic - on Singel canal and within walking distance of many of Amsterdam's attractions. The staff are well-trained, polite and helpful. The public sitting areas are truly awe inspiring. Our room was very comfortable, and beautiful as well. The bathroom was very large by European standards, and the bed was the most comfortable one we had slept in through out our European vacation. This hotel was worth every penny and I hope to return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small dark rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Chrisl54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located which is really it's main attraction. Rooms were dark and small. Bathroom while reasonably new and clean, was also small and badly lit. Noisy due to being an old hotel. Able to hear other people walking etc. Staff were generally helpful though and the free tea and coffee was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - lived up to all expectations....”
Reviews.Author: aurielsmith1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very friendly staff. Perhaps not the cheapest - but definitely worth it....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Racandtac
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea is well located within walking distance of everything but on a canal which makes it very quiet by night. The rooms are small but there is a bath in the bathroom which is a bonus. The rooms are spotless and you are able to sleep with the window open. therebis free tea and coffee available in the foyer which is a pleasant surprise as there are no tea of coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMBD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea is located on a quiet street on the Singel Canal. We stayed there for four nights before leaving for a 2 week Baltic cruise. It is within walking distance of all major attractions. The hotel is well appointed with a luxurious lobby, crystal chandeliers, a library, free internet access, an elevator, a homey yet plush bar, a restaurant, and great service from the front desk staff. Complimentary coffee, hot chocolate, tea, desserts, and bar snacks are provided, as well as rain gear and Dutch chocolates. They do their best to anticipate your needs and to more than meet your expectations. The rooms are tastfully decorated (although the lights are a little dim to read by), and exceptionally clean. The bathrooms are quite large and modern, even the towels were large enough to comfortably wrap around oneself. We would definetly stay there again and highly recommend this fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: kayemag1957
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located on the Singel Canal and was close to the city square, shopping district, attractions and a 10 minute walk to the Centraal Train Station. The Singel Canal is quiet, safe and very beautiful. The hotel itself is situated in a traditional canal house with steps up to the front door. It is opulently decorated in a heavy brocade style which is perfectly in-keeping with a fine Dutch house or hotel. You know you are in Holland. It is beautiful. The public lounge is stocked with books, magazines and newspapers for the use of the patrons, as well as a coffee/tea area where traditional Dutch cakes and biscuits are supplied complimentary every day. Very welcome when you arrive back after walking all day. A quite reading area included 2 computers with free internet access. The bar is a nice cosy area we used every night to meet up with family, drinks were reasonably priced and nuts and nibbles were also provided complimentary. Our room was very quiet and beautifully decorated and although a little small was very comfortable and big enough for us for our stay. The bathroom was lovely and also was spotlessly clean every day. The staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for you with advice, umbrellas, taxis and bookings. All spoke perfect English. The breakfast was wonderful and the best breakfast we had on our entire Europe trip. It was included in our tariff. We were extremely happy with the hotel and would highly recommend it for a stay in Holland. We stayed 5 nights, we cannot fault it. There are lots of little cafes close by and Anne Frank's House is only a 5-10 minute walk. We would go back again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, do not book last WE of september”
Reviews.Author: ombra_11
Reviews.Content: location:perfect breakfast: OK but expensive staff:perfect room: 5 th floor=very quiet en nice view on canal bathroom:room 514=very spacious, bad needs to be renewed price of 385 â‚¬/night + taxes is very OVERpriced

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice in Amsterdam-Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: bobswifecleveland
Reviews.Content: We chose this boutique hotel based on the reviews from Trip Advisor and we were glad we did. Nice,clean, hotel in a very quiet little neighborhood. Staff extremely helpfull and friendly. Very easy access to all major sites and in walking distance of everything since this is a walking city very much like Venice. (because of Canals) I am very picky when it comes to Hotels and we were very happy here. Would recommend highly for a great place to stay in Amsterdam and felt the price was resonalble for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “A really good find in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: judith h
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave very good value for money. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. We could make tea/coffee at any time in the lobby for free. Internet connection was available and free. The only slight criticism would be the size of the bedroom. It was veery small, but overlooked a lovely canal.

Reviews.Title: “Visually chaotic and very dark”
Reviews.Author: Auzzy87
Reviews.Content: This was one of the last hotels my husband and I stayed at after some extensive travels around Europe. We decided to treat ourselves to a really good hotel. As it was last minute I didn't spend much time reading reviews but the photos looked good and the location seemed reasonable. Although the staff were very nice and friendly the hotel room was very small and dark with terrible low lighting. Although they provide free coffee in the downstairs dining area it would have been nice to have in room facilities. What might be nice for some, unfortunately not to my taste the interior decoration is also very mismatched and busy. If I had spent more time researching I'm sure I would have found a hotel that provided better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a big hotel is a quite location”
Reviews.Author: DallasTX88
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit noisy. There are no locks is some of the bathroom doors. two computer are available to the public with internet access and a printer as a complimentary service. Most of the rooms has an interior view (facing other rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing decor”
Reviews.Author: Qldstar
Reviews.Content: I could not have found a more perfect hotel for our first visit to Amsterdam. The location was great, central but not noisy, overlooking the Singl. The decor was stunning. They have done an amazing job to create such a unique look in a city dominated by modern refurbishments. I found this hotel great value for money and hope to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “We were very surprised at the elegant lobby and warm inviting sitting area.”
Reviews.Author: susanintheskies
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise. The hotel is beautiful, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for walking around Amsterdam. Close to most everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Fabelous decoration”
Reviews.Author: Abusaif
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only minutes away from the dam square. It provides a nice view over the one of Amsterdam's beautiful water canals. The hotel is so well decorated that you think yourself inside a chateau. Unfortunately the standard double rooms have beds that are smaller then queen sized beds, leaving normal-sized guests with a difficult choice of either sleeping on the same bad or one of them should choose to sleep on the ground! breakfast is amazing but rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding value, beautiful decor, great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jflk01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights prior to a Baltic cruise. we had booked a classic room with inclusive breakfast and upon arrival, were upgraded to a deluxe room on Spuistrat. The room was spacious, with plenty of closet space and a great table and chairs next to the large floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was large with a double sink and a spa tub that was welcome after long days of touring the city. We were able to walk from the train station, hauling our large suitcases, within about 15-20 minutes. The decor of all rooms was exquisite and well maintained. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and the breakfast was extensive and delicious. The self service coffee machine in the lobby was a great place to grab a light snack to keep you going. This hotel is a great bargain, it has a friendly and cozy atmosphere and alot of space to spend your leisure time. We would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants an enjoyable stay in the city and will return ourselves in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Canal view luxury, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PBrave
Reviews.Content: Beautiful canal views, comfortable rooms, wonderful common space in lobby. Skip the buffet and go for pancakes after enjoying the coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful details, friendly service, nice location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: stefaniehere
Reviews.Content: beautiful attention to detail throughout the hotel. one of the concierge was very friendly and helpful while another one was involved in a lengthy flirtatious conversation with another customer as i waited patiently. i had to politely interrupt them to ask a quick question. there is public parking available just outside the door for $45 for 24 hours. you can also pay per hour. the machines for public parking only take credit cards!!! the hotel charges $55.00. our rooms were small but lovely. the light/electric outlet switches had a strange set up. hard to explain here. there is a very small gym. the location is well enough away from the busy areas to be quite peaceful yet close enough for a short walk to the action. though i love this hotel, i think one can find just as lovely places that are a bit less expensive. the reading/meeting room has a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere. there is fresh mint water, coffees, teas, and hot chocolate available in lobby 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Find in Expensive Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: boboakville
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend free on our 30 day business/pleasure trip, so we planned on a stop in Amsterdam. I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Amsterdam over the years, with varying results. We found the hotel on TripAdvisor, read the reviews and proceeded to book it. It's a bit off the normal track, but it's was a very pleasant find. It's very quaint and the lobby you have to see it - very old world, with free coffee & tea always available. The rooms were quite nice and bathroom up to date. They is a restaurant for breakfast, but we just ordered a quick coffee/pastry to sit in the lounge area of the hotel lobby. We were in a hurry to explore Amsterdam again. It is a non-smoking hotel which presented us with our only disappointment. Many smokers just stood outside on the front steps, and their smoke drifted into the lobby - an unpleasant effect inside the hotel which tries to be a bit different from the norm. Other than that, we'd go back to the hotel ahead of any others.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customers.”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & i stayed at your hotel on Saturday 20th August 2011 & would just like to say how happy we were with our stay! We hadn't stayed at this hotel before, & Sam requested a room with "a nice view" I can only tell you how delighted we were upon check-in, to be told we had been up-graded to the "suite" after only paying for a standard room. All of the staff there were very friendly & always had a smile. We will definitely be recommending this hotel to all our friends, & would like to say thank you to everybody who works there. It is not often people are treated to this luxury, & it was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123lisa_11
Reviews.Content: stayed here end of august for bank holliday weekend. ok it is not cheep anywhere a pint on average 5-6 euros and food is not cheap either but with the hotel you probably do get what you payfor as boutique hotels are not cheep anyway but there is really attention to detail in this hotel. the decor is fantastic all through the hotel. the bedroom we had was a deluxe 4 poster front facing canal room 110. it was lovely and relaxing very peacefull, nice decor, the 4 poster was extra comfy with nice drapes. the small compact bathroom was modern with toiletries and hairdryer. we had a seating area and nice furnishings. the hotel even provided complementary chocolates as it was our wedding anniverary which was a nice touch. in the loby there was a great tea/coffee/hotchocolate machine which was free and mint water on the bar which was also free. there was also various sweet jars and cake or pastries for free. we didnt have the breakfast for 16euros each we went to one of the little patisery shops futher along the canal for coffee and quasants which was nice and a little cheaper. it did nothing but rain when we were here but the hotel provide umbrellas and plastic ponchos which was great. it didnt stop anyone going out and it was still very busy wherever you went and plenty of little canal side cafes to watch people go buy. everyone here has a bike and there are bike lanes everywhere so be carefull when walking but most people ring the bell to let you know they are comming. the red light area is a 10 min walk away and not half a seedy as i imagined. it is just women in underware standing behind red lit windows scatterd up and down the streets.everyone who was walking around were just normal families with kids,couples young and old just walking up and down the canal taking it all in, yes there a few sex shops and bars on the 2 main areas but on the whole it was ok nobody was aproached or anything so dont be concerned. drugs were no issue either yes people were smoking it in some of the bars but we didnt tend to go in anyway, most places are fine all very calm. we walked miles this weekend as there is lots to see and do with the canals and museums etc now i need a rest! we went to madame tusauds would definatley recommend going but it was smaller than i imagined and its not really for young children. the hotel is within 15mins walking distance of the station but you do need a map from tourist information in the airport to find your way or you could use the metro tickets also from here. we went on a candlelit dinner cruse on the lovers canal boat. it was lovely. glass of bubbly, 2 bottles of wine red/white and lovelly 3 course meal. tea/coffee and chocolates to finish. it was very relaxed and was lovely for a special anniverasry night out. would really recomend this. great city definatley worth a visit. hotel was in a great central quiet position and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Em70
Reviews.Content: Small hotel very well located in the downtown area. Victorian style. From outside doesn't look an hotel . Breakfast not included in our rate, as was not included the wifi. In spite of those minor issues, you can consider this hotel a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: PithyPacky
Reviews.Content: Great location in the "Seven Streets" district (upscale shopping and restaurants) near the heart of Amsterdam. Cozy elegant decor. Very satisfactory 3-4 star hotel with good breakfast and very well appointed, very clean rooms. We paid around 125 euro per in Nov 2010 and that was good value for the $$. Staff spoke excellent English. Will return gladly.

Reviews.Title: “Great, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ceri393
Reviews.Content: Great location on the canal belt but also close to Dam Square. The room was clean, large and well appointed and overlooked the small central courtyard. On the positive side this meant it was very quiet, on the negative, if you didn't have the net curtains across the neighbours could see in. We had asked for a twin room but were presented with a double; after asking at reception we were correctly told that it was made up as two twins together but that if we preferred they would separate the beds. In the event the originial set up was perfectly fine, and the beds was very comfortable. Reception staff were friendly and effecient. Check in and out were smooth. Taxis were booked on the spot, arrived within 5 minutes, were of a good standard and cheaper than those on the streets. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Also free hot drinks and biscuits/sweets available from reception 24/7 and free water in the room. This was my second time staying in Hotel Estherea, and will certainly not be the last.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this wonderful hotel,will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: maj58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Estherea in May 2006. It was actually all I wanted from a hotel at the time..It was a boutique-styled ,not too big...yet quite glamorous,with a n amazing chandalier in the drawing room next to the lobby.The room was spacious ,and the bathroom was just fabulous.The Location is just great,just a couple of blocks away from Dam square,situated at the beautiful canal ,called Singel...Very quiet and peaceful,and yet very easily near the dazzling shopping area and restaurants..

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Introduction to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sookie65
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks very unassuming from the outside but once you step through the entrance doors it's like being transported into the past. The decor is beautiful. The common areas are comfortable and clean. There is free tea, coffee (of all kinds!) and hot chocolate available in the lobby 24 hours a day. There is a library, free international papers and wi-fi. The staff are all friendly and speak excellent English. Breakfast is available, but is quite expensive. We stayed in a family room, which was basically a big double room with a huge comfortable pull out sofa bed. The room slept 4 adults comfortably. The only downside to the room was it was at the back of the hotel and quite noisy, but then we were in Amsterdam! The bathroom is clean and adequate, with lovely free toiletries available, but it is not very private (slatted doors!) Be prepared for everyone in the room to know what you are doing! Overall a fabulous hotel, in an area known as "The Nine Streets", really central with fabulous shops, markets and restaurants all on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Willem65
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for exploring the centre of Amsterdam. Located on the Singel (make sure you book one of the rooms overlooking the canal), close to "9 straatjes" (nine streets) and the Jordaan from where you can walk to most of the interesting sites in the centre. The rooms are small but extremely nicely decorated (all differently) and the staff is polite and helpful. We also liked the lobby with it's free coffee and thee and it's library like atmosphere. We would recommend this hotel highly to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely,elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaUstinov
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a brief side-trip from a business trip to London. It is a lovely, old-world hotel with charming, elegant common areas and luxurious rooms. At first I was taken to a room overlooking a tiny, interior ventilation well. The canal-view rooms were all booked up for a convention. I asked to be moved to a city view room and they promptly complied. It was a lovely room by any standards and the style seemed to be classic Dutch elegance. The staff were nice to me, a Canadian. I noticed that they were rude to some American people who checked in and for no good reason. All of Europe seems on edge these days. The hotel is easy walking distance to the main sights of Amsterdam and the train station. It's located on the Singel Canal so evening strolls were pretty and fun.For all intents and purposes, the Netherlands is an english-speaking country. There is a grocery store near the hotel that has great food but the North African cashier staff seemed to be systematically taking advantage of the American tourists who were confused by the metric denominations of the euro currency. Amsterdam is a clean, well-run city with little drama or sirens. People are blunt but honest and helpful. I was surprised by the lack of flower gardens/planter pots and pets seem to be second-class citizens.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: goonervic
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here - decor was gorgeous and room comfortable, if a little on the small side. However not in the room much so not a problem. Location is great. Ate at: Red- gorgeous lobster, lovely evening, great service New King - not much atmosphere, ok food, large portions. Would consider returning if back in Amsterdam.....

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: delicatny_macho
Reviews.Content: What can I say? It was our first visit to Amsterdam and Netherlands at all. And it was unforgettable. We stayed in Estherea Hotel and the hotel has had met all of our expectations. Excellent location on Singel bank just 4-5 minutes from Dam place, cosy and calm, gorgeous breakfast with champagne and combination of buffet and a la carte, free internet access (to be true at Lobby only), all day complimentary coffee service (espresso, cappuccino, macchiato etc., hot chocolate, about of 10 sorts of tea, snacks in finally. And all of that for a good enough price. The only weakness of the hotel is in room audibility. It really feels like you share the room not only with your family but with another two families. However, if we'll go back to Amsterdam again I hope we'll stay in Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Traveller042
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The beds were divine. Decor lovely. This place has character. Situated on a quiet canal but close to the centre. Only downside was the bathroom with saloon door which was not ideal in a triple room. Our daughter was very taken by the 'free' hot chocolate and sweets provided in the foyer, and by the tropical fish tank. The hotel was very homely with comfortable areas to relax, surf the net or read in the library. We did not eat in. There are plenty of restaurants locally for breakfast and dinner. However, the exchange rate is not good and we found it very expensive. Got ripped off by the taxi driver summoned by the hotel who took a very roundabout route and charged the earth. Not the hotel's fault, I suppose, but I would arrange my own taxi next time.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that nearly killed my romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: masalazar
Reviews.Content: I booked a +400 euro/night deluxe canal view room for our romantic escapade, the room was just OK, nice, clean but too small, the minibar had just 2 bottles of water. The bathroom had not proper door (more like a folding closet door), tube was very small too - we couldn't be at the same time, neither had a shower together. The curtain was too long, quickly soaked and leaking outside so I had almost a pond outside after the shower. The room's key is not a card key but the old-style key with a bulky keyring, which we must to leave it at the reception when going out. The hotel doors closed at night so coming back at 2 a.m. was a little hectic. The 16 euro breakfast is not worth it, tables are small as well as the breakfast room. You can hear everything happening outside your room, people walking, talking so my guess was that the other way around was true too. Room's pictures look fine for a romantic weekend but for sure, I will neither recommend this hotel nor come back with that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Comforable, Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Bruce M
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we've ever stayed in. It's in one of the many very old buildings in Amsterdam. It's nicely located on Singel, and an easy walk to everything. The hotel is richly decorated with wood-paneled sitting rooms and chandeliers. They offer an superb (but pricey) breakfast, free coffee/capuccino/espresso day and night, and even an elevator (rare for old European buildings, but quite a delight after walking up staircases during our stays in Edinburgh and Copenhagen, earlier on this trip). The fine decor isn't limited to the lobby. The rooms are well-furnished in traditional style, and the large bathroom was outfitted with all modern fixtures, neat and clean. We arrived on a Thursday, and the rate was a bit under $200 USD. The rate goes up on Friday and Saturday, at around $240. It's not cheap, but it's worth it, especially considering the service, decor, and location. I've paid similar amounts for MUCH lesser hotels. I don't know if or when I'll visit Amsterdam again, but this hotel would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “We would love to come back! A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sugabtoronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights before continuing on to Venice. W found the hotel on line through Trip Advisor and could not have been happier with our choice. The staff was extremely polite and attentive and could not do enough for you. I mentioned that it was a birthday trip for my mother and a box of chocolates arrived - a lovely touch. The hotel itself is charming - small, beautifully decorated and the small touches throughout from art work, to decorative cushions, to vases,small inner gardens with fish; all in excellent taste. Umbrellas and ponchos ts the desk were made available if it was raining (which it was!) Two computers were available to guests, at no charge which was very handy to print boarding passes. The many cozy rooms to sit in after a tiring tourist day were so welcoming, as well as the 24 hour capuccino bar with cookies. The breakfast was excellent and had extensive varieties of food, able to please everyone's taste. Our room was in the renovated section, very soundproofed, modern bathroom with a walk in shower. Our room did not face the canal, but rather an inner courtyard where we could see lovely greenery and fish in a small pond. The location, right on the Singel Canal was wonderful. Don't hesitate to book your stay here - we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location & price”
Reviews.Author: natalie6
Reviews.Content: My husband & I loved this hotel. Great location that can get you to any part of this wonderful city. Gracious staff with nice rooms, especially the ones overlooking the canal. It is also close to some of the most wonderful restaurants located on this canal. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel during our month-long trip to Europe”
Reviews.Author: goodtraveler56
Reviews.Content: We stayed in nine hotels during our family driving trip through Europe (mostly France and Switzerland) and Hotel Estherea was the best hotel we stayed in for our needs. We splurged a little for this one since Amsterdam was our last stop before flying home and it was worth it. The location was in a prime location-- right on the Singel canal, bordering the Nine Street shopping district and just a few minutes walk from all the main sights in Amsterdam. The rooms were beautifully furnished and the lobby was a perfect resting spot with free cappuccinos and hot chocolate and treats all day long in a library-like setting. The only thing is that you can hear conversations in other people's rooms as you walk by.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we have been back!”
Reviews.Author: sexysandarella
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel! So close to everything, dam square, museum quarter, all the shops are between 5 and 20min walk. Hotel is great, good atmosphere with plenty of room to sit and chill and read a paper or have a drink before hitting the town. Rooms are grand, got everything you need and the ensuites are great. Love this place (with its endless supply of sweeties and biccies) and would very happily stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Day in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mrsbeee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for valentines weekend (sorry for late review). The hotel is situated close to everything you would want to see. The hotel lobby is lovely and you can get free hot drinks and snacks which are very nice. Room was lovely overlooking the canal. I would definately stay here again. It was out of the way of the tacky Red Light part of Amsterdam yet a close walk away if you wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: DSAdventures
Reviews.Content: After extensive research on a number of Amsterdam hotels, we picked Estherea. We asked for a room with a King bed, upper floor, overlooking the Singel canal and got exactly that. After an early flight, we arrived at about 8:30am. Expecting to have to store our luggage until our room was ready, it was a pleasant surprise when the room was already prepared. The reception desk staff and all of the others we met were very courteous and always helpful, whether suggesting restaurants or giving directions. There were some nice touches such as the lemon mint water at the bar or the cakes, cookies and coffee machine. It was even pleasant to sit in the lobby and watch the world go by or the fish in the huge aquarium.This hotel was ideally situated for walking excursions or its proximity to public transit, yet was extremely quiet (except when the beer bikes went by), but that is not the hotels fault. Although expensive, this hotel was a great choice for our first time in Amsterdam and we would stay at the Estheria again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LeonaNorthernVA
Reviews.Content: a very comfortable hotel. the coffee in the lobby was perfect. enjoyed the buffet breakfast. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: LEOFRICK
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Deserves every one of its four stars, and maybe even a bit more. Superb staff, good location and some very nice touches. I particularly like the coffee and biscuits available in reception throughout the day. The room was luxurious and the bed comfortable. Good breakfast too. Highly recommend this hotel to the discerning traveller with one eye on the budget.

Reviews.Title: “We like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: demidov48
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel Location not in the most center, but 10 minutes to go. Hotel offers scooters to drive. It's very convenient. 5-7 minutes to drive by scooter to shoping zone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful and one of the best locations in all of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: danman2327
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with Amsterdam and the Hotel Estherea. It is brimming with beautiful, old world charm. The rooms are extremely well appointed and beautiful. We had a large room with a street view, but there was never an issue with noise at all. The air conditioning is fantastic and the rooms are spotless. The soaps they have in the rooms are my absolute favorites. Breakfast was not part of our reservation, but we found a great restaurant on the corner called Berts Broodge, I believe, that had huge portions for all their meals, very fresh ingredients and great service. The staff at this hotel are so polite and will do anything you need with a huge smile and they end up thanking you for the honor of filling your request. How much better does it get for travelers than that? We will absolutely stay here again and have recommended it to many friends, several of whom have stayed here and loved it. It is a must stay when you visit the Venice of the north... the beautiful city of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Canal side location with very elegant dÃ©corâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Huglum
Reviews.Content: Just getting round to reviewing this Hotel after staying here at the beginning of Nov 2010. The hotel is in a good location and borders a lovely canal bank not far from Dam Square. I was very impressed with the hotel and the elegant dÃ©cor and in particular the library area which was nice for relaxing and having a coffee which was continuously free on tap. The room I had although compact had a great view of the canal and was very individually furnished and decorated. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom and room had all the amenities you would expect. I was pleased with all aspects of the hotel and the reception staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. This Hotel is a hidden Gem and excellent value for money and where other decent Hotels can be pricey in Amsterdam this is not. Avoid the corporate chain hotels and stay here is my tip as I will for future trips to Amsterdamâ€¦..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SeaBreeze77
Reviews.Content: We had a double room on the noisy (non-canal) side of the street and loved it. Elegant room with a fantastic bathroom (including a separate whirlpool bath...great for sore European travel feet). The complimentary espresso in the lobby was a wonderful touch that we utilized multiple times daily. Amsterdam is extremely expensive, so this is spendy, but we are frugal and would happily stay here anytime for $250-$300 per night, so that says something!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nw05250
Reviews.Content: A hotel with an olde world feel about it. Austere without being stuffy is how I would best describe it. Our room was on the 4th floor facing out onto the street and canal and whilst a little on the small size it was very comfortable. The bed was stupidly good and I haven't slept as well in a hotel room for a very long time. The views out over the canal made the room seem even more special.The breakfast at EUR15 a hit was well worth it. The location can't be faulted and the staff were helpful and ridiculously pleasant. Would throughly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: YGochen
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! Chosen for its location, being a 5 - 10 minute walk from Dam Square and a short walk to the trams, and having a triple room, the hotel did not fail to impress. With welcoming and friendly staff (who checked who you were before handing over the room key), a comfortable and adequately sized room, self service free coffee or tea as well as patisseries available all day, a bar to enjoy a drink at night and luxurious seating areas aplenty to read a book or watch life go by on the canal by day, a lovable resident cat and an aquarium to die for, what more could you want? A gym? but they had one of those too! The hotel offered a good choice breakfast which seemed a bit pricey at first glance at 16 euros but was quite reasonable considering you could eat and drink as much as you wished (but get there early to get the best choice). No evening meal was available though but you could order room service where the food was provided by a local restaurant "Haesje Claes" serving traditional Dutch food which also had a gluten free menu which was great for me. I would definitely choose Hotel Estherea again, and again, and again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty. Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Theresa061
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms. We had room 412 overlooking the canal. Nice room and decor but the mattress was awful. Very lumpy. They need to get some new mattresses in that room. Staff was very helpful. We had the trip advisor package which gave us free wifi and breakfast each morning for 8 euros per person. Otherwise the wifi is $10/day. Tsk Tsk. It should be free. I would stay again but think a hotel of that caliber should include free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite luxury hotel on the Singel Canal”
Reviews.Author: TwoVacayLovers
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooking the canal made us feel like quintessential Amsterdammers. We could not have loved this hotel more. The common areas were so beautiful and the staff laid back and lovely. We would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit and just as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Haggis45
Reviews.Content: We had a night here on way back to oz from a wedding in Scotland. Having stayed in April and loved it, we joined friends of Estherea and were given a canal room, free wifi and free breakfast included when we arrived. The rooms are really something else to look at as the decorations are quite plush - we had a 4 poster bed this time. The bathroom was massive including a double sink, and this place is clean! The common area downstairs is super and very inviting to grab a coffee and relax, maybe write postcards or read. Breakfast is just lovely, I liked it because it had lots of fruit, a mixed spread of tasty things and hot food too. Staff are very good and it was so easy checking in - fastest ever! The location is great - Dam Sq in one direction and the lovely Nine Streets across the canal (great for dinner options). Trams are not far - we caught one from Central as the taxi queue was huge and not moving. We love the character of this hotel and the rate we paid this time was quite reasonable, but getting the extras made it great value. Without a doubt, will stay there again and would recommend it highly. Cheers, Haggis

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jba31857
Reviews.Content: We really had a great time in Amsterdam and the Hotel Estherea made it perfect. We booked a canal view deluxe room so I can only speak for this level of hotel room. The bed was super comfy and we had two great chairs to sit in and look at the canal. It was nice being in a hotel that used to be houses. Yes, the rooms are small, but it used to be a canal house. So what. They're cozy and full of charm. It felt good to have the history around us. Loved the coffee machine in the lobby and the cookies and cakes were great. Had to wait now and again to use the computer in the lobby but the time flew by looking at the beautiful aquarium. They had umbrellas to use in case of rain and helped with places to go. I would go back in a second on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel,centrally located”
Reviews.Author: edwaterman
Reviews.Content: Spent one night pre cruise, and thouroughly enjoyed our stay. Rooms small but well appointed, and staff very friendly. Great central location, close to some very nice and reasonably priced resturants. Will definitely stay there again on another trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sproqit
Reviews.Content: Excellent! We stayed at Hotel Estherea for 4 nights in early July and had great experience. Great location and close to everything. Most of the attractions are in walking distance. I read the reviews from this board before my booking. Due to the high season, the price is not cheap, but I booked through hotelâ€™s website and joined the â€œFriends of Esthereaâ€� club and got Free Breakfast and WiFi, which sweated the deal a lot. We have a child traveling with us and I indicated in my book. On arrival, we were surprised that the extra bed for the kid is set up and free of charge. Wonderful! Our room is a classic room by the elevator and overlooking the courtyards. The room feels small since we had an extra bed but is not that small. The room is well decorated and looks beautiful. The bath room has separated bathtub and shower which is very nice and better than the most of 4 star hotels. The toilet is separated out from bathroom which is nice too. Bed is very comfortable and beddings are high quality. Like most of the hotels, the sound isolation is not that good through. I can hear others talking and even zipping the luggage. Breakfast is good. Plenty of choices. But I probably wonâ€™t pay for 16 Euros for it if itâ€™s not included in my booking. One complain I would have is that there are no change of items in breakfast. Everyday is the same. So after 2 days, Iâ€™m kind of tired of it already. As many has pointed out here, free coffee machine in the lobby is a very nice touch and added on to good experience. One last thing, the service is excellent. Front desk staff, people at the bar and breakfast are all very nice and helpful. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and very pleased with Estherea. We will definitely come back again next time when we are at Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!!”
Reviews.Author: luvjntj
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Estherea. The staff is welcoming and helpful and the hotel is beautifully appointed. The rooms overlooking the canal are small but the rooms on the streetside are very nice. They serve all types of coffee, tea and snacks in the afternoon. After a long day of sightseeing it was nice to relax in the beautiful lounge or library. It is in a perfect location; close to the Anne Frank House and within walking distance of most of the major attractions.. Great neighbourhood to walk and browse. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Max2502
Reviews.Content: This is a great, well managed hotel. It may be suffering a tad from it's own success in that the sense of astonishment I had the first time I stayed here simply wasn't there any more. I was on a deal that included breakfast and Wi Fi but had to remind the staff of this. The breakfast was a disaster - tables were not cleared, the buffet had been decimated and poorly replenished. Rooms are excellent but tight, typical of Amsterdam Central.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure at first”
Reviews.Author: phill99
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the last leg of a Baltic Cruise. Looked at several reviews first and then picked this hotel. Upon arrival by taxi I was not quite sure I made a good choice, however once inside the hotel was quite nice and the room was very nice size and over looked the canal. We ate breakfast right down the street at a corner sidewalk cafe and it was great and reasonably priced and the amount of food was more than you could eat. The hotel was very convient to all locations and they could also help in booking tours. Would not hesitate in recomending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely little hotel in the heart of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: luvsmickey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on both ends of a Celebrity Baltic cruise. What a pleasure to stay here. My husband and I stayed with 2 other couples travelling with us. It is a very quaint hotel. The rooms were well turned out and the beds and pillows were comfortable. The breakfast is well worth getting. They have an espresso machine that you can access any time of the day for a cappuccino or just a plain cup of coffee. It is centrally located and we could walk everywhere. There is a small flower market about 1 block away. Our rooms were quiet and the staff was very personable. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite â€“ a second home while on holiday”
Reviews.Author: sabrina_ide
Reviews.Content: Yesterday evening I returned from a 3-day city trip in Amsterdam. My colleague and I came to see the Take That concert in the Arena. After much reviewing on Tripadvisor and Booking.com we decided to book a standard double room in Hotel EstherÃ©a, which receives rave reviews. I am now adding mine. We arrived late Sunday morning and the kind receptionist who did our check-in said it was a bit chaotic that morning, soooo, they had upgraded us free of charge to a deluxe room. The room didnâ€™t have canal view (which we had secretly been hoping for) but she kept saying that room 402, which had been allocated to us, was a beautiful room. We decided not to make it any more difficult for her and accepted the room. It wasnâ€™t ready yet, but we could leave our luggage. Later in the afternoon we returned to check out our room and enjoy the complimentary coffee, tea and cakes in the common area we came to call â€œthe living roomâ€�. Our room was located on the back side of the hotel, overlooking Spuistraat. Each room in this hotel is different and during our stay we often tried to catch glimpses of other rooms when the maids were cleaning, to see if they were as lovely as ours. Room 402 has the same look and feel of the living room and lobby, with bordeaux red coloured wall paper, dark wooden beams and a golden glow when the lights are on. The bed mattress, pillows and feather bed were amazingly soft. Itâ€™s the best hotel bed I ever slept in. The bathroom had a jacuzzi bathtub, a shower, two sinks, hair dryer, shampoos, towels, washcloths, make-up mirror, Kleenex tissues and even cotton wools and cotton buds! In the bedroom there was a minibar, safe, closet and ironing board. We had a writing desk and a table + two chairs at the window. We didn't use the flatscreen tv or the airco (too chilly). There is no free wifi in the room, nor are there tea making facilities, but both can be found downstairs. Besides the living room there is a library, bar and a corner with two computers (free internet). We often found ourselves sitting in the living room, at all times of the day. And we werenâ€™t the only ones! Many people sit here, enjoying the sumptuous decorations and the warm feeling the common areas exude. I loved the large soft chair (it easily fits two people), I curled up here to read while my colleague was soaking in the jacuzzi. There are newspapers in several languages available at the reception and the library is, duh, filled with books that guests can use. Itâ€™s very easy to start a conversation with other hotel guests. This inviting hotel is like a second home and at the end of the day I looked forward to returning to EstherÃ©a every time. They even have a hotel cat, called Hegje. She was saved from the animal shelter and now lives in the hotel. She has her own place to sleep but when its calm you can find her walking around in the common area or sleeping in one of the chairs. Hegje isnâ€™t the only animal in the hotel, the lobby has a very beautiful aquarium as well. You can also find a gym and a public telephone in the hotel. There are two lifts, but you can take the stairs if you like. The hotel also provides free umbrellas and ponchos when it rains. You can rent a Vespa scooter or order a taxi. Personally I find walking around the best way to discover the city, since the hotel is located inside the city center. We walked from the Central Station to our hotel in about 20 minutes, itâ€™s very easy to find. All of the museums we visited were within walking distance. All staff are incredibly kind and knowledgeable about the city. There is always at least one person at the reception and usually there is also someone walking around the common area. We didnâ€™t have breakfast in the hotel (price is â‚¬ 16 per person). There is a small bakery (Lanskroon, Singel 385) two minutes walking away. So we bought something there and came back to the hotel to have breakfast in the living room. Some other people did this as well. The only downside was that we woke up during the night a couple of times and early in the morning, because Spuistraat is apparently a busy road and the house right in front of our window was being renovated. The construction workers started at 7.30 a.m. but of course the hotel canâ€™t do anything about this, so it didnâ€™t really bother me for those two nights. Overall: * good location on Singel overlooking a canal, and within walking distance of Central Station and most important highlights * splendid and comfortable room * helpful, attentive, agreeable and polite staff * luggage was already in our room when we first entered our room = great service * beautiful and cozy common areas, like living room and library, where you can just sit and relax * free coffee, tea, hot chocolate, cakes and candy all day long in the common area If Iâ€™ll ever go back to Amsterdam I will most definitely return to Hotel EstherÃ©a, I donâ€™t want any other hotel than this one. The official website of the hotel provides lots of pictures of the common areas, so I will mostly post pictures of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, quaint Hotel! Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Callijax19
Reviews.Content: From the outside of the hotel one would never know what an exquisite hotel it holds on the inside. There is so much detail to the decor ranging from the all Live Fish Tank in the foyer, to the bar/library/sitting room and unique design to very room. The standard rooms are on the small side but the shower is amazing; heated floor and all! Location is also good, right on a canal and walking distance to many restaurants and main attractions such as the Ann Frank Museum. Also, the mint lemon water, snacks, and per cup coffee maker in the lobby just adds a special welcoming touch. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing room”
Reviews.Author: brownst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights on a recent vacation. The room was elaborately, but tastefully decorated in a blue Delft pattern, with a chandelier hanging over the bed. There was also a canopy around the bed. The room was very clean and spacious, with a table that overlooked the street side of the hotel. The hotel lobby is quite unique and getting at least one drink in the bar is a must. They have a coffee machine in the lobby where you can get free cappuccinos or espressos at all times. The hotel staff were very friendly and helped with the bags to the room and out to the street. The location of the hotel is centralized to most of the sights and right on a canal. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and cosy. The find to come back for!”
Reviews.Author: FinnWithFins
Reviews.Content: After arriving to Amsterdam, pulling cabin sized louggages through idyllic streets and over the canals of Amsterdam, this hotel is well hidden at optimal place :) Right next to canal, only 10min walk from trams to Leidseplein and Damsquare, this hotel offers very elegant and cosy stay. Common areas and rooms are decorated with thick full carpets and old style massive furnitures. Even common area has huge couches and soft sofa chairs to sink into read book and enjoy complementary snacks and coffees offered all times. We happened to travel off-season time, which allowed us to find this hotel for -70% from normal rate at booking.com. Complementary coffees and great athmosphere gave really nice place to rest during the days between sightseeings. Breakfast we enjoyed at restaurants outside that streets are filled with. Not recommending coming by car, parking is costing more than 50â‚¬/day. City is to be seen by foot anyway. Defenately coming back to this hotel! Only thing missing was free wifi...

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: topbox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 10th/14th July,and we had a lovely time.The staff at the desk made us very welcome and took time to explain the hotel to us.We were shown to a fantastic coffee maker at a room beside the front desk and told there is free tea and coffee 24hrs with cakes and jars of sweets.There was also a lovely lounge and a library which made you feel like you wanted to sit and relax.We were then shown to our room by another friendly member of staff.Our room was on the first floor,and had everything we needed.We picked this room because of the price and it was small compared to others but I would stay in that size of room again as we were only there to sleep.The breakfast was excellent with another fantastic coffee maker.(I forgot to say that there was always cream to go with the coffee) which made it special for me as I love coffee.So go to this hotel and you will be pleased.Once you find the hotel you will realise that it is very central with plenty of very nice restuarants dotted about.Oh and a big thankyou to the breakfast staff nothing was too much trouble,and everyone seemed to be content in their job.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: OneVeryHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent seven days at the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location, on the Singel canal (Singelgracht) and close to both Spui and Centraal Station, was very convenient. We had a basic, interior room, but it was quite nice. The bathroom was very modern. I assume that it has been rennovated very recently. The lobby has two PC's available for you and very comfortable lounging areas. Coffee, tea and some sweets are always available. The staff was courteous and helpful. My only disappointments were that there was no free wireless and breakfast was sufficiently pricey that we chose to eat elsewhere, but a new guest program eliminates both shortcomings. We loved Amsterdam and are certain to return. When we do, we will be staying at Hotel Estherea, hand's down.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure on the Singel”
Reviews.Author: snarf1513
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful lobby with several rooms including a lounge, a library, a bar and a reading room. Our room had a fridge, a safe and a bathtub. Staff provided excellent service. We decided not to order the breakfast which was pricey. Location near the Dam, the History Museum, the canal bus and cafes and restaurants was a real plus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Estherea - look forward to staying again”
Reviews.Author: LuxurynCulture
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and decided on the Estherea. It did not disappoint - on the contrary, it exceeded all my expectations. The hotel is charming in every way, and more beautiful in real life than the photos can show. It is like a jewel in Amsterdam. I stayed for 3 nights here, my friend stayed in another hotel nearby (booked too late). Loved all the things that the other reviewers have said about the hotel - check-in - friendly and warm - the girls at reception were lovely and so helpful room - quiet and had everything I needed, absolutely spotlessly clean and no-smoking throughout. The room faced the other block of rooms, but this means they are the quietest. Ask for the 2nd or the first floor - they are quietest. free hot chocolate, the use of the computers in the lobby (free), the beautifully kept fish tank, beautiful lights, florals, made the hotel really special. Oh did I mention the yummy buffet breakfast with everything you could imagine. Close by, a) the Nine Streets shopping - do not miss La Savonniere b) Brootje Bert - irresistible burgers c) Kantil and Tiger for a reasonable rijstaffel dinner Best restaurant (make reservations early) was Tempo Doloe - don't miss this one. Everything was delicious and they make excellent cocktails too! Amsterdam can be daunting to lady travellers, so the best tip is to travel with a friend (romantic trips are highly recommended) and chart your route before you set out. Second best tip is to buy a season tram ticket - tram rides can add up.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourite hotels”
Reviews.Author: sjh2181
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, the staff were friendly and the rooms were beautiful with the best bed we have ever slept on. We found we could walk to all sights and restaurants from this wonderful hotel. the room was always clean and comfortable but the gym was pretty much non-existent. we found the buffet breakfast to have a lot of variety and always fresh. we will be staying here again on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Holocaust Tour Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelEnthusiast1_10
Reviews.Content: My sister and I decided to tour Amsterdam for three days and nights before we connected with our two week Holocaust Remembrance Tour. I have gotten in the habit of relying primarily upon Tripadvisors.com in helping me select a hotel. Tripadvisors and your followers did not disappoint me in the least in their reviews of Hotel Estherea of Amsterdam. The hotels central location was perfect as base for getting around. Although we decided not to get a room overlooking a canal, we did get a deluxe sized room with two double beds knowing that most standard sized European hotel rooms are considerably smaller than their USA counterparts. The hotel is charming from the outside, to the inside, and within our room. The front-desk staff was top notch, e.g. they were quite personable and exceptionally knowledgeable and accommodating, e.g. how to get around and restaurant recommendations. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others, but more importantly, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: DPL-OZ
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling throughout Europe for the past 19 months and this is simply one of the best hotels we have stayed in. We base ourselves in London and from there make extensive forays into the EU and I can't think of a better hotel than Estherea! The free tea & coffee & cakes in the foyer is unique and the canal room we had was utterly delightful. The staff were all so helpful at all times of the day. As we drove from London, the underground state of the art car parking system was itself a feature. Of course this was at a fee of E50 per day and for central Amsterdam that was reasonable. We rarely eat in hotels and prefer to wander out and about for our sustenance so we can't comment on their food. Brilliantly situated, the Estherea is simply a must!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right - A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevoltMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: My rather large family (we needed 11 rooms) just completed the most wonderful stay. We all thought it was the most delightful hotel. The rooms are small (like any European hotel), but we did not go to Amsterdam to spend time in the rooms. And everything else was way above expectations. For example, I read there was free coffee in the lobby. Yes, there was, but also free cappuccino and free pastry. And I read that the staff was helpful, but was surprised to find them handing us free ponchos when we wanted to take a walk in the drizzle. Stop reading and go book your rooms now!

Reviews.Title: “expensive but wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ecdickinson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Estherea for three nights at the end of our vacation. The location is great - close proximity to Nine Streets shopping district, the Palace, and walkable from Centraal Station. The hotel is quiet and the service was great; I especially liked the espresso/hot chocolate machine in the lobby for unlimited drinks! They even provide to-go cups so you can take your latte with you when you set out for the day : ) Our room was on the first floor (over the lobby) with a street view (would have preferred canal view, but didn't want to pay for it). It was very large, especially for Amsterdam standards, with plenty of operable windows but also central air and the bathroom even had double sinks! The windows had blackout curtains so we could sleep in comfortably after a late night. The only complaint is that you could hear the people above you walking, but we were in an old canal house... If you book through their website and join "Friends of Estherea" you receive extra perks - like free wireless - so definitely try that. I found the rate comparable to other sites and the perks persuaded us. It's not a party hotel - we were definitely the youngest couple there (in our late 20s) - but we didn't feel judged coming in late-night after going out! I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again when in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent. I recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: esthercbuenosaires
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful and the hotel is comfortable. The rooms are big and beautiful. They make your stay even better with their kidness and some extras, like the coffee machine and candies and some cookies, etc in the afternoon. I really recommend it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: acpiel
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location on the Singel canal, delicious sumptious buffet breakfasts, helpful and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam !”
Reviews.Author: Janethemidwife
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel , friendly staff nothing too much trouble , fantastic room, jacuzzi bath and fridge , we asked for quiet rooms so did not have canal side view but slept so peacefully after busy day sight seeing , very luxurious decor and so relaxing. Comfy bed and pillows I really cant fault it, after speaking to friends who have been to Amsterdam before and stayed else where we had a great hotel in lovely surroundings, within walking distance of all attractions including Anne Frank house, canal trips and red like district its ideal. Breakfast is pricey at 16 euros each but fresh and plentiful , cooked , fruit , smoothies usual meat , salad cereal we ate enough to skip lunch !. the red light district has been toned down as in no open drug dealers like five years ago and we felt very safe to walk around, beware the erotic show its less erotic and just pure mechanical sex ! very seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Average room”
Reviews.Author: Bells54
Reviews.Content: The lobby area of the hotel was very nice and well decored. The fish tank just gorgeous. So colourful. Reception staff very pleasant and greeted you with a friendly smile. Our room was very very small looking out onto the lift. As the lift was glass, you had to make sure your curtains were closed so other guests could not see into your room. The bed was comfortable. However the room did smell musty. If you have more than 2 bags this room would be way to small for you. As it was we had to place one bag onto a chair and a very small table in the room, as there was not much floor space. We didn't have breakfast as it was a little pricey 16 euro per person. Downstairs they had a tea and coffee machine for you to enjoy a hot drink. This was a nice touch and not seen in Europe very much. Location was very good, away from the main area, but still good walking distance to main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “romantic, picturesque, elegant - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Cookiemaven
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights/3 days at Hotel Estherea prior to Baltic Cruise departing from Amsterdam. The hotel was much more than we anticipated...lucked-out on this one, which we found on Trip Advisor. The hotel maintains an old European style yet with modern comforts. We chose the breakfast-included rate and we amazingly surprised at the extent of the breakfast (after reading other Trip Advisor reviews). The breakfast staff was eager to customize their menu for our allergy/health requirements and even remembered us the next morning with same dishes. No need to have lunch during the day after this sumptuous buffet in the morning. As for the rooms, we did get a king bed as we reserved (2 twins made-up together). Be aware that you must leave your room key at the front desk each time you leave the hotel. The decor of the bedroom was beautiful, soothing and comfortable. The bed was heavenly - wish I had one at home! The blackout curtains were really blackout - which we needed to get onto the time change. HOWEVER, we had packed luggage for a 12 day cruise, and there was absolutely no room in the room to open the luggage. It was typically European tiny. We had to stack the bags. So if you are planning this as a layover for your cruise, be sure to plan one small bag with all you need for those days and ask to leave the other pieces in their luggage room. The bathroom was impeccable - looked very new and the towels were bigger than most hotels...seriously- my husband is a big guy, and he had no complaints about the bath towel after his shower. Dryer, lotion, shampoo, body soap, shower cap all included in the bathroom kit. This location in the Jordaan District was an easy jump-off point to everything, once you get the hang of the canals and the tram stops. The front desk was very helpful with all of our crazy tourist questions. The lobby bar had free snacks (nuts, cracker mix, etc) and fresh mint-flavored ice water available all day. There were also free pastries in the afternoon. We would plan a trip to Amsterdam and stay at this hotel in a heartbeat! Go and enjoy! -Eileen in Plano, TX, USA

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to rest in towncenter”
Reviews.Author: Simone194
Reviews.Content: a very nice 4 star hotel within walking distance of Palace, New Church and Dam, public transport stops just a few minutes walk away. yet very quiet and luxurious, we loved the way everything was decorated, the pretty wallpapers especially and we had not expected to have such a large bathroom. being Dutch we know people living in Amsterdam canal houses, so we have seen rather cramped bathroom situations. they had some lovely sitting rooms, a real library and 2 computers with free internet access in the shared space. and to top it off they served a great breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxx85
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. It is clean and well appointed, located right on the Singel canal, two blocks from the tram line and less than a 15 minute walk to the central train station. Our room was large and very comfortable, overlooking the canal. The staff was great, recommending several restaurants we thoroughly enjoyed: Zwaante, Harkeema Brasserie, and Seasons. The hotel has complimentary coffee and tea available in the lobby all day and pastries after breakfast. Internet access in the lobby is free on their computers, and if you become a "Friend of Hotel Estherea" on their website before you go, you should have free access in your room and a discounted room rate (one desk clerk said we would only be eligible after a second visit to the hotel, but I asked another clerk later and she gave us the access and the discount - almost $100 saved!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Amsterdam hotel. Definately going back!”
Reviews.Author: Misshon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in three other hotels in Dam inc. the Grand Krasnopolsky. All were great but none had the charm and personality of this one. I stayed with my boyfriend for 4 nights and loved everything about the look and feel of the place. Its beautifully decorated throughout. The staff were very helpful when we enquired about the whereabouts of the chocolate festival. The receptionist didn't know anything about it but went right out of her way to research it for us. Also, the hot chocolate in the foyer is very moreish. Singel is good location not far from the hustle and bustle of Damrak/ Dam Square etc. If there was any downside then I guess you could say the hotel bar was under-manned. But that is the only criticism I can think of. Obviously this hotel is one of the more pricey ones in Amsterdam but you'll know that when doing your research and I guarantee it is worth every penny. The Estherea was a haven for us in Dam while we shopped and travelled to Utrecht for a concert and I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel with excellent staff in the Centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rovers816
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in this lovely, small hotel. Our room 407, was tiny, but spotlessly clean, overlooking the canals. Breakfast was wonderful and staff were very friendly. There is a seating area in the lounge and bar area and newspapers are available free of charge, as is tea and coffe and a small selection of cakes and sweets. In the lounge area, 2 computers are avaible for guests' use at no cost. The hotel is located very centrally and it's easy to walk to all the main attractions. The railway station is about 30 minutes walk away over cobblestones and crowded streets, a Taxi might be easier on the luggage and you.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't mind coming back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sand1957
Reviews.Content: Very nice room; we had booked a deluxe room w/ a jacuzzi, and that is never wrong, I suppose... A bit on the expensive side, but actually worth it. They charge â‚¬16 p.p. for breakfast, which we felt was a bit much, but to our delight, they offer prosecco at the buffet. Suddenly a very tempting breakfast! And we also found the rest of the buffet very satisfactory. Nice staff - nothing to complain about there.
