The only thing that was a bit on the negative side was that there was a "noisy" family in the neighbour room - the kids started playing and yelling at 7 in the morning. But - all in all - we would really recommend this hotel to everyone. Nice neighbourhood, quiet, laid-back. Nice restaurants nearby. And Amsterdam offered summer temperatures!

Reviews.Title: “As good as everyone says!”
Reviews.Author: thea123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early May 2011. All the reviews are accurate. The hotel is charming, comfortable and clean. The staff are excellent. It is in walking location to everything. We rented two rooms, one for my son and one for my husband and myself. Both were excellent, and uniquely and creatively decorated. Thank you Trip Advisor reviewers for steering us as usual to a wonderful hotel. PS- We liked the hotel's calico cat! She didn't seem too interested in the beautiful tropical fish in the aquarium though. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good”
Reviews.Author: novembre1965
Reviews.Content: Arrived with my family for one-night stay. Children were given two welcome gifts. The reception staff were very good and efficient. The parking is located just behind the hotel. Expensive, but absolutely needed in Amsterdam - police boots your car. The room was clean and perfectly arranged for a family (2+2). The only inconvenience was the size of the bathroom, which was very small. The quality of breakfast (â‚¬16 per adult, children do not pay) was superb. Even the cappuccino was very good - a rare treat. They charge customers â‚¬10 for wifi (24 hours) - worked very well. For those who do not need wifi, there are 2 complementary PCs. My wife and I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel, which is an ancient house completely renovated with style. Location is great, also - Very close to Anne Frank Museum and Magna Plaza (less than 10 minutes). The Van Gogh Museum is at 20 minutes on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service. Felt a little dated.”
Reviews.Author: Simon066
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay. Location is great and the staff on the front desk are polite and helpful. Coffee available downstairs makes up a little for not having this facility in the room. We had one of the larger rooms, and paid for the canal view - and this wasn't particularly large so I would not want to stay in a smaller room here. The hotel just felt dated. Chintzy or old world charm? Not our style but it was very clean. We still have not found the hotel in Amsterdam that we'd keep going back to. Overall fine and pleasant but expensive for the size of room.

Reviews.Title: “More than anything, an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: steada
Reviews.Content: Already said by other reviewers - this is an excellent location for visiting Amsterdam by foot or otherwise. We had a deluxe room with jacuzzi bath in the back of the hotel (room 203) on a fairly busy street. Noise was not much of a problem probably because of the soundproofing in the doors that opened to tiny balconies. Bathroom was fairly spacious, but the room itself was slightly cramped with all the luggage that we had. Probably fine for weekend travelers, but we had come from the States with lots of luggage and not much room to place our clothes or the luggage. The staff is excellent and friendly and I thought that the public rooms were very pleasant. "She" said that they reminded her of a bordello, although she has never been in one! We had a pleasant stay and I would stay there again, but would want to pay no more than the equivalent of $300 per night. For people with multiple iPads, computers, etc., the hotel's WiFi only allows one user to be on at a time and you will have to shut down all the other devices to get on a new one.

Reviews.Title: “Fab central hotel couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: paigeyg
Reviews.Content: All the other positive comments are true about this lovely hotel. Glamorous,clean, comfy, delicious free coffee in lounge and 24hr bar. Every major sight was within walking distance the canal right outside, plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. Perfect for a short break!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidLur
Reviews.Content: Overall, a real winner. Some rooms are frightfully small, but lobby and library area provide ample room. The staff is very helpful to tourists although their restaurant recommendations were less than stellar. They steered us to 2 lackluster places, one seafood place behind the hotel and another tourist trap near the hotel. The location could not be better and the breakfast is excellent. The fact that breakfast is not included and the wireless interent not being included seem a tad petty. The hotel provides free coffee and tea all day and put out sweets to snack on. Late check out is nearly impossible since it is a very popular hotel. We would definitely stay here again, particularly if we could afford the suite!

Reviews.Title: “Central location and comfort on the Singel”
Reviews.Author: love2trave09
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Estherea is a quiet hotel on the Singel Canal, not far from the Dam and trams. The staff is very nice and helpful, and the atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming. The lobby has a number of sitting areas, a couple of computers (though they can be very slow), 24 hour coffee, tea, and sweets, a small bar area, and a wonderful fish tank. The rooms are clean, reasonably sized, with well equipped modern bathrooms. My only comment is that the walls are a bit thin, but that is not a reason to forgo a stay. Breakfast is served, but not included in most rates. The staff will gladly help arrange taxis, make dinner reservations, book tours, and search out train information. The Hotel Estherea is the perfect alternative to the overpriced tourist hotels that are all over Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned charm in great location”
Reviews.Author: jillmalt
Reviews.Content: Unexpectedly plush and luxuriant from modest front entry on Singel, between Dam Square and all the Grachts (canals). Excellent service and free tea/coffee/cake in bar area all day.

Reviews.Title: “One of our all-time favorites”
Reviews.Author: NotTooFussySC
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights in May 2011. We have stayed all over the world and this place is in our top 5. I cannot imagine where some of the negative comments have come from. We thought the decor was wonderful, the lobby a great place to relax in, the staff very friendly and helpful. They even have a friendly hotel cat! Absolutely the only thing we didn't like was the blow dryer - it's one of those where you have to hold down a button the entire time you use it, very cumbersome. Otherwise the room amenities were perfect. Of course the rooms are small but that's the standard in Europe. This place was about the same price as a place we stayed in Paris on the same trip, but much higher value for price.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Seine7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel. It was a great experience. The location is wonderful. The rooms with a canal view are worth it. The decor in these rooms are so beautiful. The day bed in this room was a wonderful surprise. This hotel also gives you some extras. In the lobby, they have a wonderful machine that makes cafe latte, cappuccino, hot chocolate. They also have in the lobby area, some wonderful snacks to go with your coffee. The cookies and assortment of nuts are great. We will stay at this hotel again. The front desk is so accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel, great location, great staff, cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: TGTP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Estherea for 4 nights and it was great, we usually stay in Dam Square but chose this hotel as it sat on the Singel canal and was still very central, we werent disappointed, everything about the hotel is great, the staff, service, location, rooms and I cant wait to go back. No tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms but a great coffeemaker available at all times in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel Box - The Bar is Raised”
Reviews.Author: tgtoronto
Reviews.Content: The Estherea lived up to all the raves on TA and more! I cannot imagine why it is not rated even higher. First of all, it is in simply the nicest location in Amsterdam, on the beautiful Singel canal, close to everything. From the moment we arrived, exhausted with jet lag, we felt welcomed and pampered by the young, attractive staff. The place is like a gracious, elegant home to return to each day after your adventures in the city. It's idiosyncrasies, like the magnificent tropical aquariums, gilded grandfather clocks, period wallpapers and rich woodwork give it a unique style among the many hotels we have stayed at in many places. There is nothing else quite like it, anywhere, unfortunately, for travellers seeking good taste and comfort. The hospitality is exemplified by the generous goodies available in the lobby all day and evening, coffees, teas, hot chocolate, cookies, cakes and chocolate goodies. This week it was Easter themed, so there were assorted sugar cookie ducks and bunnies and Easter baskets in the room. The breakfast was also outstanding. I can't imagine what some previous complainers could possibly have wanted in addition to this ample buffet. We were able to enjoy it, and free internet, for only 8E per person thanks to a special Trip Advisor promotion which appeared after we booked, but was graciously applied to our reservation. Although our room did not face the canal, we had a gorgeous design with lots of space, sitting area and a magnificent bathroom, double sinks and a huge jacuzzi tub. The decor is original to Amsterdam. The incredible wallpaper patterns seen around the hotel were reminiscent of those we saw on the walls at the Riejksmuseum under the Rembrandts! The bed was fantastic, the sheets the finest. Amenities, first class. The employees were extremely helpful in all respects. They helped us arrange tickets to Kukenhof, a must-see at this time of year, and other sights around the city and the fixed rate taxi to the airport, which is actually only a few Euros more than the shuttle and a lot more direct and timesaving. To me, the mark of a good hotel is the feeling I get that I wish I never had to leave. Can you imagine being sorry to have to travel on to Paris? I wish there was an Estherea in every place I ever have or will visit. Thanks to all!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever ?”
Reviews.Author: coarmaghayes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Estherea for 4 nights in early May and found it to be one of the best hotels we have visited. Yes it was expensive and we booked a canal view room which added to the cost but in view of the service, hotel amenities and great location it was worth the money. We could fault nothing and would love to return to Amsterdam. This was our first visit and we were pleasantly surprised at the friendliness of the people and the general ambience of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Tacye
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel very plush decor and superb tropical fish tank that you could spend hours watching. Only downside was rooms out the back of the hotel are quite noisy at night from passing traffic. Breakfast was fantastic with lots of choice. Staff very helpful, toilet seat was lose and was fixed almost straight away. Luggage was held until we were ready to collect it. We have visited Amsterdam quite a few times and this was the first time we had decided to stay in a dearer hotel as the ones we stayed in the past have been full of rowdy drunks. It was well worth the extra money and will cetainly be staying at the Estherea again.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Rolling1973
Reviews.Content: We visited Estherea during Easter holidays and liked the hotel very much. There were a lot of American tourists at the same time and I suppose that the chandlerlies and golden decoration appears to them -for us it was ununual, but good experience. We appriciated very much the helpful service and the own bar and coffee place at the hotel. It was nice to sit at the hotel library to have a class or another. We had a normal room, without the view. Maybe we should have payed more extra for a view to canal Singel. The location is good, we rented bicycles from Yellow Bikes ant it cost 11 euros/day. Using bicycle gets you so much more, everything is close enough. Breakfast was excellent. The only thing that we hoped was a coffee/tea service to the tables, but we could live without that :-) The only con was the sound of steps from the room upstairs. The hotel has a lovely cat!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel - feels like 5 star. Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: AussieTa
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here for 3 nights and loved it so much we felt compelled to write a review. Estherea caters to your every need - and even provides free hot drinks and cakes at all hours. Fantastic hotel in a great location - don't consider staying anywhere else. The only thing i can say is that they should offer free wi-fi - but there are free computers downstairs and i was sometimes able to connect to other wi-fi free so it wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and location - The best hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ananLAX
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in Hotel Estherea in April 2011. Check-In was so simple and quick and the entire staff were very helpful in providing all details about amsterdam, directions and suggestion to restaurants etc., The room was reasonable size, very clean and sufficient for two of us. The Hotel is located in singel on a very romantic and quite location, but very close all the attractions in amsterdam. We could walk to most of the places. The hotel arranged tour for us to Keukenhof and also we were picked up from the hotel. The best part of the hotel is the lobby and the decorations, which is amazing. Hotel has a complimentary coffee, tea, Hot Chocolate and also some snacks like biscuts, cakes etc., which is very refreshing after a day long walking. The hotel is rated as 4 star, But the service provided, cleanliness and considering all aspects this hotel is more than 4 star even we could say the service and the overall hotel is equal to a 5 star category. For sure we wil go again to Hotel Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: yelcay
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Estherea in Amsterdam and it is an unqualified winner. The hotel is luxury wrapped in convenience and comfort and well located to major sites. Service was excellent. Would definitely stay here again and recommend hotel to all. If there were any negative, I would note the buffet breakfast, which while complete and excellent, was pricy and, we felt, should have been included in the room price. Cost is Euro 16 ($25), but I guess this did not stop many guests as breakfast seating was always crowded. A couple of restaurants in the area are recommended. First is the Pancake Bakery, which is about a 10-15 minute walk and near the Anne Frank House, is excellent. Food is terrific, prices are reasonable, service is outstanding. An overall winner. The other restaurant is Lucius, a seafood restaurant around the corner from the hotel. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GinShoo
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Estherea. The room was beautiful, the bed was very comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful. We'll definitely stay here again next time we visit Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: dddBolton
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive comments about the Estherea. It is a very comfortable hotel and the staff were extremely obliging and helpful. We enjoy city breaks but you can spend a fortune on coffees and teas over a few days so a big plus point for us was the complimentary hot drinks 24/7 and the free iced water on tap. The location is excellent, too: within walking distance of all the major sights but in a quieter spot only 10 minutes from the Damrak. Our room was comfortable with ample storage space and a fridge; the bathroom was spacious with twin sinks and the water was hot and plentiful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location for us -Hotel Estherea has it”
Reviews.Author: Catbrook
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located on the Singel canal within walking distance of Dam square, Leidseplein, shopping, coffee shops, RLD, and restaurants. It was only a 10 minute walk from the train station to the hotel. We were there during the winter. It was nice to be greeted with free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate upon arrival. Staff was friendly. Rooms were small but nicely decorated, quiet, and romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: loulops
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I enjoyed a fabulous overnight stay in Amsterdam based at this charming hotel with cosy decor, delightfully friendly and helpful staff, fabulous buffet breakfast, complimentary teas, coffees and cakes all day and above all a GREAT location. Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but felt like Funeral Home”
Reviews.Author: DrBoan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located on the Singel canal, southwest city center. It was a walkable distance to the train station and all downtown locations. The room was lovely and clean. The lobby felt like a funeral home decorated by your great aunt....heavy furniture, drapes and flowered upholstery. The breakfast was not included, and was a ridiculous price, 16 euros each (for an essentially German-deli-style breakfast). There are other small hotels on the same street for much less, including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel BUT....”
Reviews.Author: KGrizz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel with our two year old son. They were great with children and had a welcome gift for my son upon arrival, a small corner of toys in the lobby, and even a resident cat that my son loved to pet. They provided a wonderful travel cot for my son to sleep in, and our room was clean and tastefully decorated. However, the first night we were laying in bed, the people above us came into their room and I honestly thought the chandelier was going to fall right down onto my son's cot. I understand the building is very old, but the shaking of the ceiling above us and the chandelier was unbelievably loud. I could have sworn there were elephants up there, unless the people were always stomping around and mad! I will mention that my in-laws were on the trip with us and did NOT have similar complaints with their room. On a different note, the hotel staff was friendly but completely clueless when it came to helping out with questions about the local area. I asked one morning for a place nearby for breakfast; it took two members of staff and about five minutes before they came to the conclusion that nothing close by was open. The night prior, I had been asking about a tour that they offered to Keukenhof and the man could not tell me anything beyond what was listed in the brochure. I ended up booking the tour and double checked to make sure of the pick up time; when I got to the tour office I was informed that the hotel had given me incorrect information and that I would need to come back in three more hours for my tour to begin at that time. So....to sum it up, the hotel was beautiful, it was a great location, but our room was a little uncomfortable due to the loud ceiling and the hotel staff was, well....clueless. I would consider staying here in the future, but would probably shop around for other options first. Oh, and I've stayed in hotels all over Europe for around the same rate per night; this was the only one to not include breakfast in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: vantergouw
Reviews.Content: Four Irish ladies stayed here 2 weeks ago for a week-end . Wonderful staff , helpful and so attentive . Hotel very central and on a quite canal , within walking distance to all the museams and the Anne Frank house . Rooms so nice and comfortable and we would reccommend this Hotel to anyone . Coffee , Tea and Hot Choclate all day long in the lobby - free ! Myriam van Tergouw from Cork Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good location - can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: northamptonoldby
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with another couple. We had room 307 which had a nice view over the canal. Friends had 313 which was at the rear with no view (except across an internal well into another bedroom !). Both rooms were similar although 313 was slightly larger. Both were in good condition and well decorated. It was sometimes a bit noisy as it is an old building which has been converted without 21st century soundproofing between rooms. Bathroom in very good condition with plenty of soaps etc. The room also had TV with access to UK channels.Breakfast up to a good standard and best of all free tea & coffee in the lounge (sometimes with tiny cakes). the lounge is a very attractive area to rendezvous during the day...well fitted with comfortable chairs, splendid acquarium and small bar.I notice one review refers to large rooms 'by European standards'. In fact our rooms were small/medium. Perhaps there are many variations. Easy walking access from train station (17 mins walk). Ensure you are familiar with the route if arriving late...Amsterdam can be confusing in the dark and many streets are not clearly named.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best place to wake up in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: S-ELinna
Reviews.Content: Third time around - and not the last! The location is still the best in Amsterdam. The service was even better this time, and we have not complained about that before. ;o) Again we stayed in one the canal view rooms, and the supplement is worth every â‚¬uro. The sound of the city and the life on the Singel Canal wakening is great. The breakfast was as usual ample and nice. We had not met the cat before, but "it" was a charming asset. We will remain "Friends of EstherÃ©a" - and be back.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm at this little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: valskis
Reviews.Content: Having been on a bike and barge trip prior to our stay at the Hotel Estherea we were delighted with this beautiful little bouttique hotel located off the Singel Canal. The rooms are quite large by European standards and beautifully decorated. The beds are extremely comfortabe. Don't miss the large and lavish breakfast! The Hotel Estherea exudes old world charm from the gleaming crystal chandeliers to the snowy white table linens. The staff is first rate and very attentive to your needs. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with character, perfect located”
Reviews.Author: Kastafiore
Reviews.Content: Such a wonderful place to stay for a holiday! Chandelair in the canopy bed, surrounded in delft wallpaper, luxurious bathroom... And the reseption, with aquarium, fruit tree branches in bloom and sweets in jars. Delicious! We loved the interior design here. The staff was helpful, breakfast tasty, good complimentary coffee. The only thing we did not like was to have one large duvet instead of one each.

Reviews.Title: “A Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: GiaSurrey_England
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations from Estherea and they were all beautifully met with style. This compact hotel certainally pays great attention to detail and provides some unique finishing touches. The rooms are individually colour themed and are comfortable and elegant.. The breakfast is buffet style and is excellent,served on beautiful blue and white china with a wide variety of items which was kept constantly topped up. All the staff where helpful and attentive even the hotel cat which made a guest appearance this delighted my daughter! The hotel has a relaxing ambience and I always looked forward to retiring to a cup of free coffee after a day of sightseeing. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Belle Epoque on a canal in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtreat
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel were solid but it surpassed my expectations. Estherea is located about 20 minutes by from the central station and can also be reached by taking tram lines 1 and 5. It is located on one of the nicest canals in Amsterdam very near shops, cafe's, restaurants and tourist sites. The reception staff was very friendly and efficient. My room (114) had a superb view of the "Singel" canal while at the same time being quiet at night. The bathroom was large with good working shower and sink and ample supply of soap, champoo etc. All aspects of the room were in great shape without any scratches, stains, etc. The bed was comfortable with good quality cotton sheets. Breakfast was ample with a great variety of cold and hot dishes, fruits, breads, drinks, etc and the setting, perhaps not everyones taste, was nice and clean with very good service. The reception staff is eager to provide guidance and to help where necessary and bikes and scooters can be rented. Wifi worked well for me and there are 2 computers near the reception area. The is not a big chain type hotel but more like a well managed boutique type place. It even has a small exercise room and coffee, tea and water as well as a variety of cookies are offered free of charged during the day. I will certainly stay at the Estherea again the next time I have to be in Amsterdam - it was a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLM_Malta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend with my wife. We opted for the deluxe suite and WOW what an experience. The room is very big and spacious with a very large chandelier and exquisite furniture and furnishings. th lobby, recepton area and front rooms are also very spacious, well decorated and very comfortable to relax ad enjoy a drink or else have comlimnentary tea, coffee and cakes/biscuits. The staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to help Breakfast is abundant and good quality with lots of variety. All in all a FABULOUS 4 Star Boutique Hotel with 5 Star rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on quiet canal; wonderful ambience and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Nutmeg809
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days travel in Denmark for business and stopped in amsterdam to unwind.. Our three days at the Hotel Esterea was pure pleasure. Loved the decor, cheerful breakfast and very helpful staff. THe location afforded an easy walk to the 'Hop On Hop Off' canal boats. Easy walk to Dam square, Beguinehof and other sights. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the canal, not spacious but comfortable. Bed was comfortable, spacious bathroom and ample drawer space. Staff directed us to three excellent restaurants within walking distance. Highly recommend Casa di David. Restaurant in hotel serves full breakfast only. There is a lovely bar and coffee available 24/7 in the lobby. No coffee in room although there is a small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel (but stingy management)”
Reviews.Author: michael_portz
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. We had 9 nights booked and needed to cancel just 1 on the day prior to arrival... No refund was given, the manager was hard and unwaivering. Not even a small gesture to make up for our loss.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lucyf32
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, very clean very comfortable, had a lovely room even though it was not a canal view. Free computers and internet in lounge, free coffee and tea in lounge area all day.Had to pay 16 euros extra for breakfast which caught us by surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy,lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: GONeal
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful...even remembered our name when we returned from touring...I was impressed with the room size! Bathroom was small, but immaculate.A great location! The rose colored walls,and muted lighting were cozy for our March stay.Highly recommend. The coffee and hot chocolate station, with cookies, were greatly appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Hel_Chat
Reviews.Content: Just came back from one night stay at this hotel and we wish we could have stayed a few more nights. We got an upgrade to a room with the canal view up on the 4th floor, it was a good size room and had a romantic feel to it. The hotel is in a very nice canal belt and is close to many eateries. The hotel has a lovely cosy atmosphere, especially with all day self-service to coffee and hot chocolate which was very welcoming with the cold weather. Amsterdam is a fabulous city and whenever we come back to it, we would definitely be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akohen
Reviews.Content: Truly central hotel. Pick the canal view if you can (obviously more expensive but it's worth it). Friendly staff. Next time we go to Amsterdam, we won't need to look for another place to stay. This is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Understated”
Reviews.Author: foodshooter
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed here in the past 6 months and will be sure to stay again. Make no mistake this is a very understated, comfortable boutique hotel on on of Amsterdams pretty canals. It is clean, quiet, comfortable and as I mentioned understated. I like the fact that it is not a cookie cutter chain, but more like a private club. The lobby although small leads into a lovely lounge area with books and newspapers. The rooms although not large are very comfortable and clean. I would describe the decor as 'traditional' and perhaps ever so slightly fussy, but the comfort and cleanliness is out of this world. I haven't had breakfast here either of the times I stayed so can't comment on that, or room service. It is very well located on 'Singel' and you definitely feel as though you are in a part of Amsterdam that is more local in feel, although just 2 minutes from Royal Palace. There are several bars, restaurants, cafes and coffeeshops within a couple of minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emmaohall72
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel. It was the cleanest most opulent hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff were lovely, complementary coffee, hot chocolate, cakes, biscuits and huge jars of sweets available all day. Rooms were big enough and the beds were comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: Team_Kirby_Howse
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a central location, we found it to be clean and very well presented. The staff were polite and I had mentioned it was my partners birthday in the booking and they had provided some chocolates and a 'happy birthday' note which was a very kind touch. We had a nice canal view and breakfast was plentiful and available til 11am. On the downside the room was very small (my 6'3 partner banged his head in the roof of the shower!) and the sleep quality wasn't great as the cleaners start hoovering the corridors at 9am - i realise its not late but we were on holiday!! I wasn't blown away but I felt it was a good value package (used trivago.com) and would probably stay again if we returned to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULD NEVER COME BACK TO THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: andry23
Reviews.Content: Rude front desk when check in.. Can't pleased the customer and keep blaiming the customer. Tiny room and bedroom. Everything is charged (breakfast & internet Wi-fi)..

Reviews.Title: “Old-World Charm at Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: srmar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea would have ranked as one of our all-time favorite places to stay if it wasnâ€™t for the location of our rooms. Hotel Estherea has old-world charm with all the modern comforts, i.e. two free internet computer terminals in the lounge, two elevators, comfortable HVAC and a delightful hot beverage dispenser with free hot chocolate, latte, coffee mocha, etc. This â€˜boutique hotelâ€™ has its original plush ambiance from its former canal-side homes. Wondering through the library, salon and sitting rooms is as if youâ€™re visiting one of these grand homes. The hotel is near Dam Square, tourist sites and a 15-minute walk from the train station. We booked (well-in-advance) two double/twin classic rooms directly from the hotel website, which states that each room has its own unique character. The four of us agreed that we did not enjoy ours. Since our three-day stay was right before New Yearâ€™s (Dec. 27-30), we paid the holiday rate of â‚¬125, â‚¬135 and â‚¬155 per room. One room was on ground level and the other was directly above. At check-in, we asked for rooms on the same floor. Staff said that the hotel was fully booked and our rooms were â€˜a special rateâ€™ (not according to their website)! Our rooms faced a small courtyard walled-in by the surrounding rooms, maybe two across....so the courtyard was only a few meters wide. The building was about five stories high, which made these lower floor rooms dark and claustrophobic. Itâ€™s similar to rooms located in the bottom of a well! An interesting note: at checkout, staff said that the post-Christmas snowstorm caused many cancellations. Room Pro: Kudos to the housekeeping staffâ€”both rooms were very clean, visually pleasing with old-world charm, comfortable beds and pillows, warm bedding and fully equipped bathrooms. A good money-saving tip is to prepay breakfast (by email) for â‚¬12 instead of â‚¬16 pp, per-day. The breakfast buffet included a wide assortment of good tasting food, such as scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, cheeses, deli meats, breads and rolls, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt and toppings, etc. Hotel staff was courteous but do not expect them to act as concierges. Do your research in advance regarding restaurants. On our first night and still jet lagged, we asked for their dining recommendations. They referred us to the street behind the hotel. The following night, we asked for a restaurant specializing in local cuisine and they sent us to the hotel directory. They are helpful with walking directions. Room Con: Even for European standards, both rooms were small (especially considering the price). There was barely enough space to maneuver around the furniture and our 2-pieces of luggage. Our rooms were located near the stairs, so early in the morning you could hear luggage bouncing down them. In all, we liked this hotel. Our suggestion is to contact the Hotel Estherea regarding room selection and ask for one on the upper floors and away from the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh_Lady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a hotel in Amsterdam that was central yet quiet, and having read some good reviews about the Hotel Estherea on Trip Advisor, thought we would give it a go. We weren 't disappointed! The Hotel Estherea is within walking distance of Centraal Station (around 15 minutes) and only 5 minutes from Dam Square, 10 minutes from the Red Light District and around 20 minutes from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. We got the last room available when we booked, however, it was absolutely stunning. The decor was lovely and the bathroom was immaculate (with a jacuzzi bath and separate wet floor shower). The bed was exceptionally comfortable too. The only down side about our room is that there was an adjoining room, so there was a fair amount of noise came through (not a major problem, but if you are a light sleeper, it would have been quite annoying!). The public areas are really lovely too, and the free coffee, hot chocolate and teas available in the lobby (that many other travellers have also mentioned) were very welcome indeed! It was freezing when we were in Amsterdam, so a nice hot drink hit the spot when we got back! There were also PCs available for public use, which meant we were able to check in for our return flight on-line. We had breakfast one morning (â‚¬16) which we thought was quite expensive (until we saw how much breakfasts were in general in Amsterdam!) and our advice would be to take breakfast in the Hotel. It was well presented, plentiful and tasty, with plenty to choose from. If we should ever return to Amsterdam, we won't waste any time looking at other hotels as this is a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top but lovely”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin17
Reviews.Content: I love this place.It's a bit of an explosion in the dressing up box, but gorgeous . I was on my own and got a huge room all to myself for â‚¬135. Love the free coffee and biscuits too

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: docGamba
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Great resturants, shops all within walking distance. The rooms are small and for all the glowing reviews I guess I expected more. The lobby, library is first class. The staff is young, and some are destined to have a career in hospitality and others must be biding their time for the their next career opportunity.The housekeeping personnel cared the most about guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ajf35
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights in late January and we really picked the perfect place. The location is great - near everything and easy to find. Very close to the tram and the train station. The room was huge for Europe and the bathroom was gorgeous with a jetted tub and a separate shower and two sinks. There was plenty of room for both of us and all of our luggage, clothes, etc. You do have to pay for the internet which is a little annoying, but it was something like 10 or 12 euro for 24 hours. The only real problem was the noise one night - we had a room that shared a door with another room and our neighbors were pretty loud, shouting and packing, but I'm sure it was more them than any problem with the room. The lobby is beautiful and there are always people there to help you. You do have to leave your key when you go out but it's not inconvenient at all. Overall, great value, great location, big room and the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to come back to after a day's sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: bagcollector_9
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. It was our 20th Wedding anniversary and we mentioned this in our communications with the hotel, so when we arrived it was very sweet to see a box of chocs and a note in our room from the staff. We loved the free coffee, hot chocolate and tea in reception and there were biscuits and cakes at times too. The public rooms were very comfortable and it was easy to find a quiet corner. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast here, we preferred to eat a croissant in a cafe on the corner. We had a room looking out onto the canal, which we appreciated and we found the location quiet enough to sleep in quite well, but on the edge of things to do and see. The beds and linen were excellent, if the bathroom could do with a little attention (room 307). We also think the WiFi should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: CanarioViajero
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Amsterdam are not specially cheap...so, at the end, after looking at quite a lot of hotels, we finally decided to stay at the Estherea (mostly because of its location, right downtown, and because it was not the typical chain hotel). We definately were right with our election, since the Estherea is within walking distance of all the major sights and the train station (which is crucial when coming from the airport of if you travel around the Netherlands). In addition, there is free internet and free coffee/tea/hot chocolate service 24/7 for the guests, which is really appreciated after coming back following a hard day walking around, and the decoration is great (it feels as if you were at some one's home...really cozy in the Winter). On the other hand, taking into account the price of the hotel: (a) the breakfast is basic and poor. Something to improve; (b) the rooms are tiny (almost too small). Nonetheless, the bathrooms are modern and the rooms are nicely furnished; and (c) the front desk service was not the best (I would say it has been probably the worst we have had in the last weeks...and we stay at hotels every single weekend). All in all, the Estherea is a great choice to stay when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “very nice,good located,clean and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: vdbharry
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated in the center of the city, so a perfect location for discovering the old town and close to the public transportlines (tram, bus); the rooms are very clean and cosy, the reception was friendly and helpfull, so were the other staffmembers; the rooms and the hotel lobby are of the classic/romantic "warm" type, it is very pleasant that you can get coffee or tea complimentary all day and of good quality; the breakfast is also very nice and with a good price/quality ratio. What is on the rather negative site: not much, but the wifi should be free of charge, now it costs 10â‚¬/24h ( although there are 2 computers in the lobby where you can acces the internet free). The acoustic isolation of the adjacent rooms and the windows on the street site could be better. But globaly I was very pleased with the choise of this hotel, that I found via tripadvisor by the way...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TheBristolJohns
Reviews.Content: Our fifth trip to Amsterdam, and our first stay in this hotel - it won't be our last. Excellent location close to some of Amsterdam's nicest shops and restaurants, and a great base for exploring the whole city. The staff were very polite and attentive, and clearly well trained - you can tell that this is a hotel that is brilliantly managed. Lovely decor to top it all off, which creates a very comfortable ambience, with wonderful flower displays.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennieharwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights and couldn't fault it. The reception area with free coffees and biscuits is a great touch, there is a lounge for reading, books and games to borrow and a welcoming bar thats open all night. You can also use the computers/printers for free. Breakfast is superb. Rooms decorated well and beds very comfortable. Perfect location to everything, although try to get a room overlooking the canal rather than the road. Staff are very attentive, helpful and knowledgable. Perfect place to stay for a relaxing break.

Reviews.Title: “An old world gem!”
Reviews.Author: Macree
Reviews.Content: What a delightful stay in an otherwise grubby city (it doesnt seem to get any better as the years go by)Our first time to stay at this delightful boutique hotel. Everything was perfect, from the profesional and friendly English speaking staff, to the myriad of fresh orchids everywhere, the exotic fish tank, and the relaxing lounge and library/meeting room. Our room though small by our usual US chain standards it made up for it in comfort and elegance. Breakfast was more than adequate, and lots of coffee of all sorts available free day and night. We loved our stay here - took easy day trips by train to den Haag and Delft--delightfut!!!! Outstanding fish restaurant around the corner - Lucius- ask the staff to make a reservation. We ate there 3 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 1st visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Livelife060
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. We had the nicest time here. Lovely free coffee and hot chocolate in lobby. The bedrooms for all the family were excellent. The decor in each one was outstanding. Close to shops and overlooking canal. Elderly mother in law really enjoyed the lobby to sit and read and watch the passing parade! Fish tank is very restful in reception area. Will go back and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: b0tanical7
Reviews.Content: We love the hotel it was in a great location, close to the trams . The hotel staff is great and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and beautiful bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Living in a Canal House”
Reviews.Author: theaestheticone
Reviews.Content: if you want to stay on one of the canals, and want to be in walking distance to the center of everything, then this is the place. Ask for a room on the canal. We paid 20 euros more per night, but well worth it. Hotel service and quality is well within the 4 start rating. The salt water fish tank is stunning - for no reason other than just admiring the beautiful tropical fish. I like the free coffee, hot chocolate, expresso, machiato machine in the lobby. Very handy after coming in from the damp cold. I love Amsterdam and really feel like I am in my own canal house here.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem - Truly Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Clanmc
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam a number of times, but this was our first time in the Estherea. It was truly terrific. The location is outstanding, just by the canal, close to shopping and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and efficient at booking taxis restaurants etc and the kids loved the free hot chocolate! Would not now stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Dutch Treat”
Reviews.Author: Marcmarc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Amsterdam for the New Year weekend and after some TripAdvisor research landed on Hotel Estherea situated off the Singel Canal in the pulse of the city. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The moment you walk into this boutique sized hotel you are in a locale that radiates charm. The staff coud not have been nicer, the room was comfortably sized and appointed, a great bed and a view of the canal ( requested) the windows swung out and we could perch on the ledge and watch the Dutch city dwellers pump by on their Amsterdam bikes, a pleasure for sure. The location is wonderful, varied shops and restaurants are minutes away all worth a gander. Strolling through this unique city , visiting their wonderful museums and interesting sights and to return to the welcoming lobby of The Estherea made our New Year a very special one.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reviewerIOW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my aunt for 2 nights in December having spent quite literally about a month searching through possible hotels in Amsterdam. Having spent so long searching, and becoming increasingly concerned about the lack of anywhere good to stay, I stumbled across the hotel Estherea. I dedided to email the hotel directly to get a feel for their customer service and they were excellent. They responded to me within a few minutes and were extremely helpful and informative. The price they offered was as good as any I had found online, but they did have a set price for breakfast which I happened to find cheaper on another website, so I thanked them for their time and explained that I would be booking to stay with them, but through another company. They remained extremely pleasant and commented that they looked forward seeing us on arrival. On arrival, we did get a bit lost in all the chaos of amsterdam and were brave (or stupid) and jumped on a tram which we hoped would take us to very near the hotel. The tram infact only took seconds and we were off again and lost in the very cold evening. We asked several locals where the Estherea was but they did not seem to know. Eventually we were saved by the directions from a shop owner and we found the hotel within minutes. My advice, if you are arriving at night or when its cold, is to treat yourself to a cab, it cost 7euros from the hotel to the station when we went home so really not much for the comfort as a one off! Anyway, having been so put off Amsterdam hotels after the massive search, we were dubious as we walked along the canal side to our hotel, but as we saw a hotel sign in the distance and spotted our hotel we were hugely impressed! It was beautifully decorated outside and the inside was absolutely stunning. The reception staff were really welcoming and asked if a double room was ok. I explained we had requested a twin room on the booking form and they said no problem. So after a quick check in we were escorted to our room by a lovely man who took all our bags. We went in the lift up to our room (there are 2 lovely lifts in the hotel, all opulent and gold, and I am pointing this out as I have seen from many hotel reviews that lifts seem to be a luxury in amsterdam but do not worry, you get 2 here!!!) and it was absolutely lovely. The room was really warm with 2radiators which we could control, plus air con if we needed it. We had a flat screen tv with built in radio, a very clean bathroom with nice complimentary toiletries and decent loo roll (!!!), complimentary slippers and a free bottle of water each. The beds were really comfy and were clearly expensive, with really nice bounce back style pillows and decent duvets (and spare pillows in the wardrobe). We had a posh sofa and a giant armchair in the room, a hairdryer in the bathroom, plus plenty of towels and a flannel each and we even had seperate sinks! The windows opened up so we could get fresh air into the room. The hotel is non smoking so the room smelt very clean and everything was spotless. We just couldnt believe our luck as we had been so worried about what the hotel may be like. We had no need to worry, the hotel Estherea was absolutely perfect, we had truly landed on our feet. Infact we couldnt understand what stopped it being a 5 star? Many people had commented that the breakfast wasnt great so here is what I thought. I am a vegetarian and don't eat egg, so if anything, I though I would struggle to find much variety. I was wrong. The things I could eat and drink included fresh fruit smoothies, fruit juices, all types of hot drinks including many different types of tea in silk style tea bags, let alone anything else!!! Individually sealed packets of cereal, fruits to add such as raisins and prunes, toast, breads, croissants, cake, fresh fruit mix which included all sorts of lovely things such as pineapple and grapes and kiwi (the pineapple was even cut properly so there were no stalk bits in it!!!), small bunches of grapes, precut kiwi fruits, pre cut oranges, jams, various spreads such as chocolate and pate, a selection of cheeses, whole fruit such as apples and satsumas, health drinks like actimel, and I am sure loads more, I just cant remember right now!!! In addition to this, for meat/egg eaters I saw mixed cold meats, hard boiled eggs, scrambled and fried eggs and bacon. Even a fatty would be satisfied with what was on offer!!! I fail to see how anyone could complain about it! The hotel lobby style area has several rooms in which guests could relax and every chair we sat in was comfortable. To make this experience even more enjoyable, there are free hot drinks, sweets and biscuits available at all times and they never ran out. It was such a nice thing to have and we definately made the most of it, the sugary covered biscuits have to be tried, you will be hooked!!! And the toffees are yummy too, I even took some for the plane home!!! You feel very comfortable wherever you choose to relax in the hotel, and they have a bar if you want some alcohol (at a charge). They have 2 computers in the lounge areas and they are really quick. I was able to go on them as and when I wanted and didn't have to wait, or have anyone pressure me to hurry up. Maybe this is different at other times of the year? But it wasn't important to me, I just went on to boast about how great the hotel was to friends back at home! I think for a charge you can get wifi in the rooms. The reception staff were always ready with a smile when we needed to ask them things and were happy to direct us to places and also gave us a map to help, They also called a taxi which arrived within 5 minutes of the call, everything was so efficient! On the day we checked out (very sad!) the reception happily took all of our cases and securely locked them away with individual tags and gave us a receipt to collect them with. This was free of charge. When we got back to the hotel after our last day we had officially checked out, yet we felt comfortable to continue enjoying the hotels facilities and as we had about an hour before we had to leave we relaxed on the big round chair and had some hot chocolate and biscuits. I think any other hotel would have told us to leave, but the Estherea did not bat an eyelid and we felt as welcome as we had from the moment we arrived. Just to add, the hotel does have a gym but we did not use it so i cannot comment on it, other than to say it looked nice and clean through the windows, wasn't huge, but would be fine for a basic workout. I feel like there are a million more things I want to say about this absolutely brilliant hotel, I literally cannot fault it at all. Oh and noise was minimal, this is something I worry about but had no need to here, it was extremely peaceful day and night. On a final note, the hotel cat is gorgeous, I don't know how to spell his name but it sounds like 'hechyir'!!! He is a stunner and although he seems (Or she?) a bit standoffish its not actually the case. He cannot get enough fuss and ended up sprawled out in our shopping!!! If you don't like cats (are you mad?!!!) don't worry, he doesn't bother you, you make the effort for him and then he will accept happily so please do not let this put you off an amazing place to stay. My only regret is that I couldn't bring Hechyir home with me!!!!! I hope this review has helped, have a great stay! ps-location is 5 minutes to the massive long street of shops, food places are within a few minutes and station about 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Amsterdam - WOW”
Reviews.Author: 3hands
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel ideally located in Amsterdam with a super friendly staff. What else would you want? We booked a room with a canal view which was just fantastic to ring in the new year. Amsterdam knows how to celebrate and watching all the fireworks from our room was absolutely spectacular. This hotel has a great lobby and library for relaxing. Plus a nice set up with a free coffee machine and a little bar when coming back in from the days outings. This is really where you want to stay for visiting any part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pezvoladorSpore
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and liking boutique hotels to stay in in Europe, decided to stay at Estherea. It was a great decision. Hotel's located downtown, by a beautiful canal (that happened to be frozen when we were there...). Rooms were spacious for local standards, even if bathroom was smallish, and tastefully decorated with beautiful strong prints. Breakfast was excellent in terms of variety and quality. During cold spell in Amsterdam, hot chocolate available to hosts was a great welcoming touch after a long day in the city. Front office staff was courteous, efficient and helpful. If in Amsterdam, you should definitely consider staying at Hotel Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Incredibly Happy with My Decision to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: dcalexander1
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely stay at this hotel on my next visit. My girlfriend and I arrived at 9:00 am during the holiday season. Despite check-in being much later, the hotel allowed us to check in at that time. They even upgraded the room-giving us a canal view!! It was wonderful. The hotel is impeccable, beautiful- a very classic, luxurious look and very clean. Our room was definitely small, but it was finely decorated and homey. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location couldn't have been better it was on a quite canal street and it was within walking distance to many attractions including great dining options. The only small negative is the walls are thin-sometimes we could here the guests above us. I strongly suggest this hotel for travelers who like elegance and who wan to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Willingtotryanything
Reviews.Content: Located justt a few minutes from Dam Square and on the Singel Canal, this hotel is simply beautiful! Our room was not one with a canal view and so it was extremely quiet, even in the middle of the night. Amsterdam is a bit more expensive than some European countries so the cost was more expsensive than other places we have stayed at in Europe, but the view is unbeatale! It is about 10 minutes to the Anne Frank House walking slow. If you follow the Canal you will end up at the Flower Market. Only thing to remember about this hotel is to LEAVE YOUR ROOM KE Y WHEN YOU LEAVE FOR THE DAY. The receptionist who was on duty when we returned back after our day out was upset with us because we didn't know this and as such didn't leave our key. Also, few coffee and chocolates all day and night. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frananSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Amsterdam at the Hotel Estherea in October, 2010, prior to beginning a Rhine River cruise. The hotel is beautiful...original canal houses that have been remodeled into a wonderful hotel. The rooms are each decorated differently and remind you of a B&B decor. Our room was at the back of the hotel overlooking the back street -- we enjoyed people-watching from the window and did not find the street noisy. The hotel itself is on the Singel canal and only a few short blocks to the hustle and bustle of Dam square. We loved everything about the hotel. The price is steep, but you definitely get what you pay for. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “a very special place”
Reviews.Author: DWandJM
Reviews.Content: free coffee, free internet, very comfortable rooms, charming staff........what more can you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoseandPeterontour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated and of a high standard. The staff are friendly and of course speak excellent English. We only have a few minor grumbles. The first is the 10 Euro per day charge for WiFi. There are two free terminals in Reception and we felt the charge for personal use was unnecessary. Secondly the bathroom of our canal room was absolutely tiny and the room was cold despite having the heating on full. We spoke to Reception and another radiator was provided which solved the problem. Be warned if you take a Taxi from Amsterdam Central. The fare should be around 10 Euros, our driver tried unsuccessfully to charge us 20! I would like also to recommend an outstanding restaurant, which is only 10 minutes walk away. Restaurant het Zwaantje. There are reviews already on tripadvisor you can check out. Turn left out of the hotel and cross over the first bridge and keep walking a few 100 meters â€“ it is worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time and definitely not the last”
Reviews.Author: ElVikingo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three days at the Estherea and a very snowy Amsterdam. This was our fourth time, but first time in a canal view (314). Everything meet our standards and each visit just gets better. The canal view is definitely better but is it worth the extra money is debatable. Everything was first class, a new coffe machine, and some new couches in the lobby. For a four star hotel the drink prices are pretty decent, so stay and have a night cap before you retire for the night. The view from the room was stunning with all new snow. Will definitely return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: embdmb
Reviews.Content: The staff and lobby area of this hotel are excellent. We would rate the total experience of the hotel excellent except two things. We had a "canal" view room. The room was a decent size, but the bathroom was rediculously tiny. The buffet breakfast is expensive. It is 18 Euro per person and definitely not worth the price. At the rate we paid, the breakfast should have been included. We found some very nice breakfast places nearby. Another thing we thought was "cheap" on the hotel's part was a 10 Euro per day Wifi charge. There are two free computers in the lobby, but there was a wait to use them. Our overall experience here was great. A most helpful staff. An immaculately clean establishment. The location (neighborhood feel) cannot be beat. We would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed at in Amsterdam .”
Reviews.Author: DanK2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Estherea is located on the quaint Singel canal within close walking distance of Centraal station, Dam Square and the museum district. My room was elegantly furnished, spotlessly clean, relatively spacious, had an incredible bathroom with whirlpool; all for a price half that of competing hotels. After coming to Amsterdam 15+ times and staying in numerous hotels, I can say with confidence that this will be my easy hotel choice for return trips. I didn't have breakfast there, so I cannot comment on that, but the hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend staying here whenever you're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: BreakingNews58
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Estherea is just terrific. It's right on the canal and if you are lucky enough to have a canal view room, you are in for a real treat. The neighborhood is quiet by Amsterdam standards. And it's within walking distance to just about everything. There were five in our group---three of them teens --and we had two rooms that were separated by a small hallway. Then there was an outer door that closed off our little section so we could leave our individual room doors open as needed making it nearly like a suite. It was perfect for our family. Another plus--- especially when you are traveling with kids--- is that this hotel is NOT in close proximity to some of the other aspects of Amsterdam that you might not think are appropriate for kids. Relatives of ours had the misfortune of staying in a place next to a coffee house where people were smoking dope around the clock plus there were several red light type establishments on the block. Both are certainly a part of life in Amsterdam but it's can be better to stay in a hotel that's not right in the thick of it. The lobby hot chocolate is terrific. The restaurant--which just serves breakfast-- is just ok and quite expensive. I'd recommend going to a nearby pancake restaurant instead. The staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay in a great location - friendly staff, beautiful lobby & comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: DKYW
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed here for 3 nights and it was above our expectations for a European hotel. The foyer and lounge is lovely - the design elements are fantastic, internet, reading lounge, bar and coffee facilities, it was just really relaxing & you could feel it was a family-run hotel despite the fact that it's quite big. Perfect location on Singel which is near the 9 streets (shopping streets), on the canals, in the old part of town. 5 min walk from Dam Square and easy to walk around from and catch a tram to get to the Van Gogh or the Rijksmuseums. Our room was a double & it was quite large with a large bathroom by European standards. I can't stay they are all like that though as we almost changed for a room with 2 singles and it was nowhere near as big or nice as ours. Ours was beautifully decorated and had a mini chandelier almost! The receptionist gave us a great rec for an Indonesian restaurant too. Would most definitely recommend and stay there again - loved it.

Reviews.Title: “superficial luxury”
Reviews.Author: lick17
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a stunning lobby, very chic, but the standard rooms aren't really worth the price. Ours was very small and the decor was more dated than "shabby chic". Issues like this don't really annoy me but at Â£400 for 3nights I didn't feel it was worth it. On a positive note I had a lovely canal view and I did really like the free coffee/sweets/biscuits that were available 24/7 in the lobby. The location is fine-5 mins to walk into main centre. The hotel itself was quite noisy - hoovering started very early in the morning and it sounded like someone was going to come into your room. I enjoyed my stay but I don't think I would rush to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favortie hotels anywhere”
Reviews.Author: ps74
Reviews.Content: Clean, beautifully decorated in lobby and rooms. Staff was helpful, though everything is slow in Amsterdam. it's a great value for a quiet hotel that sit on the canal near great shopping, museums, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, charming, luxurious and superbly located - a dream of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoneypennyLondon
Reviews.Content: First thing of note is the superb location, right on the SIngel Canal , so picturesque and within easy walking distance to everything we wanted to see and do. Some lovely cafes and seriously good restaurants very close by. Our canal view room was fabulous, combining old world charm with modern luxuries. High quality furnishings, great bathroom, romantic ambience, all just lovely. Well worth paying that little bit extra for, the view was such a memorable part of our Amsterdam experience. Service was excellent throughout our stay, no complaints there, the front desk was extremely helpful recommending and booking restaurants for us. All in all, we really loved this hotel and don't see how anyone could possibly be disappointed by staying here - it's gorgeous, really, it is!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in superb city”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for a couple of nights during a short visit to the city. The atmosphere of the hotel is very good. The staff is firendly and helpful. The location is great, very close to Dan square and other major attractions. At the reception, there is the most extraordinary fish tank that I have ever seen. The breakfast was ok, could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations by a lot- excellent”
Reviews.Author: sylvanandmilton
Reviews.Content: We read quite a few reviews on Tripadvisor before making our reservation at the Estherea in Amsterdam. There were a few that were a little less expensive that we had considered but felt that in Europe it is really better to spend a few more bucks and really enjoy the trip. We could not have been happier with our choice of the Estherea. When we walked into the room. we were both pleasantly shocked at how nice it was. It had double sinks in the bathroom and both a shower and an air-jet tub which was wonderful after a day of sightseeing. The wallpaper with big white magnolias and the gilded faux antique chandelier over the bed were a little over the top but we loved it. A fringed lampshade matched the curtains. Color and loud prints everywhere but all tastefully put together like something out of La Cage au Folles. They were making a movie on the first couple of days we were there and we had to step over some cables. would be curious to know what the movie actually was, if anyone knows?

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, beautiful views, and elegant hotel and furnishings ...”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPromise
Reviews.Content: Our deluxe room was large and spacious, with entrance area, and large bathroom and bedroom. The room was elegantly furnished ... and the free internet was the fastest we experienced in our European trip. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel is extremely elegant in its character and furnishings. The hotel is located on the Singel canal and our room on the fourth floor had a beautiful view of the canal and the Amsterdam skyline. Easy walking distance to Flower Market, downtown, train station, and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Traveller9923
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very well appointed rooms. The location is excellent, as was the service. Also great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Charming”
Reviews.Author: WordlyTraveler44
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights in a standard room at the Hotel Estherea. The hotel is elegant and historic. Our room boasted antique furniture, lovely wallpaper and fabrics and a fabulous, large renovated bathroom. The hotel has many inviting public areas.....a library, a sitting area, a small bar. Off the lobby, the hotel offers fresh brewed coffee and hot chocolate and cookies 24/7. The hotel offers free computers for all the guests to share and access their email. The location is ideal, right on a canal, near all the restaurants. The hotel breakfast is pricey (16 euros per person), but you can buy breakfast at half that price in many nearby cafes. We loved our stay the Hotel Estherea and found the staff quite professional and gracious. Now that we have found the Hotel Estherea, we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A Rough Start but Charming!”
Reviews.Author: parkleeh
Reviews.Content: The first room we had was very cute with green details throughout. The room overlooked the Singel Canal. However, the bathroom is the size of a closet. Even the doors to the bathroom looked like a closet. When we first walked in, we were worried that we had to share a bathroom with other guests! With a bathroom that small, I could not bare to stay one more night in that room. We moved to another room with red details throughout with a bathroom at least three times the size of the first room. This room also overlooked the canal. Once we moved to this room, we had a blast. The only annoyance was the two twin beds stuck together to create a king bed. By the end of the night, the two mattresses would separate and I would fall into the crack! The staff is super friendly. They are always willing to help and answer any questions or concerns. They also have jars of treats all over the lobby. Splendid little touch! I understand why Hotel Estherea is ranked top 10 in Amsterdam! FYI...make sure you go to the bakery around the corner on the other side of the street, it's delicious! And also check out Vasso near Dam Square. The food is amazing!!!! Make sure to get the panna cotta. Simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Must be what it was like to stay in noble surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: the_melv
Reviews.Content: An easy, elegant, charming property. All of the common areas are beautifully furnished with lovely floral arrangements. The front desk staff are helpful and polite though lacking a sense of humor. Coffee is available in the common areas all day. Our room was comfortable with plenty of closet space and a nice bath. The view was an interior well. As the hotel was full there no opportunity to change. If you prefer a canal view (who wouldn't?) specifiy during reservations. When arriving by train it is best to take a taxi as it is too far to walk with luggage. After numerous trips to Amsterdam this is our favorite "little" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Athens85
Reviews.Content: I decided to book four nights in October at the EstherÃ©a Hotel as I read very good positives feedbacks on this website. The location is excellent: you can go everywhere in the downtown of Amsterdam on foot and you do not need to use public transportation. We arrived at about 11pm and a very helpful receptionist welcomed us explain everything about the hotel and Amsterdam. I have to say that all the receptionists that I meet during our stay very always very friendly and helpful (to suggest a restaurant, to organize a transfer to the airport, etc.). The hotels is composed of four buildings, two of which were recently acquired by the hotel (as I read in a magazine in my room). Our rooms was in the â€œoldâ€� buildings, the rooms furniture was ok. There were however some negatives things: the bathroom need to be refurnished as soonest, the bed was a French one (160cm) not very comfortable for two people, we heard people walking in the floor above us and one night we even heard someone snoring in a room next to ours! The room size is ok (do not expect big rooms). The breakfast is ok but the breakfast room can be sometimes crowed (is better to go as earlier as you can). Next to the reception on the ground floor there is a coffee and tea machine that hotel gust can use with no charges. Overall a great stay, with some improvements possible, in a perfect location to discover a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - Justify the high TA rating!”
Reviews.Author: Adomvatik
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 nights in this hotel. I selected it based on TA members reccomendations. Rooms (one delux and one standard for my son) were on high statndard. Functional , comfortable and well equipped. Very high Value to cost ration! Don't expect very large room but for the price you get a high standard hotel. The free cofee and coocies is a great idea. Within walking distance to all attractions. Centrally located but in a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Room”
Reviews.Author: sonnyss
Reviews.Content: Great location and very close to public transportation. Right on the canal view. Interior design is outstanding. Very secure and staff is professional and will take care of your needs. Near by awesome restaturants walking distance from the hotel. Idea location. Highly recommend to stay at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BridgetNottingham
Reviews.Content: We visited the Estherea for the seconf time last week.. Sited beside the Singel Canal, amongst other lovely 17th and 18th century buildings near the centre of Amsterdam, the Estherea is a winner before you even enter hotel. Inside the welcome is warm and helpful, whilst the decor matches the exterior, being beautiful, with lots of apparently period fdetail. Minimalist it is not. An important feature beside the entrance is a large tank filled with brilliantly coloured coral-reef fish. Typically thoughtful, there is a small step up so children can see them too. On each occasion our room faced the canal; this time the wallpaper was distinctly striking huge 'oriental' flowers. We did think Estherea was expensive and clearly there is an expectation that everyone will pay extra for breakfast. This was our single grip - we came down late and found evrything except the breads supplied diappointing.- limited fruit supplied, poor bacon, tired looking selection of cold meats and coffee machine though free coffee. Luckily our booking deal did include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Steve99Wales
Reviews.Content: Front of house 'offhand'. Bar service non existent. 5* prices but 2* service.

Reviews.Title: “Staff exceptionally helpful”
Reviews.Author: HandP47
Reviews.Content: This hotel was first class in every way - location, cleanliness, great breakfast, public areas very well appointed with free internet access. Our room was rather small but well furnished. Most importantly for us the staff were helpful in many ways, especially in arranging for us to a visit a medical clinic rather than sending us to a local hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel in a great location. The computers in the lobby as well as free coffee and tea was a plus. The room was large for European Standards. Service was great!. The location was wonderful, we walked to all the major sites including van gogh museum as well as Amsterdam Centraal Station. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel with Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: InspectorT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this terrific hotel on the basis of Trip Advisor recommendations, and our high expectations were exceeded. It is a non-chain, family-owned hotel and everyone makes the guests feel like a welcomed family members. Across the board, the staff was the friendliest and most helpful I have experienced anywhere, anytime. The location is terrific, and it is worth the extra cost to get a canal-view room. It is within easy walking distance of a multitude of good restaurants and cafes (just ask the front desk staff for their recommendations), a few minutes walk from a trolley line, or short taxi rides from the city's major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: pat1187
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel,really enjoyed our stay here.The hotel has been refurbished with a lot of different wallpapers and it seems to have worked well.It has free coffee and tea making facilities in the lobby for guests which proved very usefull.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: gemma0911
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value in comparison to others i'd looked for of a 4 star rating in this location. The location of the hotel was good, close to Dam Square. The rooms were nice and clean. The bathroom was spacious. The only criticism of the rooms is that there were no tea/coffee making facilities, however free tea and coffee was available in the lounge area. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as it was 16 euros each and there are quite a few places close by serving breakfasts at much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Efficient Staff, Beautiful Furnishings: A real 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: leisurist
Reviews.Content: The Estherea is only a few minutes walk from prime attractions. Beautiful canal location. Big choice of restaurants nearby. Staff friendly and efficient. Charming interior decor, well furnished rooms. Coffee, tea, etc., always available in lobby. 2 computers for free internet access. The only problem was some street noise at night from street behind hotel. Nonetheless, my wife and I were happy at the Estherea, and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, beautifully furnished.”
Reviews.Author: IanSA
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very helpful, our room was large and comfortable. They have nice extras such as a free coffee bar and quality biscuits. Obligingly changed the mattresses we found too soft. Have a gym, but limited equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Canal side hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: keitharrowsmith
Reviews.Content: A quiet location, just a few minute's walk away from a lot of the city centre attractions. We stayed on the top floor overlooking the canal, but many of the rooms look onto central courtyards. Some of the modern improvements don't have a top quality feel (the room doors for example could be upgraded which would help the internal sound insulation) and it must be a challenge to keep the old parts in a good state of repair (our room window leaked and the heating was a bit noisy). Breakfasts were fine - but expensive if you only want a quick bite - so better to head out to one of the many local cafes. Overall a good experience at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: seznang
Reviews.Content: This place is in a good location right on canal Singel and you wont be disappointed with this hotel. Free speedy internet, handy shuttle service and little freebies such as toilettries, nibbles and some drinks...this place will enhance your holiday and make for a pleasant stay.
