I cant recommend it enough, although I shouldve booked with breakfast included as the dining area looked nice and Im sure it wouldve been well worth it..On the downside, rooms a re a little small, such as most places in Amsterdam. It is a 4* hotel but it made you feel like a superstar with all its furnishings and trimmings.Will be back for certain on our next visit. Thanks again...

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself and stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SuePhoenix
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the nicest hotel we stayed at during our trip to Europe. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect! We were able to walk EVERYWHERE ~ Red Light District, Ann Frank Haus, all the squares, tons of restaurants, canal boat tours, casino, EVERYWHERE. There is a bike rental just a two minutes walk from the hotel. (I'd suggest riding in the morning before the bike/car traffic gets CRAZY.) There are two computers in the library area, which you can use for free. We booked a deluxe room overlooking the canal. We were very content at times to just sit in the room and relax, looking out the big windows at the canal activity. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom (nice supply of shamphoo, bath salts, etc.) The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was very clean. There is free coffee, latte, hot cocoa, tea 24/7 in the lobby. Also free ice water w/mint in the bar area. We paid 349 euros/night, which is expensive, but you get what you pay for and this hotel was worth every euro! Treat yourself and stay here. How many times are you going to visit Amsterdam?

Reviews.Title: “Charming, gracious”
Reviews.Author: Romin-7
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Amsterdam was made all the better with our one night stay at this lovely gracious hotel situated on one of the canals. The quality of furnishings and attention to detail was such a pleasure and the ability to have a cup of coffee and cake in the foyer any time of the day or night was very much appreciated. The choice of areas to entertain guests was also very much appreciated. Loved the amazing fish tank in the reception area too. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious accomodations at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Sailor-NHYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to leaving on a river cruise on the Rhine River to Basel, Switzerland. It was one of the nicest hotels in which I have stayed. The service was helpful and courteous. It was in a easily accessible location close to public transportation. It had a large bathroom with a jacuzzi and twin sinks. The bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with great service”
Reviews.Author: Pablohow
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location. Staff were very helpful and will go out of their way to accomodate your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireFellow
Reviews.Content: Spent considerable time viewing many hotels on the internet before choosing this hotel. Judging the reviews and the hotel website we decided on Hotel Etherea. Bad start to stay as we had travelled over 12 hours without sleep and had to wait two hours for our room. When we arrived we were told the room would be ready in half an hour. We waited and waited by reception but the receptionist only feet away forgot about us. When we enquired we were told that the room was in fact ready and apologised profusely. Good points to the hotel were the location and the decor. We paid what I believe was the top rate for room with canal view. Very disappointed that there was no shower cubicle as was on the website. The bathroom was extremely small and there were no doors (only see through louvre doors!!) to give some degree of privacy. There were no facilities for hot drinks in the room. The fridge was well stocked with two small bottles of water that were replaced daily, no other choices. I expected more for what we paid to stay here and even though there were many good points to the hotel we would not book it again for our regular visits to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Just4shiv
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking as I arrived a day early in Amsterdam. The hotel was an unexpected meeting point of elegance, charm, great location with attention to detail. Although the room was not large, the layout and design was very pleasing, including the bathroom with modern fixtures which had both a large tub and a shower with a double sink. The bed and its bedding were very comfortable and after 5 hours of a long drive from Hattonchatel in France, was very welcomed. I did notneed to unpack, but there was adequate cupboard space, safe and an iron with ironing board. At the foot of the bed was a small table with magazines and outlet for charging devices. The next morning, I discovered that the hotel was located very close to the heart of the city. A walk out to the left and first left would take you to the small pedestrian streets for shopping and great food. I tried to extend my stay by a day but the price had almost doubled.( I hope that the upcoming SAIL event had something to with that.) If not I would suggest that you book early for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CanadianIslanders
Reviews.Content: Our friends and we had 3 rooms for 4 nights at this hotel. First I have to say that we were thrilled upon arrival to find out we had been upgraded to larger rooms. The hotel has a wonderful feel to it and this is one hotel that the photos do not do the hotel justice. It has a wonderful lobby with several sitting rooms to just have a coffee or read. There is a great coffee station on the main floor with cookies throughout the day. The location is fantastic as it is only a few minutes from the Dam and a large grocery store. One nice touch in the room is an empty fridge for your personal items. There is loads of storage in the room, although the standard room, which we asked to see, are not quite as large. This was at least our fourth stay in AmDam and this was by far the best hotel. The only thing that could be improved upon is that their breakfast was not included and really we did not think offered good value. Other than that, our room was excellent and since we were upgraded to a larger room we did not try to pay for an upgrade to a canal view room. I don't think we were disadvantage by the room not being on the canal. Our stay far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: ColleenNigel
Reviews.Content: Small elegant hotel, friendly staff, rooms and bathrooms well appointed, clean and spacious. Good value for money. Breakfast good but staff was a bit less friendly, but that was only a minor detail. Went with brother and sister in law and they also found it charming. Location perfect for restaurants, sightseeing, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Beegee91
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Amsterdam with our 10-year-old daughter and Hotel Estherea was the perfect spot for us to stay. The hotel and staff were extremely welcoming. The location was excellent - very close to everything, yet just far enough away to be a peaceful place to be at the end of a busy day. The lobby had lovely rooms to sit in, and the hotel room was very comfortable. In part we stayed here because it was one of the few hotels that had a triple room - somthing seemingly hard to come by - and that worked very well for the three of us. The only drawback was that our room was adjacent to a busier road, which was loud with traffic and pedestrians late into the evening, but it proved to be only a minor annoyance. In all, we loved our stay and would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “great location and facilities, canal view room worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: QueensTom
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at the Hotel Etherea. A great value (canal view room @ 200 euro per night). Easy walk to the Dam; short tram ride to museums and Leidesplein.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, nicely situated, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: melted_snowball
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Amsterdam before going on to Utrecht for a meeting in early August. This hotel is very nicely located; it's right near the Nine Streets shopping area, which is full of fun independent shops, and easy walking distance to most of central Amsterdam's sights. I had a small room, with separate bathroom on one side of the room and shower-room on the other side (in what might have been a converted closet?). It was pleasant, if tight. I did think it was more expensive than it needed to be, particularly since breakfast and internet weren't included, and the room was so small. But the staff was quie friendly and helpful, and there are plenty of cheap places to get eats in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: xalara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very nice and quiet location. It is very close to the Dam square which is easy for tourists to explore the city attractions. The rooms are clean and comfortable while the staff are helpful. I should mention that the decor of the hotel is very stylish. I didn't like that both the breakfast and the parking fee are expensive. Also, WiFi is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottrn1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Amsterdam with a fantastic stay at the Hotel Estherea. The location is perfect, on a nice quiet canal location (a rare thing in amsterdam).We stayed in a deluxe canal view which I would highly recommend not only for the beautiful view but also for the larger size (coming from the US you will appreciate it...trust me). The decor is elegant and classy but not snobbish. Beds are so large and comfortable (pillow top?)Staff is extreamly helpful (examples: room ready at 9 am when check-in wasn't until 15:00, also had a taxi for us in under 5 Min. so we could catch our train to Paris at Centraal Station).Try to get a room ending with 10 as they are the largest (i.e. 310,410,510 etc.) All of the major sites are withing walking distance. There is a great little cafe next door (Broodje Bert) as well as numerous good restaurants around the corner on Spuistraat. I will only stay here for future visits as it was simply perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LECCalgary
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 people and had 3 rooms at the hotel. The staff were great, the location was great, very quiet and easy to get about. We had deluxe rooms which were really nice but the standard rooms would have done just as well. We will definitely stay here the next time wew are in Amsterdam. There is a restaurant on site but for breakfast only. If you wanted wireless in your room you had to apy but there were 2 computers you could use for free in the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, offering all you could ask for when staying in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: TouringTorres
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for a couple of nights in July 2010. We had two adjoining rooms on the 3rd floor, with one room having lovely views over the canal. The rooms were extremely comfortable, with clean, well equipped and spacious bathrooms. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We particularly enjoyed the little extras like free hot drinks, cakes and sweets available throughout the day. Only negative was that breakfast in the hotel was quite expensive, and so we popped down the road to Broodje Berts! We will definitely revisit this hotel, as it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in an ideal picturesque location.”
Reviews.Author: tracker400
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Estherea for eight nights. The overall experience was excellent. I had one of the smaller, interior rooms likely because I got a lower rate from booking.com. But my room was just fine and the bathroom was a nice size for a European hotel. The room was clean and quiet and was really just perfect for my stay. I would have loved a view but didn't need one and was able to discern if it was raining or not by looking into the little courtyard. What I loved most about the hotel was the location. As a gay traveler, I found that the hotel was a 10 minute walk to most of the gay bars or clubs. It was about a 20 minute walk to the museum area and only a five minute walk to Dam Square and the red light district. The train station was about 15 minute walk. The staff was very attractive and attentive. They have really nice umbrellas there if you don't have one or need an extra. The expresso machine was awesome to have in the lobby. I did not eat at the hotel. There are two computers in the lobby for free internet access. Often times they were in use, but for the most part I had no problem getting enough time to check emails and travel information. Most of the time I was able to pick up a free wifi signal on my smartphone. I would absolutely stay there again. Only complaint, was that the maid leaves the windows open after cleaning and some mosquitoes popped in my room and bit me up pretty well. But once i realized there was AC in the room I kept the windows closed at night. Also, there is a cat in the hotel. I love cats but if you are allergic this could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Well Appointed”
Reviews.Author: wampolch
Reviews.Content: I visit Amsterdam oftenand have stayed in 8-10 hotels, a couple of B&Bs and a couple of apartments. The Estherea is probably my favorite of the hotels. It is as comfortable as the big chain hotels like the Radisson, but it has more charm, as it is a family owned establishment. The rooms are large and clean. The staff is friendly and the location cannot be beat. The free coffe, tea and cookies are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “For boutique hotels, this must be the holy grail!”
Reviews.Author: Max2502
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel with incredible attention to detail. There are so many fine touches that distinguish this place that it would be impossible to do it justice in a brief note such as this. Take it for granted that the staff is professional, courteous and friendly. The rooms are not huge but by European standards are perfectly sized and extrememly well appointed. The way the decor and furnishings blend shows an eye for detail missing in som many other places. It features plush towels and bedding, top quality toiletries and the highest standards of cleanliness. The ambience and layout of the lobby and lounge areas is a joy. Discreet yet welcoming, understated luxury, an impressive and well stocked bookcase, daily newspapers in 4 or 5 different languages, free highspeed broadband (with automatic cache clearing), free coffee, tea or hot chocolate with cookies, delightful background music...this place just impresses to no end.

Reviews.Title: “tries hard to be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jemapohexplorer
Reviews.Content: Estherea does not have a "a la carte" restaurant. Only breakfast is served at the cafe. Strictly, that alone disqualifies it to be a 4 star. However it tries to make it up by offering free coffee and cookies. The bar is operated by a bartender who doubles up as the bell boy and the coffee machine technician. The gym is small with basic equipment. The library is however a pleasant feature. Location wise it is centrally located close to many attractions and transport. We specifically asked for a room with a canal view. The first night we were put up in the attic, a room that was NOT worth the additional charges. We complained and was transferred to a better room on the first floor. We should not be charged extra. Cleanliness was superb. The front office was very professionally run. Amsterdam has to be explored on bike. Bike rental was just around the corner. We were glad we did that. Overall the Estherea was an excellent hotel in the 3 star category. We would recommend this hotel if the price is right. It is worthwhile to compare the rates with the 2 star outlet next door if location is the primary criteria.

Reviews.Title: “mini cruise -perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: tazzyOldham
Reviews.Content: used this hotel for our one night stay over on the amsterdam mini cruise.second stay at this hotel and seemed better than last time. Delightful rooms and staff. bonus hot drinks and cakes served all day in the lobby. perfect location ,quiet yet not too far from the action. breakfast was lovely but rather expensive -not for us though as we got a good bed and breakfast deal through easy to book .com. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: cellophanestar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on other reviews on tripadvisor. I had expected the rooms to be quite small from other info I'd read and it was but still fine. The decor in the hotel is very nice, the location is really handy. I had to contact the hotel before I visited and they were very quick to reply and friendly. Free tea and coffee in the lobby and internet! Handy for checking in on flights etc. Only grumble is that the room was a 'double' but it was actually 2 single beds pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- strongly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Massenma
Reviews.Content: Our reservation had mistakenly been canceled by 800-Hotels. Thankfully the hotel had a room available and the front desk staff was very accommodating in helping us (it was actually less expensive to book directly with the hotel than what we had been initially charged by 800-Hotels). We stayed for two nights and really enjoyed our stay. The location is great and our room was spacious and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Sophie529
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, we knew we made the right choice. The Hotel Estherea is lovely and the staff is wonderful. Our room faced the canal - very romantic. The room was beautifully decorated and much larger than we expected. The bathroom was huge and modern. The complimentary coffee/tea/sweets were a welcome indulgence at the end of the day. There are quite a few good restaurants and bars just around the corner, and yet, our room was quiet and calm. Most attractions are just a short walk away and the tram is nearby for the attractions outside of walking distance. One of the canal boats stops just about a block away. It is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: worshiguchi
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Estherea for three nights in July, after a decade-long hiatus. It was the first Amsterdam hotel we ever stayed in. We have stayed elsewhere on the half dozen trips we have made since that inaugural visit a decade ago, not because we were disappointed by the first visit, but because it always seems to be booked. And no wonder, it has undergone some serious renovation since our fist visit and entered the world of luxury boutique hotels. That said, the staff are courteous, welcoming, and not at all pretentious--which distinguishes the Estherea from other hotels. The rooms are absolutely beautiful, quiet, and air-conditioned (which given the heat wave, was a god send). The hotel is ideally located, the surrounding neighborhood offers all kinds of dining options, and it is a 15 minute walk from central station. We will never stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pinkylicious
Reviews.Content: Little gem in the center of Amsterdam.... Rooms are incredible, not big but sooo cute, perfectly decorated in best Amsterdam's traditions, i loved the chandelier and wallpapers, they put me in the great mood instantly. Huge spacious bathroom with jacuzzi tube, and a sea-salt if you want to relax... The only thing - this hotel is mostly occupied by elderly people in their 50-60, I am a young girl who was travelling with friends and seemed like we didn't completely fit in there, but it was still great. Complimentary coffee, hot chocolate and sweets (which was a MUST!) in the lobby. Also very nice complimentary cold mint water in the bar and marshmallows :) - a nice refreshment during the hot summer day! 10 minutes walk to the red light district. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique charm of the highest standard"”
Reviews.Author: MJA1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea was a delight from the beginning of our stay until the end. We travelled with 3 generations, aged grandparents, middle aged parents and teenage, children, staying in 4 rooms, 3 canal view superior rooms and one standard room overlooking the internal courtyard. All were beautifully decorated, each with a different theme, clean, and - by European standards - spacious. The hotel really could not be faulted - beautiful rooms, a charming study/library/salon/bar, friendly and knowledgable staff who made excellent recommendations for restaurants and tours, and great service all round. The breakfast deserves special mention - absolutely superb and well worth the additional tariff. I have not had better anywhere. It is also in a great location, close to everything but quiet - even on the night the Netherlands got through to the world cup final and the whole country partied all night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KIRSTY26
Reviews.Content: Good base for staying in Amsterdam, Great location. Enjoyable breakfast. Very nice greek place to eat beside the hotel-closed Mon and Tue.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PGilchrist
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with excellent service. The room was perfectly clean had everything I needed. The bathroom was split into two sections, on separate sides of the room. Shower on one side, sink and toilet on the other, both had doors as usual, just a little different. The coffee/tea/cookie area was an excellent place to stop whether 2am or 2pm. Really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: spomatto
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our family and loved the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was perfect---very close to the action but on a quiet canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location to enjoy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gcjones
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Located on the Singel Canal, this hotel is convenient to most of what you would like to do in Amsterdam. It's a short walk to Dam to catch a tram. There's a GREAT bakery right around the corner - skip the hotel breakfast and get some hot croissants instead. There's also a nice little restaurant on the corner to the left as you leave the hotel that serves off-the-charts great salads. In the alley connecting to Spui Straat, there's a great pub and a beer/wine store. On Spui Straat behind the hotel are several other good restaurants, as well as several "coffeeshops" which don't actually serve coffee; rather they specialize in other treats that may only be found in Amsterdam, if you get my drift. The hotel is upscale without being pretentious. The rooms are comfortable. The staff was uniformly informed and helpful. Taxi to the airport is 43 euros. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very good location!”
Reviews.Author: roulal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, five- minute walk to the Dam square. Very clean, warm colours. Although the room was a bit small,it was warm, cosy and had wonderful view of the Singel canal. It was a bit noisy from the room above us. Very nice breakfast buffet. Great idea the coffee maker that can be used anytime (night or day) and as often desired!!! Everything was perfect! I would definitly go there again!

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: wiresticker
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the ideal position for exploring Amsterdam. Dam square and tram system are very close by. An easy walk from the main train station too. We stayed in room 310, it has a wonderful view of a canal. The bed is huge and as such makes the room feel a bit small. The room/hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are very cheerful and extremely helpful. The free tea and coffee/internet access in the lobby is a nice touch which tends to bring guests down from their rooms. Unique decor makes this Hotel special and gives it a warm comforting feel. Only a couple of niggly downsides...a tad expensive and lourve doors on the loo was a bit odd.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: laurendt88
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to the centre of the city. The rooms were impeccably clean and the hotel was incredibly charming. We really liked the free coffee and internet services. All in all, a wonderful place to stay. Would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with other hotels - this one is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gommeville
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husbands 40th birthday. I'd looked for a while as I needed parking (the hotel charges 55 euros - on street it 47e, so it's a good deal). What a result - it is perfect in every way. The room we had overlooked the street (some will overlook the canal on the other side) and it was very quiet. We've stayed in lots of nice hotels around the world and I have to say this is the best for cleanliness - I couldn't fault it and each day after the maid had been it was as polished as the moment we went in. Aside from this, the room was beautiful, the staff were all so friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect - really close to all the buzziness of Amsterdam, with a little tranquility on the canal. The little touches are perfect - I used the gym and there were bottles of water and towels to use, and also a bowl of fruit to pick from. This is one to remember!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant reasionably priced boutique hotel on Singel Canal”
Reviews.Author: CandNMontreal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is four adjoining houses overlooking a canal. Charming, elegant, great service and centrally located for visiting Amsterdam. We reserved a room overlooking the canal which costs extra but is essential for the full experience. We arrived at 8.15AM and were in our room within an hour, a rare experience for transatlantic travellers. A unique featurevis a coffee machine in the lbby that dispenses, gratis, espressos, capucinos, lattes etc after freshly grinding the beans. Staff were very helpful, breakfast was expensive (16 Euros) but very good. Room safe was an impenetrable 10 step process to program and we gave up. Loved the place and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with big furniture and small bed”
Reviews.Author: DonRobertoSanJuan
Reviews.Content: Our room was at the street side and was really small. There was no space to put our suitcases due to the 2 big chairs and table as well as some kind of wall unit taking up most of the space. The double? bed was tiny and uncomfortable. We kept on saying how our room at a cruise ship had more usable space.

Reviews.Title: “The EstherÃ©a Epitomizes Elegance and Excellence”
Reviews.Author: GalivantingGardener
Reviews.Content: The Hotel EstherÃ©a has as its Lobby's centrepiece, a magnificent crystal chandelier. In all its glory, it draws the eye of everyone who enters, commanding attention as it accentuates its prominence as the "piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance". It consists of a myriad of crystals, each small fragment beautiful and pristine on its own. However, taken altogether each of those crystals combine to become, as a whole, more brilliant and dazzling than they possibly could individually. This is my view of the Hotel EstherÃ©a , with its various attributes and facets, each exceptional and noteworthy in their own right, but nonetheless when put together, rises above and surpasses the average hotel experience into another dimension. The notable facets of the EstherÃ©a include, in no specific order: *old world charm combined with luxurious accommodations *immaculate, historic and stunning architectural canal house on the outside, fused with modern amenities, yet reflecting the lifestyles of centuries past on the inside. *pristine, central location along the first of four concentric, semicircle canals surrounding the city centre, almost everything within walking distance. *the enigmatic Dutch "gezelligheid" quality, the ambience which makes the hotel warm, cozy and welcoming. That indefinable element that makes a stay memorable. *romantic rooms with heavenly beds, which exceed European expectations and standards, especially the modern and chic, immaculately clean washrooms. *large, landscaped central atrium, perfect for allowing maximum natural light to filter into enormous floor to ceiling windows. *fabulous breakfast buffet to indulge in with relaxation, fortifying you each morning for an enjoyable, unforgettable experience in Amsterdam. *decadent treats and nibbles set out fresh all day, tempting you to pour yourself a complimentary tea or coffee (cappuccino, expresso, americano, etc), forcing you into lingering awhile in the plush surroundings of the lobby or the luxurious library. *refreshing mint & lemon infused water, available from the dispenser on the bar, to enjoy while waiting for one of the two computers provided, courtesy of the hotel. *stunning floral displays throughout, attention to details, including individual cloth hand towels in the lower common/public restrooms. *a gracious owner (along with her adorable daughters), who mingles and chats with the guests, ensuring the intimate, family-oriented, yet boutique atmosphere of the hotel. *exceptional service and hospitality from each and every staff member. From the bellboys, the housekeepers, the bartender, to all at the Front Desk, including those who replied to all my prior email requests promptly. But we especially want to mention Singh. No request, and there were many, was too great or too small for him. He is a top-notch professional, who bent over backwards to make our family's visit special. The only fault that could be found are the sounds that can carry between rooms, depending upon how courteous your neighbouring guests conduct themselves in the wee hours. In our travels we have experienced this occurrence in many establishments, so much so, that we don't travel without being adequately prepared with quality earplugs. Therefore this didn't affect us, but the unwary may not anticipate this, and it would be negligent not to mention. Taking all these factors into account, the well-travelled adventurer would not be disappointed in choosing the Hotel EstherÃ©a . It truly is a destination within a destination. A genuine gem for those who look for and expect elegance and excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Estherea while awaiting a cruise. Very nicely located overlooking the Singel Canal, within walking distance of just about everything. Loved the hotel - a quiet charm; well-appointed. Staff very helpful and professional. Free internet in lounge, which is nice to see in Europe - not usually the case. Wonderful coffee machine available 24 hours in lounge at no charge. Didn't eat there; prefer to eat in local restaurants. Room a decent size (for Europe); smallish by North American standards, but quite manageable. Facilities (washroom, TV, etc.) first rate. Windows open for fresh air! Nice view. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: Montclairite
Reviews.Content: Canal view room was spacious, quiet with a beautiful bath. Hotel staff was helpful and accomodating. Lobby and guest seating areas were elegantly decorated. Ease of internet access with 2 PCs available in the lobby made checking EMail very easy. Would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The best and most beautiful Hotel ever for me!”
Reviews.Author: OXIMA
Reviews.Content: It was the best Hotel ever, everything was great! We dident had breakfast but you can drink coffe for free and read newspapers also for free. The rooms was clean, beautiful and nice. The personel helpful and professionel. The location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to relax”
Reviews.Author: shakeyDerby
Reviews.Content: A great place to relax after a tiring day of sightseeing. It is ideally located near Dam Square on a quiet part of the Singel. It is very welcoming and the attention to detail is exceptional. The fresh floral arrangements are stunning and attention to detail evident in all areas. The staff are very polite and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast is something to look forward too with such a variety and coffee/cakes/sweets/nibbles available at all times. It really has a cosy 'family run' atmosphere - very welcoming and the beds - ahhh - heavenly comfort after hours walking the canals. Defininely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but the free coffee and tea a bonus”
Reviews.Author: spottyladybird
Reviews.Content: We took this hotel at the last minute. The location is not easy to find by foot, especially after 18:00 in Winter. The hotel is okay. The room has old decoration, though the bathroom is great. The bed bit smelly and walls are very thin, hence you can hear next door neighbour conversation. The only good thing about this place is the free tea and coffee available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Canal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awaywegoFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Estherea and enjoyed a wonderully decorated and spacious canal view room. The hotel has incredibly beautiful public areas on the first floor where guests can use the internet for free, enjoy 24 hour free coffee/tea/espresso, read the newspaper or purchase drinks from the bar The breaksfast buffet was tasty and full of variety.. Staff was warm and helpful. We have stayed in two other hotels in the city before and the Estherea is now are favorite. The area has great restaurant choices and is close to the trams. One caution, the other rooms in the hotel seemed smaller than ours so you may want to pay extra for a larger canal view room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and highly recommended - some changes would be nice”
Reviews.Author: yogaboy108
Reviews.Content: Me and my dear companion stayed here for seven nights over the course of two visits in two weeks time. I must say that our overall impression of the experience is very favorable. The hotel is gorgeous, especially the sitting areas downstairs. We had a different room each visit and both were nicely decorated. Although we were on the fourth floor both times, the room with a view over the street was very noisy and I had a hard time sleeping. The room over the courtyard was quieter. Pros: Location is perfect. Beautiful hotel with well-decorated rooms and a very comfy public sitting area, staff was mostly friendly with a couple of odd exceptions (I have never been as ignored as when I approached one front desk member, Singh. He was abrupt and dismissive and though I was trying to be quite polite, he chose to simply ignore my presence even though I was trying to ask for some very basic help. He literally stood in front of me and went back to whatever he was doing before I approached.) The fitness area isn't very appealing, but it does have some dumb-bells and two cardio machines, I think. Cons: Room rates were erratic and fluctuating. For these rates and the supposed luxury status, there really should be some basic extras, like robes and coffee in the rooms, newspapers for free, etc.Expensive and unreliable WiFi, Buffet breakfast was expensive and embarrassingly weak on all levels. Some real weak links with front desk customer service - this in itself would warrant looking at other hotel options.

Reviews.Title: “just go there!”
Reviews.Author: akapaf
Reviews.Content: having read all the reviews here on tripadvisor, we decided to give the estherea hotel a try, also considering the price (one of the cheapest in its category and area of Amsterdam). And I might say that the hotel was even better then expected! the location is perfect, on the first canal, a few blocks behind Dam square; the hotel is very charming and doesn't look like the usual chain hotels; the rooms are very beautiful, with comfy beds and spacious bathrooms (our standard room had a jacuzzi and a separate shower); the hotel staff is very helpful and friendly (the even gave our little child a gift at the arrival); the hot beverages always available in the lobby pamper you whenever you get back to the hotel. I will certainly chose this hotel again when in Amsterdam and recommend it to anybody who's visiting Amsterdam. do not waste time looking for other places and book your room till there are some free!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: law929
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the nicest area of Amsterdam. Its close to cool shops, cafes and yet on a quiet beautiful street. Because of its location it was easy to go back and forth to it multiple times a day to quickly fetch a coat or to relax before heading out again. The hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms are spotless. Free coffee and teas all day, together with yummy biscuits made us feel very welcome. We loved Estherea and would come back to it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.”
Reviews.Author: Larrye4363
Reviews.Content: Planned a trip to Amsterdam, and searched many places. While the room was a bit cozy, I enjoyed the atmosphere. Breakfast was good. Liked the comfort of the lobby. Everyone there was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the canals”
Reviews.Author: JCB_8
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from spending 5 nights at the Hotel Estherea. The Estherea is a quality hotel with a fantastic labby / library / sitting room area. There are many restaurants nearby with great breakfast options also. Rather then pay the 16 Euros each for breakfast we chose to eat out and we enjoyed the food and experience. We were initially checked into to a room on the Spuistraat street side (there were no canal facing rooms left) which proved to be quite noisy from the cars and late night revellers so we relocated to a middle room which was much better (and actually bigger with heated floor in the bathroom!). There is a 24 hour tea / coffee making facility which is great and easy access to the PC's for internet or web mail etc. The hotel is in a great location on Singel and a short stroll to the shopping and / or main centre. Best store is the de Bijenkorf store in the centre of the city and make sure you go to the top floor as they have a fantastic food area - great for lunch or morning or afternoon tea! Near the Estherea I woudl recommend the Restaurant Vasso for excellent Italian food and vino at reasonable prices or try Kantjil if you are looking for an Indonesian style dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: renatasydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated about 10 minutes walk from Centraal, along a beautiful and quiet Singel canal. Service is wonderful, rooms are comfortable and clean, bathroom has full bath and is well-equipped. Hotel offers free hot drinks, some muffins and cakes and lollies. There're two computers in the lobby and a wonderful library with the books in many different languages. They happily arranged for our room to be ready by 9am and kept our luggage until our train trip. We didn't have breakfast. The hotel is not cheap, but for the comfort and service offered it's worth every cent. It's located about 10 minutes from the historic centre. 3 min walk will take you to the large department store. There're some cafes next to the hotel (the non-smoking ones). I would strongly recommend this hotel to everyone. On Amsterdam - city is very safe, we had a walk at 1am until about 3am and felt very safe. The cyclists are mad and you must be careful when crossing as they won't signal or stop for you. Everyone speaks English.

Reviews.Title: “The Estherea is worth every one of its 4 stars and more; we hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: donnarich419
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever left comments, but my wife and I decided we should let everyone know about a great find. Here is a hotel worth commenting on and worth every one of its Four Stars and more. The Hotel EstherÃ©a in Amsterdam, Netherlands took such good care of us we hated to leave. Sitting in the centre of Amsterdam, in quiet neighbourhood and on the lovely Singel Canal, it is the perfect combination of location, great decor and unbeatable service. The flower market is right down the canal (a bridge or two as the say) and the Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum, Rembrandtâ€™s house, Central Station and more are within walking distance. When ever we asked how to get someplace, we never left the front desk without great directions accompanied by a map with all the information drawn on it. Applause, Applause to all the front desk personnel, all shifts.) When we wanted to go the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum they not only purchased tickets for us on line, but also printed the tickets so we would not have to wait in lines at the museums. Our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable, as were the down stairs sitting areas. All were comfortable and beautifully furnished and impeccably taken care of. Actually, thinking more about it we would say everything in the hotel was elegant and stylish! In the main area on the ground floor there is a really beautiful bar area and an exquisite dinning area where we enjoyed our delicious buffet breakfast each morning, a lovely library and living room area. Their beautiful salt water fish tank between the front desk and sitting area is absolutely memorizing to watch. So, letâ€™s get down to the bottom line. If you are looking for gorgeous hotel (thatâ€™s better than its 4 stars), personal attention, a fantastic staff and owners who really, really care about their guests this is it! If you want to live in the lap of luxury for a few days, be catered to andâ€¦.yes pampered, look no further than the Hotel Estherea. Ohâ€¦ if you price around (and I did a lot of it) it is a very good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly, yes, it REALLY is all that . . .”
Reviews.Author: MizLiz
Reviews.Content: Finally, finally I've found it -- a real hotel, with old-fashioned hoteliers who remember how a fine European hotel should be run. I thought they vanished just after the dinosaurs. This little place is a gem, with a staff that bends over backward. From the moment you step inside, you are transported. Traditional elegance is everywhere, and rooms are wonderfully appointed. Ours was huge by European standards, with a marvelous canal view and a bathtub to get lost in. This hotel is family run, and it shows in every aspect of their service. My hat is off to the management team. I can't imagine there is a hotel in Amsterdam that can compare. I certainly won't be looking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rich53487
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel several months before our trip.We made the hotel choice for two reasons, location and the reviews on trip advisor. This is a fabulous hotel. We checked in early so our baggage was stored and we walked around the area for about 2 hours and had lunch beofre we returned to the hotel at 1PM. Our room was available which was great because they had taken the time to finish ours early. The entire staff couldn't have been more helpful. We asked about restaurants and were given very good recommendations for breakfast and dinners. We explored on our own for lunches. We did have to extend our stay by 2 days due to the volcanic ash and cancelled flights. We managed to obtain a flight a day earlier and the hotel did not charge us for the second day. They were also most helpful with contacting our airline which enabled us to get a day earlier flight. We cannot say enough about the Estherea. The hotel lobby is exquisite. They have managed to keep the decor luxurious. They have several reading areas and a small library. Our room was simply wonderful. It was spacious and had a large bathroom, which is difficult to find in Europe for the price we paid. They do have a buffet breakfast should you want stay and eat there rather than explore early in the morning. We did have the breakfast one day and it was very good with choices for any palate. We did not have a canal view room but did see what a room looked like on the canal Even though our room was excellent, we would highly recommend a canal view room. Yes, they are slightly more expensive, but well worth it. We would have switched but no canal rooms were available. As to the room price, 140 Euros per night is the best bargain we've seen since we've been traveling to Europe. We want to thank everyone at the hotel again and highly recommend the Estherea for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: ciaotuffy
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Amsterdam with our 2 children (5 yrs and 1 yr) and definitely enjoyed our stay at the Estherea. I felt the service we received was much more personal and friendlier than the chain hotels. The hotel gave us a rollaway bed for the 5 yr old and set up a crib for the 1 yr old. While the room was very small, it was nice that they could fit us in. It looked like the room was recently renovated with a new bathroom with large separate soaking tub. The room had a small refrigerator where we could store drinks and milk. The lobby provided coffee, tea, hot chocolate and cookies during the day, a nice treat. The location of the hotel was great. We were able to walk to restaurants, shopping area, sights. The tram station was close by and we were able to get to everywhere we wanted. There were a few bakeries, cafes close by for breakfast or snacks. The staff at the hotel was super friendly and helpful. They helped us with cabs, directions, & calling the museum when we were late for our reservation time. I've already recommended this hotel to several friends and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Update on review from April 16 2010 unfortunate cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: Danandpeggy
Reviews.Content: This is my second update to clarify a review posted on April 16. Through a misunderstanding we were told we would be charged a night's stay at Hotel Estherea because we could not make it to Amsterdam due to the volcanic activity and flight cancellation. I sent an email to the hotel and they immediately responded, stating it was a misunderstanding. We will not be charged. We fully intend to travel to Amsterdam next spring and fully plan to stay at Hotel Estherea for our entire visit as we have read it is a marvelous hotel. We hope this clears up any hard feelings. Dan and Peggy Miller

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BE_2103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days - it was great. It is centrally located and most major attractions are within walking distance. We reserved early and managed to get a room with the canal view, which is a must. The room is very well furnished and comfortable, although a little small which we had expected. The bathroom is small as well, and the public toilets in the hotel basement are larger! Staff were friendly and courteous. There is internet access in the lobby, with 2 computers and while some have found this inadequate, we used it at 'off peak' times without being hurried. Breakfast is expensive - there are several bakeries around the area which are much cheaper. Had breakfast there on the first morning - it was crowded and food was slow to be replenished. Noise was not a major issue, although there were several nights where patrons returning from the canal cruise had stayed on to chat outside the hotel, which was very annoying - even with the windows closed, the sound could be heard inside. No in-house dining but not an issue as many decent restaurants nearby. Overall, a great experience and will definitely recommend to others, and stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem, nice 4 star classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jolieloulouo
Reviews.Content: stay in this hotel for 2 nights in April, nice classic europe hotel. Very beautiful lobby & provide free hot chocolate, tea & coffee in the lobby. Room size is ok & love the european style decoration. Easily walk to sightseeing point & can take the tram at the back of the hotel. But a little bit far if walk from the central station, but only cost E7 by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shimon53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night at Hotel Estherea. (I had previously stayed at the hotel last year while on business). The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was quiet and comfortable. The breakfast room is warm and inviting and the food and choice excellent. The hotel is also located in easy walking distance of all major sites. After checking out and returning later in the day, the front desk staff invited us to coffee and sweets in the lobby and free use of the internet. An excellent hotel at a good price in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Z29
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in hotel Estherea and we canÂ´t complain of anything. The room was quite small, but clean and well furnished. The location of the hotel is perfect, all sights are within reach. Free tea, coffee and cookies are plesant and the lobby of the hotel is pretty spacious and comfortably furnished. I canÂ´t comment the breakfast, we prefered to have it outside the hotel. There is a lot of small pleasant cafes, where you can have your breakfast at half price :-) (for ex. Broodje Bert situated cca 15 metres from the hotel). The only strange experience - the hotel staff debits your card as soon as you check in and in higher amount than the price of the room is.... they told me, that the difference is just the "deposit" if I use internet, bar or have breakfast... I havenÂ´t noticed this approach (to pay immediately and more than requested) nowhere in the world...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service and value”
Reviews.Author: ronshIsrael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, and I can only say that they were spot on: a quaint, welcoming hotel in a great location that I would definitely recommend to my friends and return to. A very warm and friendly lobby, with coffee and refreshments served all day, clean rooms and very friendly staff. What more could you ask for...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice comfortable little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucytartan
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we stayed in in a month in Europe. Our room was quite little and a weird shape, but with that wonderful view over the canal, who cares? The bed was excellent - comfortable, clean, good pillows and blankets - the furnishings had character without being overdone, and the bathroom was unusually well stocked with useable toiletries. The lobby - which has an honest-to-god reading room, a bar, and a self-serve tea and coffee station - is actually a great place to sit and people-watch. I sat there quite a lot waiting for the use of the hotel's one computer (my only real negative.) The breakfast was too rich and heavy for me after the first day, but there is a perfectly good little cafe on the next street corner. Hotel Estherea is well and truly worth the slightly higher room rate. How often are you in Amsterdam? May as well stay somewhere memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Les005
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovely big spacious room and bathroom. Convenient location right on the Singel Canal. Great buffett breakfast. Friendly staff. No faults !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful, great location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethD708
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed four days at the hotel with my teenage son. The location is fantastic. There is a bike shop on the corner for rentals. The front desk sent us to a wonderful Italian restaurant "two bridges down and across" Casa di David. We booked a superior room to allow for 2 beds. The room was surprisingly large with a lovely bathroom with separate tub. My son loved the breakfast. He thought the sausage was the best he has ever had. An abundance of fresh fruit, smoothies, eggs, sausage etc...I enjoyed the library with a wide selection of daily newspaper, the computers for internet access and the free coffee/tea with cookies. My only comment was that our room faced a street that was somewhat noisy at night but we were exhausted from our bike rides and touring so the noice wasn't really an issue to us.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in excellant location”
Reviews.Author: dermotty
Reviews.Content: family friendly run hotel on singel canal.de luxe room nicely decorated with lovely bathroom.reception area comfortable with tea/coffee facility throughout day.if feel breakfast too expensive at 16 euros plenty of options nearby.hotel cat a nice novelty! would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: CD001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights on a business trip. We usually gravitate to the more modern hotels, but decided to give this a shot. It really was great. While being their smallest room, we did not find it overly small. The decorations throughout the hotel seemed recently updated. The bathroom was obviously brand new and had none of those sketchy corners older hotels often have. The staff was friendly and helpful. We paid for the wireless internet and found that it was inconsistent (especially for the price). there is an unsecured wireless connection that you can use (for free!). We did not eat at the hotel. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Old Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GlobalConsultant
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel on the Singel canal in Old Amsterdam. Property is several town houses assembled into an elegant, comfortable hotel. Staff is customer-focused and efficient. Rooms are well-appointed with very comfortable beds, but vary in size from tiny to roomy. Reading areas in the lobby, very good breakfast, and a nice small bar for end of the day. Short walk to shopping, restaurants, sights, and public transportation,

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: FoodWineFunSF
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very nice hotel. The staff was genuinely warm and very professional. It felt like a hotel should -- a reading room with international newspapers, a library, a bar, computers, complimentary coffee and mint water. I asked to see a few rooms and thought all were clean and nice. The one for 119 euros was very small but for a few euros (I think 135) more you could get a much larger room with a "spa/jacuzzi" type bath tub. Our room had a view of Spui street which was nice. The decorations with the flower wallpaper were a little over the top, one wall would have been enough but the linens on the bed with great. I like modern, clean design so the entire hotel was a little too old fashion for my taste but I liked it anyway. The shampoo, lotions were of good quality. I really liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Marigold79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Estherea in 2009 and had a very nice stay. Unfortunately the second time was less than charming. There is a huge discrepancy in many of the rooms...some of them are not very nice. It was freezing all of the time, the cleaning people would always turn off the heat and open the windows? And extremely noisy! The cleaning staff would vacuum and talk very loudly from 7am onwards. I requested a particular room and they did not take this into account and put us in a not very nice one. When i questioned the front staff they were extremely unfriendly and did nothing to help us, not even an apology...very disappointing. On another night we tried to get a glass of wine at 12, but the bar closed at 12 and they refused to serve us...? Even though the waiter was there? Not cheap and i'm sure there are many other hotels for the same price with MUCH nicer rooms and staff!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel lavished with history and close to all amsterdam has to offer”
Reviews.Author: GinnerWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Hotel Estherea and its an immaculate hotel. The canal view room was both beautiful and comfy, with a king size four poster and a lovely view of the singel canal. The nice touches of free coffee n cakes after a days sight seeing and slippers and toiletries in your rooms add to the luxury feel. My only gripes would be that the room walls are a tad thin and you can hear the guests and the outside noise, we would have prefered tea/ coffee facilities in the room and the hotel charged us slightly a little more than the price at the time of booking. Try the Casa Di David authentic Italian restaurant nearby if you visit , its mind blowing x

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: vairste85
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Amsterdam,room /service/breakfast/position. I love this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jpm_9
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Estherea. The rooms were lovely - quite small, but that is to be expected in a city centre. The bathrooms in the deluxe rooms we had were really great, with separate showers and jacuzzi baths. The location is very good - with most attractions within an easy distance. It was also quiet. The breakfast was a bit disappointing - a very cramped breakfast room where guests had to find their own coffee as well as the usual buffet breakfast. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “what a place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tashb2010
Reviews.Content: Went for my birthday and simply loved it! Lovely city lovely hotel! Though they did give me a twin bed instead of a double inspite of a specific instruction and could not change it since they were fully booked they did upgrade me to a double with a better view the next night. Just be careful as you may miss the front entrance of the hotel , we almost did!

Reviews.Title: “Location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: S-ELinna
Reviews.Content: A perfectly located hotel for exploring Amsterdam, in a quiet but central location. The canal view room we had was really nice and comfortable, and good value for money, and the service at the hotel was nice and personal- We'll be back! Matter of fact - we have already booked our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay in Hotel Estherea. We paid a supplement for a canal view room, which proved to be the right choice since our top-floor room was a good size with a very comfortable king-size bed and a spacious well-equipped bathroom; the 'his n' hers' wash basins were a nice touch, as were the toiletries provided. Traditional and sumptuous decor in the public rooms provided a warm winter welcome. The staff were friendly and helpful; we were particulaly impressed to be able to check into our room as soon as we arrived at the hotel at 11am. Complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate and cakes in the reception area were very welcome, but we took our own tea-making equipment to use in our room for early morning tea. The hotel breakfast is expensive at 16 euros per person and definitely not value for money. We went to 'Broodje Bert', which is a small cafe just a few yards away along the same side of the street, for breakfast costing 7 euros per person. We found some excellent restaurants close to the hotel for evening meals; these were: Casa di David, Singel 426 (Italian); De Theeboom, Singel 210 (French) and Haesje Claese, Spuistraat 275 (Dutch). All in all a super break.

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheese-arific
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location on the canal. lower floor, canal facing rooms can be noisy as the late hours come with folks returning home from nights out, but that doesn't diminish my enthusiasm one bit as we knew we were getting that and wanted the view, which was lovely. staff are friendly and helpful. free coffee/tea and snacks in the lobby. location is convenient to all you want to see in Amsterdam - we walked everywhere. rooms are nice - well decorated and clean. nicely sized for europe.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Rik356
Reviews.Content: I trust this site and have always found it to be useful, but I disagree with most of the reviews on this occasion and felt it important to add my own comments. Before I start though it is worth mentioning that Amsterdam is an energetic city with noisy streets everywhere and if you are looking for a quiet hotel centrally with charm and views, you will be hard pushed to find a perfect one. We were looking for something with a few luxuries, not too central but close enough to not spend more than 15 minutes walking to main attractions. The Pros: The location is perfect. The hotel is very clean. The room was immaculate. The staff were certainly friendly enough, although there seemed to be a significant rotation of staff and I was challenged a couple of times simply because the staff had not seen me before. Free slippers (not comfortable though). Free internet - always working ok. Communal lounge areas were pleasant and relaxing. The Cons: The room was generally small but just ok, the toilet just 1m2, bathroom had a jacuzzi bath but actually it is not good - the jacuzzi mode is not proper jacuzzi & just pumped bubbles and so loud - louder than any vacuum cleaner, 30 seconds was enough to realise that it is not relaxing at all. There was a chandelier at chest height over the bed (I am tall) so I had to crouch whilst on the bed. Loads of grand pillows but no soft ones. Didn't sleep particularly well. There is no tea or coffee in the rooms! Why not? Tea & coffee is free in the lobby downstairs but why should i have to get dressed in the mornings just to get a cup of coffee? No bath robes in the room. Breakfast was an extra 16 euros each on top of the 400 euros for 3 nights. You do get noise through the walls but it wasn't too bad - maybe we had quiet neighbours. You can certainly hear them try the bath though! Summary: This hotel needs to add tea & coffee in the rooms, add bath robes, make the beds more comfortable, get rid of the things that it uses to sell for effect like the 'jacuzzi' baths, remove obstacles like the chandelier that I frequently hit my head on and then it will be a great place to stay. Until then I suggest that it is probably worth looking around. By the way, you need to request a room overlooking the canal if that is what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel Of All Time--Quit Browsing, Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Hernando_De_Soto
Reviews.Content: This hotel rocks! Seriously, my wife and I had the best time here. The location could not be better. The lobby is very inviting with free coffee and cookies, the staff very friendly and knowledgeable, and our room was lovely, spacious, and well decorated. Nothing about the hotel is pretentious or stuffy. Anyone who rates this hotel as less than "very good" is an idiot and obviously doesn't know what they're talking about. My wife and I have traveled extensively, and yet this is the only hotel in any country that I've considered worthy to write a review of. I can say without question that we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - roon, staff and service”
Reviews.Author: AntonoUFRGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, 21th until 25th december 2009. Wonderful HOTEL. Antonio - Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Although all the reviews were great, we were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AndiB2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing all the great reviews on TripAdvisor and Easytobook.com and got a great price for it. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Dam Square and all main attractions. The room was cute and cosy but extremelly small - for two of us we were extremely cramped and couldn't unpack and put away all our stuff. The hotel was full so we were unable to change rooms. We did have a canal view which was nice, and the room was clean but the size of it was fine for one person but definitely too small for two of us (and we are not big people!). The free refreshments in the lobby were a welcome treat, but the hotel generally lacked facilities. The walls are thin so there was quite a lot of noise, and staff were great when we complained, sending a gift to our room by way of apology. It's a nice hotel if you can guarantee a decent sized room, but I wouldn't take a chance again in case I got another tiny one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, in perfect area”
Reviews.Author: meerkatmanor87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location-2 minutes to Dam Square, 5 minutes to Anne Frank Museum, 10 minutes to the train station and siutated on the Singel Canal. We did not pay for a Canal view but when we arrived were told we had been moved to a Canal view room with no charge which was a lovely suprise. The room we stayed in (room 107) was quite small but it was decorated beautifully and the bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was gorgeous. The only negative thing about this hotel is that we asked for the password for the internet in our room but there is an extra charge of 10euro to use the internet for 24 hours. Also room service closes at 10pm, we rang at 9.55pm and were told we could not order anything (not a very helpful receptionist) other than that the hotel was really nice

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, absolutely top class”
Reviews.Author: RocknRollBaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it was one of only a few boutique hotels in Amsterdam and it definitely lived up to the positive reviews seen here. If you are looking for somewhere that is absolutely gorgeous that offers so many personal touches rather than a clinical, no frills corporate hotel then this is the place for you. I cannot think of one negative aspect to our stay here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant,beautiful friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esdalej
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central to all the attractions. The staff are very helpful and friendly. A wonderful touch of free coffee.tea and hot chocolate. The rooms are beauitfully decorated and the housekeeping staff do a wonderful job of keeping rooms clean .Stephen the porter was very helpful nothing too much trouble .If I had anything negative to say it would be the price of breakfast â‚¬16 a bit expensive- plenty of choices near hotel at very good price .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: ClareSomewhere
Reviews.Content: The Esthera has a beautiful location right on the canals and close to the 9 streets to wander around. The feel of the place was quite indulgent with ornate decor, fireplaces and library etc....spotless rooms. A good winter place - not sure how it would feel in the summer. The only down sides we could think of was that in the freezing cold winter, there was a draft through the old windows that went directly onto the bed. Also, the floors are pretty thin depending on the level, so we were able to hear people talking and walking around on the floor above us. We were highly amused by the sheer amount of reminders about no 'smoking' in the hotel (signs in the lift, in the room, in the bathroom...)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Amsterdam, great value”
Reviews.Author: Aliceesjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this wonderful hotel. It was perfect from the beginning to the end. Great service, it is located at a quiet street next to the 9 streets (an area with all small shops/boutiques), the rooms are clean and comfortable. They are not very big however, but who will need that in Amsterdam ? The value for money was excellent for a 4* hotel. If you like a nice warm and cozy hotel with great service this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “could not fault anything”
Reviews.Author: evanswaugh
Reviews.Content: we move from the Hotel Toro to here at very short notice. The staff were wonderful, the location is great for everything in the city. The room was fabulous, this was my wife and my first break without the kids for 5 years and the hotel staff made it very special. Nothing was too much trouble, but everything was relaxed and unintrusive. Bike hire is a must and just around the corner. We would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, warm and an elegant sensual feeling, helpful staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: machig
Reviews.Content: We, my husband and I stayed here twice in November, loved the hotel... the lobby has different rooms library, meeting room hang out area, bar, all cosy and the friendly staff were great. We got a canal facing room 214 more spacious than 210 for the same price. I was afraid it would be noisy but wasn't. Free tea and coffee, and cookies and candies were an extra touch of hospitality. I invited a Dutch friend over for tea and could offer her tea and cookies. My one gripe was they didn't have free internet in the rooms. The red /orange, gold velvet of the lobby with a huge crystal candelier gave it a soft sensual feeling of warmth. Near the "nine streets" an area of great restaurants/boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Canal View Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sonja87
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip in Amsterdam. The cost of the room wasn't really an issue, so I got a canal view. I would recommend this if it is something you can afford. I really loved the views, and the room wasn't huge, but spacious enough. We didn't have to pay for the television, but the wireless internet was not free (I also had that paid for by my company, so not an issue for me). Guests do have to turn in their room key as they leave the hotel, but it was quick and not a hassle each time to turn it in and get it back. The bathrooms are clean and spacious. The free cookies and hot beverages were a very nice perk; try the waffle cookies with caramel on the inside (A Dutch specialty, apparently). From what I have heard, the breakfast at the hotel is not worth the price. There are places close by if you want to find somewhere else. The staff was helpful when I needed help finding a restaurant and gave me a map with directions to the location. The location of the hotel was great - Amsterdam has small streets (short blocks compared to NYC, for example) so everything in the central area is pretty close in. Most things are within a short distance, but you still feel like you are in a very quiet section of the city in an intimate/quaint setting. It's not too far to walk to the hotel from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Made it my #2 (out of more than 10 tested) in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: spletzi
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed by the large and charmingly decorated room making it a good choice for business travellers (large wardrobe) and also for a nice weekend with its cozy sofa. Interior of the hotel itself is charming. You can get free coffee and tea in the lobby (I learned about this when I left). Beside this, very friendly and fast service. It is worth choosing a canal view room as the canal there is very nice and quiet. Location very good. For the 104 EUR a night I had booked a place I can highly recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SooLux
Reviews.Content: As the hotel was rated quite well by Tripadvisor, we booked 2 nights through booking.com. Something went wrong with the booking, we did not receive the confirmation via booking.com. I checked this with the booking customer service and they fixed the problem. I was very lucky to find parking space directly in front of the hotel. You should know that parking your car in front of the door during 24 hours costs you 50â‚¬...but the hotel is not responsible for this We paid 100â‚¬ per room per night (including taxes) and the breakfast was 16â‚¬ per person. The hotel is very charming, with nice furniture etc... The staff at the reception was very friendly. As my wife is pregnant in her 9th month, we asked for a quit and spacious room as earlier reports here indicated the rooms were small. They provided us indeed with a very nice and spacious room at the backside (417). Very friendly The breakfast is superb, typical Dutch ! A large choice of bread, fruit, etc.... excellent ! The entrance hall is very cozzy, they have even a reading room - library.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: holidayskeepmesane
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occassions and it is my favourite Amsterdam Hotel. Central location on the picturesque Singel canal close to all the sights, shops and places to eat & drink. Lovely and cosy, the decor is elegant and welcoming and the staff are extremely helpfull. Free coffee, tea and hot choc in the lobby/sitting area with cakes, biscuits .. a welcome treat after a busy day sightseeing or shopping. Breakfasts are by buffet and the selection is extensive. Definately worth paying the supplement for a canal view room, the rooms are cosy and the beds are comfy with snuggly duvets. The italian restaurant 'Casa di David' located on the same canal as the Estherea is a fun place to eat in the evenings , the food is delicious and the waiters are a scream.. booking is a must as its very popular with locals.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central, Very Grand but Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ms_fusspot
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Estherea for a quiet romantic break and were pleasantly suprisised at the comfort of the hotel. We had room 515 on the top floor and it was remarkably quiet. Beds very comfy with duvets and very user friendly heating if required. Minor gripe in that the mni bar advised is just a fridge with two bottles of complimentary water in it. I asked the receptionist and they don't stock the bar anymore so bring your own. Also there are no tea and coffee facilities in the room which means one of you has to be pursuaded in the morning to get dressed and go and get the morning cuppa's. The lobby area was very grand with a beautiful large fish tank and two internet computers. There are plenty of places to sit during the day to relax from the cold and take advantages of the very sweet hot chocolate and complimentary cakes and biscuits. The hotel do seem to do a lot to make your stay as comfortable as they can from the little bags of good night chocolates and the jars of sweets in reception it just would have been nice to have been able to have the drinking facilities in your room as well. Location wise you can't go far wrong. Right on the Singel Canal which is one of the three largest ones, minutes from the history quarter and Anne Frank's house, (go early), and just turn right to the Dam Square. In the street behind the hotel we found a lovely little bar which did a beautiful mountain of cheese with mustard which went down very smoothly with a glass or two of port. They also own the very gamely and highly popular restuarant two doors down but we didn't try it. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Layla_Key
Reviews.Content: Just a short business stay in this rather romantic hotel. Nice location and good range of hot and cold breakfast in the morning at extra 16.00 Euro charge - which I think is a bit expensive. Rooms ok and clean mine was rather smaller but the flat screen telly was huge! I would say nice and cosy hotel, a bit too expensive especially if you are not part of any group they belong to. Book in advance on some broker website to get the best deal! There has been a list price of 300 Euro, my room was only for 130 Euro. So research the best deal before you book it! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in all the ways that matter.”
Reviews.Author: Dave1301
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great 5 night stay at the Estherea while touring Amsterdam. The location is fantastic - easy walking distance to museums and sights, restaurants and shopping, but away from the hustle/bustle of the city center. The hotel is clean, in good shape and the staff is very helpful. Our room was lovely with a great soaking tub and separate shower, and a king bed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, thin walls, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hockeybod
Reviews.Content: Stopped over one night, comfortable room and staff very helpful and friendly. Good location within easy walking distance of station (15 mins), so avoid taxi (13 Euros). Walked around the city in the evening, and always felt safe, even in the red light area. Good breakfast, comfortable bed and clean room. Only problem was thin walls - I could clearly hear the couple next door having sex, which may or may not put you off this otherwise recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: charliecatSheffield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four days to celebrate our silver wedng anniversary - a fact which saw us upgraded by the hotel to an exquisite room with a canal view from the basic double I'd booked. Beautifully decorated public area and room, with an extremely comfy bed and lovely linen. Slightly small bathroom (although given the upgrade I shouldn't complain!) but well fitted out with nice complementary lotions and potions and plenty of towels. Some other reviews have been less than complimentary about the hotel staff - we found them to be excellent striking the right balance between seeing to / anticipating guests' needs but not being overly obsequious. Excellent buffet breakfast with all items regularly replaced or filled up - eggs, bacon,sausage,toast,bread,meats and cheeses,croissants and pastries - however, not included in the room rate and somewhat pricey at 16 euros per person! There's a good sandwich shop 30 seconds away from the hotel who do croissants and coffee for 3.50 euros (Berts Broodjies). Coffee,chocolate and teas are available 24 hours free of charge from machines in the lounge area, and during the day there's a varying selection of yummy cakes, biscuits and pastries to go with it. Beautiful hotel in a lovely central location. We chose it for a special occasion and it would have lived up to our expectations even without the upgrade. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be finer”
Reviews.Author: katten41
Reviews.Content: If during my decades of travel every hotel experience matched this one, I'd have fewer gray hairs. What a delightful establishment. We had a wonderful room on the top floor overlooking the canal. We stayed five nights. It was old-school decorated which matches our taste. The service was gracious and helpful. Could not ask for anything more from a hotel. [Perfectly located too. Nearly everything is within walking distance.]

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh, The Estherea”
Reviews.Author: PARTYHATSFOREVERYONE
Reviews.Content: We flew into Amsterdam a few days before we were embark on a Rhine/Main/Danube River cruise. Our pre-arranged transportation picked us up at the airport and wisked us off to the Hotel Estherea. We arrived at the hotel around 9:30 and were quite jet lagged. The hotel staff stored our luggage and we were able to get something to drink from their coffee/cocoa bar which adjoins their breakfast room. Thanks to the expedious housekeeping staff and the folks at the front desk, we were in our room in less than an hour and were able to nap for a few hours. The front desk was very helpful.
