Their recommendations for dinner were spot-on (Casa Di David is a must!) and they were very accommodating in providing directions and making reservations (use them to get tix to the Anne Frank House to avoid the lines). The room was clean & spacious in keeping with the pictures from their website. They serve a delicious breakfast every morning; it's a bit pricey but the convenience is well worth it - venture out for lunch and dinner to try the local eateries. The hotel is centrally located and close to their metro so it's easy to get to the train station to venture into the countryside if you like. Watch out for the bicyclists! If we return to Amsterdam we'll definitely stay at Hotel Estherea again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great quiet location”
Reviews.Author: AllisonM8
Reviews.Content: I took a solo trip to Amsterdam to celebrate my 33rd birthday. I wanted to treat myself and this hotel didn't disappoint. The staff were lovely, and the room was small but beautifully appointed. The fabrics were lux, the bed super comfortable, and the bathroom was just right for one person. The location is perfect - just a short walk to everything I wanted to see. I highly recommend staying here. When I got back to London, I realized I had left a brand new belt in the room. I phoned the hotel and they mailed it to me right away, with no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ElVikingo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel at the beginning of October. We were very happy with our stay, stayed in a classic room, and it was more than adequate. Nice size bathroom, clean and comfortable. Perfect for a stay in Amsterdam, when you do not stay much in your room anyway. Had breakfast one morning and it was not bad. Worth your money if you eat a lot. The coffe, chocolate, candy, cookies were great, plus the lobby felt nice and relaxing to hang out in. Did not experience long waits waiting to access the free internet pc's so no complaints there. Location was perfect and the street was not very noisy. We stayed at the Toren during our last visit in April, and we like the Estherea better, so much that we just have booked another stay over New Years.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasDrb
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, good size room and bath, good bed and linens. Several nice restaurants near by. Recommend a bike tour and Anne Frank Museum.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel In The World!”
Reviews.Author: GoGirlToo
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location on a beautiful canal, a short walk to many restaurants and attractions and right near a tram to take you quickly everywhere else. Wonderful, courteous staff. Gorgeous old-Amsterdam style canal house hotel. The public areas are drop-dead gorgeous and there are now two computers in the living room for guests without charge -- one or the other was always available.. Tea, coffee, cookies etc. left out all day are a nice touch and we appreciated a cup of camomile tea while watching the fish in the fish tank. Our room was quiet (on an interior courtyard), very charming -- comfortable bed and large bath with a nice tub/shower and nice toiletries.. This was my second stay at the Estherea, and I'd love to go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre--At Best”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELWELLALWAYS
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Estherea is in a good location on the Singel Canal. The description states that it has been held in ownership by the same family for many,many generations. That made us believe that all the personal touches and pride of family ownership would be there. Instead, the reception was aloof to the point of being unhelpful--for example,the porter showed us to our room but he never carried our bags and saw me struggling with mine. He merely opened the door for us and expected his two euro tip! When I emailed the front desk to ask about the taxi charges from the train station to the hotel they told me about 10 euros. They didn't bother to mention that all the taxi drivers in Amsterdam cheat on the fares,which is common,common knowl;edge. What the drivers say is--"you have 4 bags. That costs extra!" If the hotel staff knew this, in my view they could have easily have said--BEWARE! We were charged 25 euros for a three minute ride. Apparently that was the highest they had heard of from other complaints issued by hotel guests. When we asked about restaurant recommendations they only came up with one name--we indicated that we were just there--could there be another restaurant in all of Amsterdam.They indicated they couldn't think of one but would get back to us. They never did. Having said all that, I will now state that the location is good and central.quiet,

Reviews.Title: “Very well furnished and extremely comfortable central hotel”
Reviews.Author: colettski
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room for 3 nights our bed was a super kingsize with lovely bedlinen. Our daughter slept in a proper sturdy sofa bed which was also very comfortable. The room was cleaned everyday with bottles of mineral water replaced in the minibar free of charge. There was a very high standard of cleanliness throughout the hotel which we loved. Lots of lovely complementary toiletries, slippers and a proper iron and ironing board. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, we ate in the local cafe called broodje bert which was delicious, we also had eggs benedict one morning at Cafe Luxembourg which was also verg good. The free tea, coffee,hot chocolate was such a nice touch, we looked forward to coming back to the hotel late afternoon for a cuppa and some cakes and cookies. Our daughter loved the jars of free sweets and candies that were also on offer. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel also had free internet access which is very unusual, great for checking in online and printing off tickets. The hotel is very central it's near to Dam square, it's within walking distance of Anne Franks house, the canal boats, the museums and Vondel park, we walked everywhere with a 5 year old. This is not a cheap hotel but you get what you pay for and I honestly can't say anything negative about this hotel. I find it hard to believe that some people have had a bad experience staying here. We'll be back at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff very helpful, good location, worth the price”
Reviews.Author: LOSUsa
Reviews.Content: The staff was excelent and very helpful with any questions that we had. We spent 2 nights there and it was much better then the 5 star hotel we stayed in on the way back to Paris in Brussels. We found out the hard way via cab rides that the best way to get anywhere in Amsterdam is either the canel hop on hop off boat., or simply when you go out the front door of the hotel go right and the first cross street make another right and walk a few blocks to the center of the city. No need for fancy places to eat as any small pub will do and the food is just as good.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE! YOU WILL NOT BE DISSAPOINTED!!”
Reviews.Author: meswender
Reviews.Content: After weeks of research on every internet side imaginable I found this hotel and had a good feeling, so I booked it. My wife and I were immediately excited as soon as we stepped into the hotel. The decor is very classy and has an old world feel. The people that work there are super friendly, helpful and will do anything they can to help you find or get somewhere. The room was a suite with a four poster bed overlooking the canal. it was perfect. The bed was comfortable too. Every morning and night there was always complimentary fruit or cookies and always fresh coffee or hot chocolate. My wife and i travel a lot and try to get a lot of value for the dollar. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I must have stayed in a different room”
Reviews.Author: jockbrown
Reviews.Content: I carefully chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and other sources. I was quite disappointed (for the first time with Tripadvisor). We chose a canal view deluxe room based on other posts. I booked on their web site and paid full price, so I wasn't being "punished". The room (410) was quite plain, two small chairs and a small desk. You need to leave the bathroom to towel off. A shallow closet (too shallow for hangers to hang perpendicular to the wall) and no drawers at all. Bed and bedding adequate at best. This place is 2.5 stars - two for the room and an extra.5 for the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmmsbrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my own for one night at Hotel Estherea prior to joining up with a group tour. I actually had changed my hotel reservation about a week in advance of the trip after reading a recent string of negative reviews on Tripadvisor of the hotel that I had previously reserved. I was so pleased that I decided at the last minute to change to the Hotel Estherea instead. I arrived at 11am following my arrival on the redeye flight from the US, and my room was ready even though it was well before the designated check-in time. The room was small but very pretty, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The location was great- centrally located to many of the tourist areas, just a few minutes walk to Dam Square, yet in a nice quiet neightborhood on the Singel Canal. My only disappointment was that I only could spend one night.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staf dirty room”
Reviews.Author: Hanna100
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel that I would recomend to my worst enemy. Unfriendly staf that left us waiting for an hour (!) when checking in without explenation. The room was dirty, the bed broken (!) and there where blood stains on the sheets....we left of course after complaining. The staf refused to listned and charged us for the room...never been treated this way in a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Forsait1979
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel show the best correlation with Amsterdam. Itâ€™s very compact and cozy. It is located in the foot availability to central square/area of Amsterdam and other central sights (including Van Gogh's museum). Numbers very small, but modern enough, TV accepts many channels. The excellent first floor from the general drawing room, itâ€™s beautiful aquarium, ancient books. Itâ€™s very tasty breakfast with very various components â€“ both meat, and milky, and dessert food. In my opinion, this hotel isnâ€™t good for family rest with children, and itâ€™s good for tourist groups, romantic relations and people of advanced age.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: twodogstravel
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't have been more helpful and gracious. The room was super clean and very comfortable. We absolutely loved our stay here and would highly recommend it. We had read some reviews that were not favorable about this hotel and decided to try it anyway and are we glad we did! Frankly, I think some people aren't happy no matter what you do for them. The next time we visit Amsterdam this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and romantic”
Reviews.Author: OsloSigne
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Estherea in Amsterdam for 4 nights in June 2009 with my daughter (10) and we had a wonderful time, thanks to the lovely hotell Estherea. First, they gave us a small room, but we were moved the next day, and got a sunny, spacious room with pretty wallpaper, bedlinen, furniture and lamps. The location is first class, and the only thing that could have been better is to get a room overlooking the canal. Excellent breakfast, cosy and stylish reception area and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, accommodating, beautiful and a good value as well.”
Reviews.Author: NonUnTurista
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights at the Estherea in room #414, a canal side room on the highest floor available with full size windows. Our room had one of the largest bathrooms we've ever had in Europe which seemed to be brand new! The location for us was perfect because the hotel is right next to the Jordaan, a very quiet area, but close to the busier main attractions as well. The breakfast was fine but you could probably find something more economical near by. The front desk recommended Indrapura for Indonesian food which was very good but does require walking into a slightly seedy area. We also dined at Casa di David which is about a block away on the Singel. You can't beat the location if you request an upstairs window table. The Dylan Hotel which is located two canals over has a beautiful courtyard for drinks or dining.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel away from the chaos”
Reviews.Author: Karenkinm
Reviews.Content: Selecting a hotel in Amsterdam was very difficult, as there were so many mixed reviews. I finally picked this one as the negative comments were minimal and it had air conditioning, and we did need it! This hotel was located along the relatively quiet Singel canal. As we ventured out toward the Dam Square and the pedestrian shopping street, we really began to appreciate the location. We were within walking distance of everything but away from all the congestion of people, bikes, trams and autos. The hotel was very nice, with elegant and formal decor, and big tasseled room keys. The bed was very comfy and the linens very luxorious. We had large windows overlooking the canal and street. The bathroom was small but nice, and the toiletries supplied were impressive. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but it is housed in several centuries old buildings, with all the ambiance you'd want in an Amsterdam hotel. The hotel was a bit pricey, but after seeing some of the other hotels we had considered online, we were glad we'd paid the extra money for this one. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there were several pastry shops in the vicinity where we were able to but meat pies and beverages for about 8 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic, family owned historic hotel in an idyllic central location next to a canal”
Reviews.Author: Teresa_GreenCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at this "canal house" hotel. It was perfect in every way from the canal side location, to its beautifully maintained and furnished interior, to its friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amsterdam hotel in the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: FR73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 9 year old son have just returned from a very enjoyable stay at this wonderful hotel.The staff were very professional and courteous, and dealt with any requests swiftly. The location of the hotel really couldn't be better, right on the Singel canal, within walking distance of virtually every sight in the city, as well as shopping and entertainment areas. At the same time the immediate area is fairly quiet, so you have the best of both worlds. The free tea, coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby are a nice touch, as is the library.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: alexnkev
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three night stay at this hotel. It is located in the north east of the city - walking distance to the central train station, a canalbus terminal and a few tram stops. All the main attractions in amsterdam are within a 20minute walk. Alternativly there is a bike rental shop a few doors up (we recommend this - around 8 euros for a day). The hotel itself is elegantly decorated with chandeliers, lovely furniture and wonderful touches (like the large, colourful tropical fishtank in reception). The staff were helpful but didn't smile often. Free coffee/tea/biscuits/sweets were available in the lobby 24 hours a day. The room was a good size - jakuzzi bath with seperate shower and a seperate toilet room. The bed was large and comfy. The TV had BBC1 and BBC2 and other english channels. All in all - a very comfortable hotel to return to after a long day sightseeing. As an aside, we recommend the Red restauraunt if staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: jtmize
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from August 20 to 23, 2009 with another couple. The hotel is a great all-around place located in a perfect setting right on the Singel canal. Everything you could want to see is within a thirty minute walk. The rooms were clean, large and well-maintained. The best part of our room was the bathroom. It was large with a tub and a shower. The complimentary cookies and water in the lobby are a nice touch. We found the front desk to be generally helpful depending upon which individual employee you got when you inquired about something. The hotel also offers free internet access in the lobby. (There's a usually a line, though, to use it.) All and all, we would stay here again. It's a very nice hotel, and you could not ask for a better location--nice and quiet but just a few blocks away from Spui, Dam Square and all the other exciting parts of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, and we'd return in a minute.”
Reviews.Author: neffair
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very attractive, spotless, and has a very helpful staff. The breakfast buffet is outstanding. Although one can travel by tram, we chose to walk. It's a 10 minute walk from The Dam, a 30 minute walk from Central Station and a 40 minute walk from the Van Gogh museum. Almost all of the other museums are within a 30 minute walk. The Anne Frank House is less than a 15 minute walk. Within 10 minutes are a dozen excellent restaurants for dinner. The people are friendly, attractive, and in great shape. Bicycles have the right of way and all but the major streets are one lane on either side of the canals. The staff can book many of the museums and other activities online to save waiting times.

Reviews.Title: “Great for lovers and families”
Reviews.Author: realbufflo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed there during our 24-hour man-on-a-mission-trip to Amsterdam. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but still managed to use most of its services/features (breakfast, free coffee/candy, internet in lobby, chill in the library). The ground floor is beautiful, just like the pictures, and the breakfast was good -- they serve it until 11 am or noon, so it's possible to get quite a few things done before. My friend had emailed them in advanced to make sure that we'd get a double room, with two separate beds. The room had two beds, but they were not separated at our arrival. The bathroom doors are a bit funny too. But I guess that's part of this hotel's charm. This is clearly a hotel aimed at couples and families, and I would gladly return, maybe not with a business colleague, but surely for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mustang71
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel estherea, for 2 nights. This hotel is perfect in every way possible. The warm welcome of the staff to the cleanliness of this beautiful hotel, an absolute credit to the owners. It's positioned in the ideal location near to everything, but not in the heart of it . The other amazing thing about this hotel is the complimentary tea,coffee,biscuits and pastries which are there for you to enjoy. Also various types of sweets are available for the kids to. Also there is free access to the hotel's computer situated in one of the sitting rooms near to the beautiful marine fish tank. There are plenty of great places to eat out at night, and you don't have to walk far to find one. In fact there are plenty just one street behind the hotel. It was the first visit to Amsterdam for me and my wife but we both loved it, we must have walked for miles viewing the city. One thing to watch for is the push bikes it is a way of life here, but your more likely to get hit by one of these than a car. On a whole note Amsterdam is ideal for a short break, we both loved it and will go back again, and without any doubt will re-book to stay at the hotel estherea first class accommodation, brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: SearchforExcellence
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed travelling through the Netherlands, Germany and France, and the Hotel Estherea was hands down the best hotel experience of our trip. Pros: * Beautiful room facing the canal * Excellent, helpful and friendly staff * Quiet neighborhood only a few blocks away from Dam Square * The most comfortable bed I can remember in a long time Cons: * Maybe a little pricey Over our three night stay my wife and I thanked ourselves each time we came back "home" for the night. Beautiful lobby and nice little bar. Computer with internet downstairs seemed handy, but I enjoyed having WiFi in the room (approximately 8 euros for 24 hours). Our room had a wonderfully comfortable bed and little area to sit and enjoy some coffee in the morning. The hotel has a strict non-smoking policy, but that did not affect us. We visited some of the other popular hotels on TripAdvisor's list and I think the Hotel Estherea is a hidden gem. It's basically perfect for anyone who enjoys coming home to a quiet luxury space at the end of a hectic day of touring. Dam Square is a 5 minute walk away. The Anne Frank House was about a 10 minute walk. The Red Light District maybe 15-20 minutes. Overall I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: giggoers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a flying visit a couple of weeks ago. The hotel was fabulous, check out the photos, we had a gorgeous room overlooking the canal. Staff were very helpful, the lounge and bar areas were great, gorgeous chandelier, could have just spent the whole visit enjoying the relaxed atmosphere of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: COBDeanDave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is, indeed, within walking distance of most of the downtown Amsterdam sights. Located on a quiet canal, it is a real treasure. The staff is very accommodating -- they didn't blink an eye at our 8am check-in. If a canal-view room isn't available, I definitely recommend the room we had on the top floor, street side (room 519). It was spacious, nicely furnished, and included the only only balcony I am aware of in the hotel (looking out over the rooftops of the city).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTrotster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (July 24-27) and really enjoyed this little hotel. The front entrance, lobby, bar area, sitting areas and restaurant are very cozy and welcoming, but not small or cramped. Nice decor throughout the entire hotel. The rooms are lovely and if you are lucky enough to get a canal view, it can add that final perfect touch to the atmosphere of the experience. I found my room to be extremely cozy and comfortable, the bathroom was very nice and roomy, including a full size bath tub. The appointments in the room were perfect. The location is in an ideal location within the city center. Very close to everything (3 minutes walk to Dam Square) and tucked away on one of the more quiet canals. Who could want more? Lastly, I found the staff to be very attentive, helpful and polite. I would stay here again and certainly will the next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms; Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: supermom94
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Estherea. Beautiful (though not large) rooms; great bathrooms with nice toiletries. Inside rooms have no views but the rooms themselves are beautifully appointed. But, who needs to pay for a canal view room when you only need the rooms for sleeping and you can get the canal view in the comfortable lobby. The free cookies and cany available all day were not great but the coffee and tea were wonderful. Also, great service and best of all, the hotel is in a GREAT location; walking distance to everything including the Central train station. The free computer in the lobby was also nice but there was only one so one had to wait one's turn all the time. We'd stay at this hotel if we are ever back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Prize location , Warm staff , Extras get costly”
Reviews.Author: SYNAPSEBoston
Reviews.Content: We travel a great deal and this is a very special property . Most TA reviews are glowing and for good reason . This is a hotel in a fantastic location with some rooms which have magical views and with modern conveniences such as nicely sized bathrooms and a range of amenities . The staff are very knowledgable and are happy to make reservations for restaurants , bike rentals , etc . Coffee and tea and cookies are complimentary in the very nicely maintained common areas . We were able to check in at 1 PM after a pretty early arrival . The hotel runs at near capacity in the summer so there is big comings and goings of people in the lobby managed by multiple staff . There are abundant staff and I wondered why wiht the number of people asking questions etc , why they dont designate one of these to serve as a concierge . Our room was moderate in size with an odd sized double bed ( a bit short and we are not very tall ) and a nice litle couch and two chairs. The lighting in the room is abysmal . The hotel is superior and tries to find a sweet spot between value and service provided. It does so to some extent . Canal view rooms are more expensive particularly on weekends and breakfast is 16 euros per person . So a 210 Euro room on a weekend ( we were not there through the weekend ) with breakfast is up to almost 250 Euros not counitng tax. If you bring a laptop and want wi-fi, it is an extra10 euros per laptop and so that can add 20 euros per day to a bill .......the place can get pricey. That being said , on balance , location , staff, facilities, service make this a wise choice

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel- hostile rude people”
Reviews.Author: newyorkseasontravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a reservation back in May and then a week before we were to travel double checked our reservations, we saw that the rack rate was over 20 euros less than what we had paid for it.. though the hotel would not accept that rate, even though it was still one week before our travel time! We also paid for a deluxe room (additional 40 euros) but hardly had place to move.. if you sit on the chair you cant pass to go to the window... the staff went out of their way to be cold, distant and rude.

Reviews.Title: “great location, dissapointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: citybreak1111
Reviews.Content: location, lobby, library and free teas/coffees all day were great. however the room we stayed in was very disapointing. clean but very grubby and worn. hadnt been refurbed since the 80's. the staff were also very mixed. one or two nice people but the rest were cold and unhelpful. apparently they've just added an extention 2months ago to hotel so try to ask for rooms in that part.

Reviews.Title: “The right place”
Reviews.Author: ggold
Reviews.Content: Once we arrived at Estherea, we knew we were in the right place. The lobby is grand and beautiful with lovely rooms to rest, read, or have a cup of complimentary tea. Our room on the fifth floor overlooking the canal was a very nice size as was the bathroom. The canal side is quiet, although you can hear church bells at night if you are awake. The room was furnished beautifully and was extremely clean. We found the staff to be quite helpful. We weren't able to get into the Van Gogh museum in the morning so they made reservations on line for us for the next afternoon. I also recommend this for the Rijksmuseum. I would have liked a hotel where the breakfast was more reasonably priced, but there were several bakeries in the area and places for a complete breakfast if desired. Overall, we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stepsyl14
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant one night stay at the Estherea. Our three person room was spacious and clean. We enjoyed the decor and the lobby seating areas. We also appreciated the complimentary tea, coffee, cookies, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, wonderful experience, for the most part”
Reviews.Author: freakyholiday
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, like you step into some grand mansion situated on a quiet canal. The people behind the desk who checked us in were very nice and helpful. Our room was a great size, large living space and large bathroom, and had air conditioning. Our room overlooked the canal and was not noisy. They provided tea, coffee and cookies in the lobby all day and night. The other people behind the desk after we checked in were not as helpful. We asked for restaurant recommendations and the only response was, "take a walk and you'll find something." Also, when we checked out, the people were not helpful on helping us get to the airport. Their only response was, "take a taxi." If you can deal with unhelpful staff, then you'll love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ElMusaferain
Reviews.Content: Just another love-note to the dear Estherea - I really can't imagine a nicer place to stay in Amsterdam. Now, if you're a fan of American chain hotels, or you're looking for a pool, or if you have a low tolerance for charm - you won't like this hotel. The rooms range from very small to cosy; the hallways are narrow; there isn't 24-hour room service. That, however, is just about all the non-praise I can think of to say about this wonderful small hotel. We arrived for a second stay at the Estherea at a ridiculously early hour after a very long overnight flight, and while our room wasn't ready, my partner and I agreed that there were few hotels in the world where we would actually look forward to spending a few hours waiting. We sat in the lovely, serene library, enjoying the complimentary coffee and biscuits, reading through the range of European papers and local guides on offer, and admiring the fresh orchids scattered around the polished side tables. Once in our very comfortable canal-view room (very much worth the extra cost, both for the exquisite view and for the size of the room), we felt immediately at home. Spotlessly clean, with bright wallpaper, two comfortable chairs, and a small but well-appointed bathroom, our room proved a great homebase to explore the city on foot, easy given the Estherea's perfect central location. In the year since our last visit, 20 more rooms have been added, creating a central courtyard with a nice glass elevator but not altering the essential character of the Estherea at all. Finally, nothing but praise for the staff, from the friendly reception staff to the genial night manager who happily openeed up for us after our late returns.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: PDnBS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Estherea in late June. The journey from the airport by train was very simple and we were able to walk (about 15-20 mins) from the station to the hotel. This was our first attempt at navigating by the canals and this definitely makes Amsterdam one of the easier cities to walk around. The hotel was in an excellent location for what we wanted to do. Nice to be on a canal, so a bit quieter, and equidistant between the Centraal Station and the museum quarter, whilst being close to the Dam Square and Anne Frank House museum. The hotel interior is boldly decorated (in nice old-style prints) and this character continued into the room. The room wasnâ€™t huge â€“ but fine by European city standards â€“ as others have said, you donâ€™t want to spend much time in your room when youâ€™re there, so itâ€™s perfectly adequate. Weâ€™ve stayed in smaller rooms in London. It was comfortable and had some nice touches as well as being recently decorated. What was nice was the disproportionately large bathroom, with both a walk-in shower and a separate Jacuzzi bath. We werenâ€™t on the canal side, but still had a view over the street behind, which was nice. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. The free coffee and tea, biscuits, sweets and iced-minted-lemoned-water more than compensated for not having these facilities in the room â€“ which still had water in the mini-bar fridge. We opted for breakfast out â€“ you could get a full continental breakfast of coffee, croissant, butter& jam and a roll with cheese and ham for Eur6,90 â€“ rather than the Eur16 charged by the hotel. There are lots of nice bars and restaurants dotted over the city â€“ but there is a nice one just down the road (Restaurant & Brasserie Luden) and also try looking in the Jordaan area for a less â€œtouristyâ€� place to eat. The Rijksmuseum is undergoing major renovation at the moment, but for a first-time visitor this works well, as the â€œhighlightsâ€� of the museum are all in the Phillips Wing, which means you can see them all in just 14 rooms â€“ including The Nightwatch. We were caught out by there not being a cafe inside the museum though, so stop off at a cafe before you go in as we managed to still spend a good two hours in there. The Tui candlelight canal trip goes right past the hotel, which was nice to see from the water â€“ this is the hotelâ€™s advertised tour boat company that you get brochures on when you arrive, so maybe they all go past. That said, we certainly werenâ€™t bothered by running commentaries either in the hotel or when walking along or enjoying a coffee by the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Estherea”
Reviews.Author: aklein1022
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at another hotel for our seven night stay in mid-May. But due to construction in the adjoining building, the hotel requested that we cancel as they were sure our stay with them would be less than perfect. They suggested the Estherea. An upgrade in price for us for sure, but we are so glad we splurged. We loved our stay. The only rooms the Estherea originally had available were non canal-view, but when we checked in, a canal-view room was available. We looked at our choice of rooms and the canal-view was a no brainer, though it was yet another upgrade. No doubt the most expensive hotel stay we've ever had (nearly $2500 for the seven nights) but we have such great memories and feelings about the Estherea. Room 110 if I recall. We found it very spacious. King size bed. Nice bathroom, small fridge, desk and sitting area, but the absolute winner was the three large windows that overlooked the Singel. Gorgeous. We had breakfast at the hotel just once as the 16E p/p price was a bit much. Several very good breakfast eateries and bakeries are nearby. Coffee/tea/hot chocolate and treats are available in the lobby 24/7. Lobby is beautiful with dark wood furniture, large, comfortable rose-colored chairs and sofas, and a stunning chandelier. There is also a bar with small sitting area. The lobby also has a huge fresh-water fish tank with an aquarium assortment of amazingly colored fish. Mesmerizing. Staff, especially Daan (double a) at the front desk, could not have been more helpful and friendly. We'll probably rent an apartment on our next Amsterdam trip. But if we don't, we will definitely stay at the Estherea again. No doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Scalf
Reviews.Content: Great find around the corner from Dam Square but it seems like another world away. Sits on a quiet part of the canal which is mostly residential but is only 1 minutes walk from the centre. The rooms are quite well furnished with period reproduction furniture.This lends the hotel an old world feel. Staff are magnificent although our triple room was quite small, couldn't swing a clog in it. The 3 single beds were tiny. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem except for the small rooms”
Reviews.Author: BraddyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it. It is in a really great location almost right in the center of Amsterdam, a stones throw away from the major city sights and destinations. It is also situated on a beautiful canal, in an enchanting old building. The public rooms (lounge, bar, restaurant, reception and so on) have a club-like atmosphere, and are peaceful and cosy. The staff are very efficient and eager to please. However, what lets this hotel down is the size of the rooms. I was given 510, which was one of the smallest sized rooms I have every stayed in. It was more like a large closet than a room. Okay, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was nicely refurbished, and I had a great view over the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Another great hotel with Trip Advisors help”
Reviews.Author: fig_mar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Estherea at the end of our river cruise from Budapest. I choose the hotel using Trip Advisor and the reviews of previous visitors. We booked a canal view room to make my wife happy. I am glad we did because the view was excellent. The room was spacious and full of light from the three large windows. The bath was very clean and also spacious. The staff was very helpful with recommendations for dinning. We had two evening meals at the hotel's recommended restaurants. CafÃ© Di David was Italian and Dâ€™ Theeboom was French both were on the same street as the hotel. Both served an excellent meal for fair prices. Our third evening meal was at Indonesian Restaurant - Selecta which was also very good. My wife booked us a walking tour with Adamâ€™s Apple Tours, www.adamsapple.nl. Frank books only small groups and only charges 25 euros. Frank has an excellent knowledge of Amsterdam both past and present. You must telephone Frank to arrange a tour at [--]. BTW, Frank is listed in Rick Stevesâ€™ Amsterdam guide book. We also recommend the Amsterdam History Museum as a first stop on your visit. Book on-line for your tickets to the Van Gogh Museum and the Anne Frank House. Booking on-line will save you time waiting in long lines. The audio tour guide is a must for the Van Gogh Museum. And donâ€™t forget a canal boat tour.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Estherea is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: Theaanna
Reviews.Content: This lovely four star hotel is worth the splurge. Of course for American travelers it seems to get more expensive by the day due to the value of the dollar. The staff was so very gracious and helpful. It was beautiful and on a lovely street. I would highly recommend this hotel to the discerning traveler. Having travelled to Europe many times myself, I would return to the Hotel Estherea the next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel that's worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: ericnyc
Reviews.Content: The Estherea deserves all the kudos it's received on this site. I visited for four nights with my mom in late April 2009. You can't find a better location for being central in the city yet feeling like you have a quiet, beautiful canal all to yourself. There is a divine chocolate store about three blocks north named Puccini that's not to be missed. You can easily walk to the train station in 15-20 minutes for excursions out of town. The staff is friendly enough but not the highlight of the hotel. What is really cool and special about this hotel is the lobby and public space on the ground floor. I usually am never enticed to spend any time in such spaces, but the spaces are beautifully lit and furnished with lovely, warm items that make you want to hang out with a (free) cup of hot chocolate while you figure out your plans for the day, check your map, etc. Our room was spacious enough, and the place was always quiet at night The hotel is a little on the pricey side but really worth the splurge...all in all, it's pretty terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Edwardian Gem In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pamikef
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel located in the middle of Amsterdam is a treat of a place to stay. Centraly located near Dam Square and the Anne Frank House, there are many exceptional restaurants nearby. The staff is outstanding. The decor beautiful and stately. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous hotel if you are over 5' tall!”
Reviews.Author: Sam66Uk
Reviews.Content: Good points: Nice entrance, lounge and reading room area. Quite central but quiet location. Whole hotel was very clean. Bad points: Room size was about average for Amsterdam but small by international standards. It felt very cramped though due to the furnishing. I cut my head open on an ornate metal light fitting in the centre of our room hanging at a dangerous 5'6" (1.67m)! Staff were efficient but not friendly; this could be due to staffing levels which were low. There was a queue at the reception desk everytime I walked past it. They charged 16 euro for breakfast despite stating 14 euro on their website and in a confirmation email. This is expensive compared to other hotels and restaurants in the area. Overall I would say that if they hung their lights a bit higher and got rid of some of the furniture in the small rooms this would be a good 3 star hotel. It does not have the facilities or level of service I would expect from a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the memories!”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Duck
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam last month and stayed Hotel Estherea ~ deluxe double canal view room. On Singel canal just 5-10 walk to Dam Square. I wired them before arriving and asked if they could order some flowers for the room. I gave them a 75 euro budget. They emailed back and said could get some tulips for 30 euro. Much to my surprise, there were 6 full tulip arrangements when we arrived. They actually walked down to floating flower market and purchased the flowers. Buy the breakfast buffet ~ good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience! Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: monica82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband, parents and brother for the weekend. Located on a quiet canal, yet an easy walk to many restaurants and attractions. Gorgeous lobby with complimentary coffee, hot chocolate and snacks. And don't miss the lemon/mint infused water in the lobby bar. Each room is decorated differently making each one a unique experience. Breakfast was just okay. Kind of pricey for what you get. Staff very friendly and helpful. I would definitely go back if I am ever in Amsterdam again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Madame44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Estherea for three nights in April 2009. We had room 414. We arrived at Centraal Station and walked to the Estherea. The EASIEST way to do this is to turn RIGHT as you exit the station, then walk until you run into the SINGEL Canal, then turn LEFT. Walk straight down next to the Canal until you get to #303. It took us about 15-20 minutes with luggage. We arrived at 7:00am and did not expect our room to be ready (it wasn't!). We had the hotel breakfast since we arrived the day after Easter and most places were closed. I think the breakfast was 16â‚¬ per person. There were eggs, bacon, suasage, multiple pastries, fresh fruits, yogurts, coffee, tea, 4-5 different varieties of breads with jams an d butter. We enjoyed it that day, but did not eat there again since the price was a bit high for the amount that we eat! Our room was ready by noon, and we moved right in. When we got into the room we found a lovely gift from the hotel management since we were in Amsterdam to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The location was lovely, the room was lovely---we had a spacious canal view room, which was an upgraded room. The room was cleaned daily. Shower was wonderful--bathroom was spacious. TV reception was good. We did not hear noise from the street or the surrounding rooms. The front desk provided us with anything that we requested. The coffee, hot chocolate, tea and cookies were always welcome. It was a very comfortable and enjoyable stay. We were quite happy. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..how lovely!”
Reviews.Author: freart
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay for 2 nights in April at Hotel Estherea. What a charming hotel and beautifully appointed. The first impression was great, walking in through the double doors into a plush reception area, greeted by friendly, English speaking staff. Our luggage was cheerfully taken to our room on the second floor facing the street, which didn't pose any noise problems. The room was beautifully furnished, every detail was thought about. The bedding and pillows were comfortable and cosy. The bathroom (with shower and separate bath) looked newly renovated with lovely fittings and tiling, complete with toiletries. The new toilet was in separate room. The big chandelier over the bed gave the room a grand look, but because the ceiling was low, we bumped our heads on it! The lounge area near reception turned into a real bonus, as it was a great place to sit with visiting family members, in a cosy and luxurious environment. Not to mention the supply of lovely teas and coffee, sweets, biscuits and fruit available. Even while we were settling in our room, a staff member made sure our waiting guest downstairs was taken care of with a cup of tea. The location was great and walking distance to everything. We even walked to the Artis (Zoo) just over 2klms away. The beautiful hotel is well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDGal66
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Estherea is a true gem in the heart of Amsterdam. It is located on Singel Canal, and the location is picturesque and quiet, but also convenient to everything in the city. We were traveling with our 13 year old daughter, and instead of a double room with a roll-away cot brought in for her, we were put in a big room that had a bed for my husband and I, as well as a twin sized sleigh bed for her. She was thrilled to have a "real" bed. The staff was friendly and helpful, and we loved the fact that we returned every day to 3 fresh bottles of water chilling in our room's fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shipsatsea
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, really well decorated. Very central for all amenities. Maybe slightly pricy but a better standard than many similar hotels. Liked the fact that hot drinks were available at all times, day and night. Library was a pleasant place to sit after a hard days shopping. The hotel always felt very quiet - though it was January! My only slight gripe was the fact that there were glass plaques in lifts and rooms warning guests that they would be fined if they smoked drugs in the hotel. I've never seen this before anywhere in Amsterdam and though it totally unnecessary. It wasn't at all the type of hotel where visitors would do this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: Laurie3501
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Estherea and had a great experience. The location was ideal--a couple of blocks south of Dam Square and within a couple of blocks of the Anne Frank Huis. Even loaded down with luggage, it took us only about 20 minutes to walk from Centraal Station to our hotel. The hotel is located in a safe, quiet area of the city. Our rate was 185 Euros a day, plus about 8 Euros a day for the city tax. All front desk staff that we encountered spoke English quite well. There is a huge grocery store about 1.5 blocks away. Stepping out of the hotel, take a right. Then take the right on the first street you come to; the grocery store will be on your left at the end of that block. I would highly recommend a small restaurant called Caprese just one block north of the hotel. Look for the white & yellow awning. Great Italian food! The reception level of the Hotel Estherea is quite lovely and very welcoming. The library, sitting area, and meeting room were all well appointed and very comfortable. Various fruits, cookies, chocolates, candy, coffee, hot chocolate and tea were available 24/7 in the lobby. This hotel is 100% non smoking, with a huge penalty if you smoke in the room. Our room was #112, and it was wonderful. As the photos show, the room was rather ornate but quite charming. Three large windows opened up to views of the Singel Canal, and the heavy draperies went from floor to ceiling. Our room had two twin beds, that were set up as one bed. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. Also in the room were a large dresser/desk, two casual chairs, a small coffee table, two bedside tables and a small television. There was a large closet, extra shelves, and a mini refrigerator (stocked with two free waters every day). A small programmable safe is available in the room at no extra charge; two pairs of slippers are also provided at no charge. We noticed very little noise while inside our hotel room. The room seemed a bit cool at times, and we couldn't seem to get the thermostat to operate. I suspect the heat was turned off--or perhaps we had to request it to be turned on. It wasn't a problem though, as the outdoor temps were warm enough not to need heat in the rooms. The bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and towels, and there was a wall-mounted hair dryer. Being it was early March, leaves on the trees hadn't really started popping out. However, spring flowers and houseplants were common sights along the streets, many shrubs already had their leaves, and the grass was vibrant green. Temps were in the upper 40s and lower 50s during the day, so it was very comfortable. Our only real issue at this hotel was that even though we had a confirmed reservation (with a reservation number), it didn't seem as if they had our name on the reservation list for that day. Eventually after checking our reservation paper, they assigned us our room--but I was a little concerned they didn't have the reservation. We tried to confirm our reservation by email about a month prior to our trip. Strangely, they never got back to us, but we assumed we were OK being we never received any word of a problem. Since we were visiting in March, I doubt the hotel was full--so a missing reservation could be easily resolved. But you may want to follow up your reservation with a phone call, just to make certain--especially if visiting during high season. Overall, we had a great experience at this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: Lauren717
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Estherea at the end of March as a brief getaway for just my husband and me. We booked a canal view room, and had a charming room on the 4th floor. The bed was super comfy and had a special topper to turn it from two twins into a queen. There was shelving and hanging space in the closet, as well as many drawers in the desk. The bathroom was small and lacked storage, but the water pressure was super, the towel plush, so it was perfectly fine. The Estherea staff is lovely, the public spaces full of old world charm, and the location is fabulous -- central, but very quiet at night. We would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: Lauren717
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Estherea at the end of March as a brief getaway for just my husband and me. We booked a canal view room, and had a charming room on the 4th floor. The bed was super comfy and had a special topper to turn it from two twins into a queen. There was shelving and hanging space in the closet, as well as many drawers in the desk. The bathroom was small and lacked storage, but the water pressure was super, the towel plush, so it was perfectly fine. The Estherea staff is lovely, the public spaces full of old world charm, and the location is fabulous -- central, but very quiet at night. We would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “What You See Is Not What You Get”
Reviews.Author: wannagotravel
Reviews.Content: The website of this hotel shows newly decorated well appointed rooms, which you may not get to stay in; we didn't. We did however have a room on a floor 4 stairs up at the front of the building with a view over the canal. The decor in the room was dated and the beds felt like you were sleeping on a sandwich; the top layer sort of swiveled on the bottoms layer. The size of the room was standard for a room in a European capital. The bathroom was fine. The elevator is small, but we were fine taking the stairs just to burn some calories. At 16 Euro the breakfast is outstanding and nicely presented (here is were you collect calories); choices are almost too numerous to mention; custom tosti's available upon request; and fried or scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and ham; variety of sliced cheese and cold cuts, choice of juices; plenty of fresh fruits; choice of cereals, crackers and dark rye snack breads; many choices of other breads; yogurts, jams and cheese spreads; muesli, dried fruits, pastries and the list goes on. Check out the buffet before you make your choices. Many specialty tea choices and coffee at breakfast and same available complimentary all day in the lobby . Truly a good value, (not by American standards, but you are not in America) the average breakfast at an Amsterdam hotel will set you back 20 to 22 Euros. Take it from a Canadian born in the Netherlands! The other common spaces/rooms in this hotel are as represented on the website; very warm and inviting and true to Amsterdam style decor. No complaints here. Location is fine too; a nice neighbourhood and walking distance to Centraal Station and many attractions. Upon check out I inquired about the nicely decorated rooms presented on their website - I speak Dutch - but it was ignored. So, in the future, if we stay at this hotel again, I will make sure I know which room I am staying in and if not, we will go elsewhere in the city. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Yes, but with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: seas0ned
Reviews.Content: Even staying in Amsterdam in cold, damp February, the hotel created a warmth that made returning to it every evening an absolute pleasure. The location is deceiving if you only look it up on a map as it is on a section of the Singel Canal that is surprisingly quiet. We stayed in a very reasonably priced canal view room, but be prepared if you want this luxury at reduced cost as you are likely to get a small room. We were offered a larger room with a courtyard view, but chose the view over the size. There is building work going on in the hotel at present, with some extension work to the street behind. It is difficult to tell if these rooms will be as good, but the overall service, comfort and location of the hotel should please even the most critical of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Single beds on our honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cnoodles
Reviews.Content: Having had a fantastic stay at the Estherea in Jan 08 we decided to return to the hotel for our honeymoon from the 20th Feb 09. I had e-mailed the hotel to let them know why we were visiting but despite this we were given room 412 - which has two single beds with horrible rubber mattress covers- hardly the most romantic option for our honeymoon! When I made enquiries with reception about our room I was told that the hotel was fully booked. It appeared that the hotel had given no thought to how special this trip was for us, which was very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: bxlbkl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Valentine's Day weekend. The hotel is conveniently located. The rooms are clean and well-appointed by Amsterdam standards. The staff are friendly, professional, and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a convenient base for sightseeing and walking around in the Western Canal district.

Reviews.Title: “It was good, would stay there again...but”
Reviews.Author: CountyCorkNMurphy
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Hotel Estherea on the last weekend in January. The hotel is very well appointed on the Singel Canal. There are plenty of bars (Harry's Bar for cocktails) and good restaurants (Caprese is one of them) within a five minute walk. The area where the hotel is situated seemed to us to be very safe and quiet. There was none of the seediness similar to the Red Light district within proximity to it. I liked the hotel and found it to be of a very high standard, however I had two issues which at the time took from our experience of staying there. My husband and I were given two single beds pushed together as a double bed. We didnt complain as we were staying for two nights only but I did find this very comfortable. Secondly it was perishing cold in Amsterdam at this time of year, however the heating was turned off when we arrived late at night so we had to wait for the room to heat up. Again the following day we went out doing touristy things upon our return to the room the story was the same, heating off. I found this to be an inconvenience as it was bitterly cold outside. However we had the facility to turn it back on again as soon as we came in. All the same though it took a bit of time for the room to heat up and this also took from giving an overall good impression of the hotel. Other than these two issues, I would recommend the hotel to anyone including friends and family, as the staff are great and the location is perfect. We didnt eat breakfast there as we felt the price was excessive at â‚¬15 per person. By the way the map provided by hotel of Amsterdam, is much better than that in the Lonely Planet guide book to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful discovery”
Reviews.Author: TexanX
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam for business and was extremely pleased with this jewel of a hotel. Well tended, comfortable, stylish rooms. Professional, helpful, polite staff. Simply the BEST location for the canal neighborhoods, and close to all the hubub of the old town. Walking distance to Reiksmuseum and all markets. Fantastic bakeries close by. Fantastic coffee shops close by(Cofee and Tee). Cafe Singel was SUPERB for lunch. FoodWare offered a wonderful lunch buffett(but no atmosphere to speak of, just good quality food...). Beulings restaurant was an incredible surprise discovery, 5 star multi course chef's choice, small cozy... all a short walk from the hotel. We will look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matchy
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely friendly and accomodating at this hotel. Our flight had been changed without notice and we arrived at the hotel 3 hours earlier than expected. We managed to check into our room prior to mid-day with no fuss, this was a first for us! The hotel is beautiful and very relaxed and is perfectly situated for exploring Amsterdam. We didn't use public transport at all, we walked everywhere. The breakfast is rather on the expensive side of 16 euros each but then again, you get what you pay for. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and will be returning on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenkaufman
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam before and stayed in very basic hotels so decided to go for something a bit more upmarket this time. We really liked the hotel and were lucky enough to be given one of the bigger rooms. It was clean and in really good order. We also really liked the location - its not to far to the station and a short walk to dam square. The roads around the hotel have a really good selection of places to eat and drink. We got a really good rate on the room - if we had paid more we might have been a bit disapointed and we have rated it highly for its value for money. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EmmaNigel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, and found this to be a clean, plush and comfortable hotel. We stayed in Room 512 which was on the top floor (in the roof), the room was just right for two people, not huge, but well arranged so we didn't feel 'squeezed' as you can feel so often in some places. It had a very decent bathroom with shower/bath and hairdyer, plus all the usual things and lotions (except soap, which came in a squeezy bottle on the wall). There is wifi, but you have to pay (10 euros for 24 hrs). We didn't have breakfast in the hotel (so can't comment), but it was extremely good to know that in the afternoon after walking around (freezing) Amsterdam, there was free coffee/hot choc/tea to warm you up whilst nibbling on the free pastries/biscuits whilst slumped in a comfy sofa reading the newspapers provided. There were no coffee making facilites in the room, and the minibar only contains water - but again, it is free. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and huge fish tank in reception was just awesome, my husband could barely tear himself away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nomiwoo
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel, with brilliant staff and a great location. I booked three nights in the hotel for my boyfriend'sbirthday, and having emailed beforehand to let them know, we arrived to a find a gorgeous bouquet of flowers, a special birthday gift and a beautiful room complete with four-poster bed! The staff were really helpful, the location was perfect and the complimentary cakes and drinks very much appreciated. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: HorsesItch
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the other reviewers - take a cab from the station, it's too far to walk unlsess it's springtime and not raining. The location of the Eshterea is ideal. On a pretty canal very close to Dam Square, a 15 minute walk to the Ann Frank House, and a couple of blocks from the trams to the art galleries. The hotel is cosy and warm, with superbly decorated public areas and a huge and riveting tropical fish tank. Our room was small but very well decorated although it had no view at all. Well, not exactly true, as they had erected a banner a metre or two from our window showing pictures of trees so that you couldn't see an adjacent building site, which was a novel if expensive gesture. There were no drawers which would have been useful, and the room was so small only one person at a time could get around the bottom of the bed. But hey - all you need on a weekend trip is a comfy warm and clean room and this was ideal. (the hotel is very very clean!). They don't serve evening meals at all, but the breakfasts were stunning, and so was the beautiful dining room. All of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. There is a stunning little bar just around the corner called the Gollem - a great place to chill and sample the huge range of beers on offer. A perfect place to stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: blahSpain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, infront of a canal and only five mins walk from Dam square. Friendly staff, nice room, just like the photos. There was also a complimentary tea/coffee machine in the reception along with a range of muffins and biscuits. This was a nice touch coming in after a long cold day and having the tea, also we didnt have breakfast included but this meant we could get a coffee in the morning. Only one small bad thing to say bout this hotel is that the heating vent is located over your head when in the bed, so each morning woke up very hot and with the feeling of a sore throat. We couldnt find a switch to regulate the heating as you do in other places. All in all lovely hotel, felt safe, nice staff, nice rooms, we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: GDS309
Reviews.Content: If arriving by train, take a cab. It is really a long walk from the station unless you have no luggage and have 20-25 minutes to view things on the way. Arrived and was given a so so small room with no view. Asked for another. Hotel was accommodating to a point in that we were shown another bigger room or we could opt for a small room with a view. We opted for the broom closet sized room just for the view of the canal. (They claimed no others available. I was not so sure) This was our choice but two normal sized adults pretty much have to climb over each other to function.) Bathroom nice but very limited space on sink and shelf. View great from room . Bed was okay. No bed bugs that I could see or feel.(saw that in another review) Closet space....Poor. No drawers, a high hard to use shelf. (I lived better out of a foot locker in the Army). Beautifully decorated downstairs public rooms. Did not do the 16 Euro breakfast but room looked nice. Free coffee, cookies and candy in lobby area was nice touch . Bar open 24 hours. Fair prices on the drinks. Service was very good and staff helpful with a good restaurant recommendation. Price for 3 nights averages about 155 euros a night with taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: mambo03
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot believe the high score at tripadvisor. I usually choose my hotels based on the ratings here at tripadvisor and have never been disappointed. However, Esthera did not live up to my expectations. The room (512) was tiny, with a tiny bathroom which actually has no space to put the towels (stored on a rack above the bathtub). If you want to take a shower you have to throw the towels onto the floor. The furniture had several cigarette holes, although it was supposed to be a non-smoking room. The rooms are noisy due to the lack of any sound insulation. Breakfast is an extra 16 EUR per person which I thought was included in the price, another bad surprise. Staff is not particularly friendly. Location is quite nice, which is the only positive thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Watch out for the Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLJohnston
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice. However, watch out for the bedbugs. We stayed in room 406 at the hotel on the 24-26th October 2008, when my Husband and I woke up on the Saturday morning we noticed that we had little lumps on our skin but did not understand why. When we woke up Sunday morning with more bites I put 2+2 together. I woke up with a bite on my eye lid, which hurt and itched like hell. A week later I still have the lump without the redness! Since then, I have had to spray my home and my bags with the clothes I took to make sure this does not spread into my home. Once you have bedbugs they are hard to shift. Until now I did not know they actually existed. Its AWFUL! I have yet to email the hotel and see what repsonse I get, however, if you do stay here I would suggest you check the bed first before opening your luggage. Other than that, its a nice hotel and a nice location. I hope you have better luck than me!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRealtor
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel and experience! We loved Amsterdam and the hotel made it an even better experience. The location is perfect and right in the heart of everything. The staff was wonderful! I really cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. The next time we are in Amsterdam we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Estherea”
Reviews.Author: PADUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights from 20th October to 23 October & found it more than lived up to our expectations. We had a very comfortable, quiet room with large bathroom. The hotel was warm & comfortable with exceptionally charming, helpful & efficient staff. The breakfast was delicious & the complementary coffee, chocolate or tea very much appreciated. The hotel is on a lovely stretch of a quiet canal within easy walking distance of almost everything. There is a selection of restaurants to suit every taste & pocket just around the corner in Spuistraat . The only negative thing I would say about the hotel is that the grouting & tiling in our bathroom needed some maintainance The only negative experience we had in Amsterdam was that we were very overcharged for our taxi from the station. We asked the hotel to get us a taxi back to the station. This was less than half the price we paid to get there

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: ViewTheWorldWithMe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 nights from 12th Oct. We were absolutely pleased with everything the size of the room has enough space to open 2 hugh samsonite luggages + hand carry + has a writing table, the ensuite has everything incuding cotton buds and even bathroom slippers. On top of that the breakfast has a wide choice of bread and pastries including hot hard boiled egges, the waiting staff were excellent and very quick to respond. The front desk receptionists and the potters were all absolutely wonderful and of course the free flow of hot chocolates and biscuits help when we returned in the night and feeling cold and waiting a hot drink and there it is. No fuss at all. The location of the hotel is just great as well. 5 minutes walk to Dam Square and to where all the food is. We visited Anne Frank's house (10 minutes walked), Van Gogh museum (tram), Behjinhor (where the nun used to stay- 5 minutes walk), Molen van Sloten Windmill (by tram) and of course we walked to the famous Red light district, we truly enjoyed ourselves and because the hotel is so conveniently located, we can come back anytime when we were tired. We had a great stay. I would defintely stay there again if I were to visit. The only thing we weren't sure was why the receptionist advised that we take a cab to and from Schipol airport instead of taking the shuttle bus. We decided to take the shuttle bus anyway and we had a wonderful tour of the various drop off points for free. The shutttle was on time on both journeys and we were equally pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Guinevere50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Estherea for two nights this October. From the moment you enter its opulent panelled lobby you feel welcome. Our room wasn't quite ready and we were invited to help ourselves to free coffee, tea or hot chocolate (really good), while we waited. Our room overlooked the canal and had a pretty four poster bed. It boasted every convenience even down to the free slippers (well at least I hope they were free!). Breakfast was quite simply wonderful! Every conceivable thing you could possibly want to eat, from fresh fruit and smoothies, cereal, different breads and pastries to lovely crisply fried bacon, 'proper' sausages and eggs (scrambled or fried). Once we ate here in the morning, we didnt need anything until dinner time! We walked everywhere from this hotel, it couldn't be better placed for any attraction you may wish to visit. My only critiscism would be the lack of proper lighting to read by at night and to fix my face in the morning (!) and our bathroom was a little small, but these were minor flaws. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to feel spoiled and relaxed at the end of a day.

Reviews.Title: “A most memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Freedom2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four fantastic days at the Hotel Estherea last month and what a beautiful hotel it is. Our room was overlooking the canal and it was so lovely to see the activity day and night. Our room was very attractively decorated, ensuite had plenty of room and included were all the soaps, shampoos etc. Plenty of cupboard space which included a safe, iron and ironing board which is a very helpful addition and not usually provided in most hotels we have found. Breakfast was in a very pleasant environment and included a vast assortment of beautiful food. It was a lovely addition to be able to have, tea, coffee or hot chocolate at any time and often with the addition of a piece of cake or biscuit and also fruit on hand as well as sweets and a cool drink of minted lemon on the bar. The furnishings in the lounge and reading room were so lovely, it was wonderful to experience a little bit of yesterday today. We would strongly recommend a stay here. Lance and Jean Pereira, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_Resident
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delightful boutique hotel! After 2 weeks of travel and staying in a variety of accommodations, Hotel Estherea was a wonderful surprise upon our arrival in Amsterdam. We rented bikes and had the time of our lives exploring Amsterdam from this great central location. The (entry-level) room was small but very well-appointed and clean. The service was great and the small touches (complimentary bottled water, beverage station in the lobby, postcards, slippers in the room, etc.) were all great touches that make boutique hotels a major cut above the usual hotel chain fare. This quaint hotel radiates opulence and was a real treat at the end of our holiday. We will most definitely stay at Hotel Estherea again.

Reviews.Title: “A truly magnificant jewel”
Reviews.Author: Within
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea: We have just recently returned to Canada from our visit to Amsterdam and our stay at this magnificent hotel (Rooms 217 and 218) We couldn't have chosen a better place to stay in Amsterdam. The hotel was magnificent and we felt more like family than hotel guests. Everything in Central Amsterdam was within walking distance and the front desk staff were exemplary. I felt like we were welcomed home every time we entered the front door. From the abundance of fresh flowers, to the regal chandelier, to the library, the hotel exhibited old world charm and richness that flowed from every corner. The rooms were wonderful, clean and large. The large bathroom with double sink left no room for morning confusion. The Singel Canal was at the doorstep, and marvelous restaurants just around the corner. I would recommend this location to anyone travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: clarnicheallaigh
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Amsterdam was made so much nicer with a stay at this hotel. I searched for months to find something good online and most hotels I found hadnt the best reviews. However, this hotel lived up to its reviews and more. It is very central and just by one of the canels. You can walk everywhere from this hotel, even Central Station which brings you straight to/from the airport. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a bit pricey at â‚¬16 a head but there are plenty of lovely cafe's just around the corner where you can eat for less. I was extremely impressed with the complimentary tea's / coffee's / hot chocolate / sweets / fruit and cakes (yes free cakes!) that were in the lobby 24/7. Our room was a decent size with a funky decor and also had a huge bathroom with double sinks. Plasma TV in our room also along with an iron and ironing board which was great as usually you have to borrow one from reception. Our friends stayed in a room on the 5th floor which was very similar to our's and also a decent size. Also the rooms were cleaned daily. Although quite a pricey stay, it was well worth it for the comfort and I would definately recommend it to all - could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Fitzcaraldo
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its description on their own website. I walked from the station (a little too far for a short walk) and on the way it rained. I arrived, soaked, and the front desk staff immediately grabbed towels to dry me off. The room was very nice, albeit a little small, but extremely comfortable. Very nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort and style”
Reviews.Author: phillinda
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice central hotel located on a canal 5 - 10 minutes walk to all the sights. The beds are comfortable, the furnishings nice and the room a decent size for European hotels. Lobby, reception area and breakfast room are very beautiful and old-wordly with elegant wood furnishings. Bathrooms are large and very modern with double sinks. Restaurants close by. Very quiet area and away from the major "tourist" area near the train station, but only a 10 minute walk away. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller8382
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a weekend in January 08 and spent a bit more than we normally do for a hotel and were not disappointed. We couldn't believe when we walked into the hotel it was so nicely furnished. We had to wait a few minutes for our room to be ready but there was free tea and coffee and sweets so we were happy enough to wait! Room is lovely big bed very clean and very comfortable, tv was also quite good most of the channels are in english and had a good range of channels. Bathroom also lovely. couldnt fault anything about this hotel - well just one small thing - we stayed from a Sat to a Mon and on the monday morning there was construction work going on outside where our window was (it was facing the back) so not good when I'm woken out of sleep! but we were leaving on the Monday so it didnt really bother me. The construction work's probably finished up by now anyway. Anyway to finish up - I would definately stay here again it's money well spent, and also brilliant location just a short walk away from dam square and loads of restaurants. Also is a walking distance from the train station (takes about 5-10 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Suzibanter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming. The staff were very helpful and effecient. The rooms are large and comfortable and fully equipped. We had a view over the Singel canal. The location is perfect, walking distance to all the attractions. We didn't eat in the restaurant but the food we saw looked very tasty. I would recommend this hotel to any age group.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sacrifice
Reviews.Content: This is a great old fashioned hotel in a central location. While the decor is a bit old fashioned, the staff is friendly and the room are more than adequate. We were only there for two days so not enough for comfort to be an issue. We were able to get to everywhere we wanted to get to by foot and there were great restaurants and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: HerefordBritAbroad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Amsterdam and very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Estherea. Our room (416) was immaculate and nicely furnished. The bathroom was large and modern, with a lovely double sink and bath/shower. The staff were friendly and very helpful. There was no coffee or tea facility in our room but complimentary drinks and small cakes/sweets are available in the reception (v nice!). If we had any complaint at all it would be that the pillows were rather thin and so we could have done with more but, since we only stayed for a couple of nights, we didn't bother to ask for extra (though I'm sure they would have happily accommodated us). Overall, we had a lovely stay and if we return to Amsterdam in the future we will happily book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Bbi
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Great location - near everything but quiet. Charming. Tea coffee and snacks all day. Rooms are small, bathrooms are minute - but that's how it is in the old charming hotels in good locations. Standard room has almost no room to move around. Deluxe room is comfortable and has room enough for desk, table and a couple of chairs. Our rooms had great view of canal below.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Beautiful hotel, great staff, free goodies!”
Reviews.Author: rachelmle
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Hotel Estherea. My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and found it to be wonderful.
