It was in a great location - about a 5 minute walk to Dam Square and about 20 mins to the Anne Frank House and Central Station. The staff was always approachable and helpful. They booked tickets for us for the Anne Frank house, in order to skip over the very very long line. I highly suggest doing this. We got our tickets at the hotel front desk, and skipped an hour long line to walk straight into the museum. The tickets were the same price as buying them directly at the Anne Frank House. The staff also provided us with free ponchos and use of umbrellas during the rainy days. If coffee shops are on your agenda, there are many places near the hotel to check out. There are 2 shops within a 3-5 minute walk and dozens more within a 5-15 minute walk. The free cookies/pastries/coffee/tea/hot chocolate in the lobby was a great perk. We saved quite a few Euros by snacking at the hotel instead of at a cafe! Breakfast is 16 Euro per person, which is quite pricey. We peeked into the breakfast room one morning to see what we were missing and we were not missing much. We opted out of breakfast and went to a small bakery on the corner. We each ate breakfast for 5 Euro there - a much better choice than the 16 Euro option! We ate dinner one night at Caprese - the Italian restaurant on the street behind the hotel with the yellow and white awning. It was inexpensive, compared to many other restaurants in the area and it was absolutely delicious. Our room was wonderful. The bed was ok - not the best, but certainly not the worst. My only complaint in the room was the hair dryer. It was very weak and semi-broken. (I had to hold down the "on" button constantly or else the dryer would turn off.) Other than that, the room was great! I would certainly put this hotel in a 4 star class - not a 3 star, as listed. I have stayed in many 3, 4, and 5 star properties - and this is certainly a 4 star, considering all of its amenities.

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal Hotel and Haven in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Chasbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Estherea as a birthday treat and stayed for 3 nights over a weekend. We can only echo what other visitors have said, peaceful, quiet, clean and ideally situated for all the many places in Amsterdam that a visitor would wish to see. All staff were attentive and eager to please from check in to check out, an approach which will secure a return visit from us. We stayed in room 210 which overlooked the Singel canal and how pleasing it was to sleep with an open window in a busy city, there are not many city hotels in which that is possible. The room was a good size with all facilities that we needed and cleaned to a high standard every day. Like some of the other visitors we decided to breakfast out and found a lot of choice alongside the floating flower market which is less than a five minute walk and at a very reasonable cost. On entering our room I was pleasantly surprised to find a birthday card and generous gift from the family who own the hotel. Would I recommend the Estherea? Of course I would !!

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mali2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this lovely hotel. We had a triple room and my mom had a single room. The single room was very small but the tasteful decoration, elegant colors, comfortable bedding and beautiful furniture made up for the size. The triple room was also beautifully, luxuriously decorated and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel has a very old Europe charming feel. The large chandeliers in the front lobby, the lovely wood paneled library, and all the fabric just makes this hotel inviting and warm. The staff is very professional and helpful. The location is great, on a canal street and close to all attractions but at the same time quiet and picturesque. Another lovely feature was complementary tea, coffee, hot chocolate, water, cookies and pastries that were so great to have after a long day of walking around town. I found this very thoughful. I definitely recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel by canal”
Reviews.Author: painter2808
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Estherea. It is a warm, comfortable and cosy hotel. Rooms are small but other touches more than make up for it. Good breakfast and tea, coffee and chocolate and cakes available all day. Excellent touch. Very friendly and helpful staff. Cannot wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: jetlagged7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea is a fabulous hotel and quite accomodating as well. We just returned from our travels which including this hotel and loved everything about it. Clean, wonderfully helpful and pleasant front desk staff and exceptionally large room for European standards. Easily accomodated me and two kids with lots of room to spare. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate and cookies are always available to guests...a huge perk for a quick snack since Europe is so expensive these days for American travelers...a coffee break anywhere in Europe can easily run $15-$20.00 these days. Fruit is usually also left for guests as well as small cakes if they are left over from the restaurant. The hotel has a wonderfully comfortable lobby as well. Without doubt I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: GinaDublin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - just around the corner from lovely restaurants and bars but still quiet. I found the price expensive but then all hotels seem to be expensive in Amsterdam. We paid 220Euro for a Friday and Saturday night in July. Rooms are small but adaquate and very clean. The bed was comfortable, the towels were fluffy. We did not eat at the hotel so I can make no comment on the menu. However, they do have good coffee in the lobby, small pastries and toffees. A nice addition. One complaint I have with the hotel is that the tiles in the bathroom are quite slippy and on the first night both I and my partner slipped when stepping up into the bathroom. Although I lost my balance I didn't fall, my partner did and banged his elbow. The second complaint is that it is unreasonably expensive to use the internet facility in the lobby. You pay 5Euro for 30 minutes when for the total cost of the accommodation, the internet facility should be free. We needed to check our flight reservation which would take 5 minutes yet had to pay 5Euro for the facility. I would rate the hotel nice, great location but rather expensive for the room size etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!! Loved The Estherea!”
Reviews.Author: karlimd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Estherea for 3 nights in June. What a great hotel....everything that has been said is true...great location,beautiful lobby,free tea /coffee/snacks. There were 4 of us, 2adults and our 2 children(ages 13 & 15). It is difficult in Europe to find either connecting rooms or rooms that will accommodate 4 people. At the Estherea we had a quad room. It was fine for the 4 of us. It faced the street behind the hotel (no canal view),but it was a lovely street view. We had a king bed and 2 doubles with plenty of room. The room also had a desk & chair, plus 2 sitting chairs, a flat screen TV,and a large closet. The bathroom was clean and stocked with nice products. The real beauty of this hotel was the staff....very,very nice,great advice and restaurant recommendations. We had drinks at the bar which was nice, but never had breakfast at the hotel. If you walk out of the hotel, turn left and make a quick left at the side street, on the right side there is a great bakery (3 minute walk)...we got fresh treats in the morning and had them in our room with coffee. The breakfast price at the hotel was a little steep at 16E per person. Be sure and take Mike's Bike Tour while in Amsterdam...it was one of the highlights of our trip!! If you have any questions let me know!! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Respite in the Heart of a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Hosalito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Estherea for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon. I am so glad TripAdvisor is available, as I would never have found this gem otherwise. The hotel is tucked into the quiet Singel Canal, in a great part of town. Our room was #210 and looked out over the Singel. The street itself is very quiet, and while it's only 1 or 2 blocks from all of the action, we could never tell while we were in the room! All we could hear out of the windows is the everyday hustle and bustle of Amsterdam (think bike bells!). Our room had a double bed and a sitting area with a desk, plus of course a nicely appointed bathroom. The products in the bathroom were wonderful and the towels were very lush! There is an area in the lobby where they serve free coffee, tea, candy and cakes all day and night. Plus, fresh fruit! There is also a bar area that is fully stocked, so you can get a drink at any time, plus they have the most wonderful mint-flavored water available (that's free!). There is an elevator but you can also take the stairs if you are so inclined. If you exit the hotel and turn left, there is a Greek deli/restaurant that serves up AMAZING, authentic dishes. It's great for a quick bite! Lastly, I cannot say enough about the staff. In true Dutch fashion, they were patient, gracious, and willing to help with any request....all with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregor20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The rooms were larger than expected and extremely comfortable. There are great facilities like free tea, coffee and hot chocolate. Very comfortable foyer with 2 areas with large tables for business meetings. Staff was helpful and courteous. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay Summer 2008”
Reviews.Author: Kizzi32
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Estherea in June 2008. During our stay at the hotel we had a lovely room overlooking the canal on the 5th floor. The decor was luxurious, the bed exceptionally comfy, flat screen TV, airconditioning. The bathroom was nice and roomy with two large twin sinks and a huge bath! There is free tea and coffee next to reception, it would have been nice to have this option in the room, but hey you carn't have everything! The reception rooms, bar and library in the hotel are nicely decorated and make a nice relaxation area. The breakfast is European buffet style and the coffee excellent, I would highly surprised if someone could not find something they liked there as it was well stocked and they had a good choice, and they included some good healthy option like smoothies which made a nice change. The staff were exceptionally helpful. The hotel is well situated and is a 2-3 min walking distance of Dam Square, and is very close to the shopping centre, restaurants, bars, and the dutch travel system gives you so many choices and makes it easy to get around. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Nice Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: fmcgillin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good rates located on a canal. I travel to Amsterdam 8 times a year for business and have been let down by a lot of hotels but not this one. I was looking for a good value as I was spending the weekend on my own dime. The hotel is charming and squeaky clean. Service was very good. Room very nice. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but Costly”
Reviews.Author: sherek
Reviews.Content: REALLY LIKED: - Location (short walk to Dam Square and Anne Frank House, reasonable walk to Red Light District) - Neighborhood (great restaurants nearby and a lovely little shop selling yummy broodjes right at the corner) - View (see photo) - Comfortable bed and perfectly clean (albeit a bit small) bathroom DID NOT LIKE: - Cost - I realize that accommodations in Amsterdam in general are not cheap, but next time we'll put more of an effort to find something less costly. - Expensive breakfast - Their breakfast buffet is tasty, but we didn't realize that it would cost us an extra $16 Euros per person. (A total of $32 Euros.. for breakfast! That's US $50, the same price as a mind-blowing sashimi breakfast for two at the famous Daiwa Sushi in Tokyo.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chellye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a short break before Christmas. We have 3 kids under 10 and we had a "family" room that was really 2 rooms that joined behind a common door. It was great for us because it gave some privacy while still having the kids right there. The location was great although we didn't walk much as the weather was quite cold. The staff were wonderful and very accepting of the kids. The hot chocolate machine in the lobby makes this one of my kids favorite hotels in the world!! Great overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel95
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews have already stated all the nice things about this hotel, so I won't repeat them. I will just back them up by saying that the Estherea is a GREAT hotel! Super-friendly staff, unbeatable central location, nice extra touches, sparkling clean rooms. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to get a Great Feel for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TexasTigerDallas
Reviews.Content: Father/ son from Texas stayed for two nights in May. It was the perfect place to stay to visit this wonderful city. Room on fifth floor with canal view. Common areas very pretty and comfortable, Staff right on and helpful. Close to most attractions. Highly recommend.. This hotel deserves it's high rating on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocoabearWeymouth
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. We had a deluxe double with canal view and four poster bed. It was very romantic and beautiful. The staff were all friendly. The best thing was the complimentary tea, hot choc and cakes in reception which you could have when ever you wanted without feeling you were being watched. We took it up to our room which was good too. The hotel was very comfortable to be in with a relaxed atmosphere. The location was the best and was central to everything. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackMan_ValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2007 for my birthday and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the centraal train station which is directly linked to schipol airport. Overall it took about 45 minutes to get to the hotel from the airport and it only costs a few euros on the train and is very easy to use. The hotel is well located for all the sights in amsterdam. Dam square is 10 minutes away whilst the red light area is about 15 minutes. In the opposite direction is the leidesplein which has plenty of bars and restaurants whilst just behind the hotel is a retaurant called Hansje Claes which we would recommend. We had a room with a canal view and it was clean and comfortable and for amsterdam was quite spacious. The bathroom was also quite large and again was immaculate. We had room only but this was fine as literally 2 doors away, ( turn left as you come out of the hotel) was a cafe, berts, that did great cooked breakfasts. The next time we are in Amsterdam we shall definately be staying at this classy hotel with a fab fishtank!! One final tip; If you are planning on visiting Anne Franks house then book your tickets and print them online. We did this and were able to walk straight in through the dedicated pre booked entrance. Because we did this we avoided the queue that went around the block!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Jeewiz
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Booked a standard room and it was clean and the bathroom was large. The staff at the reception desk were very friendly and helpful.It was lovely to have free coffee,tea and cookies/cakes were always available in the lobby. Location was also very central. The tramlines were close by and it was possible to walk to Dam square, the museums etc. Lots of restaurants close by and there is a lovely tearoom ,just on the corner for breakfast if you do not wish to spend 14 euros for b/f at the hotel.I managed to book this 4 star hotel at 107 euros/day on [--]

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: cocas
Reviews.Content: My family and I have recently stayed at Estherea and I loved the hotel. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly and the location was just perfect. Although the rooms were small ( one was even tiny) and two of the bathrooms equally quite small, we were deligheted with the character of this canal house. It was near everything in a quiet canal - Singel- and you could walk everywhere. We also enjoyed the coffee, tea and hot chocolate facilities in the lobby as well as the small biscuits. It was really a delightful experience I would like to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Amsterdam if you're like me”
Reviews.Author: travelmiracle
Reviews.Content: If you're like me you want to stay right near everything happening, but have quiet for a restful retreat. If you're like me you want to fully experience the location you are in by making your home one of architectural ambiance unique to the area, while not forgiving luxury, comfort and class. If you're like me you want to walk effortlessly to everything you would want to see in the heart of a city, taking the headache of transport out of your experience. If you're like me you will relish in even the smallest den of rest at the Hotel Estherea. Drink it in.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Shabby Room”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer151
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam a dozen times in the last 10 years and stayed at a different hotel each time because I've never had a good hotel experience in Amsterdam: tiny rooms and tinier bathrooms, high prices and staff that range from cooly efficient to condescending insolence. So when I read the glowing reviews of the Estherea, I had hope - unfortunately unfounded. I was assigned the smallest room in the hotel although my rate was the normal one for a double room (well over $300US/night). It was so small, that when I took the large decorative pillows off the bed the only place to put them was on the floor and that left maybe 5 narrow feet to walk around the bed that was wedged in an alcove. The room could best be described as shabby, carpet that hadn't been changed in 20 years (an issue because you had to get on your hands and knees to get to the room safe in the bottom of the cupboard - not a closet). There were holes in the walls left unfilled, 80's style metallic wall paper and beat up cheaply made furniture. It did have a view on the canal, but that just meant it was noisy - I could hear a couple talking at normal voice through the walls too. I asked to move and of course they were full. The staff was reasonably friendly but not helpful. The only good points were the neighborhood and the breakfast. The lobby was rather grand, but in the flower capital of the world it was odd to see so many fake, glittery flower arrangements and I never spent time in the lobby anyway. So still searching for a decent reasonably priced hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ohmyGOSH
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with this hotel which I booked after reading the very favorable comments on TA. I travel to Amsterdam monthly for business. This Spring I decided to take a few days for touring with my daughter and was looking for a less expensive option than the business class hotel I where I usually stay. We`loved the Estherea - even though we ended up with a small room on the interior. The hotel is so well located, slightly to west of the center of old town, so we spent most of our time touring the city and didn't mind the room. The beds were fine, the bathroom small but clean and modern. The lobby and room are charmingly european. There is always drinks and sweets available for guest. The staff was polite and helpful. I am sure we will stay here again. The location of the hotel is great. Unless you are into the honkey tonk bar scene, sex workers, or just general touristy places, I highly recommend the quieter west side of the historic downtown. The streets and canals are elegant, it feels very safe, and you won't be awaken by the rowdy bar crawlers in the middle of the night. There are also very affordable cafes in the area, with very good and healthy food. We enjoyed being the only Americans eating in these establishments!

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Average European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markmcloughlin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Estherea for three nights and really loved the place. First of all, when we arrived quite a few hours before check-in time, they did their best to get the room ready for us. And when it was ready, we were brought to the room where our bags were already waiting for us. A nice start! The room itself was lovely and overlooked the peaceful Singel Canal. The room was unusually decorated, as was the rest of the hotel, and definitely not like your usual generic hotel. Breakfast was a bit on the expensive side at â‚¬14, but was a very decent spread. Downstairs in the lobby, there was a small bar and library, with tea/coffee/hot chocolate making facilites and little cakes left out. This was all so cozy and welcoming that I was happy working from the lobby for two days ... We've previously stayed in the Krasnapolsky in Dam square, which seemed a bit soulless and overpriced compared to Estherea. All in all, this is a very nice, unusual and welcoming mid/top-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the decor”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamNick
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Estherea. We were delighted with the hotel. The location is very attractive being on one of the cannalls (Single) and is central so many of the sights are within walking distance. The decor is fab if not a bit over the top with dark reds velvet, tassels and chandeliers everywhere. Staff are helpfull and polite and the rooms are comfortable (we were on the 4th floor with a stunning cannal view). The breakfast buffet (E14) was worth every cent. We would stay again deffinately

Reviews.Title: “Bloomin' great”
Reviews.Author: Langton_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night city break with our 2 children and were delighted with our hotel choice. We used the fast & efficient train service between the airport and central station. The hotel is a 15/20 minute stroll, if it's not raining, and its central location means that pretty much everything is within walking distance - although the trams are easy to use when legs get weary. The room (419) was ready for us on arrival at 1.00pm and there was plenty of space for all 4 of us - no canal view, but the windows open onto the interesting cityscape. Our bed was large & comfy, and the large sleigh-like sofa converted into 2 single beds. The bathroom was small but adequate. We found the staff friendly and helpful and the whole hotel felt spotlessly clean & well maintained/decorated. The breakfasts offered plenty of choice, including hot (bacon, sausages & eggs) and cost 14 euros per person (children under 11 free). However, there are plenty of cafes nearby - a couple of good ones 5 mins walk looking out onto the flower market - and offer much cheaper alternatives. There is plenty of choice for restaurants in the evening. The hotel recommended the Haesje Claes just around the corner, where we enjoyed the typically-Dutch, and very filling, food. There was a childrens menu and prices were reasonable. All-in-all, the Estherea is a great base from which to enjoy this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: LoLoChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in February, and it is very nice, staff is very professional. However, I thought the hotel was noisy. The hotel is especially noisy in the early morning as guests check out, with wheeled suitcases, doors banging shut. The hotel is charming and quaint but for the price I think you can do a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and I'm not easily pleased”
Reviews.Author: shopaholicchocaholic
Reviews.Content: Not the easiest place to find but once you know where to go it is excellently located close to Dam Square. It's a really different kind of hotel and from the moment you walk in you feel it's special. The decor and furnishings are opulent and the rooms have a feeling of elegance. I loved the bold red floral wall paper in our room. Everywhere was beautifully clean and well maintained. They provide free tea, coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby 24 hours a day along with cakes and sweets. It was noisy during the night. I could hear guests arriving back at the hotel and I could hear bikes and people out on the street. It is on one of the quieter canals so I guess other hotels have more noise. I didn't find it too much of a problem and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, & I am fussy!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJane03
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 4 nights at the Hotel Estherea. It is an outstanding hotel. It is beautifully decorated and extremely well run. The hotel staff is very helpful. Some of them might be a little formal, but all tried their best to help us in any way they could, from getting dining reservations to having a room for us when we arrived at 7 am - amazing! The location was unbeatable - no matter where we wanted to go in the city, it was an easy walk. We finally took the tram the last night, just for the experience. We had a double without the canal view, but it was very spacious. The bathroom, though small, was both spotless, and well equipped. The price was very fair. Even with the sad state of the dollar, it average the same as a recent stay at the San Diego Embassy Suites. I can't thank all the reviewers enough for all the great information that they have given in their reviews. They helped make our trip go smoothly. From needing our credit card pin number to get the train tickets from the airport to finding the Gollum - a neat brown cafe -your advice was invaluable. I strongly recommend reading all the reviews you can- I felt so comfortable choosing restaurants and finding places - like the advice from about 25 close friends! Don't hesitate trying the Luden - just around the block. The food was terrific, reasonably priced, especially in the Brasserie in the front,and felt like being in Paris. The Cafe Luxembourg was also fun, and just a little further down the street. The soups and fries were especially good. The hotel's location near so many great restaurants is just icing on the cake. We tried the hotel breakfast, and it was very good, but also crowded because they were full while we were there. So we only ate there once. Broodje Bert on the corner serves a bargain full breakfast or just a roll if you want, simple but fun to sit down and watch the world go by in front of you while sipping your coffee. Yes, we had a wonderful time. The weather was cold and rainy - it even snowed. But it didn't matter, we had such a good time in Amsterdam - we recommend it highly- and everyone spoke English!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: SISTERACT4
Reviews.Content: I am just back from the Hotel Estherea having spent 4 nights there with my 3 sisters. We booked a quadruple room (yes we are a close family!) which was quite spacious compared to the cramped offering of Paris the previous year. The hotel is located on the Singel canal which is a quiet part of the city but also very central for site seeing. The hotel has a quaint olde worlde feel to it the moment you enter. Luxurious fabrics, carpets and curtains are used throughout the hotel as well as 2 very spectacular chandeliers in the lobby - quality and class without being stuffy. There is a fantastic aquarium just inside the front door which we spent 10 minutes looking at everytime we left or returned to the hotel! Beakfast was a buffet style and of a very high standard with plenty of variety to cater for all tastes. The other nice touch was the complimentary hot drinks, chocolates, fruit, sweets and cakes which were available throughout the day and of course the resident housecat that occasionally graced the lobby! The staff were also very helpful and courteous. For beer lovers there is a cafe down the side street from the hotel - Cafe Gollem which sells over 200 speciality beers.

Reviews.Title: “canal view”
Reviews.Author: versicals
Reviews.Content: hotel estherea was superb, tastefully furnished, our double room with a canal view was very spacious light and airy, staff friendly and helpful, central for most tourist attractions.Close by there is a delightful street of antique shops which incidentally do not open until 11am, enjoyed our visit, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful place youll never want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: PawsD
Reviews.Content: I was whisked away for my birthday to amsterdam and I have to say that dispite the rain Hotel Estherea really made our trip! There is coffee and tea, cakes and sweets all free of charge in the foyer and if youre ever fortunate enough to see the foyer in this hotel you will definitely be stopping for a while just to enjoy the detail and elegance and of course the breath taking aquarium! The room was fantastic, we had a lovely view overlooking the canal, more than enough room for two with a luxurious seating area and the most comforable bed you will ever have the opportunity sleep in! The breakfast is well worth staying for with excellent choice for every type of visitor before you venture out for the day. The staff were extremely helpful and arranged for our car to be stored for the duration of our stay (as the hotel is so central everything is well within walking distance). They also pre booked the things we decided to do during our stay for us such as ann franks house etc. Well worth asking them to do to avoid the ques. We had an absolutely wondeful time and I had a wonderul birthday. The hotel was absolutely faultless and the attention to detail and comfort was impressive, the only bad thing about this hotel was that it was so comfortable I didnt want to go out during the days! Will definitly be booking this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely memories”
Reviews.Author: Becky76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights after Christmas. The room was very sweet and overlooked the canal and the hotel itself is in a great position - obviously due to the architecture in Amsterdam you do not expect massive rooms but this was perfect. The hotel was very cosy and the downstairs communal area was very inviting with hot drinks and cakes provided all day. The staff were very friendly and on booking we had mentioned it was our wedding anniversary and were given a lovely little four poster and gorgeous chocs with their best wishes. Will definitely stay there again - lovely memories.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: laurendell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my boyfriend in February. Overall, I really liked the hotel. The location is great -- it's on a beautiful, quiet canal, really central to everything we wanted to see. The room (#410) was pretty nice - we had requested a larger room on an upper floor facing the canal and that's what we got. It was a good size with lots of light. 3 large windows which opened to the canal. I think that the website makes the rooms look nicer than they are though - at least our room. I expected it to be a bit more luxurious than it actually was. The orange bedding with pale green & white walls I didn't really like ... but the view of the canal was great. Glad I got a canal view room as it made for some great photos (especially at night). My favorite things about the hotel were the gorgeous lobby, which had a really beautiful and well-done aquarium in it, the location, the view from the room, and the free chocolates and little cakes in the lobby all day. Everytime I went in and out I ate some more chocolate!! A girl can't complain too much with that. Things I didn't like : I agree with a previous poster about the bed, I didn't find it very comfortable, and I think it had a plastic liner on it which made the sheets really rough and you kind of stuck to it in the morning, ew. Also the bathroom was quite tiny and the sink didn't drain very well - but that (the sink) could have probably been fixed if we'd told anyone about it. From the floor plan, it looks like all of the canal facing rooms have small bathrooms - the larger ones are towards the back of the hotel. One of the guys at the front desk was pretty unfriendly. My boyfriend is a native dutch speaker but whenever he would talk to the him he would answer in English and acted really annoyed that my friend kept speaking to him in Dutch. It was really weird. The rest of the staff was friendly and helful though. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and would probably consider staying here again the next time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly noisy”
Reviews.Author: MarcBruxelles
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel with my mother. She had a smoking room, I had a non smoking room, as we had requested. Pretty expensive, 160 euros each + tax and breakfast (363 euros total). The worst thing was the noise from the neighbouring rooms and the lift just outside my room. Paper thin walls and very poor insulation. If I hadn't had my earplugs with me, I wouldn't have got any sleep at all. Very confortable bed, though. Both rooms were extremely cold and my mother woke up with the cold in the middle of the night. She had no idea how to switch on the heating. The staff was not particularly friendly, the blond woman at the reception desk on 17 February was very cold, distant and extremely slow. Pros: location and confortable beds, good breakfast. CONS: very expensive for what it is; TERRIBLY NOISY.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: drewfus
Reviews.Content: A gem in Amsterdam, perfect location we had a great room with a wonderful view of the canal right outside of the hotel. The room was good sized for Europe (meaning my wife and I were able to turn around at the same time). The bed was very soft which was great for my wife less positive for me but all in all I highly recommend the Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - You Can Not Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: leeche
Reviews.Content: HI THERE , my partener and i stayed here from valentines for 4 nights . this hotel is excellant , it is safe / clean , very centrally located , all sites within walking distance . the beds are so comfortable . that staff were very help on all matters . you will enjoy your stay - it is a really nice place and graet value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny212
Reviews.Content: I recently spent the weekend with my boyfriend at the Hotel Estherea and it really was lovely. The location on the Singel canal is perfect; every attraction is within walking distance and there are a number of excellent restaurants very near-by. Although we were in one of the smaller rooms (we got an excellent out of season deal), it was perfectly formed and exceptionally clean. As mentioned in some of the other reviews, one of the nicest touches is the free tea, coffee, hot chocolate and cakes; it feels like such a treat to come in from a day's walking/sight-seeing and to relax in the beautiful reception area. I would without hesitation recommend this hotel and will stay here on any further trips to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: AvisMcc
Reviews.Content: If you are tired of corporate hotels this is the place for you. Small individual hotel near centre easy to find, friendly staff. As a business traveler it was a breath of fresh air. Small standard double room with great view of canal suited us just fine. Try it ;-)

Reviews.Title: “We will never return to Estherea!”
Reviews.Author: cafemarmelade
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel three times, always for at least two nights. The first time we stayed in a room on the top floor. That was ok and we were quite impressed so rebooked to stay before and after flights from Amsterdam. However, these last times were very disappointing. The rooms we stayed in were ok in size, but have the noisiest floorboards ever. It was so bad we hardly slept because of guests moving around above us. We stayed in rooms overlooking the internal courtyard on the first and fourth floors. The reception area is quite cosy, but the coffee machine is often breaking. The staff is a mixed bag. From a very pleasant and helpful young lady, to the most terribly grumpy man on reception. Make sure you check your bill before you leave. The people next to us at check out were charged for breakfast they didn't have and other quests having meetings there were also complaining to the grumpy man about being overcharged. This hotel has totally lost it for us. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkly1London
Reviews.Content: I took my Fiancee here for a 3 night stay for his birthday. We enjoy city breaks and his brother lives here so it killed two birds with one stone. I booked this hotel based on trip advisors rating and I was not disappointed. The hotel is just lovely and the staff extremely polite and helpful. We had the breakfast one of the days and everything was lovely, as were the lamb burgers we ordered from room service one day. I have already recommended this hotel to others and I will definitely book again when we next go to see my fiancee's brother.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: jacqmac
Reviews.Content: Delighted with this Hotel, really felt we had found a little Gem! Fronts onto a canal...lovely...and if you are there on a sunday, stroll along the canal to the local flower stalls...Perfect! Hotel was within easy walking distance of everything, we went at christmas, and there is a small christmas market and ice rink set up in the square! The hotel was beautifully furnished, clean and very friendly. Would love to return. Shuttle bus available from the airport. Finally....the hotel provided the most comfortable PILLOWS I have ever lay on in a hotel!!! I know that sounds mad, but if you are fussy about pillows, like me, you'll appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel BUT”
Reviews.Author: SCP99
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife loved the hotel and I agree with the other reviews. I just feel it need to be mentioned that even though the hotel is one of the best the staff is not. How can such a nice hotel have so unpolite staff. From the day we arrived check-in and everyday we passed the reception it was like this: We are educated to say good morning,afternoon and evening, but when we did that the staff was ignoring us like we where not thier. It was like this everyday everytime we passed the reception. SORRY but for me that makes a diffrence and I hope it was just bad mood the staff was in when we where there. But the hotel is worth visiting !!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: trigcxx
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 40th birthday trip to Amsterdam. The Estherea Hotel was brilliant from start to finsish. The public rooms are all very plush, the bar area though small is very nice and warming. The staff were all very very helpful and polite. The room was on the top floor and was very comfy. The location of the hotel is excellent, once you have found your bearings everything is within walking distance. All in all a very nice 3 nights, we will use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: GoldTraveller
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night in Hotel Estherea in Amsterdam, but it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is well located at one of the canals of Amsterdam. It is quiet and very well located to see many of the main attractions of Amsterdam. You can reach the hotel on foot from the Central railway station (approximately 15 minutes), by public transportation or by taxi (about 10 euro's). The rooms are relatively small (this is Amsterdam after all), but well equipped and the hotel even has a library! In front of the hotel, there is a stop for the museum canal tour.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Indolence”
Reviews.Author: Rangnath
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Estherea. The hotel is excellent with really good service. We were just expecting a few bits but breakfast is a lovely Dutch/continental spread and the restaurants, for an evening meal, are all round the hotel and are of great value with good food. This hotel is one of the most convenient for restaurants, coffee shops and bars. We found a Bar that allows cigar/cigarette smoking and drinking and, although neither of us smoke tobacco, we enjoyed the 'old' style of Dutch Bar and if you want to mix a little luxury with the odd trip shopping then this is an absolute must as it's just round the corner from ALL the shops on the Damrak. The staff at the hotel seem to go by the maxim of, 'we can do it and if we can't then we know someone who can'. This is a 'Family Run Hotel' and family owned in every meaning of the word and it really does feel like home once you get into your room after a day wandering and shopping. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed at in Amsterdam on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Not so inviting Estherea”
Reviews.Author: MissyGalway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. I have been to Amsterdam several times but i found it difficult to find at first and a bit isolated on the way back in the evening. When we checked in i had forgotten my visa card so i paid cash up front... no problem but the guy at the front desk was rude beyond believe.He demanded 250 euro deposit per night and for me thats alot when you are only on a weekend break and it was unexpected. I had to give him 400 euro in the end. This left us with very little cash. When we were shown to our room it was tiny really small. The end of the bed was 1 foot from the wall and there was less than a foot either side of the room.We thought there was no bathroom and when we opened the door to what we thought was a wardrobe it was actually a toilet and tiny bath. When you closed the "toilet" door there was a 4inch gap really nice. I spoke to the front desk and they said they would change rooms the next day and to be fair they did give us a nice room at the top of the house. I did not enjoy this hotel at all i found the staff rude and unhelpful and the facilates poor.Watch what room you get i did request and pay for a deluxe to start with however there idea of deluxe is a view of the canal.This hotel is not worthy of a four star more basic 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, high-class comfort”
Reviews.Author: crisro
Reviews.Content: Was so completely disappointed with the Brower down the street we checked a website and found room specials at this place for only 10 euros a night more (and no breakfast). If you look for specials, this place is in no way overpriced. Great location, beautiful, comfortable, spacious rooms and an exemplary staff.. The canal room had a wonderful view and we felt like royalty the whole six days we were there. They may not serve breakfast, but for about 5 euros, you can pick up some wonderful broodjes (great sandwiches) or pastries right next door. Especially after our poor experience down the street, we could not have asked for a better respite and rescue. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed it..”
Reviews.Author: steo
Reviews.Content: We are a couple that satyed there for 3 nights this dcember. We had a great room No 316 with no view at the canal, but really we didnt care a bit..The bed was lovely the bathroom great and every morning an excellent breakfast waited for as. We will go again for sure in this great hotel. stefanos - eleni Greece

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: sofiSweden
Reviews.Content: I found that this hotel didn't warrent the over 200 EUR a night we paid for it. The room was tiny and the bathroom was more like a closet. The location was quite good however. I would not recommend it and not go back due to the fact that you would expect more given the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Traveller from UK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Estherea. Having stayed there twice before we had high expectations and were a bit disappointed with the size of our room (411). There was barely any space and it had the smallest wardrobe we have ever seen....it held three coat hangers once clothers were on them!!!! To open the safe and the fridge we had to move the bedside table and although there were 20 lights in the room, it was very dark. The bathroom was very clean but very tiny. There was always plenty of lovely hot water but we could have done with more towels. Breakfast was very nice and there was an excellent selection of food. Having free coffee etc in the lobby was a bonus. It may seem that we are being fussy but the hotel is not cheap and we were expecting a room the same size as we had had on our previoius visits. The hotel is ideally placed on the Singel canal, minutes from Dam Square. Would we return, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in one of the best town's locations...”
Reviews.Author: fitzstudio66
Reviews.Content: This wasn't my first stay at Estherea in Amsterdam but, since last time, the hotel finished the restructuring works and the result is really EXCELLENT! The lobby is much bigger, as well the breakfast room; our room had a great Singel's canal view and we are [me and my girlfriend] very very happy of the romantic weekend we spend there... An hotel that I highly suggest for a romantic weekend in a wonderful town like Amsterdam... A very special mention to the incredible BIG aquarium in the lobby that you can spend hours watching it... A real masterpiece!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, sumptuous and incredibly romantic”
Reviews.Author: Dublingirl-7
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at this beautiful hotel last week. We had a room overlooking the canal and it was amazing. The room itself wasn't terribly big but it was spotlessly clean and decorated with beautiful fabrics and furniture. The room had three windows overlooking the canal and at night the view with the lights from the houses opposite was so magical. The bathroom again was spotlessly clean and had everything you'd need. From the moment you enter the lobby of the hotel you know you've made the right choice. Luxurious fabrics all around, a gorgeous library to sit and read in and beautiful couches in which to relax and have a drink. The location of the hotel is excellent and they have a list of recommended restaurants in your room which we went by and had two lovely meals. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Erkmen
Reviews.Content: I have been to many, but many hotels due to my business. But never been such a lovely, cosy hotel. It is not the best luxuries hotel, it is not the best comfortable hotel, but it is an amazing place to stay. It is even hard to call Estherea a hotel, it has far better looking than those "industrial" hotels. The hotel is located on the edge of Singel canal in between Dam square and Rembrandt square. Easy walking distance to all important sights. The receptionist staff is very helpful and the rooms are so comfortable. The bathroom is georgeous.. Since now I have stayed at Krasnopolsky, Swissotel, Radisson Sas, NH Schiller, NH City centre in Amsterdam and Estherea is way a head of all of them. All mentioned hotels are also nice, but they are "Hotels", Estherea has its own spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jed_bartlet
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff (one of whom, by coincidence, knew a member of my family) and fantastic location. I would happily go back. I fully intend to.

Reviews.Title: “You can't smoke cannabis here !”
Reviews.Author: JLM_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Estheria for the first time and would advise anyone who wants a cozy, friendly, and smoke free enviornment to give it a try. I heard people complain about paying $15.00 for breakfast but the complementry hot drinks, cakes, biscuits and fruit available in their fantastic lobby/bar 24 hours a day more more than compensate for this. The Estheria has an in house rule that bans the smoking of any cannabis products ANYWHERE in the hotel. They will add $150 to your bill should they catch you, and they WILL catch you! They have very few smoking rooms(tobacco only) so make sure you make it clear when you book if you need a smoking room. A great hotel for non smokers. If you smoke but dont have a smoking room you will have to smoke on the street! We will be returning in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Trip Adviser recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: SHartland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Estherea Hotel. As mentioned by previous reviewers the hotel is excellent; a great location, a super room (we had a room with a view over the canal) but most of all the staff and customer service were what really made our stay. They could not do enough for us,the welcome was genuine and the advice offered on tours/eating out etc was spot on. This hotel deserved the praise and title of "most romantic hotel in Europe"!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: scotslassml9
Reviews.Content: stayed here last year and was dying to book again this year but got two trips this month so was just above our budget but totally recommend this hotel especilly upgraded canal view room which we got frre charge. good view, good service although reception over charged our internet price so take your proof but highly recommend beautiful surrounings.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel - worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Harrie_68
Reviews.Content: When I read the last review of this hotel I thought it must have been written by the manager - maybe I still think that...but everything he/she wrote is true. This hotel is beautiful. The location is fantastic - on the Singel canal - peaceful, but only a stone's throw from bars and restaurants. We had room 210 - looking over the canal - four poster bed - v. comfortable - v. clean. Lovely white bed linen. Downstairs there is free tea/coffee/hot chocolate, biscuits and cakes. Really useful when we were there as it was freezing. The staff are v welcoming - perfect English and you can book lots of things at the front desk - the Canal hopper tickets for example. They can also lend you an umbrella. There is a restaurant called Casa di David almost opposite - great atmosphere and great Italian food - and only a minutes stagger back to the hotel! I can't recommend this place enough - when we go back to Amsterdam - which we definitely will, I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “awesome estherea”
Reviews.Author: z235e49
Reviews.Content: planning a trip for february, 2008 we recalled how enjoyable our stay in feb. 2007 was at the estherea. we had a canal view room, on a higher floor. had a beautiful view of the singel canal and the low rise 17th century skyline. room was clean, nicely furnished and extremely comfortable. very peaceful residential area. incredible location. we went all over this beautiful city without taking a cab, bus or tram. excellent little greek restaurant right next door. everything was totally home made.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed This Time”
Reviews.Author: cherylMerseyside
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time in the Estherea - we loved this hotel on our previous 2 visits and had booked in for 4 nights this time but it proved to be 3rd time unlucky for us. On arrival were were allocated a very small room - the bed was so tiny we wondered how 2 people could fit into it. Also our room overlooked a very noisy building site which we believe should have been brought to our attention when checking in. This hotel is not cheap so we decided to complain. The receptionist was a grumpy middle aged chap who eventually agreed to move us although he was not apologetic at all. We were moved to a very spacious quiet room and were more than happy with it. Unfortunately our experience has made us doubtful if we would go back to this hotel for a 4th time - a shame really.

Reviews.Title: “What else is there to say?”
Reviews.Author: Dorsetlad
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent location. Yes, many of the rooms are on the small side (especially compared with the USA) but big enough unless you have lots of luggage. Useful list of recommended nearby restaurants in the hotel room brochure. Our favourite was the Haesje Claes - the menu included in the brochure shows only a tiny sample of what's on offer there. One tip: think carefully before buying an "IAmsterdam" card - you will need to be pretty busy to make it worthwhile, and nearly all the main sites are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldma
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! Our double room was small with no canal view. I requested one, but no rooms were available. Still, room was nice and cosy and the bed absolutely fab! Bathroom was also small, but again nice and clean. Free tea,coffee and hot chocolate with cakes in lobby! Location is central but nice and quiet! Overall we were very pleased with our stay. Tip - If you like tea/coffee in your room without going downstairs, get a travel kettle with you, very handy! We never travel without it:)

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: BlakeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in a perfect location. Charming, beautiful and personal. Loved everything about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveski
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Estherea from 14-18 Oct. Chose the hotel because of great reviews and was not disappointed. Decent sized room(516) was well appointed with a comfy bed and large bathroom. Have been to Amsterdam a few times and the Estherea is by far the nicest hotel I've stayed in. Also the best location. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel....!”
Reviews.Author: AnaMo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of those rare things...a perfect fit. Not a big chain so it had a personal touch, but very well appointed. The location was excellent in one of the inner canal rings on Singel. There was great dining and shopping nearby. We stayed at a chain hotel for one night before Estherea and it was more expensive and much less pleasant. Our Estherea room was just configured great, the bathroom had 2 sinks, plenty of room and a great shower (the actual bath faucet has to be turned the the left to get the shower to work-it was a bit tricky). The rooms were updated with great linens and very clean. The common areas were very cozy. I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant. Breakfast is very pricey and we didn't want to eat that much so we went a few doors down to get a baguette for breakfast-1 Euro. One thing I loved about the hotel was the free coffee/tee bar they have in the lobby. It's a beautiful bit of custom-built carpenty that has all sorts of teas, sweeteners, and an awesome coffee maker where you just press a button. This is a great perk in a hotel when you just want to get going in the morning and don't want to have to sit down and order a simple cup of coffee. We couldn't stop saying how great we thought the hotel was. We paid a bit more for a canal view (our room was 314 and great) but it really made our stay nicer being able to look out onto the canal. I totally recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at Hotel Estherea & Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rodeli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Estherea at the end of August. The hotel is very central and within walking distance to the main attractions like Dam square, the Red Light District, museums and Central Station. The service provided by the staff at the front desk was excellent - both at check in & check out as well as with any requests during our stay regarding places to visit and reservations for lunch or dinner. Our room was spacious and very comfortable and the bathroom spotless. A pleasant surprise especially after a day spent sightseeing was the coffee/hot chocolate provided in the foyer for guests. We loved our stay in Amsterdam and at Hotel Estherea and if we ever return we certainly will look forward to staying at Hotel Estherea again. Thank you to all for making our stay a really memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jabby1
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 with 3 teenage boys. The location was perfect, in the middle of the "9 streets" section and it allowed us to walk almost everywhere. We walked to the red light district, the museums, the train station and the casino all within a 15 minute walk. great restraunts on left out of the hotel, one block then down to the next street then left to the next street, away from the canel. we left the boys in bed and got breakfast at a close-by pancakes cafe each morning we found the hotel breakfast to be expensive and not that good. The staff was very helpful but a little snootie. our room overlooked the singel canal. we had two rooms which ajoined at at a "T" at the end of the hallway. there was a main door which allowed us to keep the room doors open between us and each room had its own door as well.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great location, tiny and noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: FreezeM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a beautiful October Saturday in 2006. The good: the location is perfect. It's right near all the tourist attractions, on a beautiful canal on a relatively quiet street. The hotel staff was polite (though not very warm and friendly) and helpful with directions. The entree, the lobby, the rooms (see photo), hallways and the restaurant areas are very well and tastefully decorated. It's classy from the outside (see photo) and from the inside. Everything is very clean. The price for breakfast (14 euros) is not expensive. Complementary hot chocolate, coffee and tea is available 24 hours a day in the lobby. The shower was powerful and fully made up for the small bath you had to stand in to enjoy it. The bad: we were placed in a tiny (see photo) 'normal' double room (but with a great view of the canal, see photo). They did say that if the room was too small, we could switch and this was one of the smallest room in the hotel. We only spend there one night, so with little luggage it was ok for one night. We would not have stayed in that room for any longer. The bathroom was tiny too. There was not enough room for two people. There wasn't even enough room for one! Another bad thing was the noise. We could hear the people above us walking around in their room, we could hear the slamming of closet doors from our neighbors and all the noise from the hallways. Also we couldn't seem to get the heater down, the temperature was centrally controlled. It caused the room to be way too warm and the air to be as dry as the air in airplanes. Our eyes even hurt a bit! So we slept with the window open. But the window did cause the street sounds to come in. Even though this is a relatively quiet street in Amsterdam, there is really no such thing as a quiet street in Amsterdam. We ended up sleeping very little hours. Breakfast was good, but nothing special. They run out of fresh fruit and the boiled eggs were disgusting. Like everywhere in Amsterdam, parking is awful. I just wanted to mention it, but you probably won't find a hotel with better parking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: GermanyBrandi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Estherea for two nights on a 1.5 week road trip through Netherlands and Belgium. This hotel was fantastic! Elegantly decorated, courteous staff, great location away from all the street noise. They have coffee, tea and hot chocolate available in the lobby 24 hours a day, and they also keep a bottle of chilled mint water at the bar for your use. We stayed in a general "deluxe" room, so we did not have a canal view; but the room was a good size for us, decorated well, and my husband was thrilled that there was air conditioning in the room as well! All in all, this is definitely a 4 star property located in a good location in a very nice city. You will not be disappointed with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “we will return”
Reviews.Author: jackandruth
Reviews.Content: Above expectation. No excuses, delays, problems, and apologies. We prefer quiet solitude than overstated lobbys and understated rooms and steer away from hotel chains catering to families. Not that we don't like kids, just when they aren't our own. Rooms were spacious and tastefully appointed. Deluxe rooms were the same price as a standard room everywhere else. Quiet, elegant ambiance and furnishings. Ideal location. Secluded from the main street hustle and bustle and trams along a peaceful canal, five minutes walk to everything, ten minutes to everything else. In all aspects, this hotel earns its four stars, although their breakfast buffet was a bit pricey and we opted for finding our own as was advised on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafemarmelade
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel from the moment we drove up to the front door. We were met by Rudy, who was wonderful and took care of us very well. We arrived early, at 10am. Rudy took care of our luggage and brought us coffee until our room was ready. We had a room with a canal view on the fourth floor. 412 if I remember rightly. The room was quite large, very nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. The check in staff were polite and professional. We loved sitting in the lovely lobby drinking coffee and resting our aching feet. There is a coffee/hot chocolate/tea machine in the lobby where you can help yourself 24 hours a day. The aquarium in the hotel is also amazing. The hotel is in a quiet and central location, within walking distance of many of the sights. Good restaurants can be found in the street behind the hotel, and lots of shops in the pedestrian street behind that. We did not have breakfast at the hotel. There is a great place on the corner called Bertje, or something similar. They do a good breakfast for 7 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: dekane
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful night at Hotel Estherea. Great location, very hospitable,nice extras such as coffee, hot chocolate and snacks.Rooms are very nice and comfortable. Also had a wonderful private tour fron Wynard at Senior Holland Travel very enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “The best hot chocolate”
Reviews.Author: zaydeboy
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving in Amsterdam I e-mailed hotel for directions from Central Station. They were prompt in giving accurate directions. After checking in we asked several questions to understand how to get around. Front desk staff was basically cold and and not helpful. Amsterdam was interesting but not easy to get around. The hotel room was clean, location was fine but would not be a country we would look forward to visiting again. The hotel offered hot chocolate and coffee in their lobby area as a courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gohop
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel, pleasant reception area and staff friendly. Room was a lovely size and well equipped, a friend also stayed but their room was a little small. Walking distance of all areas of the city. Loved Amsterdam can't wait to go back would book same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and quiet in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: micklois
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Estherea in June and decided to return , not dissapointed at all , a better view this time with our friends and us getting canal view rooms on the first floor , although some noise is apparent from rooms above its not too disturbing , Great location 5 min Rembrandt square , 5 mins Red light District , 5 mins Dam Square , 10 mins centraal station . Buffet Breakfast at â‚¬14 is good value , fruit juices , breads , toast , bacon ,eggs , scrambled , fresh fruit and plenty of tea and coffee . Tea and coffee available day and night free of charge , biscuits and pastries replenished on a regular basis . Absolute quality rooms decorated and furnished to a high standard , no wonder this hotel is consistently out performing its rivals in the same price bracket , beleive me you will get a quality experience at the Estherea without braking the bank

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, lovely breakfast and fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: carolandbob
Reviews.Content: As a trip leader for a NJ Ski Club, I brought a group of 46 to the Hotel Estherea for 3 nights after a week of skiing in Italy in March. Everyone was so impressed with the hotel and its staff, that my husband and I returned the first weekend in Sept. with 6 friends before embarking on a cruise. The rooms are clean and well appointed. Although the rooms that faced the street to the rear of the hotel had larger double-sink marble bathrooms , we again opted for the front rooms with 4 canal facing windows for a wonderful view. Ask for Rooms 110, 112, 210 or 212. for a canal view. For a city with pricey hotels, we were happy to pay 185 euro per night to stay in such an elegant small hotel. It is quite comfortable to sit in the lobby or read a newspaper in the library while enjoying a complimentary cup of coffee, tea or hot chocolate and cookies. There is also a small staffed bar. The buffet breakfast was included in the price and was nicely done. It included eggs, sausages, cold cuts and cheeses, cereals, fresh fruits and juices, and marvelous assortment of homebaked breads and pastries. It's location on Singel makes it a short walk to all the attractions and around the corner from the excellent classic Dutch restaurant, Haesje Claes.

Reviews.Title: “You probably can't go wrong here.”
Reviews.Author: m0thily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a welcome respite in a city of questionable lodgings. The decor is classy and warm, and it has an old charm that for once *doesn't* mean "run-down and cramped." The room we stayed in (four nights) was small. Not quite Manhattan small, but definitely not spacious. Enough room for two people and two suitcases. The bed was comfortable and large, and the hotel staff was more than willing to give us extra pillows. We had a view of some other rooms' windows (very close by), so we had to keep the curtains closed at all times. If possible, I'd recommend asking for a room with an exterior view. The bathroom was clean and luxurious. My only gripe with the bathroom was that the towels were a bit too small. Chalk that up to Americans wanting everything to be oversized! The breakfast buffet here is pretty decent... I think we paid 14 euros per person, and we got fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs, pastries, etc. Standard, but fresh and well-stocked. They gave us free (small) bottles of water in the guest room every day, which is a nice touch. Unfortunately, I think our guest room was right above the kitchen area, so every morning around 7am, we heard the swinging doors to the kitchen and the clanging of plates right through the vents in our room. It wasn't a huge deal, and might not be an issue in other rooms, but you might want to bring earplugs just in case, if you plan on sleeping past 7am. Another minor gripe is the hotel's strange policy of wanting you to leave your room key at the front desk when you leave. The keys are on a keyring that has a magnificently posh tassle on it... which would be cumbersome to carry around, anyway. But this means that you have to wait in line at the front desk to get your key or drop off your key. In other words, allow yourself a few minutes on the way back to your guest room. ...I'm reluctant to mention it here, but you have to wonder how easy it would be for a thief to get into a guest room by simply asking the staff for a certain guest room's key by number. They didn't check our ID or anything when we asked for our key. In all, we'd recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam. The neighborhood is quiet but close to everything (we're big walkers and were able to walk everywhere). You probably can't go wrong with this hotel in terms of comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Palace”
Reviews.Author: Najdyah
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel, it's in the middle of all the attraction, the entrance of the hotel make you feel as if you entering a small palace, they serve you coffee tea hot chocolate and some muffins in the lobby for free all day long, our room was small but ok, when you want to book make sure that you take a big room in the upper floor far from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hufsa
Reviews.Content: I found Estherea through Trip Advisor, and thught it looked wonderful, which indeed it was. I travelled with my father and grandparents and we all agreed it was a great place to stay in Amsterdam. The location was wonderful, in a part of town which is quiet but close to everything. The rooms were very charming, and we all had canal view, which truly gives you the right Amsterdam feeling. The staff was friendly, the breakfast nice, there was complementary tea, coffee, cakes and fruit in the lobby and the bar was NEVER closed;-) We had a wonderful stay, and for future stays in Amsterdam I know where I will stay!.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel-Canâ€™t Wait To Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: EnglandKez
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best hotel we have ever stayed in. It looks as if it has had a total refurb as all fittings, furnishings are immaculate and appear to be new. The bed in our room (No. 114) is extremely comfy. The bath tub is large and new plus deep double basins - and the pink towels were fluffy and soft. The location overlooking the Singel Canal is perfect and everything is within walking distance. Our room had three large windows and it was nice to sit on the window sills and look out. Tea/coffee and drinking chocolate were freely availabile at all times, including cookies and a selection of cakes laid out just off the reception area. A great inexpensive breakfast can be had for approximately 7 euros at "Broodje Bert's" which is located outside the hotel, turn left and on the next corner - also down the little alley way can be found "The Cracked Kettle" where good inexpensive wines can be purchased and the guy there will also uncork it for you !!! - also beers can be purchased. Amsterdam is a great walking city but one big word of warning - forget about any problems with pickpockets, drunks or druggies the big menace are the cyclists. They come straight at you in the dark as well at full speed.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the nicest hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: offbeatgirl
Reviews.Content: I'd originally planned to book a cheap room for my break in Amsterdam, but when I looked around I realised that anything central and ensuite would be expensive, and many places had a three nights minimum stay policy. In the end I decided it would be worth paying a little extra to stay somewhere with a good rating and location, and managed to get a discount rate via travelocity. I requested a room facing the canal when booking, but as I had paid a fairly low rate, I felt this might be rather hopeful of me. I was delighted therefore when I checked in to be assigned a large room on the first floor with several large windows looking directly on to the canal. The room decor was impeccable and the bathroom also clean and well proportioned. As other reviewers have mentioned, the free tea/coffee/hot chocolate was appreciated, and the public spaces in the hotel were well maintained. I didn't take breakfast in the hotel but ate out at one of the many excellent bagels + beans cafes which are dotted around the city, and which I am now slightly addicted to! I do think this is probably the nicest hotel I have stayed in, however I have some sympathy with earlier reviewers who found themselves given a small room looking out over a back street. Requesting a canal view in advance certainly worked for me and I'd suggest that if this is important to you, then you mention when booking and fingers crossed!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel of our two week Europe trip”
Reviews.Author: iblaurajc
Reviews.Content: This was our first and favorite hotel of a two week Europe vacation (we stayed in 6 hotels). The Estherea is sparkling clean, rooms of acceptable size. Charming boutique hotel with a gorgeous, welcoming, cozy lobby with separate sitting rooms. Fresh orchids everywhere. Free coffee (mediocre), tea and hot chocolate at all hours, often with snacks as well. GREAT quiet location on Singel canal a couple blocks from Dam Square. Staff seemed competent , if not particularly warm (although I will single out one guy, Igor, who worked hard to get us reservations for the Anne Frank house when there was a problem with the internet site). By the way, you must have reservations to Anne Frank; we went at 7:30 pm and there was still a line around the block. We didnt' have problems getting into any other museums. Only downside was the charge for internet - 5 euros for a half hour. All other hotels during our European stay offered free internet use. We would definitely stay here again and look no further. Another nice touch- refrigerator in room stocked with two free bottles of water each day of our 3 night stay. We absolutely loved this hotel. Felt great to return here each night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMcD789
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel when booking our flights through easyjet. We went here for our honeymoon and stayed for 4 nights. On the second day we moved rooms to a smoking room. Rooms were not huge but planty big for the 2 of us. Ensuite bathroom with bath and shower. Daily room service put out fresh towels. Restaurant downstairs only served breakfast which we did not have as it was cheaper to go out. Sat tv in the room with option of Smoovie for 10 euros a night. Mini fridge and safe in room. Excellent stay, staff very friendly, beautiful hotel. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a liittle gem”
Reviews.Author: gr8escapes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this lovely hotel. After much searching on the net for a hotel in amsterdam, decided on the Estherea after reading the excellent reviews on trip advisor, also helped by the many photos posted on this site. It was a last minute break for myself and my husband and I contacted the hotel direct as was slightly worried about the room size-and explained that I would like a large room if possible as am quite claustophobic unfortunately. Despite such a late reservation a prompt reply followed with no problem re the room size. On arrival we were delighted with the location of the hotel being in a quiet part of the city and in lovely surroundings. Our room 514 was right at the top of the hotel but really spacious and absolutely lovely-very comfortable bed and huge bathroom. Our whole exepreince of amsterdam was lovely and we will certainly be returning to the Estherea! Don't hesitate-book it and enjoy-we certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “Need to be a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: RWCFamily
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the first two nights of our trip to Europe with our toddler. I knew it was a little out of the way and wanted to make sure we were in a quiet location to get our sleep. I was pleasently suprised when we got there. It was very elegant and clean and in a beautiful location. However, we were woken each night by noise from above. The building is very old (hence the charm), but the walls are paper thin. The first night, I woke up every 30 minutes due to noise. The second night, we all woke at 12:30. The man in the room above us was having a "meeting". We called the front desk several times since none of us could sleep. Finally, my husband took my (now crying) daugher to the lobby and the front desk clerk handed him the keys to the suite on the top floor. We moved, but by this point the whole night and the next day were shot. If you can stay on the TOP floor, I highly recommend this hotel. Otherwise, you better be a good sleeper. I regret to say that I had read other complaints about noise in this hotel before making my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marmin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and very comfortable surroundings. Little to add to earlier reviews and highly recommended. The only negative observation was that it is not wheelchair friendly - but this is amsterdam so goes with the territory.

Reviews.Title: “Estherea Lives Up to its Fine Reputation”
Reviews.Author: MahrtianWanderer
Reviews.Content: We had elevated expectations about the Estherea, given the positive reviews, and we are happy to report that this small hotel is indeed a great find. Our room was very comfortable, recently renovated and decorated with superb taste and a sense of style. The beds were deep and comfy; the chairs and other furniture luxurious, in an old world way. It had a large bath with a double sink, which I did not expect. The public areas on the ground floor are especially inviting, for a coffee and a sweet treat, or a drink in the evening. These rooms have fabulous wood paneling, particularly in the stunning library. Everything was very well maintained and in perfect working order. The unexpected bonus about the Estherea is that it is in a great location, on the innermost canal known as Singel. The back of the hotel looks over Spuistraat, which has an abundance of the city's best restaurants, cafes and bookstores. We had all of our dinners (four nights) at restaurants that were within a block of the hotel - Haseje Claes, Kantjil and Tigre, and the Luden. All very different and all highly recommended. The Greek deli next door and the bakery down the alley on Spuistraat are also outstanding. You can tell we did our fair share of eating while in Amsterdam. From the Estherea, we could walk 15 minutes and be at the Rijksmuseum, the van Gogh, or the Concertgebouw. Or, one can take the street trolley, which is also just a block from the hotel. And, for the sheer pleasure of it, just wandering around the neighborhood, seeing the magnificent buildings on those delightful canals, peeking into stores and brasseries, bakeries and boutiques, taking in what makes Amsterdam so special, is the best reason to stay at the Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “Small and elegant”
Reviews.Author: rms11
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Estherea and could not have been more pleased with their service, location, and atmosphere. The staff from the front desk to the maids is very professional. We walked to everything (Dam Square, Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Red Light District, Rembrandt Square, and various shopping areas). You could have a breakfast buffet in the hotel for 14 euros or go to the corner cafe and enjoy breakfast for 7 euros. The lobby of the hotel has complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate, assorted candies and mints in addition to afternoon pastries and fruit. Trams and restaurants are within a block or two. They even lent us umbrellas and gave us complimentary plastic ponchos when it rained.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
