Reviews.Author: FunTrvlCpl
Reviews.Content: This is very nice hotel that exceeded our expectations. We had a spacious room(#507) that faced the canal, it really couldnâ€™t have been nicer. We especially liked the free coffee and snacks in the lobby. The staff was always helpful and went above and beyond. I asked for simple directions for driving and the staff member got online and printed out mapquest directions for me, very nice! One important item that is not mentioned on their website is that a trolly runs close by from the central train station. If you take the train from the Airport(very easy), you get off at Central Station and catch the #2 trolly. This will take you steps from the hotel. We tried to get a taxi from the train station and they wanted to double the price because it wasnâ€™t that far of a drive. Only because we didnâ€™t know about the trolly at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Three-night break”
Reviews.Author: KeithWhiteparish
Reviews.Content: I would find it hard to fault this hotel (beyond the fact that our room (416) had only a view of another bedroom window approx 3-4m away). The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room very comfortable, the bathroom large and spotless, with mirrors, shower, hairdryer etc. all very good. The free and ever-ready tea, coffee and chocolate machine a welcome bonus. Plus, the location was just right --- along the Singelgracht canal, in a quiet area that boasts many good restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. I would recommend highly, and certainly stay there again, when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: gweaffer
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Estherea hotel. Location ideal, can easily walk to most attractions. Although the room was small the canal view was a treat. Comfortable bed with nice crisp white sheets and soft pillows. Lounge and bar area tastefully decorated, nice little touches included glass jars of sweets, complimentary tea, coffee, and cakes. My only gripe was the monotonous music played in the bar. Complimentary bottles of water in the room was appreciated. On request ironing boards and irons were available. Reception where friendly and polite. Would stay at the Estherea again however, would like to book a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: nisarocks
Reviews.Content: Hotel Estherea is in perfect walking distance of all of Amsterdam. Located on the Singel Canal. We were lucky to get a room at the very top of the hotel. The staff was amazing. The room, incredible! The softest sheets and down comforter. Better than home! The decor was fantastic. They served coffee and hot chocolate all day. Right around the corner of the hotel was an amazng bakery that served up the most delicious ham and cheese croissants. I would love to come back to the Estherea. The atmosphere was elegant!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed at in Euope!”
Reviews.Author: stinker30
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed 3 nights and I were very impressed with this hotel! It was so cute and romantic. We booked it without doing much research, just knew we wanted to stay near dam square. The overall experience was great. It's on one of the canals, and our room actually had large windows that opened up and looked over a quaint street on the other side. Really was a nice room. Everything was very clean, had everything we needed, the staff was so friendly and helpful. We were there on our honeymoon, and the first day after we stepped out for a while the staff put a nice gift in our room for our honeymoon. It's such a cute hotel. We also stayed at a 5 star hotel in London and in Paris, but still this hotel took the cake for us.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which oozes charm”
Reviews.Author: gerard2178
Reviews.Content: 15th July 2007 - Chris and Janet, Cheshire, UK My wife and I have just returned from a 4 day break in Amsterdam. We were very impressed by the quality and style of the buildings fronting onto the various canals as well as the choice and variety of restaurants,cafes , museums etc., To cap it all, Hotel Estherea was a fine example of a beautifully refurbished hotel with a stylish reception area and attentive staff. Our room on the 4th floor overlooked the canal - room 414 - and the hotel was ideally situated for a great range of restaurants and snack bars. A wonderful holiday and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Estherea a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Abbycam
Reviews.Content: What a delightful experience! We had been warned that there was construction work going on in the Hotel but we saw none--only evidence that everything was newly redone and lovely. Hotel staff extremely helpful booking us restaurants and musem tickets. Great library to sit and read. Excellent buffet breakfast (extra cost) The candies in a jar on the bar were out of this world! We stayed in a very small (like most European hotels) room with no canal view and were very satisfied. All new fixtures and freshly decorated. It was very quiet. My only suggestion is travel light--there is virtually NO room for suitcases--but you knew that, right?

Reviews.Title: “A gem with charming touches”
Reviews.Author: Cardiffgirl
Reviews.Content: The Esselaar family who own and run the Estherea believe in creating a â€˜home from homeâ€™ with attention to detail and many charming touches. With sofas to grow old in and treats round every corner, the hotelâ€™s popularity is deserved. Simply, the Estherea is a gem. I found all the staff friendly, polite and efficient. On arrival Igor welcomed us with useful information and Ricardo whisked us up to our room in the comfortable lift. The exuberant dÃ©cor features chandeliers and large floral displays - the red velvet double seat is worth the Most Romantic Trip Advisor rating alone. Children of all ages will enjoy finding Nemo in the vast and colourful aquarium. I believe children are given a small gift. I used the payphone cubicle to make good value calls home. People seemed to enjoy the internet with printer (â‚¬5 for half an hour, I think) but we used the Easy Internet CafÃ© on the Damrak (â‚¬2 an hour). We didnâ€™t get time to enjoy the well-stocked library with its guide books, magazines and novels but after a long day walking the Estherea felt like an oasis from Amsterdamâ€™s excesses. Situated on the peaceful Singel canal between the flower market, the up and coming Jordaan area and the Dam Square the Estherea is ideally situated. Note: if you get off at Spui from the 5 or 12 tram as recommended in an earlier review youâ€™ll have to drag your cases back a full block across cobbles. The previous stop is a little closer, though in retrospect I think the trip from the station with heavy luggage could be worth a cab. During our stay the treats included strawberries and thick fresh cream, stroopwaffles, pastries and iced mint tea. The breakfast had plenty of choice, including the Dutch favourite of chocolate strands, flakes and vermicelli (hundreds-and-thousands in UK) to sprinkle on bread. There were plenty of choices for eating and drinking nearby, including fresh crispy spanakopitas in the Greek deli next door. Room 312 was a good size for Amsterdam - airy, with a lovely view over the canal and not much noise. We found the safe and air conditioning simple once weâ€™d worked them out â€“ perhaps they could have more explanation. It was good to find complimentary mineral waters every day in the minibar, also a steam iron and board in the wardrobe. The TV had BBC 1, 2, World, CNN, Discovery and pay channels in English. The bathroom was pretty and clean with elegant but practical facilities including a magnifying mirror, a washing line and a good long shelf to keep everything dry. Along with wall dispensers their Hydro basics toiletries had a botanic aroma suitable for men and women. I am sorry the last reviewer had a bad experience but when I think how much I have paid for bleak Amsterdam hotels with cramped rooms and no lift, I thought the Estherea was excellent value. Just one warning â€“ I am now addicted to the Rademakerâ€™s Hopjes coffee sweets they had on the counter but I canâ€™t find them in the UK. I suppose weâ€™ll just have to go back â€¦

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - why is it so highly rated”
Reviews.Author: PhilosParis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly rated and we cannot understand why when you have so much choice in Amsterdam for others. They first proposed room 405 (standard room) which is a very tiny room with no view (there are others like this one actually). You can actually find better in an economy hotel for far less money. We refused the room (they were maybe expecting we would accept it because we booked it on the internet with a discount - why do they have to try it, thinking people are stupid - it is always unpleasant to refuse rooms). We changed to room 415. This room was a little bit bigger, still with no view and had really nothing special. We had to accept it as we were told there was nothing else. We waked up several times during the two nights of our stay. We could actually hear each step of the neighbors on top (what is unpleasant) and more important the hotel was noisy (you can easely hear the neighbors when they come during the night, when they leave in the morning or when they just talk). On top of that, the shower was not working the second day. Globally, we found this hotel very expensive for what it is (especially if you have to pay 250 euros for a standard - basic room) and were disappointed. Of course, the location is good and the bibliotheque charming but this is not obviously where people sleep and rest to better enjoy the city later on.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite City and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leavingNJ
Reviews.Content: From the first second we arrived, my mother and I, the staff was very warm and friendly. They let us see many options for our room before we chose the one we stayed in. The rooms were very well kept with a very fancy decor. The rooms had a refridgerator, safe, hairdryer, ac, heat, and a tv. The hotel had an elevator which helps with carrying luggage up the narrow and steep houses of amsterdam. The front desk was so helpful with arranging dinner or attraction reservations. The last thing that I found very impressive was that the hallway by the restaurant, had coffee, hot chocolate, hot water for tea and at many times of the day, they had fresh fruits and pastries. The hotel location is fantastic. Just two blocks from Dam square, but yet the hotel is situated in a quieter area. The hotel is also near the tram stops in front of the palace. I would recommend that you see, the Anne Frank house, Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and take a bike tour or walking tour of the city to see all the historic sights. Parting notes: Take a canal tour, ride bikes through the city, and visit the historic quater and the red light district. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Strawberries and cream!”
Reviews.Author: lovetoroam_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights, 17th - 21st June and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was lovely and I thought quite spacious, the staff were helpful and we really enjoyed the complimentary refreshments in the lobby, on a really hot day to come back to fresh strawberries and cream and a slice of gateau was bliss! I would recommend Casa David for a lovely italian meal and service, we also enjoyed a pizza cruise along the canal. If visiting Anne Franks house be sure to get your tickets first from the Tourist Office located at the main railway station, then all you have to do is buzz the bell and go straight in.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet backwater very close to the centre. In fact the area is charming with lots of interesting shops and restaurants away from some of the busier (tackier) parts of Amsterdam. We booked a deluxe room on the hotels own website and requested a canal view. The room was quite small (but that is normal in cities like Amsterdam) but it was very nicely decorated and maintained. Nice bathroom with all the usual amenities. View of the canal was lovely. As stated by other reviewers the complimentary coffee, cookies, cakes and fruit etc is very nice. Breakfast at 14 Euros was also quite good. We loved the hotel and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say one bad thing about this hotel!! Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: supremecourt25
Reviews.Content: This hotel hands-down deserves the Traveler's Choice award (very proudly displayed on their front counter - so cute!). I requested room 417 because I had read it had a really nice canal view. I kind of badgered the hotel about it before arriving, which apparently worked because I got room 317, which also had a nice view. They knew exactly my preferences when I checked in! Nice size room, gorgeous linens, although the bathroom towels were itty-bitty! Very odd. Great bath products and the shower had a retractable clothesline, which was really cool and which we utilized. I paid 220 per night for the room which did NOT include tax - so it was more like 230 per night. Well worth it though - it was close enough to be within walking distance of everything we wanted to see, yet far enough from the RLD to be away from the noise and riffraff. Excellent. Everyone who worked the front desk was really friendly and nice - another place where you have to turn in and recieve your key whenever you leave or come back - sigh! The one exception was one lady who personally struck me as weird and not helpful. I don't recall her name, but she was in her late 40s or so, had blond hair and glasses and was short. She gave us a weird fake smile whenever we saw her and we ended up avoiding her whenever possible. When we first arrived, I asked for a recommendation for a good Thai restaurant within walking distance and she got this puzzled look on her face like she had never been asked that question in her life! she immediately went over to the computer, presumably to do a google search. Amsterdam has a gazillion good Thai restaurants, according to my guidebooks and friends who have visited there - not a weird question by any means! When I saw her going to the computer for help I said forget it, please just recommend anyplace good within walking distance. She recommended Broodje Bert, right next to the hotel. Although the food wasn't horrible, I can't recommend this place. They are just sandwiches and the service is excruciatingly slow, even by European standards. I would have walked a little further, had I known how close the pancake restaurants were to the hotel. One really nice gentleman working the front desk recommended an Indian restaurant, Shiva, which was awesome. The free coffee and water were also a nice touch. The afternoon snacks were a nice idea, but imo didn't taste very good. My only real complaint was that when I made the reservation, the hotel emailed me that the rate did not include tax or breakfast. But one day out of desperation, we decided to eat the breakfast even though it was 14 Euros per day. The buffet was excellent and no complaints - except that everyone there seemed to have the breakfast included in their rate. Nobody asked us for our room number or had us sign anything - we could have been eating the breakfast all three days!! Why tell me that it wasn't included? I felt kind of ripped off in that regard. Overall I would stay here again without hesitation. I feel certain that this is the nicest hotel of its class in Amsterdam. Request a room facing the canal and you will be in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this quaint european hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aixtrip
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Estherea. What a beautiful charming hotel. The decor is quite nice, rooms are spacious, and the location is excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Amesterdam. Very nice place. Hope to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MissContented
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a break with my husband in Amsterdam from 29th May to 1st June and had a fabulous time at Hotel Estherea. I found the Hotel at the last minute going through the internet and booked direct with the hotel. Absolutely gorgeous hotel which is located down Singel Road right by a canal which was quiet and only a 5 minute walk to Dam Square. Room was a bit small but very tastefully decorated and enough space for what you needed. We also asked for a canal view room when we arrived and were not charged any extra for it. Hotel Staff were really friendly and helpful, nothing too much trouble. Tea, coffee etc all complimentary 24 hours a day in the reception area, help yourself. Nothing in rooms but okay to go downstairs and take up to the room. Cake and fruit also complimentary. Did not have breakfast in hotel as not up early enough! We got a train from the airport for 4 euros each and it was only a 15/20 minute journey. Much cheaper than taxi and then we walked to the hotel from station. Recommend Majestic Bar in Dam Square for a drink and spot of people watching! It served Thai food and nibbles as well which was reasonably priced and tasty. Also Caressa Restaurant (I think) little Italian behind the hotel which was really good. Very busy so a good sign to eat there. Bar De Waag in New Square Market really good for midday snacks and evening meal. Definitely recommend to my friends and would definitely go back again. One thing I would suggest is that we went from Tuesday to Friday so missed the majority of the stag/hen parties. As we sat in Dam Square on the Friday afternoon they were all turning up in their job lot t-shirts so if you wanted a romantic break without the rowdy parties then go midweek!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staffstraveller
Reviews.Content: Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly staff in this great hotel. Rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated. Free tea and coffee (and lovely cakes!) in the lounge were much appreciated by tired travellers. Really convenient for all the major attractions, but in a lovely quiet location. Restaurant recommendations very helpful. I booked a canal view room which was lovely, but the interior room the kids had was just as nice. Can't praise it highly enough. If you're trying to choose between hotels when you're reading this, stop looking and book this one!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norwichgals
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my mum and her friend for their trip to Amsterdam from 26th May to 30th May and I choose the Estherea based on all the comments from the website. I was a bit concerned about the comments regarding the room size but my mum and her friend were very pleased with the size of the room which was small but not too small!! The things they loved was the location, the coffee and tea facilities and the helpfulness of the staff. They also had breakfast every day which they said was very good and had a choice of hot and cold food. They said they would definitely recommend this hotel and if they visited Amsterdam again they would stay here again. I am very pleased I booked this hotel for them and I can assure other readers that if my mum and her friend said it was excellent it really was as they have very high standards.

Reviews.Title: “3 girls singel out this one”
Reviews.Author: tazzyOldham
Reviews.Content: great hotel. perfect location. good triple room on singel canal. few minutes walk from centre. tea/ coffee not in rooms but available 24hrs in the lobby. complimentary cakes and fresh fruit in the lobby each day. lovely touch. would definitely recommend this hotel. take care when walking, pushbikes attack you from all angles. great trip though!

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiling_dave
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel, with a superb location. The room was a little small, but v. cleverly designed in order to make best use of the space. The staff could not have been more helpful, to the extent of printing a train timetable out for me for a journey I needed to make the following day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dotty8
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 11ladies and have just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam. We chose the Hotel Estherea by the excellent reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel is beautiful and the tea, coffee, hot chocolate and cookies available 24hrs in the lobby was a real bonus. The location is excellent, very quiet picturesque canalside location but only a few minutes easy walking to the centre. We checked in late due to flights (hotel was advised) and the staff were very helpful as they were throughout our stay. The Concierge recommended a Dutch restaurant for Saturday night that was just around the corner from the hotel and this too was very good, excellent food and good value. Initially we were disappointed that we were not given the canal side view that we asked for, instead we had rooms facing a tiny courtyard - but this wasn't a problem as it was very quiet. Amsterdam is a lovely city, definately recommend the Canal bus tours especially for a short stay as you can see most of the city and it is very informative. Should we go back I will definately stay at the Estherea and recommend others to do so as well.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajcory361
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two nights after reading reviews from several sites. The hotel certainly lives up to the positive comments. The rooms, although our room was a little dated in decor, are clean and comfortable. It was large enough for a coffee table and two chairs and had a canal view. The staff were friendly and gave an excellent service. The public rooms downstairs were really 5 star - with a library, and tea and coffee free for all guests whenever you required. It's situation is fantastic. Within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions, but tucked away enough to not be disturbed at night by party goers finding their way home! We drove to Amsterdam, an easy 3 hour trip from the shuttle, and parked at the Olympic Stadium just outside the city. This offered a park and ride system so for 5.50 Euros a day we had secure undercover parking plus free return tram tickets. It really is the best way if you decide to drive - I wouldn't want to cope with the cycles and trams through the city centre! Parking also worked out expensive in the city at about 50 Euros a day. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Estherea and we can't wait to book it again for our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “so looking forward to trip”
Reviews.Author: janban
Reviews.Content: Arrived monday afternoon, check in ok, was explained everything in 5 seconds flat. Breakfast was nice plenty of choice, quiet & relaxed, room small & window faced someone elses window so kept curtains closed. Very very clean, maid service was excellent. The disappointment came when speaking to anyone, yes we were answered & that was that. Maybe it was just us coming from the uk & northern we like conversation! But we dont blame the hotel staff, as the days went on we realised it was everyone in amsterdam, very abrupt.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ALPADDICT
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights at the Estherea... was not disappointed. As most people agree, the location is good. We walked from Central Station without problem. We had room 107, it overlooked the canal which was nice, but the room was small.check -in and check-out was quick. If I go to Amsterdam again , I would stay here.As far as earlier posts regarding construction noise, that was not there at all... maybe it is all done. And if you like Italian, definitely check out Casa de David right down the street on the Singel canal .... very good food and a 2 minute walk from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Estherea”
Reviews.Author: Palm Row
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the Estherea in May. What a terrific find. Walkable to everyplace, close to trams and central station. Great restaurants right out the door. Try Da David on the Singel, great italian cuisine. Ask to sit upstairs in the window.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: goodcookie
Reviews.Content: What a treat! The Estherea is a jewel. From the reception desk to the size of the room, the decor, the beautiful amenities and cleanliness of this establishment we were welcomed and thrilled. We booked a room overlooking the canal. The sun flooded the room through the 3 floor to ceiling windows. Even though you don't spend all that much time in the room, coming back to this comfortable room was a joy. Everything was immaculate. The bathroom was huge with 2 sinks and lots of room. Loved the towel warmer! The location couldn't be better. There were lots of restaurants around the hotel and pubs and cafes too. The bakery right around the corner made the most delicious pastries and croissants and we had them for breakfast every day with fresh squeezed orange juice. Transportation is fantastic. Hotel 3 blocks from Dam Square, a 5 minute walk from every tram and only 3 stops from Central Station. Our room was over $300/night but well worth it for the comfort this hotel offers. Hot tea, coffee and hot chocolate available all day with a lovely lounge, library and lobby in which to enjoy a rest.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: CityofLakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Estherea at the end of April and just like the other reviews, we loved the Estherea. I had high hopes after reading all the reivews and was not let down. We had a beautiful room facing the canal; the room was very nicely decorated and cleaned very thouroughly everyday. The room was small, but that was no suprised since that is usual for a lot of european hotels. But that didn't matter to us since we rarely were actually in the room anyways! The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful when we needed any restaurant recommendations or directions. The location was OUTSTANDING - you can practically walk anywhere. And if we couldn't walk, there is a tram stop just a couple blocks away. One thing I will say, since I couldn't find anything on this before we left - if you are arriving into Central Station, take a cab (or the tram) to the hotel. We decided to walk to the hotel with our suitcases, thinking it wasn't that far of a walk, but really at least a 15 minute walk so w/ luggage it was not the best. We walked it without luggage later on and it's fine, but just a pain w/ a lot of bags. If we go back to Amsterdam there is no question where I would stay. I am going to recommend this to anyone I know going to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with central local”
Reviews.Author: accruise
Reviews.Content: While on a river cruise vacation, my husband was taken ill and admitted to an Amsterdam hospital. A friend was able to get me a room at this hotel for two nights. I found this hotel to be one of the most charming I have stay in. As a travel agent myself, I have stayed in many hotels. My room was not large, but it had everything I could ask for and more. It was beautifully appointed, very clean, and very conveniently located to the city center. Even though I was alone, I felt very safe. The desk clerk would remember me and ask about my husband's health. I would not hesitate to book my clients in this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful canal-side hotel”
Reviews.Author: krisbeee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights after seeing favorable reviews on this site, and we were not disappointed. We had a large room overlooking the Singel canal, with windows that opened and a beautiful canopy bed. The bathroom was a bit small, but manageable. For us, the best feature was the location; the Estherea is in a beautiful, quiet area, yet it's close to lots of restaurants and shops. We found several great places to eat and shop within a few blocks. We were able to walk to the Rijksmuseum, and we took the tram (closest stops are on Spui about a block away) to the Centraal train station. I highly recommend getting a room overlooking the canal; there isn't much on the other side. Note that the hotel has giant room keys that you have to leave with the front desk when you step out, so there is a potential lack of security, but we never had any problems (there was a safe in the room, but it was so complicated I didn't use it).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay -- Would certainly stay again”
Reviews.Author: MissusM
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 8 day stay in April, myself and my two sons. Their father joined us after several days, though we were given the "Family" room at the start, though at a reduction until we were indeed reunited as a "family" (of 4). The hotel is very conveniently located within the central ring of Amerstdam, on the Singel canal, and within easy walking distance to Dam Square Central Station. Day trips were therefore made very easy, and the hotel provided info if one preferred guided tours of the city and countryside. There are many very good restaurants right behind the hotel on the Spui and very conveniently located groceries (the ubiquitous "ah:) and department stores within blocks. The hotel itself is run by very coureous and pleasant staff, is comfortably and elegant furnished, and offers a complimentry afternoon tea. Breakfast was good, though at14 Euros not a terrific value (though our 12 and 7 year old ate for free, which offset the expense). Had our room only been a bit bigger, things would have been ideal, but they were very fine, indeed, and we'd gladly repeat the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: johanad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one night stay at the Hotel Estherea and found it to be charming, comfortable, and well located. We booked a triple through the hotel and were greeted as old friends at check in. Our room on the fourth floor didn't face the canal which we knew ahead of time, but it was spacious, beautifully decorated and very cozy. The bath was wonderful with a deep tub-shower combination and everything we needed as far as hot water, soft towels, and fine bath products. The front desk people provided us with a map and directions to the Anne Frank house (close-by), made reservations for us at an excellent local restaurant to coinside with our Anne Frank visit, woke us up in time to have a full breakfast in their restaurant, and had a cab waiting to get us to the airport in time for our flight out. This was a quick visit on our way home from France, but we plan to go back next April for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in one of Amsterdam's most delightful districts”
Reviews.Author: c-burd
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat all the details which many other reviewers have given, but this hotel is really very very good for Amsterdam. I've stayed various places including the Seven Bridges and this is much nicer and in a vastly superior part of the city. It's on the edge of an area called the Nine Streets which has an amazing array of quirky shops and cafes, all independent, unique and totally wonderful. For lunches and snacks try Buffet Odette-amazing sandwiches, quiche, fresh juice, and toffee cake. Or Bagels and Beans on Kaizergracht for brekkie. Frozen Fountain is a wonderful interiors shop on Prinsengracht. In the other direction about 5 minutes away is Kalverstraat-the main big name shopping street, another 5 mins and you are in Dam Square. The location really is unbeatable. Finally I would advise people to pay for a superior room -they are much larger and brighter than the standard ones and great value at around Â£100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Amsterdam, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JezandStacy
Reviews.Content: A quiet and upscale view of Amsterdam from the most desired location. It is walking distance to everything and anything and if you can't find what you are looking for, the very helpful staff will be pleased to assist you. We had a canal view room which was very big by Amsterdam hotel standards. Everything is immaculate and very clean. Staff are exceptionally helpful, we left our computer plug in the hotel and they had no problem posting it to us the next day. The courteousy was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “"Very nice on the outside"”
Reviews.Author: vacationers2
Reviews.Content: "This hotel had the aperence of class, very nice lobby, bar, sitting room, resturant. All good and we did enjoy our selfes. The only reason we were ever at this hotel was to sleep. That we could not do. After the first night we were out very late and I was woken up but a hammer saw at 7:30am. Not a great way to wake up. I called and asked that our room be changed because of the noise and they said they would have our things moved to the other side of the hotel while we were gone. Great we thought!!! Untill the next morning when the same thing happend right out side our window. We were only there 2 nights and we loved the rooms. But not the noise. Amsterdam was beautifull. They were very helpfull in telling us where to go. We could buy our canal bus passes right at the front desk and other things I'm sure. Great location! We walked everywhere. When I read the reviews I did read about the noise and I thought what are the chances that the same noise will be going on. I was soo wrong! If you want a good nights sleep chose another Hotel. When we checked out I let them know about the noise bothering me and they comped us our roomservice. 14ero. When you are traveling to as many places as we did in a short amount of time a good night sleep is very important!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Estherea - a Winner!”
Reviews.Author: DSR3
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews are right-on. This is a great little place. Location, Staff, Quality, Ambience, all excellent. Online booking and communication was great. Tasty italian food around the corner, great little pastry shop at the corner. A real winner!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Estherea”
Reviews.Author: swanseabayview
Reviews.Content: 11th April 2007 We booked the Estherea through Hotels.nl. and loved our stay from 3rd to 6th April. From Schiphol airport we got the train from under the airport to Central Station. This was rather confusing for novices - you need to ensure you have enough coins to buy tickets from the machines - 3 Euro 60 each, or pay more at the ticket office. The hotel is almost a mile from there, so we got tram 5 to Spuistraat, from where the hotel was just a short walk. We were lucky to get a large room and bathroom on the top floor, but no view as it looked into the internal courtyard/lightwell. I was disappointed at first because of this, but it turned out not to be a problem as we spent very little time in the room. The room was very well furnished and decorated to a high standard. Everything was immaculately clean. Igor would have changed our room if we'd wanted to, but I soon got to like it. The staff are very friendly, helpful and polite. The ground floor of the hotel has sumptuous, classically elegant decor, which I loved, and we spent quite a bit of time relaxing and enjoying this area. The chandeliers are something else. They have put in a lot of thought here to cater well for guests, with a wide selection of complimentary beverages, in Delft china, on tap constantly in the foyer. Fruit, chocolates, pastries and cookies were also offered. All this can be enjoyed in the comfortable lounges/library/bar - somewhere to relax and enjoy meeting other guests. We enjoyed meeting some American guests - it is a sociable hotel because of these common areas. The tropical fish tank in the lounge area is fabulous - it has an awesome variety of fish, and various beautiful corals growing in it. The hotel is well located on the Singel Canal, a quietish (not much traffic - mainly bikes) upmarket area, where you are spoilt for choice for bars, cafes, restaurants and pastry shops within easy walking distance. Spuistraat, behind the hotel, has lots of restaurants and ends in Spui Square, which buzzes with cafes and bars. We enjoyed Cafe Luxembourg here. We also enjoyed dutch food at Haesje Claes on Spuistraat, Italian at Casa di David on Singel - lovely ambience, and Indonesian at Cilubang on Runstraat (we had the Reijstaffel, an interesting selection of small dishes rather like tapas). Broodje Bert, next block down, is good for very reasonably priced lunch. (Bertburger was excellent)! We had lots of rides on the Canal Bus - a fun way to get a good look around the city. We didn't use the trams because you can easily walk to most places from Singel You have to be very 'bike aware' as they are everywhere! I will hire one next time to save my feet from aching at night after so much walking on cobbles. I am already planning to return in the Autumn and would choose to stay at the Estherea again. Thanks to the staff for a super holiday. Sue and Richard (The Welsh folks from Swansea).

Reviews.Title: “Felt like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: debi591
Reviews.Content: The hotel was most welcoming, convenient, and quite accomodating in every way imaginable! Conveniently located in wonderful canal-front location! The decor was exquisite and the complimentary accomodations for snacks and meeting areas were wonderful. Fresh floral arrangements and Delft pattern china around the entire lobby , breakfast, and sitting areas! We met folks from California and Wales in the lovely sitting rooms as we drank our tea! I will definitely plan to stay here the next visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a ahotel”
Reviews.Author: ionaNottingham
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find the Hotel Estherea was. We stayed there for 2 nights in February this year. If you're looking for a small, comfortable hotel in a lovely part of Amsterdam with rooms overlooking the beautiful Singel Canal, then this is the place for you. The staff were extremely friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Each night they recommended and made telephone bookings at fabulous local restaurants for our evening meal. Our children loved the free tea, coffee and hot chocolate which was served in the lobby area. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone, and would like to add that I don't normally take the trouble to write reviews about anything!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: rjmollot
Reviews.Content: This is a truly charming hotel right on the Singel Canal. Our room was bright and spacious and the bathroom was well appointed. It was a pleasant place to wake up in and to return to each evening. A bit formal, but not stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: ch0c0h0lic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March and arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am and where very pleased to be told our room was ready, we were just hoping to dump our luggage and check in later. The room did not have a view but this did not really matter as we got a good rate. The room was a good size with a very comfy bed. The hotel does have a very nice lobby and seating areas where you can relax and enjoy the tasty free hot chocolate/coffee/various teas that was very welcome after a day shopping in the cold. We had a lovely time and have already recommened the hotel to others. If you are a light sleeper i would recommend earplugs as even though we where on the top floor we could hear traffic noise and the building works, but earplugs soon sorted this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelely hotel”
Reviews.Author: loobyloos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Estherea for three nights, 18th to 21st March and were given a lovely room on the fifth floor overlooking the street and city. It was absolutely spotless, spacious and very well decorated with a great bathroom. The public areas also were immaculate, cosy and very comfortable - it was a pleasure to come back to the hotel after a day sightseeing, especially as it was very cold while we were there - it snowed one morning! Coffee, tea etc. are available free of charge in the lobby and there is also a lovely little bar and a library. The hotel is in a perfect location to explore the city on foot. Public transport is plentiful and there is a tram stop two streets behind the hotel which we caught to get to Central Station and from there took a train back to the airport on our return home.. We also took a canal bus; tickets can be bought at reception and last all day and until noon the next day. Igor and the rest of the reception staff were all extremely friendly and helpful which made our stay all the better. There are numerous restaurants in the area, we especially liked the Haesje Claes on the road behind the hotel, which was very handy. All in all we had a great trip and will definately return to the Estherea, although next time we will try and visit in warmer weather!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: AtkinsonsDerby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Estherea for one night on Sat 17th March with my husband and 2 children. We had an absolutely fantastic time as soon as we got to the hotel, the lobby and reception areas are stunning, with a huge tropical fish tank which had the kids mesmerized. What you cant get from the photos however is the wonderful welcoming atmoshere the staff do truely care about their hotel. We arrived early but there was no problem getting our room early. The room was very spacious and light and airy and most importantly very clean. The complementary drinks in the lounge worked very well and my son was kept in a supply of biscuits. The hotel is very centrally positioned in a lovely area. The staff recommended an Italian restaurant Casa David I think it was called and the food there was fantastic. The hotel allowed us a late check out and were most helpful in getting us a taxi to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would return here if we were to go back to Amsterdam. A big thank you from the Atkinsons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Arthaus
Reviews.Content: Like many others my wife and I chose this hotel on the basis of reviews found on Tripadvisor. We were far from disappointed. Our room was on the fourth floor and we were given a canal view at no extra charge. The room was small but one has to remember that one is staying in a city centre town house. The room was very tastefully decorated and the bathroom was more than adequate with plenty of hot water to soak those tired limbs. We stayed four nights between 15-19th March 2007 and from the outset could not have asked for more helpful and conscientious staff. Advice was given as to a good restaurant on the night we arrived. Our flight had been delayed and it was 2145 by the time we booked into the hotel. The staff made the reservation for us whilst we freshened up and were also happy to make reservations for our choices over the following nights. The lobby of the hotel and surrounding lounge and bar are very comfortable and again very pleasing to the eye. I read previous moans about the breakfast and yes if you look around you will I'm sure find cheaper deals. However the hotel restaurant is cosy, with nice tablecloths and pottery and the choice of food and drink is plentiful (14 Euros per Head) The location is excellent being centrally located. Everwhere is within walking distance, but importantly the hotel is surrounded by great eating establishments. Directly behind the hotel is one of the best fish restaurants one could hope for. Lucius, Spuistraat 247. We went twice it was that good. Not cheap, but plenty of atmosphere and bistro appearance. Casa di David further along Singel from the hotel provided great Italien food, but recommend you book particularly on a week-end. Good, wholesome Dutch food at Haesje Claes, again behind the hotel, along from Lucius. Cafe Gommel around the corner (left out the hotel down the alley) is a great old bar and try the Cheeseboard for a good snack at just over 4 Euros. Finally, fresh pitta bread at the Greek adjacent to the hotel is well worth a visit. To example the great efforts of the staff, my wife lost both her wedding and eternity ring whilst in Amsterdam. We reported this to the reception, where before long one ring had been recovered from one of the washing machines in the laundry. The following day, the staff had recovered the second ring and seemed as happy as we were. Don't stay anywhere else in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Lots of others to choose.”
Reviews.Author: greenboy-7
Reviews.Content: Generally a good Amsterdam hotel in a great location. A few small defects spoiled it for us. Original check in clerk was quite snooty and unfriendly. The room was good but the double bed was actually two beds pushed together with separate sheets etc. We asked for smoking room but didn't get it. Neighbours were noisey. The cabbie that the hotel called for us to get us to the airport did a "tour" and it was 17 Euro more than the inward trip. He seemed to know the snooty guy). BUT, bar staff and luggage people were very friendly. Only one beer on tap, though. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Hotel Estherea”
Reviews.Author: globerunnerTO
Reviews.Content: We had one night in this lovely hotel and can't wait to come back. The hotel is spotlessly clean, charming and comfortable. I loved the comfy bed, the clean bathrooms, the lobby with free internet, mint infused water and great atmosphere. The hotel conveniently located a short 2 block walk to Dam Square and the staff was professional and courteous. The room was quiet at night with a wonderful view of the Singel Canal. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased”
Reviews.Author: Martiniguys
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews from this site, we decided to stay at this property for 3 nights. The location is great and the lobby and other common areas are very charming, but that is where it all stopped. We first given a room on the 2nd floor which was the size of a closet. We were abruptly awakened at 07:30 by the very noisy construction occurring on the floor beneath us and in the hallyway right outside our door. After complaining to the front desk, they moved us to another room up on the 5th floor, supposedly away from the noise. This room was even smaller with about 12 inches between the bed and wall. And as luck would have it, at 07:30 we were once again jolted awake by even louder construction noise right outside our window. It was very puzzling to us that we were never warned about the construction and that the staff did not seem to know where on the property it was occuring. Even if all the construction was not happening, I can't understand why this place was rated so highly. I guess most of the previous reviewers enjoy tiny rooms with dinky bathrooms where you can't even stand up straight in the showers.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: enaj47
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location on the Singel canal within walking distance to the major attractions in Amsterdam. The lobby and public areas are beautiful. There is excellent coffee available any time and plenty of comfortable seats to sip it in. Our room was very nice looking, but you hit your head on the tv entering one side of the bed, possibly on the chandelier entering the other side! Renovations were being done in the hallway. This involved stepping over, or requiring to move, workmen with many tools and open cans of paint in a narrow hallway. The breakfast at 14 euros is obviously overpriced and there are many good cafes and patisseries to eat in. Stay here for the location. If you pay enough, perhaps you will receive a more spacious room with a view. Right down the street, Dante's Cafe was good for dinner and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel wonderfully located”
Reviews.Author: kardan127
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my 10th visit to Amsterdam. We travel there often for business and occasionally on our way home from another European cities. Each time we try to find a location in which we can call 'home' and return to each time we have to be in the city. We have found our 'home' in the Estherea. The staff were wonderful. The lobby is beautiful and our room was just lovely. We booked a deluxe room on the top floor. It was beautifully decorated with a great view of the canal and the houses across the way. We arrived early in the morning and they gave us our room as soon as possible. Internet service was fabulous, although there is a slight charge both in your room or in the lobby(10 Euro for 24 hours or 5 Euro for 1/2 hour in the lobby). We only had breakfast once upon our arrival. However, it is a bit pricey at 14 Euro per person, but it was good. I hate to give this place such a great recommendation because I don't want it to become so popular that I can't book a room when needed, but I will make sure I do that well in advance for my next stay in February of 2008. It was a great experience. Only funny drawback is the walls to adjoining rooms are paper thin. The couple next door were extremely and often amorous much to our amusement! Here's to love!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: VanGoghIII
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from the 14th to the 17th of February and we really loved almost every aspect of it. In a beautiful situation overlooking a nice canal, it has a nice reception area, a beautiful marine fishtank with the most gorgeously brightly coloured fish, friendly staff, and somewhere nice to sit and have a drink after a night out. To be honest, neither myself or my wife slept particularly comfortably in the beds despite other people commenting on how nice they were, but I never normally sleep well in hotels so that's not really a fault in my opinion. What wasn't a good thing though was having a load of scaffolding outside the window, and a pair of Dutch workmen having a bit of a natter before starting work, quite early in the morning. We solved this problem by paying the extra to get a room with a nice view over the canal, but no offer of a discount was made, and no mention of the work in progress was advised to us at booking, and I do feel as though we were taken advantage of a little bit as regards that. Once we'd paid the extra, and got the new room, we had a lovely stay, but sorry, it left a negative that hasn't gone after 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel1
Reviews.Content: I took my entire family - four kids - to Amsterdam on a layover to Tanzania. We wanted to be centrally located in a family-friendly, but nice hotel. The Estherea was very friendly. We arrived on an early flight and they did their best to clean our rooms quickly so that we could check in early. The hotel was very pretty, and the rooms were very clean and attractive. The location was superb as we could walk everywhere. We never took a taxi! There were also excellent restaurants within walking distance and the concierge was always willing to give excellent recommendations. If I ever return to Amsterdam, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: jaffam
Reviews.Content: Let's get the good stuff out there: Location: Superb Communal areas: these make the hotel, they are old-fashioned but very cosy and you'll happily sit in the library reading the papers if you so desire. Service: helpful and friendly However, I always look forward to two things when I go to a hotel, and they are a great room and a delicious breakfast. Breakfast was distinctly average, not a very wide choice. And the standard room was tiny. I KNOW this is standard for city-centre hotels, especially in a canal-house, but there was no floorspace even for our bags! We had to move chairs to get the wardrobe open, there was nothing in the mini-bar, the bed mattress was AWFUL and shower room was a different climate to the rest of the room, seemingly being located somewhere near the North Pole. Whilst I wouldn't put anyone off staying here as the prices are reasonable, it's not somewhere I would return simply because getting a good night's sleep is so hard.

Reviews.Title: “All around great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GratefulDave
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there three time over the past four years. If they didn't just raise their prices substantially, I would have stayed theere again. Staff are great rooms are adequate size for three stars in Amsterdam. They have recently renovated the lobby, which must be being paid for by the price increase. Best location. Right on a canal. More quiet and quant than other areas, close to a lot of attractions. I even walked there once from the train station with a carryon roller bag. Their breakfast wasn't worth it for me. There is a great bakery and a small sandwih shop less than a block down the Singel on the same side. Ther is a great breakfast and lunch place on the second street further down the canal on the opposite side. Sorry I can't remember the name, but we went there instead. It doesn't open until 9 or 10 am though. If the price is right, this is the best place for that money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeighBCD
Reviews.Content: I travel to Amsterdam frequently on business and have stayed in many hotels in the city. I like the Estherea very much - lovely location, quality of the rooms is superb and the cost of the hotel not so extortionate. There is a great Greek deli just next to the hotel if you are looking for a simple casual evening meal - perfect for a lone traveller like me! My only complaint is that breakfast starts at 7am - it would be nice if it could start a little earlier. The hotel is a brisk 10 min walk to Central Station - along the lovely canal, what is not to like? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lobby...less than ideal rooms...”
Reviews.Author: JCHJ
Reviews.Content: Lobby is absolutely beautiful and the staff is very friendly and helpful! Our room was absolutely terrible and faced inward toward nothing at all. Good budget hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tresure
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel this is. It is very convenient, quiet, immaculately clean, and has probably the best staff I've encountered anywhere. They booked a concert for us, taxis and restaurants, and were always ready to give advice and suggestions or just to have a chat. If a light bulb went out, it was changed at once. The aquarium was amazing: I never even knew that you could grow corals like this.The constantly available chocolate, tea etc and cookies or cake were so much better than tea-making in the room. Our room was a little dark as there was scaffolding outside, but what the hell, we were only there to sleep. The room had everything we wanted, (including BBC1 &2 on the TV). Even though the refurbishment was going on, it didn't inconvenience us and the workmen were very polite and tried to minimise the effect of their works. Amazing to see the corridors newly papered in a day! This family owned and run hotel is an example to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even with kids”
Reviews.Author: Donk-Argyle
Reviews.Content: With kids aged 9, 7 and 4, finding the right hotel with inter-connecting or adjacent rooms is vital. Despite having been promised this, the rooms we were given were separated by an internal courtyard and some distance apart, albeit neighbouring. The next day, we were offered alternative rooms which were right next to each other and from this moment on, we had a fantastic stay. The hotel was excellent with really friendly staff who used their initiative and for whom nothing was any trouble. Rooms were very good, well-equipped and very attractive. Worth getting rooms with a view if you can, not on the internal courtyard so you have natural light. Breakfast was not cheap at 14 euros each, but it was good and free for children under 12. The location is great with good access to tourist attractions and a variety of good local restaurants. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and it is a great city, even with kids. All the main sites are worth visiting and many are free for the children except Nemo which was 11.50 euros each. Riding the trams and walking the canals alone are worth the journey! The hotel was undergoing re-decoration whilst we were staying and the weather was pretty poor, even by UK standards, and despite this, we had a great time and would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller078
Reviews.Content: My parents celebrated their birthdays here recently and thoroughly enjoyed their stay. The management were very helpful and gave us a choice of rooms and even left birthday gifts for my parents, which was a nice touch. The canal setting is lovely and the location within easy walking distance of many sights. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hotcakes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a couple of days at the beginning of feb and what a great choice we made. It is situated in a great location on the sigel canal just a couple of minutes walk from Dam square. The hotel decor and furnishings are lovely and the staff are very helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated with a great sized bathroom and were very clean. I would recommend this hotel and hope to return to the Estherea myself during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: mtse
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time on the TripAdvisor site to locate a hotel which met our requirements and wasn't going to break the bank. I am delighted to have encountered the Estherea. Our three nights there were absolutely first rate. An extremely comfortable room, generous bathroom with large bath and huge quantities of hot water, a breakfast of a quality (and quantity) which set us both up for the day let alone the morning, very welcoming and helpful staff and a location which to my mind is unrivalled - close to all the main sights (and shops) and only about 20 mins walk from the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh gallery. And it's clean. And a particular thank you - my wife uses a wheelchair (the hotel is not easily accessable if you can't walk as there are four steps upto the main door but a lift serves all floors) but can walk a little bit. On arrival at the airport, we discovered damage to the chair we'd brought with us which rendered it useless. Holiday in peril. KLM called the Estherea who actually had a chair they were happy to lend us for the whole of our stay. The relief at this cannot be imagined! This is just one example of the service at this hotel which I cannot commend too highly. This hotel is friendly and we would most definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aabeesley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend at the end of January. Although I had read the reviews I was still a little nervous about the hotel, however upon arrival I was really pleasantly surprised. We arrived to a typical Amsterdam street, narrow with a canal and our hotel was a couple of the traditional houses converted. The reception staff were really friendly and we were upgraded to a deluxe room. Our room was lovely (room 216) with a lovely view overlooking the canal. It was immaculately clean, spacious with a extra large bathroom. If you a planning on staying I would recommend that you upgrade to a deluxe room and if possible ask for this room as our friends who were also staying in a deluxe room didn't get such a nice room - again overlooking the canal but not as large and a small bathroom. Another thing which I really liked was the bed linen, nice fluffy pillows and a lovely duvet, no horrible blankets. There was building work going on whilst we were staying however it didn't affect our stay. The location of this hotel is perfect. Literally just around the corner from Dam Square. I would definitely return to Amsterdam and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georg4
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely. Staff were friendly and willing to help even when we complained about some building work that was going on they were very apologetic and even gave us a night free. The hotel is a short walk from the city centre so the location is ideal. The free hot drinks and biscuits was a really nice touch especially when you come in from the cold. All in all I would definately recommend staying here if you are thinking about going to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: lucylab-Penn
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful view of the Singel Canal from our room. This hotel is located within walking distance to everything. Close to all the restaurants in the Spui. 5 minute walk to the Dam Right around the corner to the flower market. We had breakfast included and it was so nice every morning. A little bar, for drinks ,coffee etc. It is a picture perfect Amsterdam postcard... We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Munkey_Tennis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Estherea for three nights in January 07. We had room 110 which was a canal view room (we were upgraded for free from a standard room). We had a lovely view of the canal, four poster bed and the room was a good size with a good bathroom and nice powerful shower. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the restaurant recommendations were spot on especially d'theeboom (try the white chocolate mousse). The free cakes and hot choc in reception kept us going coming in from the cold. The breakfast was nice and filled us up but as other reviews have said there are cheaper alternatives outside the hotel. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Its location is excellent and everywhere is within walking distance. We'd recoomend the Heineken experience, Anne Franks House and the Red light district is worth a nose around. Thankyou to Hotel Estherea for giving us a great hoiday.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: sixlegsup
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a looker. Eye catching lobby area, beautifully appointed and adorned. Very cozy, the kind of place where you can sit, chat and drink till late in the evening. The rooms were equally as charming and a decent size for Amsterdam. The service was helpful and ambitious, providing directions, a decent hair dryer and generally trying to be one step ahead of our needs. The hotel is a little noisy. Not due to the clientel, but the generally tight quarters and fairly thin walls. If you require absolute quiet to catch 40 winks then you may need to mention this when you book. Also, the hotel is currently undergoing renovations. Unfortunately, we were not informed of this prior to booking or check-in and the work often started prior to 9:00. The hotel sits on a lovely canal and has some great cafes and restaurants nearby. The Luden quickly became one of our favorites. It is also just a few blocks from Dam Square and is generally centrally located to the city sights. Would rate 3 and a half, but will curve down due to the construction. Just came from a 4 star hotel in Paris and this does not quite reach that level, though the service is probably some of the best around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience in this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: memnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Hotel Estherea, and thought it was wonderful. Our pretty, very clean, room faced the Singel Canal, so the views were great. The staff was very courteous, the lobby was lovely and it was very nice to sit and enjoy the coffee and tea that is provided. Location is great, with excellent restaurants just behind the hotel on Spuistraat: Haesje Claes, D'Vijff Vlieghen and Kanttjil & de Tijger were our favorites. Centrally located for walking to the sights (don't miss the floating flower market on Singel Canel at Muntplein.) Can get a little noisy at times, creaking floors, people traffic on the street below, but it didn't detract from all the charm. Word of advice: when taking a taxi (we took one to the airport) we were told by the front desk that if the hotel calls, it is a fixed rate, yet when we got to the airport, we had a hard time with the taxi driver, who seemed not to know a thing about it. Check the cost with the driver first. This was not the hotels fault, however. All in all, a charming hotel and a good value, and I would definitely stay here again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Place”
Reviews.Author: EliMiami
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely wonderful. It is oozes charm and elegance. We were there for four nights and have no complaints. The hot chocolate and cookies were a huge hit with my kids. They always wanted to go back to the hotel when we were sightseeing. We had a very comfortable quad room with lots of fluffy pillows. The beds with their comforters were wonderfully soft as well. The breakfast was included and was plentiful and superb. We were in Europe for 2 weeks and this was the first place where the American bacon was cooked to perfection. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Singh, at the front desk, even gave us ponchos when it was raining. We plan to go back to the Estherea for our 20th. anniv. in 5 years, but this time without the kids. It is a very romantic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hinkle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Christmas in Europe with part of our time in Amsterdam. It was my first visit to Amsterdam and my wife's third. She read a review of the Hotel Esthera on Tripadvisor. We booked it and crossed our fingers that it was going to be everything we had read and hoped for. It was! We had the nicest stay there. Our room was beautiful and big (no view, but who cares, we were sleeping!). The staff was top shelf. The breakfast was generous and great quality. The complimentary coffee, tea or hot choclate and bisquits in the lobby was a great touch and very welcomed. Overall, the staff and front desk could not have been more helpful. If you happen to get lucky and have Rudy meet, greet and assist you then you really will have a wonderful experience. No doubts, no hesitations. This is THE place to stay in Amsterdam. Hinkle, Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Christmas at Estherea; the best!”
Reviews.Author: traveller015
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at Hotel estherea - chosen thanks to the many good reviews it was given. Our fifth trip to Amsterdam and the best hotel we've been to. Arriving in ( after trecking round shops and bars) to the 24hr tea/coffee/hot choc machine was heaven (no kettles to boil)! There was even iced-water with fresh mint! Public rooms very cosy and Christmas decorations very tasteful. (Bowls of chocolates on various tables)Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast is optional - well worth the 14 Euros - especially the sausages and the muffins! Room overlooked canal ; was a great size and tastefully decorated (antique writing desk!) We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “loved Estherea”
Reviews.Author: doownelg
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel Estherea and it was wonderful. The hotel was gorgeous and comfortable. Tea coffee hot chocolate on tap 24/7. There was also a plentiful supply of biscuits and delicious pastries all day and night great after a late night! The staff were extremely friendly efficient and helpful especially Rudi. As soon as we checked in we got a map, brochures and special offer vouchers to various tourist attractions with no pressure to go. Room we got was decorated in lovely peach tones bed was ultra comfortable but very small no where to put suitcase which in turn took up any extra room. but thats only a minor fault which didnt detract from hotel. Bathroom was lovely bath and shower and a plentiful supply of toiletries and super soft towels. Breakfast was included and their was plenty to choose from whatever your tastes hot and cold. Dining room was lovely. Highly recommend and will stay their again as it was right in middle of everything yet quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SargeantPepper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, booked through Opodo online which was cheapest deal i could find that included breakfast. A good 10 min walk from train station! Really impressed with reception and decor, felt very relaxed with the place. Our room was spacious and very clean. We faced the back of the hotel overlooking a small street. I did request an upgrade with a canal view but i was told this was an extra 40 euros per night. So i declined. Bathroom was nice decor ,very small but with deep bath and shower. Breakfast good, also you can have breakie in your room free of charge which was lovely. Tea/coffee not in room but available 24 hours in reception. Help yourself. Also biscuits, fruit and toffees! We arrived late so ate at Italian directly behind hotel which was good for cheap food. We also dined at a traditional dutch restaurant along the same street called Haasje claes, which was fabulous. You need to book table there is was rammed. cost for two people 3 courses and good bottle of wine Â£58. There was a great atmosphere and the people were very friendly. Hotel was great location and withing easy walking distance to most of sights and Dam square and shops. Just around corner is a tiny bar that sells loads of different beers. We went there twice! We didnt go on trams so walked everywhere, but did do a canal boat which was nice change and gave us a rest. We had a lovely romantic break and the hotel was individual and charming with modern facilities. This beats any chain hotels. Get to tourist attractions early to avoid queues.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: JOJO99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend in Feb 2006 for his Birthday. I never got round to writing a review first time around, but we're looking to go back to Amsterdam next year and I would love to go back to Hotel Estherea. This is one of the nicest hotels we have stayed at. The staff were excellent, location very good, we couldn't fault it. I was considering paying extra for a canal view room but found the standard room really good value, with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever stayed in. The free refreshments in the hotel foyer/reception are a welcome sight after trudging the streets in the February temperatures. Hopefully we'll be able to book the hotel again for next year, and yes you can find cheaper hotels in the area but it's worth paying that little bit extra. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore any bad reviews - this hotel is all you need!!”
Reviews.Author: UKNomads
Reviews.Content: We're struggling to find fault with the Hotel Estherea. We stayed for three nights and found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. You'll find cheaper, but you'll struggle to beat the location. We didn't have to use public transport to get anywhere as everything is within a 10 minute walk. However, the hotel is far enough away from the centre of Amsterdam to have the peace that we wanted and that some of the cheaper hotels cannot provide. Breakfast at the hotel was not included in the rate but as other reviews state there is a great little cafe within a few yards which does the job for half the price (and this is even mentioned in the hotel guest book!). We tried the hotel breakfast on the last day as well and it was certainly worth the money and kept us going until the middle of the afternoon. The hotel also recommend a number of restaurants and we tried three of these within a few minutes walk and have to agree with the recommendations. Overall, we took cheap flights to see Amsterdam but didn't want a cheap noisy hotel. The Hotel Estherea provided us with everything it promised and we will be recommending it to friends and family and would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely overrated”
Reviews.Author: LunaDeMargarita
Reviews.Content: After seeing so many wonderful reviews on this website, I was determined to book a room there for a three-day stay in Amsterdam. I contacted the hotel directly, and was offered 2 rooms (one for my husband and me, the other - for my 17 & 20 year olds). Two days before arrival, I e-mailed the hotel to reconfirm the reservation, and specifically asked for 2 rooms facing the canal. Yes, the location of the hotel is superb, and a little family-run restaurant on the corner just outside is wonderful, but the rooms... please! We were given 2 rooms, neither one of which faced the street. The term "tiny" does not even begin to describe it, and the fact that it was July - hot, humid - and the room had no air conditioning... The staff gave us one small desk fan per room, and we asked for another one because it was sheer hell sleeping in a stuffy, airless room, but were politely told that there were no more fans left to lend. I repeatedly asked to be moved to another room, but was told that the hotel was fully booked and my request could not be honored. In short, our stay at Hotel Estherea was disappointing, but walking the streets of this beautiful city, seeing all the wonderful sights, taking canal rides - it all made up for our not-so-wonderful accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RATSOMATIC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 3 night stay in Amsterdam. We had a family room which was comfortable and clean. The lobby has an old fashioned luxurious feel with a library, leather armchairs, chandeliers and a great aquarium. The reception staff were all helpful and friendly. Tea, coffee, hot chocolate and biscuits on tap all day. The upstairs corridors were a bit uninspiring but that was really the only thing that struck me. The hotel is in a great location, on a quiet part of the Singel, a few miniutes walk from Dam square and the main shopping streets, but also close to the quirky shops and boutiques of the Jordaan area. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishBrady
Reviews.Content: A brilliant location, we walked down to it from the main station but got a taxi back! The cobbled streets are a pain to drag suitcases over! All in all we had a lovely stay at this hotel, we visited it with 2 friends. Their room was bigger than ours, the window faced an inner courtyard which they found quite noisy as they had the noise from 3 other rooms surrounding the courtyard. Our room faced the rear of the hotel so no nice views for us, plus it was tiny. If I was to stay there again I would request a room with a view of the canal. The staff were very polite, place was spotlessly clean. There was complimentary coffee, tea, drinking chocolate and cakes, biscuits and fruit in the reception which was a nice touch. We didnt eat in the hotel as the street behind it is full of fabulous restaurants. Plus breckie was expensive at â‚¬14 per person. We walked to the flower market every morning for food, which was great and only a 5 minutes walk. The hotel is in a great location, 5 mins walk from Dam square but in a lovely quiet area. Would recommend it. The only bad part of our stay was the cleaners were very noisy, they woke us every morning at 8 - 830 slamming doors. Plus the morning we were leaving there was drilling and hammering going on in the hotel from 7:30am which was a total pain. They could have waited until a bit later to start making noise like that!! We complained and were offered a complimentary breakfast which we declined. But this probably almost never happens we were just unluckly. We paid 140 Euros a night for a double room... not bad for a 4star smack bang in the middle of Amsterdam ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrs2006
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay along the Singel, right in the heart of Amsterdam. There are cheaper hotels about but it's worth spending a little bit extra to stay here. Ask for a room at the front of the building as the views over the canal are great.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to fault!”
Reviews.Author: willing-tourist
Reviews.Content: This is just simply one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed in - and there have been many! My husband and I plan to return to Amsterdam next year and I shall not even consider staying anywhere else. The hotel lives up to all the praise heaped on it by your other reviewers and is also exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “ab fab!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lousan
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights bed and breakfast , and having read some of the reviews were a little bit apprehensive. No Need, this hotel and staff could not do enough for you. The breakfast was excellent with enough choices to suit anybodys taste. Our room was immaculate and cleaned every day with fresh towels if required. Anyone who complains about this hotel should really get a life!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Stragics
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Estherea from September 18-22, 2006. From reading tripadvisor posts, I expected the hotel to be great and it lived up to that expectation. Paying 124 Euro/night including breakfast but not a 5% tax (visit the utell website for their Great Rates), I felt that we really came away with one of the best hotel deals in Europe. Upon checking-in, I asked for a room on the 5th floor (none available). I proceeded to ask for a canal view (available for a 45 Euro/night suppliment). We stuck with our original room which was Room 217. The man at the desk told us our room was nice. I thought that was his way of consoling me for not choosing to upgrade to the canal view. However, the room WAS nice! And we were escorted there by a bellboy who carried our bag and showed us how to operate the lights and open the minibar in the room. The room has an entry way with a closet and luggage area on the left and double doors leading to the bathroom on the right. There is no air conditioning in the room, however, there are two small fans provided. There are a few English channels on the tv. The windows opened out onto the most beautiful street view. The bed was two twins pushed together, however, the bed and linens were amazingly comfortable. Soft pillows and two twin-size down comforters made it hard to leave the bed in the morning. The bathroom was incredible and only slightly smaller than the size of the hotel room we had just stayed at in Paris. Double sinks and a deep soaking tub were nice touches. There was always hot water and strong shower pressure when bathing. Both the bathroom and bedroom were kept clean. Service was excellent. From making restaurant reservations to giving directions and train timetables, the staff went out of their way to help us enjoy our time in Amsterdam. The coffee, tea, and hot chocolate machines downstairs were fantastic and the little cookies in their own drawer made a quick snack with the drinks. Breakfast was included in our rate and always hit the spot. Breakfast included: scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, bacon, sausage, various breads, cereals, yogurts, fruits, meats, and cheeses. To drink, you'll find a variety of juices, milk, coffee, tea, or hot chocolate. They'll even make you a cappucino if you ask. I believe breakfast is 16 euro if not included in your rate. The breakfast room can hold 60 people and it did get almost full on the Friday morning we were leaving. The location of the hotel is fantastic. We came to Amsterdam via Paris on the Thalys train into Centraal Station. It was approximately a 15 minute walk from the station pulling our suitcase. Going out at night was also very easy and there is much to see within walking distance of the hotel.
