It would be very hard for me to stay at any other hotel in Amsterdam now that I know how great the Estherea is.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: McUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for two nights - and it was the only place with rooms available due to a convention. It is quite simply the worst hotel I have stayed in. I booked one of the deluxe rooms. It was comparable to a 2-3 star hotel in the UK (which would have cost considerably less). The bathroom was absolutely tiny, with a folding door. The reception staff were the rudest I have ever encountered. Despite telling them I did not want my room cleaned (as I was working), the manager called to me to tell to leave 'NOW' so that they could clean it. The night before checking out, I asked the receptionist if he could book me a taxi to take me to the airport for the morning. He replied that there is no need to book in Amsterdam, as taxis can be called to arrive immediately. The following morning, there were no taxis available for at least 1 hour, and the manager informed me that I should have booked the night before, because of the convention. When I told him what his staff had said , he merely shrugged his shoulders and said 'his mistake'. There were around 15 guests who all needed to get a taxi, all of whom were furious. In the end we shared taxis, and only just managed to catch our flights. It is the closest to Fawlty Towers that I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Smangelala
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews, and meant to get around to it, but haven't until now. My husband and I stayed here last November, my second trip to Amsterdam but first time at this hotel, and it was perfect. The location is great, not to mention the hotel amenities- the library, the spotless cozy rooms, the tea and coffee, and the friendly staff ,all made this an excellent home away from home. Per our trip plans we checked out and went to Brussels and unexpectedly returned the same day, praying we would be able to get a room at this hotel again (after wasted train ride to Brussels and hours walking around city looking for hotel with limited French speaking abilities did not bode well.) Thanks to the friendly staff, we not only got a room for the remainder of our stay, but had an upgrade to canal view. Will definitely be back...

Reviews.Title: “Really brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Globerunner2
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed for three night starting September 15th. We couldn't fault it at all. The room was clean and very comfortable, the lounges superb and the dining areas immaculate. Everyone did as much as they could to go that little bit further to help . The only downside for the ladies is the beautiful dark haired receptionist. Keep you husband on a tight lead!!!. I think mine fell in love again!!! One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: clerwood
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam in July and thoroughly enjoyed my stay in the Estherea. This hotel was great. The location was perfect- the bedroom was very comfortable and clean and the bathroom was very spacious. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: anonymous_from_PA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Estherea is a great little gem of a hotel. If you are looking for a quite place to stay along a canal this is place for you. The room I stayed in (Room 316) was a nice size for European room with a great bathroom. The bathroom had double sinks! No problem with hot water or pressure. The bed was great too, nice hard mattress. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I think this hotel is more of a four star than the three I have seen it rated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Estherea”
Reviews.Author: goodnamestaken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The location is terrific! Our room was small, but well-appointed, comfortable and clean. Super comfy bed. The bathroom was a generous size (considering the size of the room) and very clean. The lobby area is simply charming. Our room had a canal view, which was greatly appreciated. The staff was welcoming, but not overwhlemingly so. Like others, we also opted to have breakfast elsewhere. Bagels & Beans is a hike, but worth it if you need a big cup of coffee in the morning. (Besides it's on the way to the museums if you're walking.) Overall, a wonderful experience. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonlady3
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 2 nights at the Estherea for my husbands 50th birthday. Very pleased with the deal we got from Expedia, as it was in a nice location, convenient to everything but quiet. We found some good restaurants in Spuistraat, 2 minutes walk - thoroughly recommend Luden, also a good tapas bar. Staff very friendly (as we found most of the people in Holland). Weather was not good, but hotel will lend you a decent umbrella. Breakfasts very nice, and tea, coffee, hot chocolate available 24 hrs along with fruit and cakes. Rooms perhaps a little small, but on a city holiday you do not spend so much time in the room, and as it rained both days, lack of air con was not a problem! I am sure it is very cosy for a winter break!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WashySteve
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel in Amsterdam which is clean and tidy, has friendly staff, has excellent facilities, and is in an ideal location (i.e. close enough to the action of Leidseplein & Dam Square whilst being far enough away to avoid the more 'undersirable' areas of the city), then the Estherea is for you. On arriving you almost feel you're in a time-warp, with an austere lobby/bar area reminiscent of the 1940's (some would call it charm ?), however this seems to be the whole point of the hotel as it is a perfect deterrent for the ubiquitous hen/stag party element which is more suited to the lesser hotels scattered around the Central Station. As with previous reviews we avoided the Hotel breakfasts & opted for 'Broodjes Bert' cafe which is 30 yards up the road - excellent breakfasts in the open air (weather permitting) for Eu 7.00. Any negatives ? Prices of alcoholic beverages at the bar were a bit excessive (which probably explains why nobody seemed to use it), however I'm probably being picky. Overall, I'd 100% recommend the hotel for any of you over 40 (if you're twenty-something and on an Amsterdam weekend which involves excessive alcohol & partying, this probably isn't the place for you).

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzyl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days july 19 Clean hotel,but no tea or coffee facilities in room you have to go down stairs for a drink which is a bit of a pain when you first wake up. Also staff could be a bit more friendly what happened to a smile. No aircon in the room we stayed in (room 105) very hot with just a small fan to cool you down. Also if you want to watch any movies you have to buy a remote control about 10 euros and also pay for movies on check out

Reviews.Title: “Estherea is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: andeesue
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights in this charming hotel, July 4-10, 2006. Our first room was on the 3rd floor, facing an inner area. It was a warm time and our first night was uncomfortable.The very helpful bellboy suggested we find out if a room is available on the a/c 5th floor, which we did. Apparently, the entire hotel will eventually all be air conditioned. That made all the difference! Our room, though small, was very efficiently arranged, with closets, drawers, built in niches by the beds. Our first room was larger and had a big bathroom, but the canal view and a/c were much more important. We appreciated the ever present fruit available, as well as the coffee/tea/hot chocolate machine, and the cookies and candies.... fun to have a drink at the bar and enjoy the extra treats at no cost. The location is great, and close to many restaurants and places of interest. We took the trams often, and really got around easily. Our friend was staying at a hotel with an enormous amount of stairs just to get to the lobby. I felt we were in the lap of luxury compared to her place. The Estherea is a very special place!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Andy7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Estherea for 2 nights in mid July. We had a family room on the fifth floor and luckily had airconditioning due to the extremely unusual good weather Holland is having at the moment. All the staff were very helpful and friendly and they were really good with the kids. Very close to all the main sights of the city and we walked most places with a buggy and five year old who didn't complain (much!) The hotel organised a babysitter for one night for us. She was very good and the cost was cheaper than our babysitter at home. We would definitely recommend this hotel for young families and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edmund Spenser
Reviews.Content: Date: 18/07/06 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor member. Liverpool. Just returned from a 60th birthday celebration in Amsterdam. The hotel is every bit as good as its description. The rooms were clean and spacious. Although not air-conditioned each room had a fan. The staff were brilliant and nothing was too much trouble. I do not recall ever giving an 'excellent' rating before but the Estherea merited it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: DAK3id
Reviews.Content: WE chose the Estherea based on earlier TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. My wife & I stayed for 5 nights in mid-July after completeing a Baltic cruise. It was fairly warm in Amsterdam and our second floor front canal view room (#210) had no A/C but the nights cooled off quickly and the provided fan helped considerably. We slept with open windows and although it could get noisy with canal boats and mopeds, it get quite quiet after 10 pm (11 on Friday night) so sleep wasn't a problem. It is a lovely, mostly residential/small offce area with loads of cafes and restaurants on Spuistrasse, the street behind the hotel as well as in the nearby Dam Square and Leidesplein areas. We especially liked the prix fixe menu at Luden as well as the more bistro-like Cafe Luxembourg. The hotel's breakfast was fine, better than many European hotels and 'only' eur14 (where many charge eur20 or more). I would definitely recommend this hotel based on its location and helpful, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snooper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming hotel July 4th thru the 6th on our way back from a cruise in the Baltic. We had booked a room on the canal which was on the second floor. It was very beautifully decorated with lovely drapes, and wonderful molding on the ceiling. The bathroom was spacious and had a wonderful deep tub with shower. The only problem was that Amsterdamn was experiencing a heat wave with temperatures in the 90's. This of course was not the hotel's fault and we were lucky to be quick enough to put our request in to move to the fifth floor which did have air conditioning. There is also an elevator which is not always the case in these small hotels. The staff especially the bellman/porter was wonderful and gave us great recommendations for places to eat. We would stay there again but would book a room on the fifth floor not on the canal side as it can be quite noisy. The hotel has a nice little bar and breakfast room. We walked down the street (Singel) and had breakfast at a little cafe which only charged 7 euros for ham and eggs on a roll with tomatoes and fruit on the side, wonderful coffee also. There is also a great greek deli next door with fantastic food and very reasonable. This hotel is in the canal ring and you can walk to the central station from there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but no A/C”
Reviews.Author: musikahl
Reviews.Content: I would say that this hotel ranks slightly above average. The rooms were fine - small, a bit worn, yet charming with the way it was painted and the moulding on the walls and doors. The biggest issue was that there was no air conditioning - which really got to be a problem when it reached 30 degrees (85F) and we were on the 4th floor. I remember reading that on previous TripAdvisor posts, but I didn't think it would be a problem because I assumed Amsterdam wouldn't be that hot in June. Because it was so warm, the windows were open, which made it very noisy, even though we were overlooking the back of the building. The front desk staff was ok - polite but not necessarily friendly. However, the bellman who brought up our bags was very friendly. The best part of the hotel was probably the location. On the Singel canal, it was a peaceful neighborhood, but it wasn't too far at all from Dam Square or Leidseplein. Someone in an earlier post mentioned Broodje Bert, just south of the hotel. I have to put in a good word too - especially for the Goat Cheese, Honey, and Walnut sandwich. One of the tastiest treats I had on my entire 3-week European vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A decent place”
Reviews.Author: CATRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel 3 days ago. We typically stay in 4 or 5 star hotels and resorts and while not being picky, we know when the place is decent, fake or a rip off with a storefront. We really liked this hotel for it's location, staff and ambience. The place is not really that small but retains the boutique hotel atmosphere. Stayed on the 5th floor, top floor attic- like room (# 514) facing a canal. The room was not large but functional and charming with large bath, safe, and mini bar. Complimentary coffee, tea, cocoa, fruit and snacks next to the lobby. Quiet canal street location in great neighborhood, only 2 blocks (5 min. walk) from the ground zero of Amsterdam, 10 minute walk (average pace) to Red Light District. The street in the back has plenty of good restaurants. We tried 2 restaurants recommended by the hotel in their room booklet and liked them both. Massage can be arranged by the hotel. The bell boy even carried a massage table for the lady that showed up. Front desk was very helpful. Just friendly people all around. The bottom line: very reasonable for the price. Beware of some Chinese and Middle Eastern/North African restaurants in the area which serve substandard food for inflated prices... with a smile, of course. Stick to what is recommended by the hotel or just use common sense by picking a place that is busy (not only with beer drinkers) and appears to have a professional setup. There are a lot of tourists in the area and bad restaurants don't really care about repeat business. Anyway, next time in Amsterdam we don't have to look for another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Estherea - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Greg H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Estherea in mid-March, when the weather was chilly, but the welcome very warm from the friendly staff. My Fiance and I got an upgrade ( without asking!) to a very comfortable room with balcony and Four-Poster bed - like the complimentary coffee and waffles that were available on return from our many easy walks to the sights of Amsterdam, this was very much appreciated when the temperature did not go above zero! Situated on the Singel canal, it proved a great base from which to walk to must sees like the Floating Flower Market (about 400 metres away), Anne Frank Museum (about 1km). The area near the Hotel had plenty of good quality restaurants, such as the D"Vijf Vliegen, where we dined on contemporary European Cuisine in a Canal House dating back to the 1640s! We booked this hotel on the strength of the Tripadvisor reviews, and were not disappointed - fell in love with Amsterdam and the Esthera, and are looking forward to returning in mid-July - should be a lot warmer than March! Trip Advisor member, Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elegant Estherea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our European holiday, and am more and more convinced about the advantages of staying at family run hotels. The beautiful Estherea hotel is a family run hotel on the quiet Singel canal in the heart of amsteredam. The main shopping and nightlife areas i.e. Dam square, Leidseplein etc. are a few steps away and one can never imagine that the hustle and bustle is so close to this tranquil and pretty neighbourhood. The hotel itself is classy and elegant, and the beautiful reception and bar area with its rich furnishing and beautiful furniture resembles an upper class country home, warm and inviting. The stunning aquarium in the reception area which my daughter fell in love with, is lovingly tended too by the owner himself. We were met at the door by the friendliest porter in the world (he helps at the bar too), and he pretty much set the tone for the rest of the staff who were extremely corteous and helpful. The room was bright airy and plain lovely, with great use of space and very rich tapestry. The beds were very comfortable and the linen of good quality. The bathroom, although slightly small, had all one required , fluffy fresh towels and complimentry toilettries of good quality. Needless to say, everything was very clean. The complimentry coffee, tea and hot chocolate facility (all day long} near the reception, alongwith fresh fruit and cakes was very welcome as we would pop in and out of the hotel with our shopping bags. A nice touch indeed !! Definately recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay here again when i re-visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jonathand
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed here for a week in February for our two year anniversary, although we had one of the smaller rooms it was very comfortable, and beautifully decorated. The staff were excellent, very helpful and the facilities were fantastic. Although we decided not to have breakfast in the hotel (we prefered the small patisserie on the next street) the Coffee/Tea/Chocolate facilities in the hotel were a great bonus. The hotel was in an excellent location, on a very quiet street, and well within walking distance of the station (even with our cases!). The furthest places we visited were the Heineken Expierience and the Van Gough Museum, although they were only a 20 minute walk from the hotel... We especially enjoyed sitting on the benches outside the hotel by the canal... The rooms were very modern and nicely decorated, with a great TV! We will definately stay here again on our next visit to Amsterdam and would definately recommend it to friends.. Jonathan and Louise

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights (June 1-4) at Estherea with a friend. Never been in an Amsterdam hotel before but the reputation of hotels there it's quite bad, therefore - after careful consideration of other Tripadvisor's members! - opted for it, especially after getting an excellent rate through the Otel site. The Hotel is in an excellent position, about 5 minutes walk from Dam Square (possibily the busiest and noisiest place in Amsterdam!) but it's located on a lovely, tree-shaded canal street and therefore has a pleasant, quiet location. Indeed it's so centrally located that we never took a tram during our stay to wander around the whole of the city centre! Even the Central Station is about 15 minutes walk (if your luggage isn't too heavy of course, otherwise it's just a short trip with tram). The room we got (511) was on fifth floor and in the back side, therefore absolutely quiet. It was reasonably dimensioned (not a "large" room but we managed to find a place for 2 luggages and 2 backcpacks without bumping on them at every step). Everything was spotlessly clean, most importantly the bathroom, where towels got changed every day. The service was awesome, people at the door always smiling, courteous and full of help. Also the buffet breakfast was plentiful and of good quality (several different types of bread, good brands for jam and cornflakes, etc.); there was also free availabitlity at all time of coffee/tea from a machine behind the main lobby, which was very welcome after a day of walking in the cool air of this "fake summer"! I will definitely choose again the Estherea if I will return to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Estherea”
Reviews.Author: AHLS
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a quiet but central location on the Singel canal. Only 3 or 4 minutes walk from Dam Square. We (2 adults & 2 children) spent 3 nights in a quad room on the 4th floor, with 2 sets of twin beds. The room overlooked Spuistraat rather than the Singel canal, but it was a good size, light and airy, with an ensuite bathroom. Room was spotlessly clean and had a TV with UK channels. Safe in room for valuables. Breakfast buffet was from 7.00 - 10.00 and included continental breakfast, fruit, and cooked. Breakfast was Euro 14 for adults but free for children and good quality and value. Free coffee, tea and hot chocolate available from reception area until 11.00 pm. Small bar near reception. Staff were friendly and helpful. No restaurant in the hotel for evening meals but we ate at a couple of restaurants recommended by the hotel within 5 minutes walk (Casa di David on Singel and Haesje Claes on Spuistraat) and both were very good. We would certainly stay at the Estherea if we visited Amsterdam again

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: injeanious
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with our choice of hotel which we booked based on Tripadvisors recommendations. The hotel had a very upscale European feel to us and was beautifully decorated. The rooms weren't huge but decorated expensively and very tastefully. We had view of the canal and the hotel was close enough to walk to anywhere in the city. The staff was extremely helpful and proactive, spoke good English and readily available. An optional breakfast is served for an additional cost which was a little pricey but had a huge assortment and very convenient. It was nice that they offered free coffee, tea and hot chocolate all day as well as fresh fruit. We felt like this hotel was a great find and was a great price for such a nice hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GailLannum
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe and I booked this hotel based on reviews in Trip Advisor. I loved this hotel. The staff were very nice and our room was everything I wanted it to be (#314). We had 3 windows overlooking the canal, the room was nicely decorated, and the bed was very comfortable. Very cozy and charming. The location was perfect....walkable to Dam Square, Flower Market, Museums and more. I also loved Amsterdam. We will return and definetely stay at the Estherea!!

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Modern_Phrenologist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at the Estherea. It is a fine hotel, in an excellent location with a friendly, helpful, knowledgeable staff. Our room was rather large by European standards and was the only room in the hotel with a balcony. The balcony was lovely for the 15 minutes each day it did not rain. The bathroom was compact, but had everything one could need, including the expected soaps, shampoos, etc. My only reservation is the cost and quality of the breakfasts. At 14 Euros per person it was not good value for money. Much better could be had in neighborhood cafes. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance of most of the mian sights and museums in Amsterdam. Since it is only about 200 yards from the nearest tram stop, it is easy to travel anywhere else in the city. There are more than a dozen restaurants, of various price ranges and foods, within two blocks of the hotel and many more if one walks 3 or 4 blocks. We would certainly stay in the hotel again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable, but...”
Reviews.Author: lochnagar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and our family had four rooms - all very comfortable and quite spacious. We were visiting Amsterdam for a family member's birthday. My wife and I were in a twin room on the fourth floor and our two children stayed in another twin on the same floor. The hotel staff were very helpful, particularly the night desk attendant. We arrived quite late and he was very efficient. The 14 Euro breakfast was okay but not very memorable for the price. One issue which did concern us was that someone in the room next to our children was using cannabis - the smell pervaded all over the fourth floor. We complained to the hotel management who apparently, knew that someone had been "using" because the cleaners had seen the evidence. The hotel info booklet says quite clearly that they do not allow drugs in the hotel and the management told us that the fourth floor was a no smoking floor anyway. They didn't seem very anxious to enforce their own rules. The hotel was clean and comfortable and is in a good location. Would go back again, providing they sort out their confusing smoking/non-smoking policy.

Reviews.Title: “Stop Sneaking in to our Room!”
Reviews.Author: dd01a
Reviews.Content: Anywhere you go, perhaps the bottom line is "you only get what you paid for"... We chose this hotel because of the popularity on this site, but went for a "500 Euro for 3 nights (standard double)" special deal. Upon arrival we (cheakily) asked for a canal view room but was told there would be 45 Euro supplement charge per night. So our cheap-rate room was on the 2nd level with no view. Instead there was a small, dark patio right outside our window and a few workmen appeared every morning - God knows what they were renovating - checking up & down outside walls. We kept the curtains shut but had to keep the windows open while we were in, as the room was quite stuffy and the bathroom had no ventilation (there was a tiny, tiny one which didn't seem to do the job at all) The walls & ceilings were so thin - we couldn't hear the next door but we could even hear people whispering in the corridor, footsteps on the squeaky floor upstairs were almost unbearable. Peculiar thing was this..... You return the key to the reception everytime you go out, so they know which guests are in or out. On the 1st day when we went out for a dinner, we left some lights on and made sure all our windows were shut (dodgy patio!), came back a couple of hours later to find all the lights turned off and one of the top small windows open. 2nd day while we were out they changed the furniture - changed the bedside table, entire dressing table & all our things in the drawers were taken out (ok but why? we thought we were in the wrong room!) Evening of the 3rd day we deliberately left all the lights on and went out for a meal, came back few hours later to find some lights off, fridge door wide open (again WHY?????) small windows open again... We're not making up the story! And certainly we were not on the magic mushroom or whatever that is!! As soon as we go out they come in to check the room, open the window for ventilation and sneak out! Well there was a safe in the room so we weren't too concerned about the security... Shower was powerful. Free tea/coffee machine at the reception. But then it would have been a lot nicer if there was a kettle facility in each room. The hotel's in the nice part of the city, stunning chandelier & aquerium tank at the reception... The mystery of freaky guestroom-checker remains, but besides that, I would only recommend this hotel if you're prepared to pay more for better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Koalaguinness
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in mid-February and found it a lovely place from which to enjoy Amsterdam. The standard double room wasn't large, but it was very clean and very comfortable. When we were in the hotel we found ourselves relaxing in the beautifully decorated library reading papers and planning where to eat next. We didn't eat breakfast here, there are loads of tasty (and cheaper) places nearby. Best of all the Estherea was a perfect location from which to walk to most parts of central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour: Stay there”
Reviews.Author: UK_Manchester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned today from three nights at the Estherea. We can only echo the opinions of all the previous reviewers who gave it the maximum five "yellows" as we call them. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. From the moment you walk into the lobby, which exudes its own charm with tasteful decor, you have a sense of stepping back into a more leisurely and refined age. My wife was celebrating a "significant" birthday and when we were shown into our room the management had left a gift of toiletries wrapped in cellophane on the table. This little personal touch together with the complimentary hot drinks sweets and chocolates show us that the large, soulless chain hotels have much to learn from the smaller, family-run hotels which go the extra mile. Amsterdam is a compact city and whilst the Estherea is in a quiet location it is no more than two or three minutes walk from the bars, restaurants and shops. This is the best of both worlds. The management gives guests a list of recommended restaurants within walking distance. We tried two of them, an Indonesian in Rembrandt Square and a Thai restaurant, both of which were excellent. We feel the hotel maintains high standards and is not overpriced when compared to similar hotels in other Continental cities. The acid test is would we go back to the Estherea. Answer: like a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Exceellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AstridCB
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from 3 nights at this Hotel over the Easter break and it was wonderful! Ok so it isn't cheap but, it was well worth the money and I didn't begrudge paying a bit more for a fabulous room which overlooked the Singel Canal and was huge with a wonderful four poster bed. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly, we left our bags at reception on our last day and were told to help ourselves to the free coffee and tea on our return to pick them up which was a welcome break. The breakfast was expensive at 14 Euros but we only had it the once and it made our Sunday a more relaxing day. We tried to get a cab to the Hotel from Amsterdam Central Station on our arrival but the cab driver obviously felt it wasn't a worthwhile route for him and told us it was only a short walk!! It took us 15 minutes, not a long distance but probably a bit far with two suitcases and late at night! We took the recommendation of eating at the Three Sisters in Rembrandtsplein on Saturday night which Reception booked for us and it was a delicious meal, lovely steak and great service. I would definately stay at this hotel again, it's location is first class and I will certainly recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rubys
Reviews.Content: We thought (logically)that by paying more for our hotel, we would be getting a higher quality establishment. What a disappointment! Our room was not big enough to swing a very young, very small kitten in, let alone a cat! There was no air conditioning and when we stayed - it was HOT The reception staff were stuffy and unhelpful I would not recommend this hotel and I will not return to it either.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: An American living in Northwest England
Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: MJP-22
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here, and were happy that we had requested a room on the canal side - not only a beautiful view, but quieter than the back side of the hotel. Though I must add that the block behind the hotel was busier because there were many great restaurants in this direction. It was great having so many places to eat so close by. The room was large, nicely decorated, and very clean. The public rooms were inviting, the staff pleasant, and the "help yourselves" coffee, tea, hot chocolate and fruit was delightful when you returned from outside, or when you just wanted to sit and take it easy. Go for the hot chocolate, it's really, really good. The Spui square was only a block and a half away and from there you can get trams all over the city. The hotel location was terrific. I'd suggest this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherylMerseyside
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in this beautiful hotel - we did not have a canal view this time but our room was huge and so luxurious. This hotel is the best we have ever stayed in, the staff are so helpful and friendly and the location is superb. We had good weather too this time so all in all it was a great holiday. We will definitely return again to the Estherea and highly recommend it to anybody not on a tight budget. Also the fish tank in the reception has to be seen to be believed - fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i have recently returned from a two night break at the hotel estherea. i had supprised him for his 30 th birthday and i made an excellent choice in hotel after reading other reviews on this site. the hotel staff were friendly and polite and the room we had was a four poster bed overlooking the singel canal and it was truly beautiful. exceptonally clean and a gorgeous hotel. excellent location and the hot drinks were welcomed after a long walk in cold winds !! i would certainly reccommend estherea and will certainly stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not really worth the money”
Reviews.Author: clars
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay in amsterdam which is a lovely city to visit. It was as a present for my husband so I wanted to get a nice hotel. This one is lovely but definitely not a four star hotel by any means. After reading reviews on this site we didn't go for breakfast..there are lovely places around to get something to eat for far less than 14 euro which is what the hotel charges. We were in room 407 which is too the back but is so noisy..not sure if it was just the people in the other rooms or just the hotel in general. The free tea and coffee and fruit was lovely especially considering it was so cold. The reception staff were really friendly and the location is lovely. I had asked by email for directions to the hotel and was told to either get a taxi from the airport or the connexion which connects the airport to the hotels. I wouldn't go for either of these ways...a one way ticket on the train is 3.60 each and then it is about a 15 minute stroll to the hotel. A taxi would cost 42 euro.....There are some really dodgy looking hotels in amsterdam so you have to be careful but this was 300 for the two of us for two nights with no breakfast so I think it was a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed but not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon0
Reviews.Content: There are definitely some great things about the hotel - we were very grateful to be given a room immediately after arriving at the hotel several hours before scheduled check-in. The staff were efficient and polite, the free fruit and hot drinks most welcome and the location is great. However - as previous reviewers have mentioned - we often found the room to be cold, this wasn't helped by the fact that the cleaners left the window open each day after cleaning (even though it was snowing outside!)and one of the radiators wasn't working. Our room was located next to the lift and this combined with the thin walls meant that we were disturbed by noise from lift mechanism each time the lift was used. We didn't complain as our break was only for a few nights and we didn't spend much time in our room but given the choice I wouldn't stay in that particular room again!

Reviews.Title: “Estheria--my home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: domer65
Reviews.Content: What is not to like? My wife and I have been to Amsterdam twice--each time staryed at this wonderful small hotel. We already have reservations for june 13/14 this year. The location is superior. We are not the DAM square crowd---we like the relaxed atmosphere---there is enough fun a good restaurants for us--two fine pubs near by. We found the management and employees friendly and helpful at all times. We travel in Europe quite often and look for hotels like Estheria---small family run fine hotels---we have developed our own list and frrequent them when possible. Estheria is great.

Reviews.Title: “luxury at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: carsdeb
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 4 night stay. Our room although a bit on the small side, had a canal view which made up for the room size. The bed has to be one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in, with crisp clean white sheets. The hotel was very clean, it has been polished to perfection. The free coffee, tea etc was a real bonus.The hotel is in the best location for exploring Amsterdam. We have been to Amsterdam on numerous occasions and have stayed in many different classes and types of hotels,always trying to find one that is located centrally, that has a good ambiance, that is clean, well looked after with attentive staff. We have found it with the Estherea - we will not stay anywhere else. ps try the all you can eat ribs at the sing singel pub, turn right when you leave the hotel and keep walking you will find the pub on the right approx 200 yds.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier with the Estherea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4-day break at the Hotel Estherea. The staff are friendly, courteous and could not have been more helpful. We found it to be a very relaxing environment. The rooms are more than adequate, very clean and comfortable. The tea/coffee/hot chocolate which is available free of charge all day to guests is most welcoming when coming back in from the cold! We would definitely return to the Estherea and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have hoped for a better hotel from which to explore Amsterdam. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is beautiful. Our room was comfortable and beautifully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great location within walking distance of interesting sites. Not too far from an American Express office which came in handy. Did not try the full breakfast in the morning -- the muffins and fruit on the continental table were enough. Great advice on restaurants, appreciated the loan of an umbrella, and help with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sheky3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful choice. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They gave excellent restaurant and excursion recommendations. We loved the 24hr coffee, tea, and fruits. The library and lounge was a great place to relax. We had one of the smaller rooms facing the canal, but there are bigger ones. It was perfect for a couple. The room and bathroom were immaculate. The hotel is situated within walking distance of everything, such a great location.It was far enough away from the things, that it was quiet and peaceful to sleep. My boyfriend and I would definitely recommend staying here and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: E&JJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights in mid February. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a canal view room free of charge which was a great start. The room was beautiful - a very decent size with a sitting area and a compact but very clean and well equipped bathroom. The on demand tea, coffee and chocolate in the lounge area was a real plus and the beautifully appointed library was a gorgeous place to sit and read a book or the newspapers provided. Breakfast was excellent. Bacon and egg available for those who wanted something a little more substantial along with the traditional breads, rolls, meat, cheese, yoghurt, fruit etc. English TV channels available in the rooms along with a well stocked minibar and safe. The staff were very efficient, polite and friendly. It is so well situated, very near the centre but quiet location. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to any first time visitors to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Snootsworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Estherea for our 20th wedding anniversary. On arrival we got a lovely warm welcome and a surprise basket of celebratory freebies in our room. The view from our window was of one of Amsterdam's numerous canals, very picturesque! Our room was clean, nicely decorated and really only lacked tea and coffee making facilities. Mind you all we had to do was take up the complimentary coffee from the lobby up to our room! The hotel itself is very inviting, lots of dark wood, old books and leather sofas. The staff were always friendly and courteous, always willing to help and answer questions. Amsterdam is a fantastic city to explore and the Estherea's location is ideal for getting to all the sights. All in all we had a fantastic time...do visit Anne Franks' house and do eat in the little cafe bar "De Prins" opposite the house on the other side of the canal....brilliant food, nice vibe and cheap! I can thoroughly recommend the Estherea and Amsterdam; we had a lovely time.....despite the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: pomandoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on our honeymoon in the Estherea, we opted for a canal view room which was well worth the extra. They gave us an absolutely beautiful room with a four poster bed and a gift pack to congratulate us! The free coffee/hot chocolate 24 hours is great and there are really comfy sofa's and seats with books to read and you feel really welcomed there. The foyer is beautiful too. Location is fantastic, really easy to potter around and are some brilliant european cafes/bars really near by. Price was really reasonable too. If you are going for a romantic weekend in Amsterdam, or wanting to do the city (rather than take in the dope cafes and seedier end of town - although admittedly we did go for a walk round that area!) then this is definitely the place to say. Highly recommend, it made our honeymoon! (We also avoided breakfast there due to price and found a lovely place 4 doors down that was really nice and much cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Worth every euro”
Reviews.Author: Captain Mikey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for five nights. She is a bit of a bathroom snob and is wary of European bathrooms. In this case, the bathroom met her standards: large tub, plenty of room, large sink bowl. We also appreciated the 24 hour coffee in the lobby. The staff was very attentive and their command of English was excellent. The bed was comforatble and spacious. It is also in a good location, near a lot of things but not too busy. As was the case with another traveler, we were occasionally disturbed by a bit of nighttime noise outside our window, but it was nothing extraordinary. Amsterdam is, after all, a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dantechnet
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews on this site before booking and the Estherea Hotel really does deserve its high rating. We booked a standard room, which we did find quite small but we weren't intending to spend much time there so wasn't an issue. What was a problem were the decorators that started work next door at 7am, we mentioned this to reception and they offered us an alternative room (bigger and better view) immediately, no fuss or hassle. The hotel staff were all friendly and the hotel has a nice relaxed atmosphere, which was always a pleasure to return to after a hard day touring Amsterdam. The location is perfect and very central to all museums and restaurants, would highly recommend the Estherea and will definitely return again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Non smokers beware!”
Reviews.Author: bunyete
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam for the first time with my spouse last weekend. We stayed at the Estheria for 2 nights in a deluxe room (room #114). At first we were very satisfied by the hotel because it is beautiful, our room was large, clean, well decorated, and had a nice view on the canal, and the staff made a good impression on us. The first problem arose on the first night: our room was on the first floor and we were disturbed around 1a.m by a group of people talking loudly right under our windows, probably waiting for some friends on the doorstep of the hotel. Apparently, nothing special has been done for (external)noise insulation. However it only last 15 minutes and thus was a minor problem. Note that we could not hear any noise coming from other rooms. The second problem was of much greater importance. We asked for a non-smoking room, as usual, because we are, though french, very sensitive (negatively) to cigarette smoke. The room was indeed non-smoking, and nobody had smoked in our room, but the room in front of ours (room #115) was a smoking room. And the guests in room #115, in their right, were unfortunately smoking a lot. Our room was invaded by smoke all night and we had to sleep with an open window in spite of the outside temperature (I would say around -5 Â°C). At the reception, after checking the corridor, they admitted that there was indeed a lot of smoke but could not do anything because room #115 was a smoking room and the hotel was full (so that they could not give us another room). We thus spent a terrible second night in that hotel. We however appreciated the breakfast (non smoking area). Note that it is not included in the room price (extra 14 EUR per person). Note also that the hotel has no restaurant but that there are plenty right next to it. I did not ask for any discount (not my style, at least with my wife standing next to me :C), but when I checked out, they did not ask me whether I had enjoyed my stay, they did not apologize, and did not offer any kind of compensation. Apart from that, Amsterdam is a beautiful city and we had a wonderful time wandering in its streets and visiting a few of its museums.

Reviews.Title: “17th century canalhouse charm”
Reviews.Author: RoomRaider69
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I loved the Estherea. This was my second time in Amsterdam, and the hotel was definitely better than where I stayed the first time. PROS 1) Central location on Singel, which is the innermost of Amsterdam's four concentric canals. Roughly 3 blocks from Dam Square, with easy access to virtually all Amsterdam attractions. You can walk anywhere from here or catch a tram, but if you have luggage, a taxi is Eur 10 or less from Amsterdam Centraal. 2) Very attractive lobby with extensive sitting areas, a big aquarium, and all the charm of a 17th century Dutch canalhouse. 3) Well-decorated room with soft lighting, a soft off-orange paint job, and very comfortable bed. 4) Responsive management. We had a billing problem that was very quickly resolved by management. 5) Informative website with detailed property history. CONS 1) Breakfast is 14 Euro extra. We skipped it. There are dozens of quaint little cafes within a 10-minute walk of the hotel, most of which have English menus and good breakfasts for Eur 6/person. Just walk in the direction of Jordaan. 2) Bath amenities. You'll encounter quintessential Dutch cheapness when there is no soap, shampoo, or conditioner in the bathroom. Instead, there is a wall-mounted bottle of institutional-style chemical ooze that is said to work on both hair and skin. My girlfriend had a rough time, getting neither clean hair nor skin. 3) Views. If you want a canal view, be sure to ask for it (and pay extra). Our room had a view of a ventilation shaft and caught a lot of noise from the teenagers across the ventilation shaft. The clientele of the hotel appeared to trend towards college-age Americans and families. Also note: wireless internet is 10 Eur per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mollysmum
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at Hotel Estherea from 11th to 13th Jan on our first trip to Amsterdam. Although we had a really hectic schedule and so did not spend a lot of time in the hotel, it really made our stay special. Its location is excellent - very handy for Dam Square, trams to wherever you want to go, and the street behind the hotel is packed with fantastic restaurants (recommend 'Five'). There's such a lovely ambience from the moment you enter. Our room (212) had a canal view and was pleasantly and comfortably furnished. We did pay extra for a 'deluxe' room since they told us that was the only way we'd get a canal view, but another couple we met paid the standard rate (98 Euro) and also got a canal view. We also paid for wireless internet access for the first day, but then discovered so many unsecured networks in the vicinity that we didn't pay for access the second day, since we weren't too worried about internet security. The most expensive (reputedly) brothel in Amsterdam is a few doors down, but it's very discreet and the area in general is very upmarket. Highly recommend it (the hotel, that is)!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaytraveller
Reviews.Content: What a charming and warm hotel. This is so perfectly situated, in a delightful setting overlooking the Singel Canal. Three frontage canal houses make up this hotel. On entering, the reception is warm and inviting. The staff were helpful, the porter made us welcome showing the lovely lounges and breakfast room. A nice touch is the self service tea coffee and chocolate, plus the cookies in the draws beneath. It was great after a day of sight seeing to collaspe in a comfy chair and help yourself to a cuppa. As for our room, overlooking the canal, it was simply charming, room 110 will make you feel like you are on your honeymoon again! While the busy city called to be explored the lure of the cosy room also called on my tired feet. Just delightful. All in all a perfect location and a wonderful hotel. Everywhere was spotless. I feel that the owners are so proud of there hotel and so they should be. Always request a canal view though as it buts you on the best side.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DonPoco
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a group of 5 couples and just completed a 14 day river cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam. Found the Estherea on the internet and it had received some nice reviews from fellow travelers. Price was right too. We were not disappointed. The rooms were spacious with a large bathroom. Our room was on the warm side but the hotel staff supplied us a fan which really helped. The lobby was had a wonderful decor and the staff was extreme helpful. Estherea is right on the Single canal and all the main attractions were within easy walking distance - Ann Frank House, Dam Square, Red Light District, Flower Market, etc. The hotel only serves breakfast which I thought was pricey. My wife ate there both mornings and said it was very good. There are a couple of pastry shops in the next block which were excellent. We highly recommend the Estherea.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: sasharoon
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my first visit to Amsterdam. I found the Estherea on this web site and I was not disapointed. It is a charming hotel in a beautiful location. the lobby is very pretty and very European. Our room was a decent size. I have defiantely stayed in smaller rooms in Europe. It was very pleasant and well kept. The veiw from the canal side rooms is really beautiful. . The staff was very pleasant and helpful. This hotel is a great value. It is very reasonably priced and delivers in this price category. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a princess!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: spanishangel77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night. It was my first time to Amsterdam and I was told the city is not known for there hotels. I was so impressed with our hotel, it was classy and vintage everything I was looking for. The room was so spacious and clean and it had a beautiful big canopy bed and a view that was to die for. Ask for a room looking onto the canal. My boyfriend had been to Amsterdam before and was never happy with the size of room as he is 6'3. He loved the hotel too! It is also very central and easy to get around the city. I loved it and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: ikospez
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent a few days in this hotel and we were very happy. The location is just excellent, everything is at 5 - 10 min walk but the canal is silent and calm. The people working at the desk are very helpful and professional. A girl (unfortunately I do not recall her name) hepled us in finding cool resturants and took care of all reservations and also advised us of a resturant. The best part are the rooms. Our room faced the canal and was clean and very cosy, perfect for a couple. The bath is just great, big, clean and it had a bathtub! Immagine the whole day walking around Amsterdam in the cold and then going back in the hotel room and jump in a steaming hot bathtub...perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra44Ayr_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in this hotel in September 2005 and found everything we had read in the reviews to be true. The hotel is in a great location for touring Amsterdam and although near the centre you are not disturbed by noise at night. Our room was beautiful and had a lovely view over the canal. The decor was tastefully done and everything was spotlessly clean. We found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant at all times even phoning the lost property office for us when we left our camera bag on the tram. The courtesy free tea, coffee and fruit is an excellant extra touch which we have not had before in any top class hotel. The only thing which we felt was lacking was the fact that the entire public area on the ground floor, including the bar area,was non smoking and while we accept this suited many people, it surely would have been possible to select one small area where smoking was permitted. Smoking was allowed in the rooms so it was not a problem but it did mean we did not tend to sit for too long in the public areas as we would have done between our sightseeing trips. On the whole, I would recommend this hotel and we will certainly stay here when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and room”
Reviews.Author: TessM
Reviews.Content: I was only there for one night before flying back to the states but after seeing the location (not too far from the Central Station but not too close), the room and being greeted by the friendly staff, I wanted to stay longer! I had a view of the canal from my good-sized room (as opposed to many European rooms that are rather cramped). There's a charming library on the ground floor to watch the world go by while having tea. I've stayed in a number of hotels in A'dam but I'll be going back to Estherea from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: lufromitaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 nights at the Hotel Estherea in July 05 and we really recommend it. Great location, very comfortable rooms, friendly staff, charming foyer and library.... in brief: the nicest hotel we have stayed in Amsterdam (after three trips.)

Reviews.Title: “Well served at the Estherea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews of this hotel, I decided to check it out. The 24-hour free coffee, tea, and fruit is a great plus. Computer internet is available in the lovely lobby at a beautiful wooden desk for 7 euros per hour, purchase the card at the hotel desk. Most staff were gracious except for one gruff older gentleman behind the desk. He was being imposed upon by all customers. It was a wonderful stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel at a nice price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our three night stay at the Estherea. We got an excellent weekend rate of 99Euros/night, and felt we got very good value. They also provide a 5% discount for paying with cash. The hotel is very clean and nicely decorated. As mentioned in other reviews, there is complementary tea and coffee in the lounge and small snacks. They have a library with travel books which we were able to borrow and take to our room to read. Our room had no view at all - looking into a window-well, but was large and very clean. There is really nothing negative to say for the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPMWROX
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Hotel Estheria. The hotel was beautifully appointed, the service friendly and the location can't be beat. We had a room overlooking the Canal. The room was small but spotless and comfortable. Great neighborhood in easy walking distance to all the sites. Go and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LolaA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four days at the Hotel Estherea, and we not disappointed! The hotel was very clean and the decor of the lobby area was pretty impressive. Breakfast on the other hand is not impressive, 14euros for not very much, we didn't have it, but we heard other guests talking about it! We found the staff very friendly and are happy to advise you of where to go and what to do. We had a room on the fourth floor, which was a good size, but not the greatest of views, but since we were there to sight see, we weren't bothered. We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Louise

Reviews.Title: “Locked out at 4am as night porter went for a sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed to return from a night out at approx 4am & find several other guests on the doorstep. We were all locked out & despite ringing the bell, knocking on windows & phoning the hotel we were unable to get access until 5.30am - when the night porter woke up. When we complained about this the next day we were simply told that it would not occur again, although I would have expected some type of recompense or even a drink in the bar to compensate up for all our trouble. The hotel was charging 260 pounds a night for a room that we couldn't get to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read all the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor I was confident we had chosen a good hotel and we were not disappointed. As the trip was to celebrate a birthday I had requested a canal view room. Although we did not have a canal view we were given a great room on the top floor with a balcony and the staff even gave a small present on arrival. From photos I have seen some of the rooms are on the small side, (although our room was a good size), BUT as a tourist out for most of the day how much space do you need? Our room (as well as the lobby, lounge area and restaurant) was spotlessly clean, richly decorated and had more charm than all of the large chain hotels put together. The hotel was on a quiet canal away from the busy/noisy streets but within easy walking distance of most places of interest and some nice restaurants and cafes. If I ever return to Amsterdam I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: jdbhouston
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in Amsterdam. I and my friend thought it closer to Centraal Station, so we opted for walking to the hotel instead of taking the tram. Should have taken the tram just one or two stops! But on arrival we found a beautiful hotel, from the lush reception and lobby area, to the bright and richly appointed room. It was very comfortable, and the bathroom was larger than we expected. The only downside was the airconditioning...although there were controls in the room, the temperature never seemed to change, so the room was always a bit stuffy. Overall, a very comfortable and luxurious hotel located right on one of the Amsterdam canals. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would stay here myself again.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: cchancesare
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in mid August. I was pleasantly surprised. This is a 2 star hotel? It is nicer than 3 star hotels I stayed in previously. The room was beautiful. We got a room with a view of the canal. Beautiful bathroom. The lobby is exquisite. Having all day access to a hot drink and a cookie or a fruit. Really nice touch. A quick walk from DAM Square and then all the other action. The staff was great. My advice... don't stay anywhere else - this is truly great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 day break at Estheria, flights booked with Air Miles from Leeds and hotel booked with Expedia on basis of reviews on Trip Advisor. Not disappointed. A lovely hotel in a great location for discovering Amsterdam on foot. 5 minutes from Dam Square but in quiet location on Singel canal. Paid Euro 99 (Â£68) per night per room without breakfast. Given choice of small room overlooking canal or larger air conditioned room in newer part of hotel at the back. Looked at both. Opted for the larger room. Very nicely furnished and very comfortable as was the rest of the hotel. Very courteous and efficient staff. Free coffee/tea and biscuits and fruit in lobby area a major advantage. Didn't eat breakfast in hotel. Thought Euro 14 per person was a bit expensive. Plenty of coffee shops and restaurants within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. Would definitely stay again but don't pay the "tarrif" (full) price. Hotel well worth its 4* rating.

Reviews.Title: “5* star hotel 1* room”
Reviews.Author: Scientist-Mad
Reviews.Content: I always pick my hotels after reading reviews on tripadvisor and for the first time I was really disappointed. The hotel is very nice but our room (405) was terrible. You cannot even compare it to B&B. We paid Â£120/night for a very very small room at the back with no air-con. We had to leave the window open at night and the noise from the street is too much for a good night sleep. Carpet in the room was shabby and stained, bed was very small for double, a tiny tv, smallest desk and above all the shower room was separate from the toilet and at the opposite end. We had our toiletries at two places and still ran out of place to put everything. You can hear every noise from adjoining rooms and it is not pleasant...I dont understand how they call themselves 4* when they cannot even provide simple amenities like door signs, shampoo, conditioner, iron (available upon request but house cleaning took it back every day), hair drier was the slowest one I've ever seen in my life. And the two glasses provided in the bathroom were chipped and cracked. Now you dont expect that from a hotel with this reputation, do u? It actually encouraged us to stay out as much as possible and therefore, we got to see quite alot. I think its a hit and miss with this hotel. All the rooms are different sizes (looking at the fire safety map) and therefore different decore. I dont think anyone staying in one of the back room has reviewed this hotel here. Certainly avoid the rooms at the back if you can but then u r charged extra for a canal view room. On the positive side, the hotel (outside our room) was very nice, it is centrally located - just 5 mins from Dam square, easily reachable from central station - tram nos 1, 2, 5, 13 stop at Spui which is under 5 mins away, breakfast was adequate and staff is polite. I will definiely not stay here again. For this price I'd rather stay at Marriott or Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Great location great value”
Reviews.Author: rad9378
Reviews.Content: My second stay here; the hotel has been refurbished since I last visited and is even better. We were not lucky enough to have a canal view room but ours was comfortable and attractive. The hotel has a cosy bar, pleasant breakfast room and library area. Although there is no restaurant for evening dining there are dozens of bars and restaurants within 5 minutes walk. All the attractions of Amsterdam are easily accessible, but despite this the hotel is very peaceful and relaxing. The staff are friendly and professional. All in all a great value hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great, luxurious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: k_killough
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day stay at the Hotel Estherea in Amsterdam. We found the hotel lavishly decorated with warm and welcoming staff. Although our hotel room was quite compact it had a beautiful view of the canal and surrounding area and was tastefully decorated. The hotel is situated close to many of the popular tourist areas of Amsterdam but a good distance from the more seedy areas so guests never feel uneasy or unsafe. All in all we had a fantastic time and would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the best in town”
Reviews.Author: Lenster
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and i spent my 40th birthday in amsterdam recently and we chose to stay at the hotel estherea. This hotel is fantastic for couples and familys, it's no good for back packers or people on a budget as it's quite expensive. But if your looking for luxury at an affordable price, then you need look no further than this wonderful establishment. So if your planning a trip to the dam with your wife or girlfriend and choose to stay anywhere other than here, your making a big mistake! Go, be happy, n-joy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my elderly mother and found the staff very helpful, we had a superb room overlooking the canal (312) it was clean and lavishly furnished. We had breakfast which was copious and good value we didn.t need to eat again the whole day !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsTee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Estherea for 6 nights in April 2005. The best thing about the hotel is its location, but that's not to say that it is the only good thing about it. But first things first. Adjoining the Spui, in the inner part of the Western Canal Belt on the Singel, near the Jordaan, near the Beginhof, with many excellent restaurants, bars, coffee shops, shopping areas and major tram access all within very close walking distance, it is probably as well located a hotel as there is in Amsterdam. It is amazing that this place can maintain relative quiet but it does. The rooms are small, but clean, with very nice bathrooms. The first room we were taken to was not exactly to our liking (though we would have been fine had they not been willing to let us change) but the staff was very nice and made a room change to a room that was more to our liking with little effort. Both rooms had canal views. They offer free coffee, tea and hot chocolate (available 24/7), they have a nice bar and a breakfast room with a typical dutch buffet breakfast (we didn't eat there -- we chose to eat breakfast at several nearby places that gave a much better slice of local experience). The hotel has apparently been owned by the same family for a long time, and it is pretty obvious -- much of the staff seemed related to one another. We were very happy there, more for the location than the rooms themselves, but there were nice amenities, nice rooms and excellent value for the money (and the location is definitely superior to many far more expensive and only marginally nicer hotels). At the end of 6 nights, we weren't sick of the place, which also says something. A word to those who care about such things. The Estherea is not cannibas friendly -- they politely but firmly make it clear that cannibas smoking is not allowed in the hotel. However, being within a block of Tweed Kamer, one of the most interesting and eclectic coffee shops in Amsterdam, and several others as well, it really didn't matter. Cheers!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Estherea
HotelInfo.Address: Singel 303-309, Amsterdam 1012 WJ, The Netherlands
